At the same moment, she also noticed that she happened to be standing right in front of a McDonald's, and her stomach growled loudly. Despite her massive weight gain, she felt incredibly hungry.

"No, I can't," she said. "I have to try and track down whatever demon is making me fat." Faith's stomach growled once more. "But on the other hand, I'm starving..."
112112.title: A higher-level demon is to blame

1121121.content:
No matter how hard Faith tried to fight it, she couldn't deny her extreme hunger and gave in. The fat slayer entered the McDonald's and ordered 10 of everything on the menu. Faith sat down at a table and began ravenously devouring the mountain of food she had just purchased. The demon's curse went to work on the food as Faith ate, making it much more fattening than it already was. As a result, Faith's waistline continued to rapidly expand, causing her big belly to become exposed as her shirt grew tighter and rode up on her body. The demons curse was also still at work on the general populous of Sunnydale, because as Faith stuffed her greedy face other patrons of the restaurant approached her with their own offerings.

"Urp! Oh greatmurff!" She said sarcastically as a passing woman stuffed a large burger meal into her mouth which she chewed and swallowed "Is it not enough that i can't stop my own greed? Ulp!! Urp! You people have to feed me to? Hic!"

Before she knew it, Faith had eaten all of the food in front of her, as well as several other full meals she'd been forced to eat. She was panting from the speed she'd been eating and was having trouble suppressing hiccups as she rubbed her exposed gut which was gurgling. She groaned as she felt a stab of hunger and was unable to stop herself from once more approaching the register to order some more food. To her intense annoyance she found that she was force fed by several random people as she approached the register, and she had to physically hold up her buttonless unzipped jeans to stop them falling down. And so as the evening went on, Faith continued to eat and eat and grow fatter and fatter. Other customers began to watch her and soon became fascinated by the sight of the young woman fattening herself up, and many of them felt the urge to aide her in her gluttony. Faith ate furiously and as she did she could physically feel her body grow, with each added pound of fat bulging against her forever tightening clothing. She greedily stuffed her face until her gut became so large that it ran into the table, causing her to become wedged in her seat. At that moment, she suddenly heard a familiar voice.

"Oh my god, Faith, is that you?"

Faith looked up to see...
1121121.title: Faith goes inside and pigs out

choices: Buffy immediately realizes that she's been cursed too
Buffy doesn't realize anything is wrong until she's fat
11211211.content:
"Buffy!" Faith exclaimed with her mouth full of food. "Boy am I glad to see you!"

"Whoa... Your, um... what happened to you?" Buffy asked, shocked that the fat woman sitting in front of her was in fact Faith (Faith now weighed in at about 190 pounds).

"It's a curse," Faith explained as she munched away at the pile of food in front of her "I can't stop eating! I need you to hunt down the demon that's doing this to me and kick it's god damn ass"

Just then Faith was approached by a small family, each member carrying several brown paper bags full of food. Buffy stared in shock as they started removing burgers and such from their bags and proceeded to stuff it into Faith's mouth. What shocked Buffy even more was that Faith showed no signs of trying to stop them as they force fed her, as she opened her greedy mouth willingly as they fed her in between mouthfuls she was feeding herself.

"Urrp! Another side effect of the curse, Ulp!!" Explained Faith as she was force fed some more.

"Don't worry, I'll find the demon responsible... and we'll have you back to your... Err... old thin self again in no time," Buffy said, trying to sound reassuring.

"Wait a second!" Said Faith stopping Buffy before she could leave "Can you get me some more food first? I'm sort of stuck in this seat at the moment"

The demon watched the whole scene unfold through his crystal ball as Buffy attempted to pull Faith out from the table. He chanted a few magic words and gave an evil laugh. Buffy finally managed to pull Faith free and suddenly realized that she felt extremely hungry. Faith didn't realize just how fat she had become until she was standing upright and noticed that she could no longer see her own feet. Her belly had expanded significantly and now hung down over her thighs, her top was skin tight and unable to hide the tanned flesh. She also saw that her breasts had become larger and that her hands were now pudgier. Her ass also appeared to be much wider, as her underwear was riding up it uncomfortably. Faith stood there examining her new blubber for so long that she almost forgot about food until Buffy called her name and pointed to a huge pile of food that she had just brought over.

"Thanks," Faith said as she unwrapped a large double cheeseburger and began eating it. Buffy began stuffing her face as well, causing Faith to become concerned.

"What about the demon?" she asked.

"Hey, I'm starving. You can't expect me to tackle something like this on an empty stomach, can you?" Buffy replied.
11211211.title: Buffy

choices: Faith goes on a great big gorge
Faith reports the demon to the Scoobies
11212.content:
Later that afternoon, Faith wandered the streets of Sunnydale. Just an ordinary day. Not much going on around here. At least, not while there were two Slayers. And Buffy seemed willing to take most of the strain, leaving her fellow Chosen One with very little to do most days. It depressed the hell out of her. She was supposed to be the big damn hero, and she had ended up just being the spare.

She had tried working with the Scoobies, but they were such a close knit group that she didn't have a lot of sway with them.

She tried to tell herself that it was fine, that she was better off as a lone wolf, but... she really wanted that camaraderie. That friendship.

Then, she found herself staring straight a large buffet restaurant in town. Interesting, she thought. Was this place new? She wasn't sure if she'd known about this place before.

Whatever the case, people were running and screaming from it in terror.

Seeing a guy in a suit outside the building, she ran up. "Hey, what's the beef?"

"My restaurant has been infested with some sort of... creature!" he complained. "This monster is stealing food and terrorizing the customers!"

Faith peered through the window and saw what was happening. Seemed there was some kind of monster - a demon, most likely, attacking people. Didn't seem to be hurting anyone - just scaring them off and taking their food.

"Hungry little bugger," she remarked. "Still, I can relate... Sit tight, pal, I got this."

Before the owner could react, Faith strode through the current of escaping customers and headed straight for her new target. The demon was remarkably slim for a great big eating demon. Tall and scaly with two small horns on his head. He grabbed whatever food he could and shoved it down his maw.

"Hey, pal! Didn't your mom ever teach you about table manners?" Faith yelled.

The demon twisted around and saw her. "Well, well, well... a little girl with a loud voice," he hissed a slimy voice. "What makes you think you can interrupt my dinner?"

Faith smirked. "Oh man, you think this is going to go your way? You're looking at the Slayer. I'm about to pull your insides outside."

The demon quirked what could have been an eyebrow. "Oh really? You're a lot less... blonde... than I heard you'd be."

He was trying to get under her skin. Faith shrugged - it would only make killing him more fun. "We're a pair, all right. She's the 'nice' one. I'm the 'mean' one. Now you get to find out why."

Without wasting another moment, she ran at him, did a somersault and landed a solid kick right in his chest, sending him flying backwards into a wall.

The demon right himself and cricked his neck. "My oh my... So you do have a little punch in you...
Always up for a good dinner show. Even if I'm in the middle of it..."

He reared up and went into a very skilled pounce. Faith was just barely able to dodge it, bounding out of the way and preparing to make another blow. But the demon had surprising rebound skills and was already heading back in her direction.

"Oh cra --- !"

The demon was on her in a second, pressing his scaly hands to her face. "Ut eam homo devorator, et adipem eam...," he intoned.

Faith winced, but she didn't feel anything immediately happen. Must not be done talking yet.

"Sorry, I don't speak that," she replied, giving him a solid kick in the abdomen that sent him flying backwards and away from her.

"A pity," he grunted, getting to his feet shakily. "It's such a lovely language."

Faith yelled and threw another punch. The demon's jaw gave a crack as he flew backwards and crashed into the wall. He fell to the floor in a heap before glaring up at her.

"Fine. I shall depart. But this isn't over, Slayer - as you'll soon see."

There was a flash of purple energy, and the demon blinked from existence.

Faith sighed in annoyance. Damn - he was still at large. But at least she had probably burnt a few calories during the fight.

She looked around the restaurant. Lot of damage, but nothing irreparable. And although a lot of food had been eaten, the majority of it was still intact.

And damn... it still looked so good...

She looked around again. No sign of anyone. The crowd outside had dissipated. Not even the owner had stuck around.

Well, she thought, picking up a spoon. They'll probably just blame any missing food on the demon...
11212.title: Faith finds a job: a gluttony demon is haunting...

112121.content:
With the restaurant all to herself, Faith saw no problem in helping herself to the leftovers. Better than letting them go to waste, right?

There was a great big vat of thick buttery mashed potatoes. That would do nicely. She grabbed a chair and sat herself down in front of it. With her spoon at hand, she started to shovel the huge vat into her gut. She didn't think she'd be able to finish it all in one sitting. After all, there was more here than could possibly fit in her stomach. She would just load up until she was too full to have another mouthful.

It was a solid plan, and for the first fifteen minutes, she thought it would work just fine.

But to her surprise, she found that the fullness wasn't coming. She continued eating, figuring she was just extra hungry. The hunger didn't relent. She just wanted more and more. Once half an hour had elapsed, she tossed the puny little spoon aside and started eating with her hands, getting it all over herself, but she didn't care. She needed more. She needed it. She needed more. So much more.

Eating as fast as she could, she could feel her stomach getting full, but not feeling full. She needed to feel full soon, right? Physically, she needed to feel full before she burst. But her stomach continued to stretch to accommodate her meal.

It wasn't long before the vat of mashed potatoes was empty, and Faith was looking very full.

Letting out a belch, Faith patted her stomach - it was very full. But it didn't feel that way. She felt like she could continue eating with no ill effects. She was worried.

So worried that she went straight for a vat of green beans and began to shovel them into her mouth as well. She followed that up with some ramen noodles, followed by chicken, then steak... Not eating all of it, mind you. Just taking bits and pieces of everything.

Soon, though, Faith found she couldn't quite move normally. Her stomach was swelling to such enormous proportions that it was like smuggling a globe under her shirt.

Still, she thought, she wasn't full yet, and she wanted dessert. So she took an entire gallon of cookies n creme ice cream and headed out the backdoor, grabbing another spoon as she went.

Waddling down the alleys, Faith looked down at her enormous stomach. How had this happened? How was she able to eat all of this? Bite after bite of ice cream went down her throat and into the swell that swayed back and forth just ahead of her.

An hour later, Faith was laid out on the ground, leaning against a building and slurping down whatever ice cream had melted. She tossed the container in a dumpster and slumped against the wall, her stomach now entirely in her lap. She couldn't help but pout as she couldn't pull her shirt down over her stomach.

On the plus side, the insane hunger had subsided, and she was now content. Not exactly stuffed like she should've felt. Definitely not feeling as ill as she thought she would've. She felt... good. She gave her stomach a slap. A small smile on her sticky lips.

"Oh man...," she sighed contentedly. "Belly - you and me are gonna have a lot of fun..."

A small voice in her head told her, this is wrong, but she found it remarkably easy to ignore...
112121.title: Faith goes on a great big gorge

choices: Faith meets with Buffy to search out the portal
1121212.content:
Sunnydale High was one of those schools that just seemed like it ought to be a warm happy place for young minds to be molded into wage slaves destined to flip burgers to live in their crummy apartments while the upper class continued to ride their asses until they died. Naturally, Faith didn't care for it. She supposed she ought to enroll in classes one day, but it seemed like such a hassle. Much more fun to just wander the halls and write insulting things about the more annoying faculty members - especially Principal Snyder. The guy was such a sniveling little weasel that tormenting him was one of her favorite hobbies.

Right now, however, Faith was making her way to the library for the regularly scheduled Scooby meeting. She rarely had anything to contribute - they usually just ended up doing whatever Buffy told them to do - but hey, free doughnuts. Reason enough to show up and feign interest.

Of course, she had to do something about her wardrobe. The food in her stomach had successfully digested, but her body clung to every calorie. Imagine her shock when she stepped on a scale found that she'd gained seven pounds overnight. She supposed she ought to be concerned, but she was remarkably calm. Weird... Still, she stole some slightly larger clothes from a clothing store - shoplifting was a skill and she didn't care what anybody said - and wore them to the library.

Walking inside, she saw the usual Scooby gang seated around the table in the center of the room - seriously, who designed this place? - and she strode over to them nonchalantly. They were going through their various leatherbound books that Giles seemed to always have in excess.

Speak of the Watcher, he looked up when she entered. "Ah, Faith - glad you're here," he said. "We're just going over the latest catastrophe that's destined to destroy Sunnydale."

Faith scrunched up her face. "Another one? Geez - didn't we just have one last week? And the week before that?"

"They tend to happen fairly regularly," replied Buffy. "Usually on Tuesday, typically around 9 'clock."

"8 o'clock Central Time," Xander added.

"It's not that hard to plan your life around once you get used to it," agreed Willow.

Faith shrugged and sat down. "So what's the beef with this latest disaster?"

Giles started pulling out papers. "Yes, it appears there's been a portal opened somewhere in a ten mile radius of here, and various demons have been slipping into the town. Small numbers at the moment, but they've been increasing. We're hoping to find whoever is messing about with this portal and shut it down before the demon population overwhelms the town."

"Yeah, the lines at the DMV are long enough," Xander quipped.

"What kind of demons?" asked Faith.

"Oh, we got the great big bumper variety pack," said Buffy, pulling out a notepad. "We've had sightings of fire demons burning down buildings, water demons trying to flood the neighborhood, mucus demons turning the place to snot..."

"And I saw a demon trying to steal all the clearance items at Walmart," added Willow excitedly. "So I'm calling him a 'Thrift Demon'."

"Seen anything similar, Faith?" Buffy asked.

"Yeah, I fought a demon at a restaurant stealing everyone's food. Remarkably skinny. Tried fighting him, but he teleported away."

"Oh fun," sighed Xander. "Demons can just vanish into thin air. Ever get the feeling the bad guys don't play fair?"

"Just another demon to add to the list," Buffy sighed.

"Did this demon have any powers that you noticed?" Giles asked.

"Other than high metabolism?" added Willow.

"Not really. Super nimble. Lots of jumping. Can take a punch. Oh, and he grabbed my head at one point and started chanting something, but I kicked him off before he could finish."

"Do you remember what the chant was?" Giles asked.

Faith shook her head. "You kidding? I can barely remember how this conversation started. But it was in some weird language. Vaguely Latin-ish."

Giles blinked. "Yes, well... I'll be sure to pull out my Latin-ish textbooks and find something on glutton demons."

"Sorry - he's a bit grumpy when there's an apocalypse happening," Willow whispered.

"I am not grumpy!" Giles snapped. "I'm just... just... yelling at teenagers in a library. Fine, yes. I am grumpy. I'd like to find this portal quickly. Buffy, Faith - perhaps you two should patrol the city after school and find out where it's coming from."

"Oooh, and I can work on some kind of 'portal detectors'," Willow added eagerly. "Help you find it quicker!"

"Yes, splendid idea. Perhaps you'd all better head back to class now."

"Awww, but we're enjoying the leathery books and notepads," Buffy faux-pouted as she got her things.

"We'll reconvene tonight at 7," Giles continued. "Be ready for anything."

"Not too hard, since there's a lot of 'anything' in this town," Xander said, already following Buffy and Willow out the door.

"See you tonight, Faith," Buffy called over her shoulder.

"Later, B," Faith replied, getting up as well, already feeling that disconnect she always felt when they went off without her. Sure, they had class to get to, and she couldn't exactly join them, what with her not being a student, but still - seeing them leave in a group while she was left alone with a dusty old librarian.

Speaking of which...

"And of course, they just leave their leftover snacks everywhere," Giles sighed, shaking his head.

Faith turned and saw the snacks in question. A half-empty container of glazed doughnuts, a few party bags of chips... She licked her lips. "Don't sweat it, G," she said, pretending to be put out. "I'll dispose of the evidence we were ever here."

Giles blinked in surprise. "Oh... Well, thank you, Faith. I appreciate it. There's a dumpster around the back for anything you don't want..."

"Gotcha," she replied, gathering everything up. She had no intention of visiting any dumpster.

As she loaded up her arms, Giles couldn't help but notice the way her stomach bulged over her pants and raised an eyebrow. "Faith... are you certain the demon didn't do anything to you?"

"Nothing a little Slayer super-healing can't handle," Faith replied breezily.

"Really? No... ill-effects? Even if he didn't finish his chant, there might have been some magical transference."

"Trust me, G - I think I'd notice if something was wrong, don't you?" she replied. "See you guys tonight at 7."

"... Indeed," Giles said quietly, watching the girl scurry off with an armload of goodies. He shrugged as she disappeared. He'd keep an eye on things, but for now, he wasn't going to worry. The portal needed closing first.
1121212.title: She reconvenes with the Scoobies

choices: A great big flashy thing opens in the sky!
11212121.content:
That evening, Faith made her way down to the local cemetery - of which there were several, what with this being Sunnydale and everything, but whatever - carrying her usual stake just in case. She'd made sure to eat relatively light tonight - but she still had a pretty sizeable bulge in her belly as she walked past the gravestones and crypts that lined the place. She supposed she ought to be a little self conscious about it. She was a Slayer, after all. Supposed to be fit. But that was the joy of her special metabolism - any weight gained would disappear soon enough. She just happened to be eating too much for it to remain unnoticeable.

Still, she was wearing black, and that was slimming. She walked through the cemetery and approached the other Slayer, as well as the Watcher and the Wicca who were standing off to the side.

"Ah, Faith - roughly on time," said Giles in his British-stuffiness. "Now we can begin."

"Ooooh, fun," she replied.

"Okay, ladies," said Willow, reaching into her bag. "Just got the portal tracker gem things ready. Hopefully, by going in opposite directions, you won't have to worry about missing it."

"Yes, the radius has expanded to eleven miles last we checked," said Giles. "Still within Sunnydale city limits, so you shouldn't have to walk too far to find the portal generator."

"And no idea who the portal maker person is?" Buffy asked.

"Not as of yet. Could be human. Could be one of their fellow demons."

"Could even be a hacked off squirrel," said Willow with a goofy grin.

"Willow, please..."

"Nah, I'm with her," said Faith. "One doofus squirrel just happens to accidentally squeak an incantation when he stubs his toe, portal opens up, kablooie."

Giles rolled his eyes while Buffy and Willow giggled. "I could've stayed home and soaked my knee," he sighed.

"Eh, you love it, you know you do," Buffy said, gently elbowing him in the ribs.

"We'd better split before his glasses fall off," Faith added.

"Yeah, come on, Giles, let's let the Slayers have their hunt," Willow said, guiding the weary Watcher away. "We can join Xander and Oz marathoning all their Mystery Science Theater 3000 videos..."

"Oh, joy of joys," Giles sighed as he allowed himself to be led away. "Just a night of eating popcorn, drinking grape soda and mocking black-and-white B-movies... Actually, that does sound enjoyable..." He looked back to the Slayers. "You two be careful!"

"You know us!" Buffy replied.

"Indeed..."

Buffy and Faith chuckled as they were left alone in the cemetery. They walked a bit in silence, waiting for the gems to come 'online'.

"So... seen that glutton demon lately?" Buffy asked conversationally.

"Nah, and it's been a few days... But then again, I haven't heard about anyone having their food stolen, so he might be lying low for now."

"Good, good... So... whatcha been up to?"

Faith regarded Buffy with a funny look. "You know - the usual. Staking vamps, watching TV, eating, sleeping, rinse, wash, repeat..."

"Uh huh, great, great... So... how often do you train? Exercise?"

Faith shrugged. "Whenever I find the time. Although, I have to admit, I haven't been keeping up lately..."

Buffy looked like she was trying very hard not to say something.

"... You got something to say, B?"

"No! Nonononono, definitely nothing to say over here..."

"Good. Let's keep it that way."

They walked a little further until they were out of the cemetery - it was a big one - and stood at the iron gate.

"Okay," said Buffy, handling her gemstone. "I guess... you go that way, and I'll go this way. Walk around for a couple hours waving these things around and see what happens."

"And if one of us finds the thing making the portal?"

"... Stop it, I guess? I'm not really sure."

"Solid plan."

With that, they turned back to back and walked off in opposite directions.

Faith held the gemstone in her hand, waiting to see if anything happened. Absolutely nothing. She had a feeling Buffy would find it anyway. She was the actual Slayer, after all, and she was just the second rate knockoff. Kicking a tin can bitterly, she continued on her walk, waving the gem back and forth like it was a metal detector.

Her stomach gurgled. She was hungry again. Damn, after the big dinner she'd had, how could she still be hungry?

To her surprise, there was a burger joint up ahead. Seemed there was always something nearby to fill her belly. Licking her chops, she walked over. Might as well get something to tide her over during the search. She walked inside and gave her order - had to keep it fairly light since she was going to have to pay money for this.

"Double cheeseburger, no tomatoes or onions, large fries and large chocolate shake," she said breezily, already fishing the money out of her purse.

"For here or to go?" asked the cashier.

Before Faith could utter the words 'to go', there was a rumbling in the air that took them by surprise. You'd think in California they'd be more prepared for earthquakes, but this one made them all jump.

Faith looked outside, and she realized she would be staying here for a while.
11212121.title: Faith meets with Buffy to search out the portal

choices: A chubbier Faith wakes up in an alley
112121211.content:
The air around her seemed to warp and twist before a familiar scaly demon came spilling onto the floor. He did a tuck and roll before landing neatly on his feet, giving her a twisted smile. "Well, well, well, the other Slayer stops by for a mid-patrol snack?"

Faith glared at him. "Says the demon whose whole existence is stuffing his face?"

But the glutton demon smiled again. "Oh, I think you know by now it goes much deeper than that. How are those jeans fitting, by the way?"

Faith blinked. "... Fine, thanks... Why?"

"Because in a few minutes, they won't fit at all."

The demon snapped his fingers, and the lights in the building began to dim and turn a blood red color. The other people in the restaurant were all running out the doors in fear, including the employees. Damn, she thought, so much for that burger. And why was that a priority right now?

The wind whipped up, blowing her hair into her face, and she realized she needed to focus. She rushed at the demon and threw a punch, but her fist shot through empty space and embedded itself in the wall. The demon had disappeared. She looked all around for it, but it was now hovering in the air, streaks of red light flashing around it.

"Losing energy already? Somebody's been a little lazy lately!"

Faith growled and pulled her fist out of the wall. "What the hell are you doing?"

"Oh, just making some late night snacks. Seems the light show scared off the people in the kitchen, but I don't mind doing the cooking myself."

"So that's what this is about? Feeding your stupid face?"

"Oh, no, of course not!"

Suddenly, Faith's mouth opened against her will, and a cheeseburger flew into it, jamming itself into her gaping maw.

"... It's about feeding your stupid face!"

Faith tried to make herself not chew, but this demon had some kind of mental power over her. It took a while, but soon, the entire burger was eaten and swallowed. She barely had time to recover before another one flew through the air and forced itself into her mouth. This time, she could swear she felt her esophagus expand because she found herself swallowing the burger whole somehow.

"Wha... What are you doing?" she cried, gasping for breath.

"It's feeding time," the demon replied. "Not to worry. No tomatoes or onions. Those will probably be the only food left in the place by the time I'm through with you."

Before Faith could even formulate a witty response, she found herself slowly rising into the air. She tried to run or jump or anything, but without any gravity, it was no good. To make matters worse, burger after burger came flying out of the kitchen, swirling around her before jamming itself into her face hole. Somehow, she just kept swallowing them whole. One after the other. She could feel her stomach swell like a big meat-filled balloon. One greasy fatty burger after another.

And dammit, it felt good. To be force fed like this, not having to lift a finger, to be this stuffed and bloated...

It wasn't long before the button on her jeans gave way, and the zipper slipped down next. Faith opened wide and just let the burgers fill her up. Her giant balloon of a belly was swinging around like a wrecking ball as the demon slowly spun her around.

"Now, see? Isn't this fun? But wait, there's more! I believe the fries are up!"

Faith barely had time to look before an endless stream of french fries went flying into her mouth, sailing single file into her stomach. Oh god, it was salty heaven. She could feel her stomach swelling larger and large, to the point that she wasn't even in the air anymore. Her engorged stomach was too heavy now. She sat her ass neatly on the floor and leaned back against a wall, allowing the food to continue filling her up.

"And now...," the demon continued, "... time for something to wet your whistle!"

Faith let out a yelp as the soda dispensers all emptied, as well as the ice cream and milkshakes. They blended together into a sugary delight. Oh, god, the cascade of flavors - it should've been mush, but it was like she was tasting each of them separately and yet at the same time.

This feeding session seemed to go on for hours, but it was really more like twenty minutes before the entire kitchen was spent, and Faith was left sitting with a belly so big that it stretched out at least five feet in front of her.

"Well, well, well, just look at you...," the demon said in a growly voice. "Once all that food digests, it'll be a miracle if you can even move."

Faith was breathing heavily from the gorge, but she managed a few words. "Can't... get fat... Slayer... metabolism..."

"Oh, I know," the demon giggled. "The Slayer metabolism helps you to maintain your fighting figure. But if you eat too fast for it to keep up, it'll probably give up at some point. You have to admit, though... you don't hate all this extra size, do you?"

Faith's head was still swimmy from consuming so much in so little time, trapping her in a sort of food coma euphoria. Her hand couldn't reach far enough to rub her delightfully sore tummy. "I... I don't... I mean..."

But the demon smiled. "I thought as much," he chuckled. "Now then, I have other things to do, but do not despair, Slayer, for we shall meet again. In the meantime, just relax, digest and maybe invest in some stretch pants."

The demon disappeared in a flash, but Faith barely registered. She just slumped backwards and felt her eyelids getting heavier.
112121211.title: The glutton demon reappears

1141.content:
"Angel Investigations - we give hope to the hopeless," Cordelia said as fake-perkily as she could manage. "What mystical, metaphysical or just plain weird problem can we help you with today?" She jotted down the details on her notepad. "Mmmm-hmmmm... floating furniture... dismembered limbs... a pair of different hands... oh, they're thumb wrestling? That's interesting... Okay, just give me the address and I'll pass this along to our crack staff... Excellent. Thank you."

Cordelia ripped the paper with the necessary details and took them back to the main office where Angel was going through a few bills.

"Got another one for you," she announced. "82nd Street."

"How serious?"

"Could very well be a war."

"Uh-huh... Okay, I'll give Wes a ring, and we'll go check it out." He got up from his desk, grabbed the paper from her and headed out the door. "You'll hold down the fort while I'm gone, right?"

"Yeah, sure," she said casually. "No problemo, boss."

He regarded her briefly. "You sure?"

"Yeah! Totally sure! Absolutely!"

Angel's eyes could see right through her - she really was a crummy actress.

"Cordelia, it's okay to admit you're still sad. I miss him, too."

Cordelia could already feel her lower lip tremble at the mention of 'him'.

It had been over a month since Doyle's death. He'd sacrificed himself to save them and a bunch of Lister demons from a deadly beacon. The poor half-demon had been vaporized right in front of them, reduced to nothing, and all they had left of him were the visions from the Powers That Be that he'd passed on to Cordy before his death. It had taken her weeks to get to a point where she wasn't constantly sobbing. 13211111111211111.content:
Later that evening, having returned from a pleasant dinner at Dairy Queen, at which Donna had consumed a sundae meant for six people to share, she and Eric were making out on the latter's bed.

Donna was already shirtless, wearing only jeans and a heavy-duty bra. As they kissed, Eric played with his girlfriend's flab, squeezing the small roll which had recently formed between her belly and breasts.

As he nuzzled her neck, Donna slid her hands down and began to unzip his pants. He shifted slightly to give her better access, and suddenly they were both tumbling on to the floor.

It had always been a narrow bed, and as Donna grew bigger it had become more and more difficult to do it comfortably in the small space available. Having sex required a decent amount of balance, which Eric had inadvertently upset.

It wasn't a long way down, and Donna's extra padding meant she hardly felt anything, but she still hit the floor with an impressive thump.
Eric landed on top of her, and spent a pleasant moment with his face literally buried in Donna's cleavage before she pushed him off.

Donna started laughing, but Eric shushed her. Kitty and Red had been in the kitchen when they snuck in, and as he strained his ears he heard the sounds of someone making their way upstairs.

"Crap." Donna whispered, before turning over and attempting to hide under the bed. Eric knew that particularly strategy wasn't going to work, and tried to think of a plan. He was still thinking twenty seconds later when there was a knock on the door.

"Eric? Dad says keep it down or else." Laurie told him through the door, sounding bored.

"Uh, okay!" He yelled in response, praying she wouldn't try and come in. Donna had so far only succeeded at fitting her head and shoulders under the bed.

There was no reply, and after a few seconds Eric let out a sigh of relief.

Which turned out to be a little premature. Donna emerged with a look of disgust on her face, and a stack of magazines in her hands.

"Eric, what the hell are these?" She slung the magazines towards him, and they spread out almost neatly in front of where he was kneeling.

Each publication had a title like 'Big and Bouncy' or 'Plumpers', and the covers all featured voluptuous women in various states of undress.
While their expressions ranged from sultry to innocent, Donna's was one of pure outrage.

"Uh, these are just, uh, well..." Eric stammered, drawing a complete blank.

"Is this what you like? Do you think this is sexy?" Donna asked angrily.

"Yes..." Eric said quietly, seeing no point in trying to lie.

Donna got to her feet. "So what, were you going to fatten me up until I looked like one of these girls?"

Eric looked up at his girlfriend, who was already as big, if not bigger than most of the models in the magazines strewn around her feet. With her tits, belly and especially her magnificent ass, she could have been a centerfold in any one of them.

"Donna, I..." Eric wanted to come clean, but he just didn't know where to start. If Donna truly realised how fat she had gotten under his influence, would she ever forgive him?

"Save it!" She snarled, grabbing her shirt and heading out the door without pausing to put it on. He winced as she stomped down the stairs, and again as he heard the front door slam.

Outside, Donna was wrestling with a variety of emotions as she walked home. As her bare flesh goose pimpled in the cool night air, she felt her anger being replaced by confusion. She knew she had gained a little weight recently, maybe more than a little. Did Eric have something to do with it?

She was so busy considering this that she rang her doorbell without a second thought. Thankfully Midge was the one who answered the door.

"Donna? Do you know you're not wearing a shirt?"

Donna looked at her mother, who she now noticed had put on a few pounds herself.

"Mom... Am I fat?"

132111111112111111.content:
It was morning in the Forman household, and a relatively peaceful one, mostly due to the fact that Red had left for work early. Laurie and Eric were sitting opposite each other at the breakfast table, while Kitty finished cleaning the kitchen.

Eric was staring despondently at his breakfast, causing Kitty to pat him on the shoulder.

"Are you okay sweetie? You hardly touched your waffles."

It had been two days since Eric had last seen Donna, and he was worried. He would have gone over to her house, but he just didn't know what kind of reception he would get.

"Oh, I'm just not very hungry." He told her, pushing his plate to the centre of the table. Laurie immediately grabbed it and pulled it towards her, digging in eagerly.

Eric quickly looked away. Laurie's low cut nightshirt and continuing refusal to wear a bra to the breakfast table were distracting enough when she wasn't stuffing herself with food. She had already finished two helpings of waffles, along with half a dozen scrambled eggs and a side of bacon.

She finished the waffles in record time, washing them down with a long draught of orange juice before letting out a satisfied belch.

Kitty looked at her daughter with undisguised distaste. "Um, Laurie honey, you have some syrup on your..."

Laurie looked down and dabbed the fleck of syrup from her cleavage, before sucking her finger clean.

"Is there any more bacon?" She asked sweetly, wiping her hand on her shirt.

Before Kitty could lie and tell her there wasn't, Hyde slouched into the kitchen.

"Mail's here." He announced, waving a small stack of letters.

Laurie's expression instantly changed to one of fear, and she gripped the table as Hyde flipped through the mail.

"Bill, bill, bill..." He muttered, before looking up and smiling at Laurie. "Oh, here's something interesting."

She pushed back her chair, ready to jump to her feet and grab the letter.

"A letter for... Forman."

Laurie and Eric both looked surprised as Hyde handed him the envelope, before sitting down between them and grabbing a slice of toast.

Eric opened the letter as Laurie eyed Hyde suspiciously. Inside was a slip of paper, and what looked like...

Eric's eyes widened when he realised what he was looking at. It was a photo of Jackie, completely naked. Her pendulous belly was sagging down in front of her crotch, and she was covering her nipples with her hands, but it was still enough to bring him to full attention. It was a few seconds before he looked up at her face, to see she was staring straight at the camera, one eyebrow raised coquettishly.

Eric suddenly remembered where he was and quickly slipped the photo back into the envelope.

"Um, I have to... go." He said, jumping up from the table and walking quickly out of the room.

Kitty frowned, but she actually did have to go. She grabbed her bag and
hurried out, leaving Laurie and Hyde alone in the kitchen.

Looking over her shoulder until she was sure her mother was gone, Laurie returned her attention to Hyde.

"No letters for me Hyde?" She asked, trying to sound casual.

He continued buttering his slice of toast, then paused as if something had just occurred to him.

"Now that you mention it, there was a rather chunky envelope from the University of Wisconsin."

He resumed buttering his toast, but Laurie grabbed his wrist. "Where is it? Give it to me now you little..."

Hyde didn't react. "Don't worry Laurie, I'm sure it will turn up. Maybe Kitty will find it. Or Red..."

Laurie sighed, knowing she was beaten. "What do you want?"

He took a bite of his toast. "Just a few favours."

Laurie frowned. "Fine, but just hand stuff."

Hyde grimaced. "Not those kind of favours."

"Are you sure?" Laurie asked, leaning towards him and pushing her chest forward, though it was her bloated belly that bumped against him first.

Hyde was unmoved. "I'm sure."

With that he took his toast and left, telling her he'd catch up with her later.

Laurie was outraged. First Hyde blackmailed her, then he completely rejected her. She'd have to get back at him somehow.

But before she could do anything, she needed to get that letter.

1321111111121111111.content:
While Laurie was trying to think of a plan, Jackie was just finishing her own breakfast. Ten rich, buttery croissants with various jellies and jams, washed down with a gallon of creamy whole milk.

She rubbed her belly, imagining it growing even bigger. Last time she stepped on the scale, she had gained ten pounds, and that had been three days ago. Judging by the way her panties were bunching and cutting into her thighs, she had definitely gained a few more.

She wondered what Eric was making of the photo she had sent him. She had taken a few, from a few different angles, before deciding on the one she thought was the most enticing. She had included a written message, telling him that if he wanted a closer look, her parents would be gone all weekend.

Now it was up to Eric, Jackie thought, confident that he wouldn't be able to resist. She was just scraping the last of the strawberry jam out of the jar with her fingers when the doorbell rang.

She almost dropped the jar in surprise. Her parents had left early that morning, and the housekeeper had the day off. There was only one person she was expecting, but she hadn't thought he'd come over straight away!

Quickly she licked her fingers clean and got to her feet. After rinsing her sticky hands in the sink, she checked her reflection in the shiny surface of the toaster. Her hair was a little messy, and her pyjama top, the buttons straining around her belly, was spotted with jelly and butter.
She had been planning to dress up a little, maybe borrow one of her mother's teddies, but if Eric was eager enough to come over at ten o'clock in the morning, she supposed he wouldn't mind.

The doorbell rang again, and with a satisfied smile Jackie made her way to the front door. She undid the top two buttons of her shirt, showing off her slightly increased cleavage, and opened the door.

"Hi Jackie."

"Um. Hey Donna."

There was a brief pause. The two young women hadn't actually spoken to each other since the argument in the Formans' driveway, over a month ago. They had both grown a lot since then, physically if not emotionally. As fat as Jackie had gotten, she was barely even half the size of the rotund redhead.

"Can I come in?" Donna asked, after another few seconds had passed.

Jackie hesitated, but stood to one side. As Donna lumbered past her, Jackie took the opportunity to get a closer look at her ass, jiggling with each step beneath her tight grey sweatpants.

In the kitchen, Jackie invited her to take a seat, though it was a struggle for her to balance her enormous rear on the narrow chair.

"Do you want a drink, or some food?" Jackie asked, resorting to manners to navigate through the awkwardness. At the mention of the word 'food', Donna's belly let out a audible rumble.

"No. Thank you." She said, cheeks tinged with red

About a minute passed before Jackie grew impatient enough to break the silence. "So, what's up?"

It seemed that was all the invitation Donna needed to tell Jackie everything that had happened.
She told her about finding the magazines, and her suspicions about Eric, and admitted that Jackie had been right all along. She had stepped on the scale yesterday morning and had almost fainted when she saw the dial whiz up past 150, past 200, past 250...

When it finally settled on 263 pounds, Donna still hadn't believed it. It was only when she stripped down in front of the full-length mirror that she finally comprehended the scale of her weight gain. If Eric had something to do with it, if he had secretly tried to fatten her up, then she didn't think she could forgive him. Then again, she could hardly lay all the blame on him, he had never tied her down and force-fed her.

Jackie was somewhat discomfited by these revelations. Over the last few weeks she had come to think of Donna as her rival for Eric's affections, making it easier to scheme against her, but here she was seeking sympathy and advice.

"So, what do you think I should do?" Donna said, shifting slightly in the creaking chair.

Jackie was conflicted. If Donna had truly been as oblivious to her weight gain as she said she was, then maybe she should break up with Eric. But if Jackie told her to do it, was it just so she could have Eric all to herself?
She needed more time to figure this out.

"Are you sure you don't want something to eat? There's pie."

Once again, as if on cue, Donna's stomach let out a grumble. She shook her head firmly.

"No. I really can't. I'm trying to... well... lose weight."

Jackie was a little impressed by her willpower, but she still needed to distract her. "Well, you don't mind if I have some, do you?"

Before Donna could answer she turned and pulled open the fridge. She removed the pie, along with a can of whipped cream. She placed it down on the counter and cut a large, before spraying it liberally with cream.

Glancing at Donna, who was watching her closely, she picked it up and took a bite, chewing luxuriously and letting out a satisfied murmur.

"Is that... apple pie?" Donna asked, drooling slightly. All she had eaten for breakfast was some toast, and she was currently hungrier than she she had ever imagined possible.

Jackie suppressed a smile before answering. "Cherry."

Suddenly Donna was on her feet. "Maybe just one piece."

Jackie handed her the slice she was holding and watched as she crammed the entire thing into her mouth. Crumbs and flecks of cream covered the lower half of her face, and her eyes took on a glazed look as she chewed.

Jackie quietly slid the rest of the pie across the counter, and Donna let out a guttural moan and dug in with her bare hands. She practically buried her face in the flaky pastry, scooping up chunks of pie. When she finished, she was left breathing heavily, her hands and face stained dark red with cherry juice.

Jackie was amazed, and watched in silence as Donna slowly realised what she had done. She looked from the remains of the pie to Jackie, her face flushed even redder than the juice that coated her cheeks and chin.

"I'm... I'm so sorry, I..." She began, before giving up and running for the door, her butt bouncing as she ran. Jackie waited until she heard the front door slam, and then let out a low whistle. She scooped up a small fragment of pie that had escaped Donna's attention and popped it into her mouth.

"Is that everything?" The clerk asked, as Laurie slapped the money down on the counter.

She looked back at the four cases of beer and nodded. "Yeah, that's all."

As he counted out her change, she felt a pang of hunger and reconsidered. She hadn't eaten since dinner, and that had been almost two hours ago.

"Actually, give me a bag of those pork rinds. And some of that beef jerky too."

She immediately opened the bag of pork rinds, tipping the salty snacks straight into her mouth. She was halfway through the bag before she realised the clerk had returned to watching his miniature TV, rather than carrying her stuff out to the car for her.

Laurie didn't get it. Usually guys were eager to help her with the smallest of tasks, from holding doors open to lighting her cigarette. She pondered this as she chomped down another handful of pork rinds, scratching her belly with her free hand. She was even wearing one of her cutest outfits, a white t-shirt with a deep v-neck and and a pair of daisy dukes.

What Laurie wasn't taking into account of course was the body beneath the outfit. While her expanded breasts enhanced her cleavage considerably, it also meant the shirt barely reached halfway to her belly button. The denim shorts were incredibly tight, cutting into her belly and hips and forming a thick muffin top all the way around, and revealed every dimple of her flabbier ass.

After it became clear that he wasn't going to help her out, Laurie sighed and stuffed her snacks into her pockets, before bending down and picking up the beer. They were heavy, and her tight clothes made it even more difficult, but she managed to navigate her way to the door.

She was thankful that Hyde and Fez were waiting right outside, where they eagerly took the cases off her hands. She panted slightly as they loaded up the Vista Cruiser.

"Okay, are we done? You got your favour." Laurie said, retrieving her beef jerky and taking a bite.

Hyde shook his head. "Not even close. First things first, you have to drive us back home and hide this beer in your room."

Laurie groaned, but she knew she had no choice, and got back into the car. Hyde sat in the passenger seat, while Fez rode in back with the beer.

"This is so cool!" Fez said happily as they pulled out of the parking lot.

Hyde looked back at him with a grin. "I know man, our own private chauffeur. Toss me one of those brewskis."

Fez passed him a can and opened one for himself. Laurie licked her lips, dry from the salty snacks she had eaten, glancing sideways as Hyde sipped his beer.

"Hey, let me have some of that." She said, taking one hand off the wheel and reaching for the can.

"No way, it's ours." Hyde told her, moving it out of her reach. "Plus, you're driving."

Laurie rolled her eyes. "Come on, what's the worst that could..."

She was interrupted by the brief whoop of a siren and the thrum of a motorcycle engine, as blue and red lights filled the rear windshield.

"Cops!" Hyde yelled. "Lose the beer!"

He quickly slid his out of sight down the side of his seat, but Fez panicked, simply throwing his can into the air. It spiralled in the air, most of the liquid landing right on top of Laurie. She shrieked as the cold beer soaked through her top, and the car swerved slightly before she regained control.

The siren sounded again and Laurie slowed to a halt, turning around to glare at Fez, who smiled nervously while Hyde threw a blanket over the cases of beer.

She returned her attention to the situation at hand and quickly checked her make-up in the rear view mirror, before adjusting her shirt slightly to better showcase her rack.
She looked straight ahead as the crunching footsteps approached the car, and waited until knuckles rapped against the window before rolling it down.

"Do you know why I pulled you over ma'am?"

"Why no officer, I..." Laurie launched into her usual routine before she realised she was talking to a woman. She did a double take at the tight ponytail pinned up beneath the wide-brimmed hat, and the unmistakable swell of breasts underneath the pressed black uniform. Her name tag read Murphy, and her sleeve bore a sergeant's stripes.

Usually a few giggly compliments and a little flash of the goods was all Laurie needed to get out of trouble, but this might be a little more difficult.

"Well, you breezed through a stop sign about half a mile back and..." Sergeant Murphy began, before glancing down over her regulation aviators at the stain on Laurie's top. "Have you been drinking tonight ma'am?"

"No! You see, this idiot..." She turned to point at Fez, but Hyde subtly shook his head, so she turned back. "I mean, some idiot spilled beer on me as I was leaving... church."

The sergeant remained impassive. "You were swerving a little back there. That plus the stop sign, I'm going to have to write you a ticket. License and registration please."

Laurie knew she shouldn't push her luck, but she was in a bad mood. Hyde's manipulation, plus the clerk's indifference to her, and now this was just too much to deal with. "Oh come on! Don't you have real criminals to chase?"

She glanced at the officer's midsection, which bulged over her belt. It was only a small potbelly, dwarfed by Laurie's own gut, but she seized on it anyway.

"Or some more donuts to eat?"

It must have been a sore spot for Sergeant Murphy, because she immediately stopped writing out the ticket. After a brief pause, she spoke.

"Step out of the car please ma'am."

Laurie unbuckled her seatbelt and did as instructed, already regretting her rash insult. Sergeant Murphy explained that she was administering a field sobriety test, and asked her to please walk ten paces along the broken yellow line.

Laurie calmed down a little. She wasn't drunk, so it would be easy.
It might have been, if Sergeant Murphy hadn't skilfully interposed her size 8 boot between her feet and caused her to go stumbling to the ground, landing on her belly on the rough tarmac.

"Hey!" Laurie yelled, but before she could protest further Sergeant Murphy was kneeling on the small of her back and slapping handcuffs on her wrists.

She was hoisted upright and informed that she was being arrested on suspicion of drunk-driving. Sergeant Murphy frog-marched her back towards the Vista Cruiser and asked Hyde if he was okay to drive.

He nodded, dumbfounded, and slid over into the driver's seat. After they cautiously and slowly drove out of sight, Sergeant Murphy pushed Laurie down on to the ground and told her to sit tight. She would have to radio dispatch for a squad car to come pick her up.

"This time of night, it shouldn't be more than an hour, two tops." She told her, her voice for the first time betraying a hint of vindictiveness.

As Sergeant Murphy returned to her motorbike, Laurie sat sullenly on the ground, damp seeping in through the seat of her pants, her top covered in beer, and her arms wrenched painfully behind her back. She was starting to wonder if this was worse than just letting her parents see that stupid letter...

Eric looked at all the magazines scattered over his bed in confusion. He eyed the photo of Jackie. Of course he wasn't planning on seeing her. Although there was a tiny part of him that wanted to, but no, he couldn't as much as he fantasized about it, he wasn't going to have an actual fat girl harem. That was just ridiculous. He was strictly a one-fat-girl-at-a-time type of guy. He looked at the photo again. He couldn't help but smirk at the bitter irony. Donna, the girl he was supposed to be totally in love with, wasn't into any of his fat fetish fantasies, whereas Jackie, who he was supposed to hate, seemed to actually be into it. Maybe. Kind of. He wasn't sure just what was going on with her yet.

He quietly wondered just what he was supposed to do with all this. Was he wrong for liking it? He'd convinced himself he wasn't, but... part of him wasn't sure.

His mind drifted down a surprising path as it reminded him that this wasn't the only problem he and Donna had. God knows their relationship had been pretty volatile in recent years. Sometimes, he felt like he was constantly apologizing for something he'd said that was apparently insensitive. He knew he deserved it mostly, but there were other times he felt she was being unfair to him. Other times, she'd get mad at Eric for things that weren't his fault, and she'd use feminism and sex to win arguments. And although they had supposedly made up, he still smarted over her attitude towards the promise ring. Eric had only given it to her and never made any indication of undermining her future or interests, only asking if they were together in the hypothetical futures she brought up.

He rubbed his eyes. He really didn't need this. What was he supposed to do? Ditch Donna for Jackie? He and Jackie barely even tolerated each other. Why was she even interested in him, anyway? What had prompted it? Was she messing with him? No, of course not. Even she would never be that cruel. Did she actually like him? What was the deal?

He stayed in his room all day, trying to distract himself from his current problem. If only Donna shared his interest, this wouldn't be a problem. Then he recognized that he was trying to shift the blame, and he knew he had to accept that this was all on him. He hadn't forced anything on her, but he'd manipulated her.

Well, maybe if he apologized to her, that'd be a good start to some kind of solution. Maybe she'd never forgive him, but at least he could try.

He finally went outside - ignoring an irate Red on the phone with the police about Laurie - and slipped around the hedge to Donna's house. The cars weren't in the driveway, so hopefully, he wouldn't have to endure getting past her parents. He knocked on the door and hoped for the best.

When it opened, he saw Donna in her sweats and a t-shirt, which were doing a poor job of obscuring just how enormous she was now. Her large belly protruded far in front of her. He had to work hard not to glance down at it.

"What do you want?" she grumbled.

"... I'm here to apologize," he said.

She only raised an eyebrow, so he continued.

"Yes, I like fat girls. Just gonna get that out in the open. When we started dating, it was because I like you for you, and not for what size you are. But lately, when you started gaining weight... well, I admit I did encourage it..."

Donna glared at him. "Yeah, I should've gotten the hint when you arranged a picnic that was mostly desserts."

"Yeah, that wasn't good..."

"Look, Eric," she sighed, "I admit that you're not completely at fault here. You didn't exactly force anything on me. Everything I ate, I ate of my own volition. But this just isn't what I'm interested in. And you tried to manipulate me to fit your 'ideal' woman."

Eric winced. That was all true, definitely. "I know. And I'm sorry. I one hundred percent own what I did."

"Good. I'm glad you see what you did was wrong. But it's not enough right now."

"... What are you saying?"

"Eric... I'm sorry. I do love you, but this has put a different light on our relationship. We clearly want different things. God knows we've had problems before..."

"... Yeah, I guess we have."

"So maybe we need to break up right now."

"You think?"

"I know. I mean, I'm up for staying friends, but we're changing. Developing. Going in different directions. Maybe it's time to... y'know... accept that and move on."

Eric nodded sadly. He was heartbroken this was happening, but he had to admit that deep down, he and Donna had been headed this way for a while. "I... guess we will then..."

"I think we should be apart for a while."

"Agreed. Um, again, I'm sorry about..." He indicated her fatness.

She smirked. "It's okay. I'll figure something out... Goodbye, Eric," she said with a note of sadness.

Eric nodded, trying to keep his composure. Part of him wanted to cry so hard right now, but he didn't want the last image she had of him for a while to be him weeping. He managed a sad smile and turned back towards his yard, hearing the door shut behind him.

He wandered back to the house in a daze. Well, he thought sadly, this was a good life lesson. Never manipulate the people you love for your own selfish ends. The problem wasn't that he liked fat women. The problem was that he'd let that desire become more important than his relationship. He vowed he'd be better in the future.

He re-entered the kitchen to find his family in the midst of a crisis as Hyde and Fez awkwardly tried to explain to Red and Kitty why their daughter was in jail. Looked like a nice distraction from everything else going on.

1321111111121111111121.content:
At the Burkhart residence, Jackie was enjoying an especially big dinner. Thanks to her missing mother's unlimited credit cards, she could run up as big a tab as she wanted without worry, and teach that bitch a lesson for just walking out on her. She was having an extra-large pizza with everything, breadsticks and a liter of soda to wash it all down. By the time she was finished, she was lying on the floor in a bloated heap, an empty bottle by her head and crumbs everywhere. It was moments like this she missed the cleaning staff.

She ran her hands up and down her taught belly with glee. She beamed at how firm it was, so jam-packed full of food that it didn't even jiggle. She smiled to herself. She really knew how to throw a party for one. If this didn't get Eric's attention, nothing would.

Then, she heard the phone ring, snapping her out of her food coma.

Groaning to herself, she wished she was the kind of girl that could just let a phone ring before forcing herself into a sitting position. She heaved herself onto her feet and into the living room, thudding down on the couch and nabbing the phone.

"Burkhart residence," she said, just in case it was another lawyer trying to sue her imprisoned father.

"Jackie, it's me," said Donna.

Jackie sat up straight. "Donna? What is it?"

She heard a sniffle on the other end of the line. "Eric and I just broke up."

"... What?! What happened? When? Why?"

Donna took a moment to compose herself. "He... he admitted he's been trying to fatten me up," she said shakily. "He came over to apologize, but... Jackie, I just couldn't forgive him for it. It just... it changed everything about our relationship. This whole time he was with me, he was wishing I was... fat."

Jackie felt her heart drop. "... He did? Oh my god."

"I know... And I know you probably think it's weird, him liking fat girls, but that's not even the problem! He just... He manipulated me."

Jackie swallowed. She could hear the genuine heartbreak in her friend's voice, and it shook her to the core. All thought of 'stealing Eric' vanished from her head out of concern for her friend. "Oh, Donna, I... I'm sure he didn't want to hurt you," she said quickly. "I know what he did was wrong, but... he'd never intentionally make you feel bad."

"I know. Logically, I know that. I just can't... I'm not the kind of woman he needs. He needs someone who's into that, you know? He needs someone who shares that with him. I mean, if it's that important to him... he shouldn't need to trick someone into being what he wants, you know?"

Jackie sat in silence for a moment before realizing she was supposed to answer. "Yeah... So, what happened? Did you have a big fight?"

"No... he accepted it. I think we're going to try and be friends later, but... I just can't see him for a while. It'll be too hard. I need some time away from him."

"I understand. And hey, when you're ready, we can hang out sometime, okay? Get together, have lunch, drinks and then call him bad names?"

That got a brief laugh. "Yeah, thanks, Jackie... Although, maybe skip lunch. I've been eating too much lately."

Jackie bit back a comment like "no such thing as too much" out of respect, but smiled all the same. "Whatever you wanna do."

They talked for a while longer, seeing as how they hadn't really spoke in a long time, before saying goodnight and moving on.

Jackie wandered back into the kitchen, having digested most of her dinner, and set about cleaning up. God, she felt guilty. She couldn't believe what her brain had talked her into. Looking back, how did any of her plan to 'steal Eric' make any sense? Did she even like Eric that way? I mean, okay, so he was sweet, loyal, thoughtful, caring... probably make a good father someday...

She shook her head. Damn. Now she was actually thinking of Eric as something other than that scrawny neighbor boy. She visualized him in her head. He was cute, in a dorky sort of way. Nice smile. A haircut and some weight-lifting, and he'd be kinda sexy...

She mentally slapped herself. Stop it! This is your best friend's boyfriend!

Ex-boyfriend.

God. What was happening to her?

She finished cleaning the mess and sat at the table, placing her hands atop her belly. She peered down at it curiously. All this, just to get Eric's attention. The attention of a boy who she didn't even really like that way. Or, at least, she wasn't sure if she liked that way. Maybe. Kinda.

Oh god, of all the boy's to suddenly have a crush on, it was Eric friggin' Forman.

Rolling her eyes, she got up from the table to leave, but then she remembered the ice cream in the freezer she had been planning on eating, but the phone call distracted her.

She'd only been gaining weight to get Eric's attention. But now... she had to wonder. Did she really want to be fat?

"Thank you, Mr Forman!" Jackie squealed, kissing his forehead before sitting down. She noticed Eric roll his eyes before joining her at the table.

At that moment, in walked Laurie, looking remarkably grumpy and drab in her plus-size jeans and slightly-too-small top. Her large beer belly jiggled as she joined them at the table, sitting down with a thud across from them.

"Oh joy, the midget's here," she grumbled.

"Now Laurie, be nice. She's Eric's friend, and she's joining us for dinner."

Laurie gave her a dismissive look and took her plate. As she piled on her food, Jackie couldn't help but marvel how big she was since she'd last seen her. What had happened there? She stole a glance at Eric and realized that he was trying very hard not to look at her. Oh god, this poor boy was so sex-starved he was drawn to his own sister's fatness. She probably should've been grossed out by that, but to her surprise, she felt bad for him. He needed something else to focus on.

And luckily, she was the kind of girl who could pull that off.

When the food came around to her, she took a very generous helping. She talked animatedly - one of her natural gifts - to keep Mr and Mrs Forman focused on her instead of her plate, talking about shopping - something Kitty would be interested in - and her dad's car - something Red would be interested in. During all this, she added more and more food to her plate, creating an impressive mound.

She glanced at Eric and saw him staring quietly at her meal and saw that it was working. If he could focus on her fatness instead, the night would go much easier for him.

And she liked the attention, too.

Of course, her stomach protested at all the food in front of her, still not done digesting her burgers and fries from the Hub. Still, she soldiered on and ate what she could.

She threw a glance at Laurie. She was eating an impressive amount as well, but she was still all sullen and not speaking. Some sort of drama had taken place she was not aware of. Served the bitch right for stealing Michael from her.

Jackie tried to keep her mind off her fullness by continually chatting with everyone, but after fifteen minutes, it was beginning to feel a little tight in her mid-section. God, she was so full. She glanced down at her belly and saw how the buttons were straining on her shirt. This was a nice top, too. She didn't want to ruin it.

But there was still so much food to finish, and she wanted to keep Eric's attention. She looked at Laurie again and saw her also slowing down, a hand atop her bloated belly. Grimacing, Jackie continued eating. If nothing else, this scrawny neighbor boy would be fantasizing about her tonight, and no one else.

It was another ten minutes before she finished, and she was so stuffed she was worried she might barf, but she did it. Every last scrap of food was eaten off her plate. She set her fork down and daintily dabbed at her mouth with her napkin.

"That was wonderful, Mrs Forman," she said, trying to stay bright and cheery even when she was ready to pass out.

"Well, thank you, Jackie! I'm glad you enjoyed it! It's just a little something I spent hours on! Aha ha ha ha ha ha!"

They all proceeded to get up from their chairs. Jackie was so full she could barely move and was clearly struggling, but Eric wrapped an arm around hers and gently helped her up. Her head practically erupted with joy as he made physical contact. She wanted to squeeze his arm and walk off into the sunset with him, but that would probably be embarrassing for him in front of his family.

And she wasn't in the mood to walk, anyway. Right now, she wanted to pass out.

Laurie, meanwhile, was looking similarly bloated as she tried to get up from the chair, but she had no one to help her from the table. She waddled awkwardly, trying to get her engorged gut to stop swinging like a pendulum and waddle back to her room. God, what was happening to her? Why was she letting this happen to herself? She used to dominate all those who dared cross her with charm, good looks and pure evil. Now she was a fat blob leeching off her parents, getting in trouble all the time.
1321111111121111111121112111.title: Laurie is having dinner with them as well

13211111111211111111211121111.content:
If the walk up from the basement had seemed long after one meal, walking back down again was moderately terrifying after two meals.

Jackie clutched Eric's arm as he gently guided her down into the basement and towards the couch. She needed to lie down for a bit, but she had to do so in a dignified manner. Something ladylike. Just because she'd eaten like a pig didn't mean she couldn't still look amazing. She gently lowered herself onto the couch, lying on her side, placing her head in one hand, the elbow resting on the couch arm, and her other hand resting atop her belly. She looked up at Eric with a sultry look in her eye, and she struggled not to squeal at how cute he looked when he blushed.

She allowed a small smile. She was pulling it off.

And then she let out a belch that echoed throughout the room.

Her hand flew to her mouth in shock, startled she'd let herself do that. She looked at Eric, who was looking surprised, and also like he was trying not to laugh. Realizing she'd lost the moment, she sighed and waved him on. "Oh, just let it out."

Eric descended into helpless giggles and doubled over, slapping his knee as he slumped into the nearby chair. "I'm... I'm sorry...," he laughed. "It's just... the look on your face...!"

Jackie tried to look annoyed, but the amount he was laughing made her smile a bit. It was pretty funny. "Yeah, well, buckle up, buttercup, because I think I feel another one coming on."

"Oh, by all means, go ahead," Eric chuckled.

Jackie laid herself flat on her back and let a long low belch erupt from her midsection. She propped up her head on the couch arm and patted her stomach. "Ohhhh, god," she moaned. "I can't believe I finished all that food."

"Neither can I. I mean, it was impressive, y'know?"

"Yeah, I guess it was. After all I ate with Rhonda at the Hub, I'm surprised I didn't just burst."

Eric's eyes widened. "You mean... you'd already eaten before you got here? Why didn't you say?"

Jackie shrugged awkwardly. "I dunno... I guess I just... wanted to stay for dinner? I mean... I..." Oh god, was this it? Where was this going? "... I like spending time with you, Eric," she settled on. It was true, after all. "I like... being around you. Laughing with you. Arguing with you. And god knows we do a lot of that..."

Eric smiled, so she continued.

"I dunno... I guess I kinda... like you..."

There was a long pause, and she briefly hoped this was happening the way she wanted to.

Eric shifted in his seat, looking like he was trying to build up his nerve. "Well, I... kinda like you, too, Jackie."

Jackie gave a sleepy smile. "I'd go over to you, but I'm so stuffed I can't move."

"Message received," he replied, getting up and sitting with her on the couch, putting her feet in his lap.

"Ooooh, my tummy hurts," she moaned, giving it a gentle rub.

She saw the look in his eyes - that desire - and quietly began to undo the straining buttons on her top, exposing the pale orb of her fat belly, so taut and round from an all day stuffing. She saw the desire increase and smiled at him, raising an eyebrow.

"Wanna help me make the hurt go away, Eric?" she asked playfully.

His expression didn't change, but he managed to nod.

She reached out for his hand and grabbed it, placing it atop her stomach. "Rub my tummy better, Eric," she moaned. "It's so full and stuffed, and I need someone to rub it."

Eric bit his lip. God, this was a fantasy come to life! Except no. Not a fantasy. Reality. A real life woman. Jackie. Jackie Burkhart was offering him the chance to rub this big fat stomach of hers. He had to proceed carefully. Not like when he manipulated Donna. This had to be done correctly - with her needs in mind.

So, he gently began rubbing in big circles across the massive surface. God, it was soft and hard at the same time. The flesh so thick but the inside packed so firmly. He listened carefully to the sounds she made - a grunt when he pushed to hard and a contented 'mmmm' when he did it just right. And soon, he was getting 'mmmm-ed' quite a lot.

"... Is that good?" he asked quietly.

She nodded, her eyes shut, her head back, her arms splayed all over.

Eric continued like that for a long time, just enjoying her belly, her company, the quiet...

Before he knew it, it had been half an hour, and he'd done nothing but rub her stomach. Still, the smile never left her face. She looked so content, full of food and enjoying his hands on her.

As he slowed, she opened her eyes slightly and looked at him. She saw the look in his eye was very content, but still some desire. One more thing he clearly wanted to do. She was so sleepy, but she still wanted it so bad. She lazily lifted a hand and placed it on his cheek, fighting to keep her smile from getting too big. God, how had this happened? She'd actually fallen for Eric Forman to the point that she was about to invite him to do this?

He leaned down and gently kissed her.

God, he was actually really good, too. No wonder Donna put up with him for so long. He was gentle, curious, sweet, hungry all at once. She wrapped her arms around him and pulled him closer, until he was lying on top of her, but careful not to put too much pressure on her still stuffed belly. So considerate.

After several minutes of tongue hockey, they came up for air, and he looked her in the eye.

"... Wanna go out on a date Saturday?"

She beamed.
