Fez and Rhonda hit the food court
132111111112111111112111211111.content:
Donna grumbled to herself as she waddled through the clothing store. It was all Eric's fault, probably. Even after being broken up for several months, she was still gaining weight. It wasn't fair. He'd instilled some kind of joy of gluttony within her, and now she was pigging out constantly. Any diet she came up with never seemed to get past the planning stage. She'd tell herself she'd start tomorrow, but then she'd see something sweet or salty or savory that she craved and would put it off until she'd forgotten about it and gained another pound.

Fifteen pounds later, this wasn't getting any better. Her ample figure had ballooned out of her current wardrobe, so she now found herself looking around the plus-size store at the mall. She caught sight of her enormous ass in the mirror and sighed. She didn't want this. She really didn't. How the hell was she supposed to stop?

Still, it wasn't a total loss. Some of these plus-size outfits were pretty cute. She was just comparing colors when she heard footsteps approaching, and she turned in surprise.

"Donna, old friend!" Fez exclaimed. "You are a sight for soaring eyes!"

"Sore eyes, Fez," Donna smiled, giving him a hug.

"Oh, I think they make eye drops for that, but not in this department."

"What're you doing in the women's section of a plus-size clothing store?"

"It is strictly above board, I assure you. Rhonda is looking for a new dress."

"Oh, where is she?"

"Changing room. This way."

Fez led Donna towards the changing room in the back. After checking with the employee on duty, they watched as one of the curtains was pulled back, and out stepped a much bigger "Big" Rhonda than Donna had last seen.

Rhonda was wearing a floral dress that hugged her curves rather flatteringly. Her big belly was her most prominent feature, with smallish breasts and a flat ass, but the dress drew attention away from those. She gave a small twirl for Fez. "What do you think?"

"A vision of an angel," Fez replied.

Donna glanced at Fez in bewilderment. Rhonda had clearly gained weight in the last few months. Did he not see that? Or was he like Eric and preferred them heavier? Or was something else up?

"Donna!" said Rhonda. "Great to see you! Hardly anyone sees you anymore!"

Donna shrugged amiably. "Paper's not gonna write itself."

"Loved the article on the condition of the gym bleachers. Someone seriously needs to rebuild those."

"Yes, preferably with more room for couples to engage in the sex," Fez agreed.

Donna crinkled her nose, but smiled all the same. "Thanks, Rhonda. How are things with you guys?"

"Things have been great," Rhonda smiled. "Fez and I are really happy, aren't we, Fezzie?"

"Every day is an adventure," Fez said with a smile.

Donna eyed Fez again but said nothing for now. "That dress looks great on you, Rhonda."

"Oh, thanks! I needed to go up a size. Clothes are all cute and fun until you can't breathe in them," she giggled.

"Yeah, that's... very true," Donna sighed, eyeing the clothes she was still carrying.

"Oh, do you need this changing room? Just give me a minute to change back! Back in five!" She ducked back behind the curtain and went back to changing clothes.

Donna gently guided Fez further away and whispered at him. Now was the time to say something. "Everything okay with you guys?"

"Everything's fine!" Fez insisted, smiling as big as he could.

"Don't make me purple nurple you."

Fez quickly covered nipples. "Okay, okay! Rhonda is sweet and lovely and fun to be with... but..."

"But what?"

"... I don't know... I still think about Jackie..."

Donna rolled her eyes. "Oh my god, Fez..."

"It's just not fair! She has taken interest in everyone except for young handsome Fez! She had Kelso, then she liked Hyde for a while, and then she went back to Kelso, and now she's making goo-goo eyes at Eric!"

Donna did a double-take. "Wait, what?"

"I know! It's so unfair! I am so much better looking than Eric! I have the moves, the smoky sexy goodness, we can roller-disco together...!"

"Eric and Jackie are together?!"

Fez shrugged, still oblivious to the redhead's emotions. "I don't think so. But they're all pally now, and poor Fez is left on the corner all alone."

Still reeling from an increased possibility her ex and her best friend were potentially heading towards being a couple, Donna managed to regain her senses. "You've got Rhonda," she pointed out. "And correct me if I'm wrong, but you really like her a lot."

"Ai, I do... And I was doing fine with Rhonda until Jackie started liking Eric... What do I do?"

"Well, either tell Rhonda the truth and break up with her, or stay with her and pretend everything's fine."

Fez nodded. "You are absolutely right, Donna. Thank you for your support."

"Of course."

They heard the curtain re-open, and they turned to see Rhonda walking towards them, carrying the dress over her arm, and her plump body forced back into the somewhat-tight jeans and shirt. She beamed at them.

"Okay, I'm ready to go. Fez?"

"I shall follow you to the ends of the earth and back," Fez replied with a big smile.

She smiled and waddled off towards the register with a wave to Donna.

Donna, however, gave Fez a surprised look.

Fez shrugged. "She is good at cuddling," he said before following after her.

Donna stared after them in amazement before shaking her head in disgust and disappearing behind the curtain herself. She slipped out of her constricting jeans and slipped into the much bigger pair. She noted with some pleasure how easily they slid up her meaty thighs. She thoroughly enjoyed not having to grunt and struggle as she buttoned them up around her inflated waist. She particularly enjoyed how the took her enormous ass and gave them a very attractive curved shape.

Smiling quietly, she ran her hand up and down her ass and thought Rhonda was right - being fat was much easier when your clothes actually fit you.
132111111112111111112111211111.title: Donna meets Fez and Rhonda

1321111111121111111121112111111.content:
Fez dropped Rhonda off at her place and made his way a few blocks down to the Forman house. He wondered what would happen if he let slip to Eric that he had seen Donna today. Maybe he could reignite his interest in the rounded redhead and keep him away from Jackie. Then he'd be able to continue dating Rhonda in peace, knowing that she was still single.

He found the basement door and entered without knocking, as was customary at the Forman house, and meandered inside. He found Eric going through a few magazines while Hyde sat in his chair watching TV.

"Hello, friends of Fez!" he announced brightly. "You will never believe who I saw at the mall today!"

"If it's Willy Wonka again, we still don't buy it," Hyde replied.

"Yeah, it was probably just a hobo in a purple jacket," Eric agreed.

"Hey, he's out there somewhere!" Fez snapped before remembering why he came down here. "And no! I saw Donna!"

That got their attention. Both guys looked up in surprise.

"Donna? Really?" asked Eric.

"A rare sighting of the wild Pinciotti," mused Hyde.

"How is she?"

"She's a workin' girl," Fez said. "Talked a lot about the paper. And boy, has she ballooned up, am I right?"

Eric blinked. "I don't know. I didn't see here."

"Well, I am! Rhonda and I saw her at the plus-size clothing store!"

"Not really able to judge considering Rhonda was probably shopping for plus-size clothes, too, buddy," Hyde pointed out.

"That is beside the point! The point is, Donna is doing great and living her best life right now."

"Well, good," said Eric, already looking back at his magazines. "Glad to hear it. I was hoping she would be."

Fez deflated slightly. He'd been hoping Eric would badger him for more questions - not maturely accept Donna had moved on. "What are you doing?"

"Trying to find some nice restaurant ideas."

"What for?"

"Haven't heard? Forman and Jackie are going on a date," Hyde said, his attention already back on the TV.

Fez's mouth fell open. "Wh... what?!"

"Yeah, we're going out tomorrow!" Eric said with an eager smile. "Just gotta pick out a decent place. You know she's got standards."

"But... you can't... I mean... You and Jackie..."

Eric looked at him with raised eyebrows. "Me and Jackie what?"

"But... you don't even... You and Jackie aren't in love!"

"... Well, no, it's just a date to see if we work. All we know is that we like each other."

"But you can't...! I mean, you shouldn't..." Damn. Every argument he tried to come up with sounded dumber than the rest and never got past the first few words.

Mercifully, the door suddenly burst open, and in stormed Kelso. "All right, Eric! There's no escape!"

The guys all stared at him in befuddlement.

"... Escape from what?" Eric asked, sounding a wee bit amused.

"Escape from me! You thought you could just date Jackie and get away with it?"

"Damn right, buddy!" Fez exclaimed, relieved he had someone else to fight this battle for him.

"Kelso, you guys broke up!"

"She was still my girl first!"

"Yeah, she was!" Fez agreed emphatically.

"So what, you want to get back together with her?"

"I... I don't know! I just don't want you dating her!"

"Because what kind of friend would do that?" asked Fez dramatically.

"Look, Kelso, you guys have been over for months. Donna and I have been over in less time. How have you not moved on yet? You've been banging every girl in town since then!"

"Yeah, and that's awesome! But I didn't want Jackie to move on!"

"And she shouldn't!" Fez agreed.

"So, what, you were hoping she'd be miserable without you for the rest of her life?"

"Well...," Kelso faltered, "... I mean... not quite like that... I just..."

They all looked at him as he stammered. Hyde went back to the TV.

Kelso finally thudded down in the lawn chair. "I guess... I wasn't ready to think of her with someone else. Especially not one of my best friends."

"Yeah, cuz what kind of friend does that?" Fez threw in.

Eric ignored Fez and focused on Kelso. "Look, man, I'm sorry, but this is what's happening. And right now, it's just one date. For all I know, that's all it's going to be. But it might not be, and I'm hoping it leads to more. I know that's hard for you. God knows it'll be hard when Donna meets another guy. And it'll be hard for Jackie when you finally settle down and meet someone else."

That made Kelso perk up a little. "Really? It will?"

"If that's what you need to take from all this, sure. She'll be sad seeing the man she once loved move on to someone else, even if she's with someone else."

Kelso thought about this for a while. "Well... I guess that makes it better..."

Fez blinked. "What the hell?"

"I promise to treat her right, man," Eric assured him.

"Yeah, okay... Just promise you won't do it with her for a while. At least not after the first date."

"Dude, you know Jackie doesn't put out."

Kelso laughed. "Yeah, that's true. She makes you work for it."

"What is happening?" Fez demanded, realizing that none of them were listening to him.

"Oh, and just a tip - the first time, she's probably gonna want candles lit. And the wind blowing. And you might wanna get one of those puffy pirates shirts like on those romance book covers. She's super into that."

"Noted."

"Oh, come on!" Fez moaned. "He can't date Jackie!"

Both guys looked at him.

"Why not?" asked Kelso.

Fez blinked. With no one on his side, he realized he was stuck for an answer. "Because... he doesn't have a nice jacket? Jackie will want him dressed nice."

Eric waved him off. "Oh, I can pull something together. We agreed to keep it casual."

Kelso scoffed. "Lucky you. I mean, I have the natural advantage of looking good in anything, so you're outta luck there..."

"Well, I mean, she accepted going out with Hyde when he was just wearing whatever he was wearing that day."

"Yeah, but I have that rugged handsomeness that makes up for less-than-stellar clothing options," Hyde replied, not looking up from the TV.

As the other three went back to what they were doing, Fez slumped in the background. Nothing seemed to be going right for him.

Hyde blackmails Laurie the next morning
13211111111211111111211121111111.content:
Later that night, Hyde came upstairs from his cot in the basement to look for a midnight snack. They'd had chicken earlier. Maybe there was still some in the fridge. Didn't matter if it was cold. There had to be something. He quietly snuck upstairs and made it to the fridge, pulling it open and being bathed in the light within. He peered around and found a leftover chicken leg that would satisfy him for the night.

He was just closing the fridge door when he saw headlights pulling into the driveway. Instinctively, he ducked behind the counter, but then, he remembered that he lived here, so he crept back up again. Peering out the sliding backdoor, he saw that the car in question was a cab. He saw the backdoor swing open, and out swung a pair of super meaty thighs, followed by a big round belly, and a cascade of blonde hair. Laurie Forman was back from wherever the hell she'd been. Honestly, sometimes, he simply forgot that she still lived here. She slipped in and out of their lives so often, it was getting difficult to keep track.

He watched as Laurie finished paying the cab driver - and then briefly attempt to make out with him - before the cab reversed out of the driveway and onto the road, disappearing into the distance. Laurie stood on the back porch for a few seconds before turning to head inside. There was a certain clumsiness to her turn that gave away to Hyde that she'd been out drinking. He knew there were two options here. Either be here and confront her head on, possibly humiliating her, or he could go back to hiding behind the counter and listen in on her drunken stupor, possibly learning something humiliating that he could use later.

The second option had a level of sneakiness that he greatly appreciated, so he resumed hiding behind the counter before she could enter. As silently as possible, he crawled on his hands and knees until he was hidden in the hall behind the fridge. He heard the backdoor quietly squeak open, the staggering footsteps, and then it squeaked shut again.

Right away, it was clear how drunk Laurie was. Peering around the corner, he saw her stagger about the kitchen, slap her purse down on the table, and move around, singing quietly and decidedly off-key. He bit back a smirk. He'd seen her drunk before, but this was something new. After everything that had gone wrong in her lousy life, was the shame finally catching up to her? Not impossible, but highly unlikely. Something must be bothering her. If he listened long enough, maybe he'd hear something.

Laurie, of course, was deaf and blind to the world around her. She was drunk. Completely pissed. She'd gone to a bar in the hopes of killing a few brain cells. Usually, it wasn't hard to get drinks for free, but tonight, it'd been damn near impossible. Thankfully, there'd been one guy who'd been interested in her that night. Some oily-looking skeevy kind of guy. Laurie had suspected at the time that he was trying to get her drunk enough for some easy sex, and frankly, the guy looked deranged. She wanted to be drunk, though, and he was willing to pay. So she made a deal with the bartender to call her a cab once it looked like the guy was going to take her with him. When the guy ducked into the restroom, the bartender had discreetly had her slipped out to the waiting cab.

Of course, it had taken a long time to get there, and she'd gotten very drunk in the process. So many drinks. So much booze in her belly. She could still hear it slosh inside of her as she waddled awkwardly around the house. She sleepily staggered over to the counter and lifted it up on top of it with a slap. It gurgled with the contact, making her giggle.

"Whassa'matter, belly?" she slurred. "Not get enuff to drink?"

Hyde peered around the corner in bemusement. The girl was actually talking to her stomach. She rubbed it soothingly as it sat lazily atop the counter, perfectly round. What had she done to herself that she'd let herself get that fat? What went on at college before she flunked out?

"C'mon then," she continued, lifting her stomach off the counter and walking awkwardly to the fridge. "Lessee what we got in'ere..."

Hyde hid himself further away in the darkness, although he briefly wondered if it was worth it. She was clearly too drunk to know what was going on around her. He could probably walk through the room in just his shades, and she wouldn't notice. He chanced peeking all the way around, and there she was, rooting through the fridge. Sounded like she was looking for something. But what? Red's beer? Was she really going to have more to drink?

But then, he heard munching and chewing, followed by swallowing and moaning. She was eating. Seeing that she was totally engrossed in whatever was in the fridge, Hyde took a chance and quietly snuck in on his bare feet into the kitchen, tiptoeing around her. She was so oblivious that she didn't hear a sound. Just more munching and gulping and swallowing and burping. It was an endless cycle, and she wasn't about to break it.

He finally was standing directly behind her. Good god, she wasn't even really looking for anything. She was just eating whatever she could get her hands on. Chicken, peanut butter, jelly, sticks of butter, mac n cheese, ranch dressing, mustard, ketchup... She was chugging a bottle of barbecue sauce, for gawd's sake!

But inside Laurie's drunken mind, there was nothing odd about this. She needed more. She craved more. She ate and ate and ate, not caring how many stains were on her shirt or how much of a mess she made. More and more and more...

Finally, however, she grew tired, slowed for a while, and then finally stopped. She leaned her head against the freezer door in silence before she at last shut the fridge door. Hyde froze, realizing that he was still out in the open. He didn't know what to do, short of diving back behind the counter.

But then, she turned, and she was face to face with him. Her engorged stomach swung out far in front of her, revealing the buttons on her blouse had popped off at some point. She looked at him with sleepy eyes, and he wondered if she even knew he was there.

"... Hey, ugly," she mumbled. "I need t' pee. Which way's th' bathroom?"

Momentarily dumbfounded, Hyde took a moment before he pointed towards the stairs.

"Thanks..."

Laurie waddled out of the kitchen and upstairs. Once she was out of sight, she let out a loud belch that shook the house.

Hyde stared after her in a stupor, then at the mess on the floor. Shrugging, he turned and left. Tomorrow morning would be interesting.

Eric straightened his jacket one more time. He was going to get this right. Not only was he going out with a sexy fat girl, but it was a sexy fat girl who was into being a sexy fat girl. God, this was exciting. He never would've guessed he'd be all excited about taking out Jackie Burkhart of all people, but here he was, trying to look his best for her and make sure she had a good time.

A few things he had decided to rule out. No buffets or all-you-can-eat joints. This was a date, not some fetish fantasy he wanted to act out. Also - no talking about it over dinner. They were trying to see if they were compatible as a couple. Because it wasn't just horny desire fueling this date - he was genuinely into her. The last few months of being friends had been fun and easy - much easier than it had ever been with Donna. She actually seemed to enjoy some of his nerdier aspects, watching Star Trek reruns with him, and once she got the hang of it, she was actually pretty good at dubbing old movies and sports shows with him.

He grabbed the keys to the Vista Cruiser, said good night to his parents, and walked out the door, all set. He hoped this would go well.

Ten minutes later, he was parked outside the Burkhart residence. Damn, this was a big house. It was hard for him to imagine her all alone in there, what with her absentee parents. Jackie was the sort of person that required people in her life, if only to admire and fawn over her. Maybe that was why she hung out in the basement even after she and Kelso broke up.

Walking up the steps, he took a deep breath and rang the doorbell. He was ready for this. Everything was going to be fine.

The door opened. He took one look at her and forgot to breathe for a few seconds.

Jackie was stunning. Hair done up nicely, a lovely form-fitting floral print dress and her handbag around her shoulder. She smiled shyly at him, clearly grinning from excitement. "Hey!" she said.

"Hey," he replied, still mesmerized. It took a few moments for his brain to come back online. "Ready to go?"

"Yeah," she said, following him down to the car. "Just had to make sure the housekeeper was all set for the night. When nobody's home, she holds her poker night in the basement. She thinks we think she's scrubbing the floors."

Eric chuckled, guiding her towards the car. Mentally remembering all the things she complained about Kelso never doing for her, he reached out and opened the passenger side door. She smiled appreciatively and got herself inside. This car was a little lower than she was used to, so it took a little while to fit her plump body inside. Once she got herself situated, he shut the door and went around to the driver's side. When he got there, he saw that she was having a bit of a tug of war with the seat belt, trying to make it fit around her belly. He was briefly mesmerized before remembering she was probably not enjoying this as much as him, and he reached out and pressed a button on her seat.

"Here. Let me adjust that for you," he said.

Jackie felt her seat slide backwards, allowing her to sigh with relief. "Thanks," she gasped, finally comfortable.

Soon, he was pulling out of her driveway and out onto the open road.

"So, where are we going?" she asked. There was a tiny part of her that was worried he would say Fatso Burger or the Hub.

"Al Fredo's," he replied. "Italian food. Thought you might like it."

Jackie's eyes widened. "Eric, that's a fancy place! How'd you get a table?"

He grinned slyly. "Oh, I have my contacts..."

"Contacts?"

"Yeah. Well... My mom removed the owner's kidney stone a year ago, so she got us a table."

Jackie laughed. "Well, remind me to thank her next time I see her."

A few minutes later, Eric had parked the car, and they were both walking up the sidewalk and into the building.

Jackie swooned. The place smelled divine. She beamed at all the pasta. All the marinara. All the fettuccine. All the everything. It was like fat girl heaven! So many carbs to consume!

Eric guided her to their table and pulled her chair out for her before seating himself. He was really trying. Keep putting in that effort, he told himself. She appreciates that kind of thing.

The waiter brought them their menus, and they peered over them.

"So, what do you want to get?" he asked.

"God, there's just so much good stuff on here," Jackie murmured.

Eric braced himself. As much as he'd like to see her pig out, he still didn't have a lot of money other than the forty bucks Red had given him. Man, minimum wage sucked.

At last, Jackie said, "I'll think I'll get the lasagna with garlic bread."

Eric glanced at the price and tried not to look too relieved. "Oh good. I'll get the Pasta Carbonara myself..."

"Ordering the cheap stuff, huh?"

"Er... well, I mean..."

Jackie giggled at how flustered he looked. "It's okay, Eric. I get it. You're poor."

Eric looked mock-affronted. "Am not! Just middle class! Big difference!"

"Sure, it is," she smirked playfully. "I mean, I guess I could pull out my dad's credit card that he doesn't know I have..."

"No, I insist. I'm paying tonight."

"Awwww, that's sweet."

"Although, I may need you to pay for gas for the next few weeks..."

She laughed and gave a nod. "Whatever you say."

Soon, the waiter arrived and took their orders, left glasses of water, and took the menus, leaving them alone once more.

"So...," Eric said, racking his brain to think of something that didn't involve Donna, Kelso or his fetish. "Still hanging out with Rhonda?"

Jackie shrugged. "Sometimes. She's really sweet, and she's been helping with my homework. And we get lunch together sometimes. Oh, and I've been totally updating her wardrobe. How does such a sweet girl survive with only two pairs of shoes and the same basic clothes every day? Poor thing needed some variety, stat!"

Eric smiled. "And so, Jackie Burkhart swooped in and saved the day?"

"Of course, I did! That should be my mission in life! Taking girls with no taste in fashion and beautifying them!"

"Well, I think it's very kind that you're willing to share your wisdom with the world, Miss Burkhart."

She shrugged cheerfully. "Can't keep all this beauty knowledge to myself! Gotta spread it all over, like peanut butter."

"Damn. Now I want peanut butter..."

Jackie laughed. God, this was actually really fun. Were her dates with Kelso ever this enjoyable? She couldn't recall any actual attempts at witty banter. He was usually so physical. Get through dinner so they could make out in the car. Not much conversation. But with Eric... He just seemed to know how to make her laugh.

Their conversation switched from friends to school to jobs to movies. Eric briefly remembered his self-promise to not discuss his fetish with her and felt momentarily proud of himself. Then, Jackie made a joke about the janitor, and he was steered away from those thoughts again. All he could focus on was this beautiful girl sitting across from him, and something told him that, fat or thin, Jackie Burkhart was the kind of person he might've fallen for no matter what.

1321111111121111111121112111111111.content:
"... So did you hear there's talk of a Muppet movie?" Eric asked.

Jackie squealed. "Oooooh, I love Muppets! They're so cute! I love Kermit! He is adorable! I just wish he'd give Miss Piggy a chance!"

"Poor guy doesn't know how good he has it, with a woman like that..."

"Oh, totally! I bet they'd be totally sweet together!"

There was a brief pause as they looked across the table at each other, and the subtle parallels became apparent. Eric tried to smother a goofy grin, and Jackie hoped he didn't notice her blush.

Thankfully, the moment was interrupted by their waiter bringing the food. They smiled courteously and thanked him before really looking at their dishes.

While Eric's meal was sufficient and looked great, Jackie's portions were enormous. She hadn't quite realized just how big the lasagna serving was going to be. The noodles, the cheese, the marinara... and a few pieces of garlic bread... God, was she drooling? She discreetly wiped her chin just in case.

Eric was already starting in on his food. "Damn, this is good," he said. "Gonna try yours?"

Jackie blinked in surprise. "Yeah... just... I dunno... marveling at it?"

Eric chuckled. "Yeah, it's a work of art. If you don't eat it, they'll just hang it in the Louvre."

Jackie smiled and took her fork. It was such a huge plate. She hoped she had enough room. She grabbed a fork and one of the slices of garlic bread, and she dug in.

God, it was amazing. So delicious. If you could have an orgasm in your mouth, she would be halfway through her second by now. The food was simply to die for. She did her best to hold back a rapturous groan before digging back in for a second bite.

Eric sat across from her, silently eating his dinner, only occasionally glancing up at her. When he did, though, he was treated to the delectable sight of Jackie eagerly gobbling up her dinner. Slowly at first, as she was savoring the taste, but faster and faster as she grew to love it. You'd think the poor girl hadn't eaten in weeks from the ferocious way she was inhaling that lasagna. And it was such a huge serving. How was she going to finish it all?

He was so mesmerized by how beautiful her pigging out was that he almost forgot his own food. She was already halfway through her dinner before he remembered and set about finishing it.

Jackie was just lost in the feast. She was shoveling food into her mouth via the fork in one hand, and her free hand was slowly working its way down to her belly, feeling how full it was getting. God, she was so big and round, and this food was making her bigger and rounder... She thought of Eric's hands rubbing it, soothing it, jiggling it, playing with it... Now she was eating even faster. Gotta have more. Gotta get nice and big. Bigger for him. Bigger for herself.

She was barely three quarters of the way through her meal before she remembered she was in a public place. She began to slow down, feeling her cheeks redden as she glanced around the restaurant and saw maybe a couple of people looking at her funny. Regaining her composure, she sat up a little straighter and began eating a tad more daintily, sticking her fork very carefully into the food. She ate each piece very deliberately before dabbing at the corners of her mouth with her cloth napkin. She was a lady, dammit.

She glanced across at Eric, who was sitting there with a restrained smile on her face.

"Eric Forman, don't you dare laugh at me in a public place," she said firmly.

"... Can I laugh at you in the car on the way home?" he asked, a slight waver in his voice.

She shot him a look. But seeing how hard he was trying not to laugh, she couldn't help but smile a bit, too. "You're lucky you're cute," she muttered.

"I remind myself of that everyday," he replied, almost recovered by now.

She let out a small giggle, and her previous embarrassment melted away. "How do you do that?"

"Do what?"

"Say something almost witty that makes me kind of laugh?"

He pretended to balk. "Almost witty?? I'll have you know I'm the wittiest one in the group!"

"Only because Steven can't be bothered, Michael doesn't have the wherewithal, and Fez is just... I dunno, he seems lost most of the time."

Eric smirked. "I'm nominating myself to be 'Most Sarcastic' for senior year."

"Oh god, you're a shoo-in. I'll have to see if I still have some sway with the yearbook committee. I've kind of lost touch with all my contacts."

"Well, thanks, but it's an honor just to be nominated."

"You just said you're nominating yourself."

"Your point is...?"

She smiled fondly at him and shook her head, resuming her meal.

It took a while, but at last, she finished it all. She scraped up the last bits of sauce and finished off the last of the garlic bread. God, her breath was probably atrocious right now. But that didn't matter. What mattered was that she was stuffed. And not just stuffed.

She was stu-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-ffed.

She leaned back in her chair and patted her bowling ball of a belly. She was so tired after all that hard work. Her stomach stretched so far in front of her, it was like a globe. She rubbed it soothingly, looking up as Eric was just finishing his own, much smaller, meal. He was just wrapping up when he looked up and saw her all bloated, sitting in her chair like a pregnant woman.

He smiled amiably. "Did you enjoy it?"

She gave a weak nod, followed by a small hiccup.

Soon, he was paying the bill, during which she just sat there and rubbed her belly. She wasn't ready to move yet. And when the transaction was finally finished, she still wasn't ready to move. She needed Eric's hand to help her get up. She was certain she heard a few joints in his arm pop as she was heaved to her feet. She waddled awkwardly next to him out of the restaurant.

She was soon back in the car with him, but she was too full to even think of trying to buckle herself up. Eric, of course, was only to happy to do it for her. They had to adjust the seat again, but soon, she was safely buckled in, and she still had room to breathe.

Once they were on the road, she felt it was safe to speak again.

"God, I feel like a beached whale," she moaned.

Eric chuckled. "Well, as beached whales go, you're a very cute one."

She swatted at him lazily. "Hush."

It was a long ten minute drive back to her place. She kept kind of hoping that he'd put a hand on her belly and give it a soothing rub, but he was focused on driving. She pouted sleepily but accepted that was probably the sane thing to do.

At last, they were back at the Burkhart mansion. She groaned at the thought of having to go up those steps. Thankfully, Eric was ever the gentleman and helped her up them. She squeezed his arm and rested her head on his shoulder. She could hear her stomach gurgle as they walked. God, was this dress always this tight?

All too soon, they arrived at the front door.

"Well, here we are," Eric said softly.

Jackie drowsed sleepily. "Just five more minutes," she moaned.

He chuckled. "Well, I guess I can stay that long."

They sat down on the rather chilly porch swing. She snuggled up to him, wrapping her arms around him, and he did the same to keep her warm. He tried his best not to get hard just feeling her tightly-packed gut up against his side.

They just sat there on the swing for a long time. They briefly tried gently swinging, but even the slightest motion made Jackie's belly lurch, so they kept still. It was okay, though. She was enjoying just being in his arms.

It ended up being much longer than five minutes. It was more like thirty before they both finally stirred.

"... I guess... I should go in at some point," she mused.

"Yeah...,' he agreed uncertainly.

She pulled away to look into his eyes. He looked back at her questioningly, as if asking what she wanted to do next. She knew damn well what she wanted to do next. She put a hand behind his head and brought him in for a deep long kiss. His hands rose up and cupped her face, pulling her a little closer. They kissed for so long, you'd think they'd need to stop for air, but there was so much longing. So much desire. So much --

She broke the kiss, resulting in both of them breathing heavily. She put a hand to her chest and tried to calm herself down. He swallowed, surprised by the break in the action.

"... I don't think we should go any farther," she gasped. "I mean... I want to, but... it's still the first date... and it's not like I don't trust you or anything, and I had a great time and everything, but..."

"It's too soon. I understand," he said, nodding vigorously.

"Good! Good... Okay... I think I should go... in... now."

"Yeah... okay..."

They got off the swing, and he walked her to the door.

"Well...," she faltered, "... good night."

"Good night," he replied. Then, he quickly added, "I'll call you tomorrow."

"Damn right, you will," she said in that proud tone.

He smiled. He loved that unshakeable confidence. He contemplated kissing her again, but he didn't want to make the longing worse, so he settled for smiling and turning back towards his car.

She watched him walk down the steps and into the Vista Cruiser. Once he was back in the driver's seat, she saw him turn and take one last look at her before driving off into the night. She realized she must have the dopiest smile on her face as she turned and entered the house. Damn, that kiss had been hot. She knew she'd be having a very wet dream about him, his lips and his hands on her belly sometime tonight.

13211111111211111111211121111111111.content:
The following Sunday morning, Eric woke up feeling surprisingly good. It wasn't super surprising, given the night he'd had, but damn, he felt like life was good again. Like getting up and moving around was a fun activity for all members of the family. He hadn't felt this good since things had started clicking with Donna. It amazed him that starting a new relationship could be so invigorating. Before, the thought of losing her had petrified him, but he had to admit, he was really glad they had ended things, if only so that he could finally see Jackie Burkhart through new eyes.

He looked in his sock drawer and found the photo Jackie had sent him months ago. He still wasn't one hundred percent certain why she had sent it, but she'd apologized, so he didn't feel a need to dredge it up again. Had she been trying to drive a wedge between him and Donna? Well, if she had, it hadn't really been necessary. They had been heading for that break up at some point anyway. Might as well let it happen when it did.

But the subject of the photo had taken a deeper meaning to him now. He wasn't sure what to make of it. Now that he and Jackie were more or less together, did he keep the photo or throw it away? What was the right move here? He tucked it back under his socks. He'd keep it for now. You never knew. He'd probably discuss it with her and see how she felt about it. No point in hiding these things.

Of course, that was a problem for another time. For now, he had things to do. Like breakfast. He needed his 9am cereal. He got dressed and headed downstairs.

He found his parents were tidying up.

"Well, look who's finally up, Mr Out-on-a-Date-Last-Night!" laughed Kitty. "How was it going out with Jackie?"

"It was good," Eric replied, preparing his food. "Great restaurant. Good time."

"You remembered to tip the waiter, didn't you?" Red said sternly.

"Yes, tipped generously."

Red held out his hand, and Eric sighed as he handed him the change. His dad smiled triumphantly and headed out towards the garage to go to work.

Laurie came staggering in from her bedroom, wearing her pajamas and a fluffy white bathrobe that was completely open, allowing her belly to swing freely, only half-covered by her t-shirt. "Morning," she groused.

Eric tutted. "Looks like someone else was out having fun last night."

"More fun than you'll ever have..."

"Laurie, for heaven's sake," Kitty groaned, "I know you're depressed about failing college and wasting our money, but that doesn't mean you should just mope around all the time. At some point, you're going to have to get a job."

Laurie let out a moan while Eric feign-gasped. "Mom, don't use the 'j-word' in front of Laurie! She'll turn to dust like a vampire!"

"Oh, please, you think your cute little retail job is so impressive?" she sneered.

"Makes more money than getting drunk every night does."

"I'm sure your mop and bucket are the talk of the town."

"At least I can pay for my own stuff."

"Okay, that's enough!" Kitty said sharply. "Both of you, either apologize and say you love each other, or just get away from each other!"

"Bye!"

"Bye!"

Eric made tracks for the back porch while Laurie retreated to her room - with a can of beer and a few blocks of cheese. Kitty shook her head and resumed housework.

Eric hung out shooting hoops for a while. It was his day off, and he was glad for it. He could fully appreciate the joy of the previous night. Of course, as he shot hoops, he found himself constantly looking at the Pinciotti house. He wondered if maybe Donna was home. They had barely spoken since the break up. In the early days, they'd managed a few words or at least an acknowledgement in the hallway, but now, she was constantly in the school paper's office. Sometimes, he'd see headlights out his window as she finally got home. He sometimes wondered if she was seeing anyone, but so far, it sounded like she was simply married to her job.

Fooling around for a bit, Eric continued to let his mind drift until Hyde finally came from upstairs and joined him. It wasn't long before Kelso and Fez wandered into the driveway as well.

"Well, well, well, look who's up and about on this fine Sunday morning," remarked Kelso, grinning goofily.

Eric smiled pleasantly back. "Yep, I'm awake. Nice firm grasp of the obvious there, Kelso."

Hyde caught the ball and held onto it, removing any pretense that some kind of game was going on. "Okay, Forman. Spill it. Now."

"Yes, tell us what you did to her, you son of a bitch," Fez said forcefully, still clearly jealous.

Eric blinked. "Not much to tell. We went out. Had dinner. Fancy place, so she was happy. Rocked on her porch swing for a bit..."

"Did you make out?" Kelso asked.

"A gentleman never tells."

"Oh please," Hyde sneered. "Since when are any of us gentlemen?"

"Fair point. Yes, we did make out for a bit."

"And that's it?" Kelso asked. "Because you promised you wouldn't do anything else."

"Promise kept. We both agreed to we're going to take it slow."

"Better not be too slow," Hyde grumbled. "I remember you and Donna dragging it out for god-knows-how-long."

"You'll be the first to know, my friend. You shall hear absolutely everything."

"... Yeah, no. Not that interested."

They started to pass the ball between each other again.

"So things are good with you two?" Kelso asked.

"Good so far. Gonna call her a little later."

"Cuz you want to, or cuz she told you to?"

"Both."

"Well, good luck with that. Phone calls with Jackie can go on for hours."

"I dunno. I mean, we talk all the time anyway, so who knows?"

"Man, imagine being able to not only listen to Jackie for hours, but to manage an actual conversation with her for hours...," Hyde mused. "The mind boggles."

"Well, I admit, there are a several stretches where I just kinda listen, but every once in a while, she says something I have a response to, so you just gotta wait for it to come around," Eric explained.

"That's true," Kelso said. "I mean, I was never that good at the listening thing. Especially if the TV's on."

"Yeah, I tried that. Bad idea when Gilligan's on..."

Suddenly, the ball thudded right into his chest from Fez's direction as the fourth member of the group finally voiced his opinion. "Do you love her?"

They all stared at him in bemusement. He looked so pouty when he was angry.

"... I'm sorry, what?" Eric finally croaked out.

"Do you love her?" Fez repeated, looking like he was realizing just how he sounded.

"Why do you ask?"

"Oh... just... idle curiosity...?"

Eric regarded him for a long moment. "I don't think so... I mean... it's still the beginning. Love's one of those things that takes time, y'know?"

Kelso nodded. "Although, word to the wise, if she says it first, say it back anyway. Otherwise, there's a lot of cursing involved..."

"I just... want to make sure you're doing right by her," Fez said awkwardly.

An eyebrow arched from behind Hyde's shades. "How's Rhonda, Fez?"

Fez was clearly thrown by the question. "Uh, she's... she's great! Talked for hours last night!"

"Dude, weren't you with us all night?" Kelso asked.

"Yeah, I don't think we got home until midnight," Hyde agreed, "and your girl Rhonda's an early sleeper, isn't she?"

Fez stammered. "Well, I mean... maybe it wasn't last night. Maybe it was that afternoon?"

Eric blinked. "You can't remember the last time you talked to your own girlfriend?"

"Hey, I can too! I just... Well, they say a little mystery is good for a relationship!"

"Not when you're the one mystified."

Fez tried to look confident. "I was just going to meet her for lunch when we finish here," he said, puffing his chest out. "Going to take her out."

"Where to?" Hyde asked.

"Again, a little mystery is good for a relationship!"

They all looked at him, clearly unconvinced. Feeling a little nervous, Fez loosened his collar and checked the watch he wasn't wearing.

"Well, look at the time, I must be off! Good day, friends of Fez!"

"But Fez -- "

"I said 'good day'!"

Fez turned and hurried out of the driveway and up the road, not daring to look back.

Hyde shook his head. "What a maroon."

"Yeah, poor guy's got it bad," sighed Kelso.

"And if even you can tell, he's really got it bad," Eric agreed.

"Yeah... wait, huh?"

Eric tossed the ball back to Hyde. "All right, I'd better get onto the whole 'calling Jackie' thing. I'll see you guys later."

"Yeah, if you finish early, you'll be in time for dinner," Hyde grinned.

Eric headed off into the kitchen and checked around to make sure no one was around. God, he wished he had a phone in his room. He picked it off the cradle and dialed the number. After waiting a few seconds, he heard someone pick up.

"Burkhart residence," a lovely voice that made his heart dance said.

"Hey, it's me."

"Eric! Oh my god, I am so glad you called! You will never believe what Stacy Hargrove is wearing today!"

Eric smiled warmly and settled in for a good long listen.
13211111111211111111211121111111111.title: Eric tells the guys about the date

132111111112111111112111211111111111.content:
Fez set off determinedly towards Rhonda's house. Damn Eric, he thought. Damn him for putting him through this. He probably could've handled Jackie falling for someone else is she'd met someone outside the group. Or gone back to Kelso. Or hell, even Hyde would've been understandable - the guy was kinda dreamy. But Eric?! How was it that after all that time arguing or being pissed at each other, they were suddenly all loveydovey and best of friends and enjoying each others company? Fez practically worshiped the ground she walked on, made sure she knew it every day, and she chose Eric? What, indeed, the hell?

He stormed his way up the road until he saw Rhonda's house in the distance. It was only now that he began to realize that it was going to be a tad rude of him to just show up unannounced. It was going to be a pain in the ass to walk all the way down several blocks to his own house to call her, though. But he had to do something.

Luckily, he spotted a pay phone not too far away, readily available. Checking his pockets, he found a few quarters with his cash, so he scurried over and stepped inside. He deposited the coins, dialed the number and waited, hoping that he could get her and not her mother.

After a few rings, he was greeted with a familiar voice.

"Hello?"

"Rhonda, hi! It is Fez!"

"Hey, sweetie! What's up?"

"I was just wondering if you were free for lunch today?"

"Mmmmm! Always free for lunch!"

"Excellent! I shall meet you at your house soon!"

"Great! Thanks, Fezzie!"

He hung up. Great. Now he had to wait a while and see if he could make it look like he'd actually walked several blocks. He did the math in his head and knew it sometimes took fifteen minutes to walk all the way from his house to Rhonda's. This was why he needed friends with cars, which was probably why he shouldn't be so quick to burn bridges with Eric anytime soon.

Then he remembered that as a foreigner, just standing around in one spot for fifteen minutes was going to look strange to this super-white neighborhood, so he'd better go for a fifteen minute walk. He figured he could walk seven minutes in one direction, then double back. He started walking in the direction of his host parents' house.

God, this had gotten complicated quickly.

By the time he arrived back at the house, he was exhausted. He staggered up to Rhonda's front door and knocked. She answered the door, smiling at him behind her enormous glasses.

"Hi, Fez! Let's get going! I'm starved!"

"But of course, dreamboat," Fez panted.

"You okay? You look tired."

"Oh, I... got held up, so I ran the rest of the way."

"Awww, you didn't have to do that for me," she smiled. "You're just the best boyfriend ever, you know that?"

Fez smiled but groaned internally. He was having one of those internal arguments that he preferred to ignore. That part of him that was a good guy was angry that he was treating Rhonda like this. She was a very nice girl who adored him, and here he was still scheming over Jackie and being all petty towards his friend Eric because she preferred him instead.

He spent all that time trying to romance her away from Kelso, and instead, she prefers Eric Forman.

The nice part of himself promptly gave the asshole part of himself a kick in the metaphorical 'nads. Knock it off. This girl is crazy about you, and you were crazy about her until this whole Eric/Jackie thing started. Stop being an idiot and accept that you never had a chance with Jackie, and start noticing this pretty awesome girl.

Fez gave a discreet sad sigh. His nice guy self was right. He was being a tool. Rhonda was walking beside him, talking animatedly about something, and he wasn't even listening. He was always trying to encourage her to speak up more and get over her shyness. And now she was, and what was he doing? Stewing over Jackie, a girl who saw him as a friend at best and the hired help at worst. He re-focused on what Rhonda was saying, figuring he could catch up later.

At last, there was a gap in the conversation, and he spoke. "So, any preference for lunch?"

Rhonda thought for a moment. "Hmmmm... kinda feeling like pizza today..."

"Then we can hit the pizzeria up the street. Extra large with pepperoni and sausage."

"Ooooh, my favorite!"

"And we'll grab some fries on the way, seeing as how you're so hungry."

"You're the best!"

Fez smiled at how her chubby face lit up at the mention of food. Seeing her happy made him feel good, especially when he was the cause of it. He took her hand in his and led her to their destinations.

Within an hour, they were on a picnic table at the park on this lovely spring day, and between them sat an enormous pizza with a big basket of fries and two cokes - one small and one large. Before long, they were chatting away about school, life and candy.

Fez had about three slices of pizza and a few handfuls of fries, but Rhonda was naturally a much heavier eater. Over the next hour and a half, she ate the remaining five gigantic slices of pizza and the entire basket of fries, plus a her entire beverage and what was leftover from Fez's. Her legs were spread apart for her overstuffed belly sitting between them, rubbing it under the table. She let out a small hiccup, causing her to blush with embarrassment.

"Oh god...," she moaned, wishing quietly that she could unbutton her skirt in a public place. "I feel like such a pig..."

Fez smiled winningly. "Well, you are a beautiful pig."

She stared, then laughed awkwardly. "I mean... I... well, I don't..."

But Fez reached across and put a hand on her belly. "Rhonda, I think you are one of the most beautiful women on the face of this Earth, and no amount of food you eat is going to tell me otherwise."

Rhonda stared at him for a long moment before a silly smile split across her face. "I'd come over there and hug you, but I'm so stuffed I can't move."

"Then allow Fez to come and assist you," he replied, getting up and going around to hug his fat girlfriend around the middle.

She was just hugging him back when she let out a small burp from the pressure, directly into his ear.

"Sorry..."

"Tis the music of the angels, my dear."
132111111112111111112111211111111111.title: Fez manages to get Rhonda to lunch

1321111111121111111121112111111111111.content:
Donna sighed to herself as she sat back in class. It was that last class of the day, and she was itching to get back to her much roomier officer desk and rolling chair, as opposed to this cramped little formica desk/chair combo. God, her gut was wedged in tightly. She could barely breathe. Why didn't they make these dumb desks adjustable for plus-size students? Just because she was overweight didn't mean she shouldn't be comfortable, right? How did her fellow fat students deal with it?

Thankfully, the boredom finally released her as class ended, and she was free to go. She gathered her things into her bag very slowly and deliberately, waiting for her classmates to leave. As soon as the last one filtered out the door, she immediately began the ridiculously-challenging task of getting out of her desk. Her stomach and butt were now so large it was a struggle to jam herself into the desk, and even harder to remove herself. She had discovered how big she had gotten when, one day, she'd tried to stand up and brought the desk up with her. After that humiliation, she wasn't about to try that again in public.

Finally, like a cork in a wine bottle, she popped herself free. She rubbed her sore belly, knowing she probably had a great big red line going across her flesh. Trying super hard not to pout, she waddled out of the classroom with her bookbag over her shoulder. At least her clothes fit better since she bought bigger ones. If she was going to be fat, she was determined to be as comfortable as possible.

She headed for the writing room to work on the paper like she always did, already mentally working on how she was going to word a paragraph in the first article. When she glanced in the direction of the lockers down an adjoining hall, her eyes fell on Hyde and Kelso talking while Kelso fussed with getting his papers organized and Hyde making no effort to help. God, she hadn't spoken to them in a couple of months. How had that even happened? She'd buried herself in her work that she never spoke to anyone except her parents and the newspaper team.

Well, maybe it was time to do something about that, she thought. Go over and talk to them. Catch up with them. Reconnect. Something. Anything.

So she made the walk down the hall towards them, just as Kelso was finally getting his shit together, and Hyde was checking his watch. "Hey!" she exclaimed.

They both whirled around and looked at her in surprise. "Donna?" Hyde asked, clearly gaping, allowing his zen to slip for a second.

"Big D?" Kelso said, staring in amazement.

Donna forced a smile. How much weight had she gained since she last saw them? She was enormous, compared to how she'd looked before. She hoped she wasn't blushing. "Yeah, it's me...," she said awkwardly.

Kelso let out a laugh and embraced her in a hug. "Damn, Donna, look at you!"

"Yeah, man," Hyde added, patting her shoulder. "You never call, never write, never visit... Your mother and I are very worried," he added, indicating Kelso as the 'mother'.

"I know, I'm sorry," Donna sighed. "It's just... after things ended with Eric, I just... needed to lose myself a bit, I guess."

Kelso shrugged. "Well, you haven't lost that much, by the look of things."

Hyde gave him a thump on the head.

Donna sighed. "I know, I know... I spend so much time behind a desk these days, I'm not getting a lot of physical activity. And I'm constantly eating whatever junk food the rest of the crew brings in. I seriously need to do something about all this fat."

"Well, we're not gonna be much help on that front," Hyde shrugged. "We've got a long day of goofing off ahead of us."

"Yeah, we were gonna chill on the couch and fall asleep watching TV," agreed Kelso.

"It's okay. I'll be fine," Donna said, deciding she wanted to shift the conversation in a different direction. "So! What's new with you guys?"

Hyde shrugged again. "Not much. Workin' at the Foto Hut still. Kelso's sleeping with anything that moves."

Kelso grinned sleazily. "Yeah, but only the good-looking things. I mean, girls."

"Great, glad to hear it," Donna said, rolling her eyes. Time to get to the meat of it. "How about Eric? How's he been?"

"Oh, not bad, since he hooked up with Jackie."

That brought Donna up short. "... Wait, what?"

Hyde hoped he didn't wince too obviously. "Uh... yeah, Forman and Jackie are together now."

"... How together?"

"Like, 'talking on the phone, going out and making out' together."

"Yeah, they've only been together for a few weeks, but they look like they're doing pretty good," Kelso nodded.

Donna stared at him. "And... you're okay with that?"

Kelso shrugged. "Well, it was a little weird at first, but Eric's a good guy, and he promised not to have sex with her for a while, so that's good... And I guess it's good to have Jackie off the market so I don't end up with her again. Frees me up for more sexual activity."

Hyde rolled his eyes. "Yeah, that's a good way to look at it."

Donna was still reeling. "Yeah... well, it's good you're being so mature."

Kelso grinned. "Yeah, being a senior is totally making me grow up."

"Yeah, it is. Well, I gotta go work on the paper. I'll see you guys later."

"Yeah, okay, we'll..."

But Kelso trailed off as Donna turned and walked back up the corridor before he finished, watching as she stormed away.

"Damn...," Hyde sighed. "That's the last time we're gonna see her for another two months."

Donna stormed off, already trying to forget them. Eric and Jackie?!? Seriously?!? Sure, she'd already heard something, but her ex with her best friend?

The best friend she hadn't really spoken to in months...

But they were supposed to hate each other!

But people change.

But how could they do this so soon?

It's been months...

God, she hated this. She made it to the printing press and set to work, angrily typing, trying to focus on her work. She typed so fast, she'd finished six pages before the rest of the team entered, carrying several pizzas in their arms.

"Hey, boss!" one of the girls said. "We brought dinner!"

"Good," Donna said, leaning back from her seventh page. "God, I'm starving."

While the others each took a couple slices and got to work, Donna found the pizza she was looking for - sausage, green peppers and pepperoni. She was positively drooling. She half-heartedly helped her team with their articles like she was supposed to, but once they were all off and running, she began frantically chowing down. She knew she shouldn't be freaking out like this. She should be focused on her work. But what the hell? She'd finished her part early. She had time to pig out.

It wasn't that she wanted to. She just couldn't stand the thought of Eric and Jackie together. Because it meant that Eric had well and truly moved on. That he had found someone else that wasn't her. That he wasn't obsessed with her anymore. That he was scheming to reunite with her at all.

That her scrawny little neighbor boy didn't need her anymore.

The asshole.

And that tiny little bitch. Yes, she knew Jackie was fat now, and that no doubt was a big part of Eric's attraction to her, but dammit, why did that midget have to swoop and steal Eric like that? Since when did she even care about Eric? He was everything she hated in a man. Specifically, not very manly.

She was so angry and bitter that she didn't realize until she'd taken the last bite that she'd eaten the entire pizza. But she was so ravenous - how could she possibly be full now? She found a regular cheese pizza that was only half gone and started in on that. All four slices. Into her belly.

By the time their meet was done, Donna was stuffed. Her belly was desperate to pop the buttons off her flannel plaid shirt. Just explode off. She peered down and saw how much they were straining around her fatness. Was it seriously time to update her wardrobe already?! How was she ever going afford this? Even her job at the radio station wasn't going to cover this at the rate she was growing.

Everyone in the newspaper said goodbye and closed up for the night, all set to print the paper for tomorrow. Donna volunteered to take care of everything so they could all leave. Once the door was shut, let out a sigh of relief, letting her overstuffed belly expand to its true size, and one of the middle buttons popped clean off. She groaned in embarrassment, which then became a moan of pain. Holy crap, she was full. She leaned back in her swivel chair, rubbing her stomach. So utterly gorged. What a pig she was.

Donna peered down at it sadly. What was she going to do now?

She noticed there was still a few slices left. With a blank expression, she started eating them, just as ravenously as before. Might as well finish them.

By the time she was waddling out to her car, another button was gone. They were in her pocket, because she was determined to sew them back on when she got home. Okay, so women shouldn't have to sew, but dammit, she liked this shirt.

She got into her car, and she quickly found that her engorged gut was pressing against the steering wheel.

God, what had Eric done to her? How could she be such an utter pig? What was happening to her?

And was the Dairy Queen drive thru still open?

13211111111211111111211121111111111111.content:
Three oreo blizzards and a dilly bar later, Donna finally made it home. It was a super struggle to remove her stubbornly-small seat belt, and when she finally got it off, it almost shot across into the windshield, but she caught it in time. Her stomach was so utterly stuffed after such a long day of gorging, she thought it a miracle she'd only lost two buttons. Sighing sadly to herself, Donna got her door open and just barely managed to uncork herself. She awkwardly climbed out of the car and onto the pavement.

Looking up at her house, she cast a glance next door at the Forman house. She quietly wondered whether or not he was home. A dark thought traipsed across her mind, and she wondered if Jackie was there, too. For a moment, she was really angry, but then her tummy gurgled, and all thoughts ceased. All that anger was just fueling her gluttony. Stupid Eric, making her stress eat like this. She caught her profile in her shadow on the wall and grimaced. So round. Enormous belly, enormous ass, enormous boobs...

Okay, maybe it wasn't all bad, but still.

She stifled all thoughts of Eric and food from her mind. She had school work to do. She had to start brainstorming tomorrows paper. She had a few interviews lined up. Things to prepare. Unlike Jackie, she had better things to do than worry about how fat she was getting and how much food she could cram into her gullet.

She opened the kitchen door and was stunned by the buffet of food that filled the room.

"Um... hello?" she called out.

Suddenly, the kitchen door swung open, and in walked Midge, who was, since the last time Donna had seen her, very fat indeed. Big belly, big butt, even bigger boobs... At first, she didn't even notice her daughter had come home. She went straight for a meat tray and started nibbling away when she looked up and saw her.

"... Dawnnah?" she asked through her full mouth.

"... Mom?"

Midge swallowed. "Oh my gosh, sweetie! I feel like I haven't seen you in days!" she squealed, waddling over and hugging her daughter in a big meaty hug.

Donna let out a yelp as her mother's big stomach collided with her own stuffed stomach, hoping she didn't suddenly barf all over the back of her mom's blouse. She managed to hold it in and pulled back. "Mom, oh my god, what's going on?"

"I'm sorry, sweetie, but you spend so much time at that school that I feel like I haven't seen you in forever!"

"It's... it's okay, I just... what's with all the food?"

"Huh...? Oh! The food! I'm having a little get together with some of the ladies in town! They're really into this whole eating thing!"

"Eating thing?"

"Yeah! Remember when you said that a woman shouldn't be judged by her weight?"

"... Well... yeah..."

"Well, I told some of the ladies in my social circles, and they were interested, and then they told some of their friends, and so on and so on, and now, we're all gaining weight together!"

"You're what?!"

"Yeah, come on in! I'll introduce you! Oh, and help me with some of these trays. Your dumb father won't help."

Donna rolled her eyes but agreed as she helped her mother with the trays of admittedly delicious-looking food, bringing them into the living room. Her jaw dropped at what she saw.

Wall-to-wall fatties. Women of various sizes filling the room, sitting on the couch, the chairs, the floor, the stairs, anywhere they could fit!

Donna stared in stunned silence as they all cheered at the sight of food.

Midge waved. "Everyone! This is my daughter, Donna!"

"Hi, Donna," a few of them muttered as they proceeded to dig into their respective dinners.

Donna watched as they started pigging out on food. Meat, fruit, veggies, breads, grains, pasta, dessert, dessert, and even more dessert...

"God, it's like a drug den for gluttons," she murmured.

Midge nodded cluelessly. "Isn't it great? Thank you so much for this idea, Donna! We're all so happy!"

"What? No, Mom, this wasn't my idea! All I said was..."

"That women shouldn't have to worry about being thin for men! And you were right! We've all been enjoying porking up! All that food out there, and all that weight we're gaining - we're gaining it for women everywhere!"

The women cheered and whooped in agreement between bites.

Donna watched in silent wonder. How was this even possible? "Where's Dad?"

"Oh, probably down at the bar or something. He hardly ever talks anymore. I don't think he's all that keen on the new and improved me."

"Are you kidding?"

Midge shook her head, making her jowls jiggle. "No! In fact, I guarantee you at least half of these women's husbands have left because they gained weight."

"But... but aren't they upset about that?"

"Well, they were a bit... But then I brought out cake for us all to eat, and that helped a little."

"Mom, they're just smothering their feelings with food!"

"I know! Isn't it wonderful? No more wasting tears over men because we're too busy eating cake to bother!"

Donna sighed. "Mom, look, I still agree that women shouldn't be judged by their weight, but deliberately stuffing yourselves to immobility isn't the answer!"

"Why not? It's way more fun than bothering to worry about what men think of us! Who needs 'em?"

"Down with men!" a very large older woman bellowed.

"Down with men!!" the whole group chanted, their mouths full of whatever they were eating.

"That's the spirit!" Midge cheered. "Now, if you'll excuse me, sweetheart, mommy needs to get in on those bowls of skittles before Betty eats them all." She waddled into the group and laid out on her back and placed her head against a woman's leg. The woman took the hint and used a massive scoop to pour several skittles into Midge's mouth.

Donna stood in the doorway, her mouth agape, almost certain she could see her mother's massive stomach swelling from the cascade of candy pouring inside of it.

Shaking her head, she struggled through the overstuffed room and up the stairs to the safety of her bedroom.

132111111112111111112111211111111111111.content:
Jackie did a silly little dance to herself as she slipped on her XXL jeans and a great big fluffy sweater. The weather was cooling off, and she was enjoying being snug as a fat little bug in her new autumn clothes. She was still giddy at the thought of what had taken place in her life. She was dating Eric Forman. A year ago, she'd have thought such a fate would be worse than death, but she'd found the scrawny little nerd boy was actually very sweet and loving, not to mention cute as hell.

Plus, he was super into her fatness. Whenever they made out, his hands were always exploring every blubbery curve. It made her feel sexy in her own skin, something thought she'd always felt before, but not quite like this.

In fact, she was kind of hoping he'd step things up a notch. She was super into her fatness and stuffing herself, but he was strangely restrained in that regard. Like, he was holding himself back. He was more concerned right now with just having a good time. She liked that for the most part. It showed he really valued her as a person. But she wanted him to show his appreciation for her weight in other ways. Preferably, sexy ways. Mainly, edible ways.

So one day, she nabbed her father's credit card and went out to the local Piggly Wiggly to see about making a piggly wiggly of herself. She loaded up on everything that looked good and extra fattening to her. Creme-filled doughnuts, chocolate chip cookies, thick peanut butter, whipped cream... She had to really try not to just eat it all right here and now.

She held strong, though, and one swipe of the credit card later, she was driving home and ready to implement her plan. She took all the groceries upstairs to her room and got on the phone to Eric.

"Eric, it's me!" she said casually.

"Hey, what's up?"

"I was wondering if you'd like to hang out at my place?"

"Would I like to hang out at my rich girlfriend's enormous mansion? Gosh, what a decision...!"

She giggled. "Come on over, spaz. I'll be in my room."

"On my way!"

He hung up, and she bit her lip excitedly. She wanted to do this right. She needed to change into something attractive, but not to the point it was obvious she was trying to turn him on. She searched her wardrobe, and then she found a button-down shirt that might have fit her a couple sizes ago. Curious, she tried it on. It just barely fit around her globular middle.

Pleased with the effect of the strained fabric, she waited by the window as the Vista Cruiser pulled up in her driveway. He stepped out and took a look around - he was always amazed by her house - and his eyes fell on her window. She smiled and beckoned him to come up. He waved in response and hurried to the front door.

Jackie set up the food around the bed. She found the remote for her room's TV for background noise. She knew what she was doing.

A few minutes later, when Eric arrived in her room, he was greeted by the sight of Jackie wearing very tight clothes and surrounded by a buffet of sugary goodies. His eyebrow skyrocketed at the sight.

"Hey, Eric!" she said in a sweet voice.

"... Hey, Jackie, what's all this?"

"Oh, I just thought you could join me for... lunch, I guess you'd call it..."

"Is that right?"

"Yeah." She pulled out the remote. "Plus, there's a Twilight Zone marathon right now, so I thought you'd like to watch with me."

A small smile split across Eric's face. "Yeah... that sounds like fun."

She beamed and patted an empty spot on the bed next to her. He kicked off his shoes and joined her, wrapping an arm around her shoulders while she turned on the TV, and Rod Serling began telling them another really weird story.

It started very casually at first. She had a box of chocolate chip cookies, which she very occasionally shared with him. He got maybe five of them, while she ate the remaining twenty-five. It was when she discarded of the empty container that she had started getting his full attention. He was clearly trying very hard not to stare, his eyes nervously twitching between the TV and her stomach.

Smiling discreetly, she gave her belly a gentle pat before reaching over and grabbing a box of doughnuts. She didn't even offer him anything this time. She just went to town on all six of them. And god, they were good. Who would've thought being seductive could be so yummy? She chomped through the chocolate-frosted creme-filled heavenly baked goods and had them all gone before the first episode was over.

She was just tossing the box onto the floor when she let out a thunderous belch. Her hand flew instinctively to her mouth, but then she saw the look on Eric's face, and she realized, hey, maybe that was hot to him.

"... Excuse me...," she said sheepishly.

"... You're excused," he replied lamely.

She giggled fondly. He was such a dork. She reached into her bedside table and pulled out the jar of peanut butter and a spoon. She was pretty full by now, but she figured he was pretty aroused right now, so she wanted to milk this. "Unnnngh," she moaned in an exaggerated fashion. "I'm so full... Eric, can you help me with this?" She held out the spoon.

Eric blinked in confusion as he took it, but when she opened the jar of peanut butter and held it out to him, he realized. "Oh. Uh... sure...," he managed awkwardly. She leaned back against her pillow, and he proceeded to spoon the thick substance into her open mouth. She ate it down and took a sip of water before opening her mouth again.

Eric could scarcely believe this was happening. The TV was pretty much forgotten at this point. He was way too focused on this beautiful girl lying before him, hands atop her fat gut while he fed her peanut butter. He stole a glance at the ingredients and gaped at the calories momentarily. How was she doing it?

Jackie was, as it happened, doing it very well. She was getting very full now, but she wanted more, and she wanted Eric to give it to her. She wanted him to fatten her up until she couldn't move. She wanted him to care for her. She had always been such a spoiled girl growing up. Given everything she ever wanted. Now, she was going to be a greedy little piggy.

It amazed them both that they were soon halfway through the jar. Jackie's tastebuds were crying out at this point, so she held up a hand to stop him. "Okay... time to switch gears," she croaked through her thickly-coated mouth. She took another swig of water before she tried to move, but she was so stuffed, she couldn't. "Eric... there's a can of whipped cream on the nightstand. Could you get it for me?"

Eric's eyes widened in excitement. "Uh, sure, yeah," he said, trying to smother a smile. He had to crawl over her to get to it, but he managed to get his hands on the can in question and brought it over to her.

Jackie let her arms splay out over the bed as he was over her. "Thank you," she said before opening her mouth for him.

Eric realized where this was going and hoped he didn't look too obvious. He placed the nozzle on the tip of her tongue and sprayed a great big dollop for her to gulp down.

She smiled teasingly. "I think you can do better than that."

Eric blinked in confusion before she puckered up. At first, he thought she wanted a kiss, but then he saw her eyes on the nozzle and got the idea. Smiling slightly, he placed the nozzle between her lips and gently pressed.

Jackie's eyes rolled up in her head as the stream of cream filled her mouth and was gulped down her throat. God, this was hot. She could feel herself swelling up. Her stomach was steadily filling up, and she could feel those buttons straining against that great orb as it became increasingly engorged. She let out a pleasured moan as the can kept filling her up.

Eric, for his part, was watching half-aroused, half-amazed. How was this happening? Was he going to wake up in a minute? Where was this going? Were they going to...? Damn, he didn't think to bring a condom. Still, watching her gorge herself for him was still amazing, and he felt he should just be grateful that she was doing this at all, and clearly enjoying it, too.

At last, there was the sound of the can finally depleting itself. As Eric removed it from her lips, Jackie let out a low moan as she clutched her stomach. Eric stayed over her, staring into her half-open eyes as she took in a few deep breaths. There was a soft plip! and something bounced off his shirt. They both looked to see that one of the buttons had finally burst off of her shirt. They stared at that little bit of belly bulging out of the now-bigger gap.

"... Did I do good?" she asked weakly.

Eric leaned down and gave her a gentle kiss. "You did great," he replied. "But then, you always are, aren't you?"

She smirked. "Damn right. Hic!"

They didn't have sex, even though both wanted to. He didn't have protection, and she was too stuffed to really get into it. But they had other ways to please each other, and when that was over, a couple more buttons were missing from Jackie's shirt. As the day went by, they lay together on her bed, half-watching the TV and cuddling, his hand rubbing small circles on her overstuffed stomach.

As Jackie dozed off, she snuggled into him and enjoyed the dreams that were coming her way.
