1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Eric had a lovely day with Jackie. After the marathon ended and she'd slept off her food coma, she'd been hungry again, and they'd ordered a pizza. He had one slice and she had seven. This had been followed up with a rather steamy make out session and lots of belly rubs and cuddling. So he was in good spirits, and in underwear that probably needed changing, when we drove home and walked into the kitchen.

He was just reaching into the fridge for some juice when the living room door burst open, and in walked Red and Kitty, looking ready to tear him a new one.

"Now, look here, young lady," Kitty started, "you can't just waltz -- oh, sweetie, it's you."

"Oh, thank god," Red sighed, leaning against the door frame.

"Dad, I think this is the happiest you've ever been to see me since I was born," Eric deadpanned as he resumed pouring himself a glass.

"Sorry, sweetie. We thought you were Laurie," Kitty explained.

"Oh? What's she done?"

"She's eaten us out of house and home! That's what she's done!"

Eric smirked. "That's a shame."

"Did you eat dinner already?"

"Yeah, Jackie and I had pizza."

"Oh, thank god, because there's precious little food left in this house! I had to feed Steven corn flakes!"

At that moment, they heard a car pulling up, and they saw a cab on the curb. A few moments later, Laurie came stumbling out, threw some cash at the driver, and she waddled awkwardly up the driveway towards the kitchen door, her massive belly swaying horizontally and vertically simultaneously.

"Oh good lord...," Red groaned.

Eric chuckled. "Well, I'll be in my room, not being a financial drain on the family. Have a lovely evening." And with that, he was gone.

Red and Kitty watched despairingly as their daughter stumbled awkwardly through the kitchen door. Her clothes were way too small for her at this point. Her enormous stomach bulged out from under her t-shirt and hang over the waistband of her jeans. Her meaty thighs stopped moving a few seconds after the rest of her, and her extra chin wobbled as she looked back and forth between them.

Laurie was bemused to see them both glaring at her with their arms crossed. She wasn't sure what to say. Hell, she wasn't even sure why they were angry.

So she belched instead.

"URRRRRRRRRRRRP!!"

Red closed his eyes disparagingly while Kitty just looked shocked.

Pleased that she momentarily had the advantage of them, Laurie smiled sleepily. "So... I had a lovely evening. How about you?"

"Young lady, what the hell do you think you're doing?" Kitty demanded.

"Oh, I had a late lunch, then an early dinner, and then a late dinner, and now I'm home for an early midnight snack..."

"Sweetheart," Red said awkwardly, not really wanting to confront his beloved daughter. "I know you're feeling down about... not finishing... college..."

"'Failed', Red. Just say it. She failed college."

"Yeah, I failed college," Laurie agreed. "I never wanted to go. Well, more accurately, I just wanted to go for the parties and the keggers."

Red stared at her incredulously. "Excuse me?!"

"Laurie, are you drunk?" Kitty asked.

"... Y'know, I might be just a little bit..."

"Young lady, sit down!" Red snapped.

Laurie sat down rather clumsily in a chair, her hands atop her belly. "Sitting, daddy."

"Now you listen to me, young lady! You've been coasting on our money for the past few months. Now, we let it slide because we thought you were going through something, but if all you want to do is eat and sleep, then it's going to be with your own money from now on! You're going to be getting a job!"

There was a long silence as Laurie stared at him. Then, oddly, she started laughing uproariously at him.

Red stared at her for a long time, momentarily bemused, before he realized she wasn't taking him seriously. So he activated his most furious glare, hoping it would get the message apart.

Laurie continued to laugh for a few seconds more, until the glare fully registered. The laughter gave way to silence, which in turn to annoyance. "Oh, god, you're serious."

"Damn right we are, young lady. If you're going to spend all your time eating, it'll be on your dime. Comprende?"

Laurie glared at him for a long moment. He wasn't budging this time. And just pouting wasn't going to help her now. "... Comprendo," he replied.

Red's glare became a very fake smile. "Well, good! I'm glad we came to this agreement! I'll be sure to leave the want ads under your bedroom door! And if you don't have a job within a month, you're out!"

Laurie did her best not to roll her eyes, settling for a contrite nod instead.

Red turned on his heel and left the room.

Kitty's neutral expression gave way to a smile. "Well! Hope you find something good, sweetie!" she said before scurrying after her husband.

Laurie sat in the kitchen for a long time. God, it had come to this. She'd have to get a stupid lame ass job. Like a regular person.

Her stomach made a grumbling noise as it worked on digesting her day long feast. The gravy train was truly over. Sighing sadly to herself, she heaved herself up and waddled to the fridge. Not much since she'd pretty much inhaled the entire contents last night. She found a bottle of salad dressing and began to drink it. One last free gorge before she had to... *shudder*... work.

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
The following morning, things were rather calm around the Forman household. At least, as calm as could be, at any rate. Eric and Hyde were enjoying teasing Laurie for having to get a job. She, in turn, sneered at them that she was going to find an adult job, as opposed to Price Mart and the Foto Hut. This, naturally, led to a few jokes about going into porn. Laurie was initially insulted, but then seemed thoughtful, so Red put the brakes on that by handing her the want ads again.

Kitty made them all breakfast - small portions for Laurie as punishment for spending their money - and went about the day. As they all one by one departed for work - and Laurie to her bedroom - Kitty went about her day, putting away dishes and general cleaning. As grueling as it could be sometimes, she really did appreciate these moments to herself. She went outside and proceeded to sweep the back porch when she heard raised voices from next door.

"Going out for more food, Midge?"

"God, you're such an ass, Bob!"

The sound of the door slamming, and then angry footsteps headed the direction of the Forman house.

Kitty blanched. Midge was angry and hoping to come to her for someone to yak at about it. She wondered how quickly she could run inside and hide in the living room. Wait until Midge was gone. Pretend she didn't live there anymore. Hail a cab from the front yard and hide in Mexico with endless martinis.

She barely had time to get to the handle of the sliding door when Midge's very heavy footsteps rounded the corner and were coming up the driveway.

"Oh, Kitty! Glad I caught you!"

Kitty grimaced internally and slowly turned around with a fake smile on her face. "Well, hi there, Midge! What's going...?"

That was as far as she got as she took in the sight of Midge waddling up the driveway towards her. Good lord, the woman was enormous! Possibly three times as big as when they'd last seen each other. Kitty wasn't even really sure when that'd been. She watched her grossly overweight neighbor come up to her, her enormous stomach swaying back and forth, her titanic breasts bobbing up and down, her thighs rippling with every furious step...

Suddenly, Kitty found herself very interested in what was going on with Midge.

"Oh, Bob's being an ass again!" Midge snapped. "He's so rude to me! He doesn't want to have sex or do anything! And all because I'm gaining weight!"

Kitty blinked, then forced a look of shock on her face. "Oh! Have you gained weight? It's hardly noticeable! So I didn't notice!"

Midge nodded emphatically. "Yes, I have! And Bob's sure as hell noticed! He doesn't understand! Women shouldn't have to be skinny and trim to attract men! They should love us for who we are on the inside!"

Kitty nodded distantly. "Okay... and Bob's not going for that, huh?"

Kitty saw her neighbor's eyes turn a bit sad. "Are you okay, Midge?"

"Huh? Oh, yeah. Just Donna's never home anymore except to have dinner and sleep. Spending all that time at her school newspaper. I mean, I'm proud of her for running it, but I never see her, y'know?"

Kitty nodded sympathetically. "It's all part of that painful process of letting them grow up and... leave home," she sighed sadly.

Kitty braced herself for the inevitable.

"Kitty, would you mind if I came in?"

"Oh, thank you! I just need something to tide me over until lunch!" the bloated blonde squealed as she shuffled past her into the kitchen.

Kitty found herself immediately forgotten on the back porch as Midge waddled to the fridge and blatantly began to raid it. Whatever leftovers there were from breakfast were soon being devoured. Fresh fruit on the counter. The orange juice - good lord, she wasn't even using a glass! She grabbed a container of mixed nuts and poured a large amount of its contents into her mouth. Once she'd gotten them all down, she let out a belch and raided the cupboards for the chips and cereal.

Kitty sighed. They'd finally gotten Laurie to stop eating their food all willy-nilly, and now Midge was eating them out of house and home!

She wondered if they should give Midge the want ads...

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
The weeks passed, and Laurie found herself unable to land a job. The truth was - and she didn't want to admit to it - that she had no real skills outside of looking all sexy and getting men to do what she wanted when she wanted. She had a few interviews for various positions - from receptionist to other receptionist - but her usual tactic of showing cleavage and flirting with the interviewer didn't work. She'd ballooned so much that her usual brand of sexy wasn't working anymore. She tried to tell herself that every single interviewer must've been gay, but deep down, she knew that wasn't true. Her extreme weight gain was preventing her from using her only true talent. Now she had to have actual skills if she was going to get anywhere.

Depressed, she looked over the want ads one more time, and to her dismay, the only thing on there that looked even remotely possible was a job running the drive-thru at the local Fatso Burger. She grimaced at the thought, but she went ahead and called them. Might as well give it a shot. It would suck to have to go in there and not be able to buy the food.

The next day, she arrived at the restaurant and found the manager's office in the back. She gave a tired knock and popped her head inside. "Excuse me, I'm Laurie Forman. I'm hear for the drive-thru interview."

The manager was much younger than she'd expected. Possibly a high school senior. He was scrawny, wore glasses and looked up apprehensively, like he was cripplingly shy. "Hi, Miss Forman," he squeaked. "Why don't you just have a seat?"

Laurie walked all the way in. She hadn't really bothered to look sexy this time. Just normal jeans, a dress shirt, a little makeup, and her hair curled just enough. She awkwardly placed her considerable rump upon the comparatively small chair, but she was relieved there were no armrests. She sat as straight as she could.

She saw a look of astonishment on his face as he seemed to be noticing just how large she was. At first, she thought it was disgust, but then, she saw how he was looking at her, and she saw him swallow before he started the interview, and that's when she realized - was he into her?! Immediately, her brain sprang back into life and went into overdrive. There was hope for this yet.

"So...," he said awkwardly. "My name is Peter. Welcome to Fatso Burger. Do you have any previous experience?"

Laurie shook her head, putting on her biggest doe eyes. "No, I don't. So... you'd have to teach me how to do it." She threw in a bashful smile for good measure.

It worked. The guy was already putty in her hands. He stumbled on. "Oh, that's fine," he said quickly. "What's your availability like?"

"Oh, I'm very available," she said with a silly giggle, followed by a flirtatious wink.

The guy blushed heavily and fumbled through his papers. "Uh... so, weekends are okay?"

Laurie tried not to wince at the thought of giving up her weekends, but she knew she needed this job to keep living rent-free in her parents' house. Besides, she wasn't really partying it up on weekends anyway. It was now more of a whenever-the-hell-she-felt-like-it kind of thing.

"Oh... weekends are fine," she said, trying to keep the flirty tone in her voice.

Peter wrote down on the forms. "That's good... What would you say is your greatest personal strength?"

Laurie bit back a smirk. Too easy. "Oh, I'm a really easy person," she said. "It's one of my best assets." She leaned forward just enough that he could see down her shirt.

He looked like he was going to drop his pencil. "Um... any weaknesses?"

"Sometimes... I can be a bit of a pushover... and I give in easily... as you can see...," she said with a shy smile, giving her belly a light pat.

The blush was getting so red, he'd probably be able to guide Santa's sleigh. He was really was into her. "I see...," he squeaked. "Well... I think I can go ahead and give you the job!"

Laurie lit up. "Oh, you really can?" she gushed. "Oh my god, thank you! You're my hero!" she squealed, leaping to her feet and jumping up and down excitedly a few times.

Peter smiled modestly. "Oh, it's nothing. I see potential in you."

I bet you do, she thought wryly.

He handed her some forms to sign. "We'll do your orientation and, er, if you don't mind me asking... what size uniform will you need?"

"Not at all," she smiled. "The keyword here, Peter, is 'extra-extra-large'."

He tried to nod casually, but she could tell from the way he crossed his legs under the desk that he was excited now.

Soon, the forms were filled out, and she was on her way out. She decided to order a large chocolate shake as she left to celebrate, but he insisted on paying for it to "welcome her aboard". She smiled all cheerfully at him, which he tried to play off coolly.

She took her shake and walked back to the car, pleased with herself. Employment achieved. She'd probably have to make out with that scrawny little loser a few times. Bend over a few times to show him her ass, leave the top buttons on her uniform open, and maybe eat a large cheeseburger with her gut hanging out a few times, and that would probably be enough to tip him over the edge. Keep talking like he was this big damn hero who'd saved her from unemployment to make him think he was all manly and stuff. In her experience, any man would always believe a lie if you told him he was the hero of it.

She finished her shake and drove home, pleased with herself. Okay, so it was a degrading job in a fast food joint, but it was work. And it was full of delicious burgers and fries. And all those milkshakes to consume.

She wondered if maybe she should go ahead and get an XXXL uniform to be on the safe side...

Donna grimaced and wiped the tears of pain from her eyes as she attempted to jog. She was trying to burn some poundage by doing laps on the school track. It had seemed like such a sensible dream on paper. Get out there, just start running. Start sweating these damn pounds off. But she hadn't quite realized how many of these damn pounds she'd gained lately. Her thighs were rubbing together furiously, making her huge fat thighs red and sensitive. Her massive gut was bouncing up and down, jostling her boobs somethin' fierce. The sweat was glistening, accompanied by her exhausted wheezes.

She barely finished two laps before she slumped realized she was going to pass out soon. She waddled awkwardly off the track and collapsed on the bleachers. She rolled onto her back and let her arms fall limply on either side, one clattering against the floor and the other dangling limply. Her belly heaved up and down with every weakened breath. The sun was beating down on her, which was not the best thing for her Wisconsinite body. She was used to at least feeling a chill in the air. Grunting, she sat up a little and looked around. Not a soul in sight. Thank god, because this super-stretchy tracksuit was suffocating her. She reached up and weakly managed to pull the zipper down, allowing what little breeze there was to flow across her body.

She could feel her gut expand as she set it free.

Sliding her big meaty arms out of the tight sleeves, she let out a sigh of relief and let a small smile overtake her plump lips. She quickly scowled. She was too fat. She was pathetic. How could she be letting this happen to herself? What had Eric done to her? When had she become such a glutton? Why was she hooked on stuffing herself?

And why was she suddenly craving an ice cold coke when water was healthier?

Donna was just considering a nap when she heard footsteps that were passing by. And here she was, half-naked, in her bra, her huge gut hanging out for the world to see...

In a word, shit!

Acting quickly, she slipped her open tracksuit around her shoulders and tried to cover herself. She looked around, trying ascertain the identity of the footsteps, and her heart plummeted.

It was Jackie. The brunette was waddling up along the pathway towards the track, sipping from a Big Gulp and munching on a chocolate bar. Of all the people she could be looking at, it had to be her former best friend who was now dating the former love of her life.

Realizing she potentially in her field of vision, Donna slipped the suit's sleeves back on as she turned and awkwardly ran back down the bleachers and towards the edge. She had to hide. Forget just getting dressed. She had to hide entirely. It was way to weird to see Jackie.

Running was difficult, but she pulled it off just long enough to get beneath the bleachers. She knew that wasn't enough to guarantee she was invisible to the naked eye. She had to hide deeper within their depths. She climbed under the metal staffs, which was a tough squeeze. She made it through the first few, but on the fourth, she was taken by surprise when she couldn't move forward anymore. She was too big to make it through. She tried and tried, but it was no use. She tried to move back, but to her alarm, she couldn't do that either.

Crap, crap, ca-a-a-a-a-ap...!

"... Donna?"

She froze.

"Donna, what are you doing under here?"

"... Jogging?"

"... Okay... well, the track's over there, so..."

"Yeah..."

There was a long pause. Donna couldn't even turn around to face her in her current predicament. She was wedged like a cork in a bottle. Then, to her horror, she found that she hadn't finished zipping up her tracksuit, which meant her gut was still hanging out, and she couldn't reach around to remedy the situation.

"Do you need some help?" Jackie asked.

"No! No. I don't. I'm fine. I'm just..."

"... stuck?"

"..."

Jackie rolled her eyes and eased her way around the beams until she found a wide enough opening to slip through. She came all the way around and let her eyes growing wide at how similarly wide Donna was. Even the dark, there was no mistaking the redhead's enormous belly wedged between the beams, with Donna at such an angle she could do anything.

Donna glared at her. "So are you gonna stare at me all day, or are you going to help me?"

Jackie shook the shock out of her head. "Sorry, I was just... Come on. Let's try moving you."

First, she helped Donna get her awkwardly-angled arm out from between the beams so she could more effectively try to pull herself free. She managed to squeeze herself backwards a bit, but she let out a hiss of pain when her belly failed to move, still wedged between them.

There was a long pause as they realized there really only one way for her to get her gut free, and it was going to involve Jackie's hands touching it.

"... So...," Jackie drawled. "I'm just gonna... I'm gonna have to..."

"Yeah, just... get on with it," Donna said with a grimace.

Jackie nodded and reached forward, digging her fingers into the sides of her old friend's stomach. God, it was huge. Bigger than hers. So soft. Like a big meaty pillow.

Okay, now it was weird.

Digging her hands in under the fat, Jackie squeezed the stomach together until it was narrow enough to slide right out of the bulkheads. Once free, Donna reversed quickly away and crammed herself back into the tracksuit. Even in the dark, her face was beet red.

"Donna...?"

"Thanks," she replied quickly. "Sorry, but I've gotta go."

"Wait, Donna! Come back!" Jackie called after her friend's retreating form. "We haven't spoken in months! We need to --!"

"Need to what? Talk about how you're dating my ex?! How you're satisfying him in a way I never could?! How you love his weird fat fetish when I can't?! Because it's too weird, Jackie! This is sick and unhealthy and I hate that he did this to me!"

Jackie's anger flared at that. "Did what to you? Made you fat? He may have gotten you started, but you look like you're twice as big as when I last saw you! Which was months ago!"

"It's his stupid fault! His fault I can't stop eating! I hate that I've become this! I'm sorry we can't all get off on it like you, but some of us have to live with the reality of being this big! Of being unhealthy! I can't even jog anymore!"

"Well, maybe if you didn't spend all your time behind a desk, hiding from us and the rest of the world because you couldn't move on! At least I get out and do things between gorging myself, unlike you!"

"You know what? Screw you! You don't understand anything! You're just a dumbass sophomore! All you care about is lip gloss and Teen Beat and looking good! I'm going to have a career! I'm going to get out of this stupid town and away from you and your new burnout friends!"

"... They're your friends, too. What do you think they would think if they heard you talk about them like that?"

Damn it, when did Jackie become the morally superior one?

"... I gotta go," she mumbled, turning and leaving.

"Donna, please don't!"

But it was too late. She stormed from under the bleachers and into the daylight. Wiping her eyes clear of tears, she waddled off back into the school. She didn't want to look back and risk seeing Jackie crying, because then she'd just run back and hug her, and she couldn't do that. She just couldn't.

Laurie's new job was basically just her sitting on her ass all day.

Technically, it was against regulations for the drive-thru personnel to sit on-duty, but she grew tired of standing after only ten minutes and whined to her FA boss that her feet hurt, and he'd immediately caved and given her a very tall stool to sit on. Except he was already arranging her schedule so she wouldn't be here on those days anyway, so whatever.

She'd been on the job for a couple weeks now, and already, the benefits were rolling in. Free food, for openers. She was supposed to get a discount, but Peter was covering that himself out of his own paycheck. God, the guy was an idiot. He actually thought he stood a chance with her. But she knew how to play him pretty well.

Naturally, this special treatment hadn't exactly earned her any friends at work, but she was pretty much isolated in the drive thru booth all day. No co-worker contact necessary. On the plus side, she saw that Peter wasn't that hot of a boss with his subordinates anyway. The guy clearly relished what little power he had. Clearly someone who had learned all the wrong lessons after being bullied in high school. This wasn't the "I'll take a long hard look at myself and figure out how to be a good person in spite of this" kind of guy. He was more the "I'll have my revenge by taking my frustrations out on these hapless fast food workers" kind of guy. Not that Laurie had felt at all bad about playing him, but if she had, this knowledge would've made toying with him easier.

So, really, this was the ideal setup for her. She tucked into her second cheeseburger of the day and took another order. This was easy, too. Just type in what the person wanted and pass it along to the kitchen. Take their money at the window and move on.

Imagine her surprise when a familiar voice rang through.

"Hi, I'll have a triple-decker Fatso combo with extra cheese, extra pickles and no lettuce or tomatoes, two large fries and a large chocolate milkshake, please!"

Laurie blinked. Wasn't that Donna's dumb mom? "... Ten ninety-two. Please pull around to the first window," she answered.

A few seconds later, Laurie pulled back her window to find herself face-to-face with a very fat Midge Pinnciotti. She was so large she seemed to fill up the entire front seat, with her enormous stomach pressed against the wheel.

The larger woman lowered her enormous sunglasses and peered through the checkout window at her server. "Laurie?" she asked, bemused. "Is that you?"

Laurie stared back. She hadn't seen Midge in so long. What the hell was happening? "Uh, yeah, it's me. How've you been, Midge?"

"Oh, I'm fine, sweetheart! It's so good to see you looking so good!"

"Yeah, I'm... Yeah! So! Whatcha been up to?"

"Oh, y'know. Not much. Just getting some lunch before I meet up with my women's group for Linner."

"Linner?"

"Yeah, it's like brunch is breakfast and lunch, but with lunch and dinner instead!"

"So... you're seriously going to eat all this and then go have more food?"

"Of course! It's empowering! Eating until you're so stuffed you can't move is the way of the future! All the women in my group are doing it! And we're spreading the word! We're encouraging every woman we meet to have a little extra! More burgers! More pizza! More calories! More carbs! More salt! More sugar! More -- !"

HONK HONK

They both peered over their shoulder and saw someone else at the drive-up intercom was waiting impatiently.

Midge slunk back into her seat and sheepishly handed Laurie the money. "Of course, some aren't as passionate as me."

Laurie nodded faintly as she inserted the money into the til and gave Midge some of her change. "Okay, well, I'll probably see you around a lot then."

"Oh, I imagine so! A full belly is a happy belly! And this place keeps my belly full and happy!" She hefted her enormous gut for emphasis before driving on to pick up her food.

Laurie watched her drive off in a slight stupor before moving on to take the next annoyed customer's order. It was weird seeing the former fitness queen Midge inflated like a beach ball - three beach balls. And apparently, there was a whole group of women fattening themselves up and spreading the fattening word. She quietly wondered how well it was taking effect.

In order to pacify the woman over the intercom, she offered her an upgrade to a large fries for free, which was accepted, in addition to the extra large combo they just ordered. When the woman drove around, Laurie took note that it was another fat woman - not quite Midge's size, but plump - and several old fast food wrappers in the back.

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Jackie was waddling much more cheerfully through the high school that day. Her first time with Eric had been amazing - for a first time, anyway - and she was beaming as she made her way to her locker. It was such an odd thing to think that Eric Forman of all people could make her feel like that, but after the last few months, it felt even weirder to picture her life without him.

She hadn't seen or heard from Donna since the unpleasantness under the bleachers, and frankly, she was glad. If that was going to be Donna's attitude, she didn't need her in her life anymore. She would be just fine without her. She had other friends, of course.

In fact, one such friend was waddling in her direction.

"Jackie! Hi!"

"Hey, Rhonda! Ready for lunch?"

Rhonda snorted playfully. "Only, like, always!"

Rhonda had probably gained at least five pounds since the last time they'd hung out. The plump nerd had felt very free to eat whatever she wanted lately. Fez hadn't seemed to mind. And dammit, there was just so much good food to eat, she wanted it all. So every article of clothing she had was elasticated and extra-roomy as her gut charged ahead and grew much rounder.

Jackie smiled. Rhonda's appetite had certainly been on the rise lately. But that was okay. Jackie was still in the process of gaining more weight, and she liked having an almost equally fat friend to have a good gorge with. Shame they had to rely on cafeteria food at the moment.

"What do you wanna bet they're going to serve that instant mashed potato powder again?" Jackie grimaced as they got in line.

"Yeah, that sucks," said Rhonda, but she then acquired an impish grin and leaned in close. "I also have a jumbo-bag of marshmallows in my backpack."

Jackie's enormous grin threatened to split her face. "Oh my god, you are my hero!"

Rhonda shrugged bashfully. "Well, y'know. Hungry girls. We gotta eat, right?"

"Damn right! Just because they serve crap here, why should we suffer?"

They went through the line and got their lunches. Sadly, their boyfriends didn't share their lunch break with them, so they were on their own. Not that they minded. It was fun having girl time together. Jackie would help Rhonda with fashion, and Rhonda would help Jackie with schoolwork. And there would be much eating between them.

Right now, the two girls were more focused on eating. They only kinda had some of the cafeteria food before they gave in and went to town on the jumbo marshmallows. Not wanting to risk them getting confiscated, they ate with their backs to the supervising teachers and huddled in a corner.

Jackie couldn't resist putting her hand on her belly while she ate, enjoying its mighty heft. So much sugar. There were probably twenty-five calories in each piece. And there were probably forty marshmallows in the entire bag. Just thinking about that was enough to make her a little wet downstairs.

Somehow, between the two of them, Jackie and Rhonda polished off the entire bag with still ten minutes left in their lunch break.

"Ugh...," moaned Rhonda. "I'm stuffed."

"Me, too," Jackie sighed, rubbing her stomach. "God, what a gut."

"Hee hee. You look pregnant."

"Pregnant with a giant marshmallow baby."

They both giggled in a silly way before settling down, hands atop their bellies and matching dopey grins.

After a moment, Jackie's eyes peered around the cafeteria curiously. Her eyes flitted around from student to student. One thing she couldn't help but notice...

There were a lot more fat girls than usual.

Somehow, she wasn't sure how, it seemed like a majority of the female student populace was gaining a bit of weight. Once slender girls were now sporting double chins and fuller faces, while husky girls were now sporting some large potbellies and thunder thighs. Some of them clearly didn't notice how big they were getting, or at least were in denial, as several of their clothes were struggling to hold all their respective fatness inside.

And there were a lot more girls eating fattening food. Hell, a former friend from the pep squad who'd once been rail thin was now struggling to keep her cheer sweater over her swelling belly as she tucked into the cafeteria fries.

"Is it just me...," Jackie said quietly, "...or all a lot of the girls here getting a little... heavy?"

Rhonda came out of her sugar coma to take a glance around. "Yeah... I guess... So?"

"I dunno... Just seems... odd. All of a sudden, the girls around here are gaining weight all at once."

"Yeah, now that you mention it, it's kind of strange... Still, I mean, no big deal. What was that whole thing about not having to live up to society's beauty standards?"

"Oh sure, yeah, totally. It's just... interesting..."

They sat back and observed their fellow fatties milling about, stuffing their face holes in silent fascination.

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna sat morosely in the school newspaper's office. She could just barely fit in her editor's swivel chair at this point. She could hear it groan as she tried to get comfortable.

For the last week, she'd been letting the others have a go at being editor-in-chief of their dinky little school paper. She didn't like relinquishing control like that, but she was still feeling bad about her blow up at Jackie, and frankly, it was only getting worse. The more she replayed the explosion in her head, the more she realized she didn't have much of a reason to be angry. Jackie and Eric were realistically free to do whatever they wanted. So her best friend and her ex were... doing stuff. At least her old friend shared Eric's weird creepy little fetish for fat chicks. He could stuff her full of calories until her heart gave out, for all she cared. If that's what he got off on, then they could do it together until Jackie reached the ripe old age of forty.

Donna sighed sadly. She was letting the anger get through again. That pathetic bitterness that was driving her crazy. She didn't wish that on Jackie. She didn't really hate her or Eric. She was mad at herself. Logically, breaking up with Eric had been the right thing to do. They didn't have that much in common, and what he'd done was not cool. He had clearly been sorry, but it had been a breach of trust. He'd accepted her decision and moved on.

She was also mad at herself for pretty much abandoning her friends. She had always been career-minded, but now she hardly saw her friends or her family. She missed the guys. She missed the basement. She saw them occasionally, but usually as a casual wave from across a crowded hall. She liked most of the other kids on her editing team, but they were... eh. Nothing special. Good solid team, but they didn't seem interested in hanging out with her after printing the paper.

Sitting slouched in her chair, she grimaced when she saw her big meaty hands were casually resting atop her giant belly. She hated that she did that, but dammit, it was just so comfy. Why did her fat have to be so cozy? She kinda missed going to the gym. Except, not really. It was nice to not worry about that and simply let herself go.

But she wasn't like Jackie. She couldn't get off on it. Being fat wasn't sexy for her. It was just what she was now. She liked to eat, and getting fat was just a side effect.

Dammit, her writer's block wasn't going away. With a hefty grunt, she unstuck herself from her chair and went for a walk -- or rather, a waddle. She tried to convince herself she wasn't going to go eat more food, but she had a feeling she was. She could really go for a big thick juicy greasy cheeseburger right now. With buckets of curly fries. And an extra-large chocolate shake. With loads of whipped cream.

Donna sighed sadly as she walked up to the burger joint not far from the school. She hated that this place had opened so close by. And she really hated that it was pretty affordable for a student to frequent. She ordered her meal and took to an open table, hoping maybe she'd think of a new story while she ate.

She probably would have if she hadn't eaten the whole thing - the whole triple-patty with the works - in less than ten minutes. She must've been hungry. She let out a sad groan as she went to town on the extra-large curly fries. Still nothing.

She was just slurping down the last of her XXL chocolate shake when something caught her eye.

There were so many fat girls here today. Like, a lot of them. Of various ages. Some were her own age, but others were older, and they were all swarming this little snack shack place. At first, Donna didn't think much of it, but the more she looked, the more she saw how ill-fitting a lot of their clothes were. Clearly, these were women who were gaining weight faster than they realized, if they had yet to update their wardrobes to something bigger.

Donna observed the men as well, but none of them seemed any different than usual. Whatever was going on must only be effecting the women. Bloating them up. Making them gain weight.

She quietly observed as two teenage girls, who were only a little pudgy, began wolfing down enormous burgers and fries, not unlike she herself had been just minutes ago. She watched an older woman order two enormous milkshakes and proceed to alternate drinking from both of them. One girl was practically pouring a huge bag of curly fries into her greedy little mouth.

Donna watched all this in quiet fascination. Once she was feeling up to it, she began waddling back towards the school. So many questions began running through her mind. What was happening around here? Was there some kind of epidemic? Something she didn't know about?

Was it something she could blame her own weight gain on?

She made it back to the office and jammed her enormous ass back into her chair. She rolled up to the typewriter and started banging away.

Writer's block -- officially defeated!

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna sat at the large wooden table as closely as she could. With her enormous stomach protruding in front of her, it was a bit difficult to sit close enough. She hunched over so her big billowing arms could rest on it, getting her various papers settled, trying to look somewhat professional, even if it was only a school paper she was preparing.

Surrounding her were the other members of her "staff". Five other students, who were all part of the "investigating team". They all sat in a somewhat lazy circle around the table. They liked Donna well enough. She was a great leader, and she certainly took a lot of strain off their work, seeing as how she was such a control freak she did most of it herself, but they sometimes thought she was trying to hard. This was a high school newspaper. Sure, some of them were interested in such a profession one day, but the way Donna ran things, you'd think they worked for an actual paper. Constantly chasing down stories. Getting hard-hitting interviews with the staff. Going out and getting answers about the funny smell in B Hall. It was more than a little exhausting.

"Okay...," Donna said, going over her notes. "I don't know if you guys have noticed, but there's been a weight gain problem at this school."

One of her junior journalists, Matt, spoke up. "Oh, come on, Donna! Don't be so hard on yourself!"

"Yeah!" said Belle, another one. "You've got nothing to be ashamed of!"

Donna blinked, then closed her eyes in frustration. "No...," she groaned. "I don't mean me . I mean, the population in general is gaining weight."

All of her cohorts shrunk back, embarrassed.

Content that they would probably all shut up after that, she continued. "So! I want you guys to put your feelers out there and find out how this is happening. Matt, Chris - I want you guys to interview some people and ask them about it."

Chris, a photographer, blanched. "You mean we have to actually walk up to fat people and ask them why they've gained weight?"

"Well, don't word it quite like that...," Donna sighed, before turning her attentions to the other three. "Belle, Amy - go down to the burger shack near the school and talk to the staff and customers. Business over there has been pretty big lately. Find out why."

"Sure thing, boss," Amy said, gathering her notes.

"And Dave...," she finished, looking over her notes. "... I guess there's nothing left but to interview the school band about their latest fundraiser."

"Oh great," Dave grumbled. "More stories about the band geeks."

"At least you're not interviewing a bunch of fatsos," replied Chris, but Matt gave him a sharp jab with his elbow.

"Okay that's it," Donna sighed. "Let's get some answers."

Matt, Dave and Chris gathered their things and departed quickly.

Amy and Belle stayed back for a few minutes to write down a few interview questions. Donna quietly observed them as she gathered her things. They were two of the only truly slim girls left in town. Amy had long flowing red hair, much like her own, and nice jeans and a plaid shirt, while Belle had curly brown hair and wore a lovely blue dress. She envied them so much right now. They were nice and fit. Everything she had once been and now was not. It wasn't fair. How did they get through the day without constantly eating?

Ugh. Eating. Now she was hungry again. This was insane.

Once her friends had gone, Donna determinedly strode to her car. Not going to eat. Not going to eat. Not going to eat.

She repeated that mantra all the way to the Hub. She parked her car and put on her coat and sunglasses, hoping she wouldn't be recognized. Not that she probably would be, anyway. She'd gained so much weight that most people she'd known for years didn't realize it was her.

Donna walked inside and gazed around, hoping no one she knew was here. She began her stride to the line before the counter, but her eyes opened wide at the sight of the enormous woman in front of her. She couldn't avert her eyes from her enormous backside, like two mighty marshmallows crammed into a pair of jean shorts. The back flab that was hugged by the pink top she wore. The big roll of flab that encapsulated her neck. The way her pillow-like arms rested lazily on either side of her. The way her enormous jugs rose and fell with every belabored breath.

She watched in wonder as this gargantuan woman became next in line, and she waddled awkwardly across the tiled floor to the counter and gratefully leaned against it. "Two large cheeseburgers, no pickles, a basket of fries, and a large cola," she huffed.

The cashier nodded and took the order.

Donna stared as she took a step forward, waiting for her turn. How could this woman eat like that? She turned her head around the room and saw that she was not alone. A lot of plump girls surrounded her, much like at the burger shack. Some were still a bit thin but pigging out excessively with massive dinners of fries, burgers and pizzas, and already-fat girls happily gorging themselves stupid with even more of the same.

The fat woman in front of her received her order and waddled away. Donna ordered a cheeseburger, fries and a coke, and then went to sit down in a corner where she could observe everything. As she ate her own food, she stared in open amazement as the women of Point Place made huge pigs of themselves. Food was ordered and devoured, and big bellies grew bigger. She watched in amazement as they laughed, talked with their friends, and didn't seem to notice how big they were swelling up.

Her eyes fell to the fat woman who'd been in front of her in line. She wasn't with anyone. She had a whole table to herself. She just plowed through it all. The burgers, the fries, the soft drink, everything was crammed into her belly. Her pink top was slowly rising up the sphere of her gut as she crammed it fuller and fuller. By the time half an hour had gone by, she was leaning back in her chair, the food completely consumed, and she was rubbing her stomach in a very self-satisfied way. Donna watched in amazement as she even unbuttoned her shorts and covered her mouth as a belch worked its way up. She sat back in her chair with a silly grin on her face.

Donna watched her for a long time. After just sitting there for at least fifteen minutes, the woman got up, re-buttoned her pants and waddled out of the building.

Momentarily disturbed to realize she'd been pretty much ogling some random fat woman for the last hour, Donna tidied away her mess and left her table. She took one last look at the fattened females all sitting around her, seemingly oblivious to what their monstrous meals were doing to them, and made her way outside.

She was going to save this town from itself. Somehow.

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna heaved herself out of her car, pleased that it had only taken four tries this time, and waddled her way up to the house. She was determined that that was the last time she would stuff herself full of greasy salty takeout. It was time for something healthy. Carrots, lettuce, tomatoes, anything that could start counteracting the effects of so many months of burgers and pizzas.

She entered the kitchen and made a beeline for the fridge. There had to be something. Anything healthy.

But there wasn't. Much to her shock, there was nothing but junk food and various meats. Hot dogs, pork chops, candy bars, soda, maple syrup, ranch dressing, and just about any other fatty food that required refrigeration that you could think of. Even the freezer was overloaded with ice cream. Hissing in frustration, she turned to the cabinets, but found nothing but sugary cereals, popcorn, chips, etc.

She slammed the last of them closed and stormed into the living room.

There was her mother. Zoned out in front of the TV. Watching some crappy soap opera. A couple empty fast food bags strewn lazily about. Hands atop her enormous belly. Her over-inflated boobs almost blocking her view of the screen.

Donna glared at what she perceived to be a wreck of a human being. "Mom?"

Midge blinked and rolled her eyes in her daughter's direction. "Oh, hi, sweetie. What's up?"

"What's up? Mom, what happened to all the food in the kitchen?"

"What? Is the food gone?"

"All the healthy food is gone! You know, the vegetables, the fruit, the grains..."

"Oh, you mean the boring food! Yeah, I guess after we finished what we already I had, I just didn't buy more."

"But you bought a gallon jug of maple syrup?"

"Well, we like it on our pancakes! And it's a good mid-day pick-me-up..."

"Seriously?! Mom, this is insane! If this is all you're eating, how are you even still alive?"

Midge shrugged. "I dunno. I mean, it's not like I never eat vegetables anymore. I just... prefer cheeseburgers!"

"Ugh, Mom, this is not healthy."

"But I feel so good! Better than I have in years!"

"What about what dad thinks?"

"Pfft! That ass? Why should I worry about what a man thinks of me? Besides, he's never here anymore. He's been spending more time at work. I won't let him sleep in the main bedroom anymore. He keeps making snide comments about my weight! Can you believe him?"

Donna closed her eyes. Her parents were so unpredictable when it came to whether or not they wanted to stay together. They'd renewed their vows, but it had only taken a few months for them to start bickering again. And now, with her becoming "less physically attractive", one of the few foundations of their relationship was crumbling. She didn't want to be a hypocrite and give her mom hell for the same thing as her dad, but dammit, this wasn't supposed to be enjoyable. She didn't want this. She wanted to lose weight.

At least, that's what she kept telling herself.

"Donna? Sweetie, are you okay?"

"... Yeah, I just... Mom, why do you like being fat so much?"

Midge smiled. "Because it's so freeing! I can just eat whatever I want whenever I want! And so what if I gain some weight? So what if I have to go up several pant sizes? I still feel beautiful!"

Donna shuffled. "Yeah... Wish I felt the same."

"Oh, sweetie... You know you're beautiful. Doesn't matter if you're a size 2 or a size 20. You just have to learn to love yourself as you are."

The words entered Donna's brain, and deep down, she knew her mother was right, but... she was still stubborn as hell, and she didn't like it when she was wrong.

"Thanks, Mom," she said quietly. "I'm, uh... going to do homework now."

"Okay, sweetie! I'll see you when dinner's ready!"

Ignoring the fact that dinner was probably going to be delivery (again), Donna waddled her way upstairs and hid herself in her room. She leaned against the door and wrapped her arms around herself. Dammit, why had Eric done this to her? He'd awakened some kind of gluttonous demon that had been slumbering inside her, and now it had assumed control over her. Like, had she always been such a pig deep down? It had just taken his machinations to let that inner-piggy out?

Her eyes flitted to the full-length mirror hanging from her closet door. She stared at her reflection for a long time. She didn't even really recognize herself anymore. Bits of her face were still the same, but she had such puffy cheeks, a prominent double chin, dimples... Okay, so she didn't have an ugly fat face.

She gazed at the rest of her. The big double belly, the lack of gap between her thighs, her thick arms, her enormous boobs... She ran her hands over them, gently jiggling them... It was pretty kickass to have way bigger boobs now...

Ugh, no, stop, wrong.

She let her hands fall to her side again and shook her head. She sat down at her desk and got her books out.

Self-love was going to be a long road for Donna Pinciotti

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Jackie and Rhonda had been sitting in Rhonda's bedroom doing schoolwork together. Jackie was relieved she had found a nerdy friend to help her out. Her grades hadn't exactly been crap before, but now they were much better, thanks to Rhonda's little study tips and tricks that helped a LOT.

And holy crap, this girl could eat. It was so nice to have someone who shared that gluttonous desire for more food. Okay, she didn't necessarily share the fetish itself, but she appreciated a good fattening meal now and again.

With the schoolwork over, Jackie leaned back on the bed and rubbed her tired eyes. "Ugh, I'm so glad that's over."

Rhonda giggled. "Feeling the burn, huh?"

"Yeah, I think it's in the back of my corneas somewhere."

While her friend set about tidying the books away, Jackie tried to make sure she had everything required of her crammed into her head. "You know what we need to relieve the pressure?" she asked. "Food."

Rhonda raised an amused eyebrow. "I think that's just gonna add a different kind of pressure," she said, playfully flicking the already-tight button on Jackie's pants.

Jackie swatted her away. "No, really. We're going to get hungry, and hunger eats away at the brain. We can't retain knowledge with empty stomachs."

"I think your understanding of neurobiology is severely lacking, but... I could really go for a burger right now."

"Really? Only one?"

Rhonda blushed slightly. "Well... maybe one really big one."

"Yeah... One the size of a tractor tire!"

The two fatties giggled to each other like they were ever-so-naughty and got in Jackie's car. They considered the Hub, but they'd been eating there a lot lately, and the food there just wasn't the level of grease they were looking for. Fatso Burger it was.

When they entered, they weren't surprised to see how many overweight women chowing down. The increased girth among females in Point Place was becoming a more common sight. They stood in line and ordered double cheeseburgers, fries and shakes and waited patiently for their orders.

While they were waiting, Jackie's eyes flitted past the counter and into the back room. She could see various employees wandering around, going about their business, and if she looked closely, she could see the one working the drive thru intercom. To her surprise, it was a very fat blonde woman. A very fat blonde woman who seemed to be on the verge of bursting out of her uniform.

A very fat blonde woman she recognized as Laurie Forman.

Laurie was sitting on her too-tiny stool and chomping down on a burger. Upon closer inspection, she was actually surrounded by a small pile of empty burger wrappers, french fry containers and drink cups. Her free hand was being used to take orders and receive money from customers, but other than that, she was barely moving at all.

At last, Laurie glanced in the direction of the dining area, and her eyes widened when she saw Jackie. There was a long awkward pause until the blonde motioned to someone Jackie couldn't see that she was going on her break now, followed by her downing the last of her burger and shuffling out of the back towards the door while another employee scrambled to take over from her. A few coworkers glared at her as she shuffled through the door towards them.

"Jackie! Hey!" Laurie said, looking a little flustered. "Surprised to see you here!"

"... Yeah, you, too," Jackie replied, looking the bloated blonde up and down. She couldn't help but eye the buttons on her uniform shirt straining to keep that big fat belly from surging forward. "Eric mentioned you got a job. Didn't realize it was here..."

Rhonda arrived with their food. "Oh, hi! Who's this?"

"Rhonda, this is Eric's older sister, Laurie."

"Oh... Oh! That Laurie?"

Laurie sneered in response. "Yes, that Laurie. Come on. Let's all have a seat. I need a real chair."

She led the two bewildered friends over towards a small table in the corner, away from everyone else. They sat in a small triangle as Jackie and Rhonda unloaded their food.

"Want some fries?" Rhonda asked politely.

Laurie waved her away. "Oof. No thanks. I've had enough fries for one day," she said, patting her belly.

Jackie raised an eyebrow. "Yeah, I saw all the empty wrappers around your work station."

"Oh, like you're one to talk. Look at all that food you're putting away."

"Yeah, but I paid for mine. How much did you pay for yours?"

Laurie snorted. "For your information, the staff eats for free."

"While you're on the clock?"

"Well, not if anyone from corporate is here."

Rhonda looked surprised. "So... you just eat all day while you're at work? How do you get away with that?"

Laurie smirked. "The boss has a crush on me. Poor guy can barely concentrate when I bend over in front of him in these super-tight slacks."

"Ugh," grumbled Jackie. "So you're just manipulating this poor guy so you can get free food?"

"Oh, please. Don't get all high and mighty with me. You know how it is. Food is expensive. And we want lots of it. So we found ourselves some guys who like seeing us blow up like balloons and let the gravy train roll in! And dammit, now I want gravy..."

Jackie glared at her fiercely. "Hey. I'm not just with Eric because he likes me fat. I'm with him because we like each other. He's a great guy, and I think we'd be happy together no matter what size I am. So don't drag me down to your level just because you have no heart."

Laurie rolled her eyes. "You just keep telling yourself that, sweetie," she replied. She heaved herself to her feet and waddled awkwardly back towards the employee entrance, making a point of showing off her enormous bubble butt as she went.

Rhonda had sat there awkwardly during the confrontation, absently eating her fries. "So...," she said slowly.

Jackie let go of a breath she didn't know she'd been holding. "I'm sorry, Rhonda. I didn't mean for there to be drama or anything..."

"It's okay. Really," Rhonda assured her, smiling a bit. "I think it's sweet how you stood up for you and Eric."

"Well, I'm not going to let some skankoid like Laurie Forman tell me that Eric and I aren't for real. Yes, he has an appreciation for how smoking hot I am, but we don't spend every waking minute doing fatty things. We watch TV, talk about life, listen to music - even if we can't stand each others taste in music."

Rhonda giggled, but part of her looked distant. "You don't think..."

"Think what?"

"... that Fez is only with me because I'm fat?"

"Oh, no, Rhonda! I'm sure he isn't! Fez is a nice guy! He's weird and creepy, but less so since he met you..."

"Well... there was a period where he seemed a little off, y'know? Like, he wasn't one hundred percent into the relationship? But lately, I've been eating so much and gaining a lot of weight... and not long after that, he started getting more serious about us."

Jackie thought about that. "That's... interesting," she faltered. "But I'm sure there's a simple explanation."

"I hope so. I want there to be more to our relationship than just me getting fat."

"Yeah...," Jackie murmured, before a devilish grin split across her face. "Although, you have to admit... it's kinda nice, isn't it?"

Rhonda blushed. "I dunno... I mean, my parents are after me to lose weight..."

"Well, that's their problem. Do you like being fat?"

The nerdy girl fidgeted in her seat, but a tiny smile was appearing. "... Maybe...?"

"Maybe?"

"I mean... it's kinda nice when I've eaten a lot, and my stomach feels nice and tight."

Jackie smiled excitedly. "I know! I love that feeling! When I've eaten so much that when I lie back, I can't even see past my stomach!"

"I just feel so cozy afterwards!"

"It's the best!"

So they continued eating, their previous sour encounter with the bitchy blonde forgotten for now, and they soon finished their meals and were leaning back in their chairs, big bellies pooched outwards.

"Oh man," Rhonda moaned contentedly. "So full..."

"Yeah, we are," Jackie said proudly.

She reached over and gave her friend's stomach a gentle jiggle.

Rhonda halfheartedly slapped her hand away. "Quit it...," she moaned with a lazy giggle.

Jackie giggled back and patted her own belly. "Look at how big they are...," she breathed. "Oh my gosh... It's like the bottom half is all squishy and soft, but up here..." She rubbed the top of her gut. "... It's like a bowling ball in my belly! I'm pregnant with a bowling ball burger baby!"

They both giggled again. They couldn't help it. It was all just so silly and fun. Rhonda playfully began jiggling her own belly, giving it a few silly slaps. Soon, the two friends were chatting away about being fat and what they should get for dessert.

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna was going over the reports and photos that Dave and Matt had brought in. She was mentally assembling the report in her head for the school paper. The most she could gather about this recent town-wide weight gain was that people were simply surrendering to their most basic urges - specifically, the desire for junk food. And it was an epidemic that wasn't showing any signs of slowing down. Fast food joints were booming, and restaurants were seeing an increase in sales, from high-end upscale restaurants to all-you-can-eat buffets to Chinese takeout.

It was all so amazing. What was the source? What was causing all of this? The only pattern was that the obesity seemed to be contained to only women in town. Men were about the same as they were before. Women were fattening up like Thanksgiving turkeys, and it was weird. But why? What was causing all this? Something in the water? Messing with their brains? Someone on TV preaching the pros of gluttony?

No, no, stop. Think rationally. It's what journalists are supposed to do. Think of something reasonable. There had to be something simple at the top of this weird fatty pyramid. No evil genius. No evil plan. Something... simple...

She finished with the reports she'd already gotten from her male colleagues. Now she was just waiting for Amy and Belle to come back with their findings. She'd sent them out to investigate the fast food joint near the school, plus any other restaurants they could think of, to interview people. She hadn't really seen them in the two weeks since. And they were running late. She needed their info before she could start printing the story.

Then, she heard slow footsteps coming up the hallway. She shook her head. Probably not the girls. They were always brisk walkers. You could always tell when they were coming. She went back to her writing.

But then, the footsteps stopped right before her door. Upon hearing it open, she looked up. Her eyes widened.

It was Amy and Belle, all right, but not quite as she remembered.

For starters, they were carrying a couple not-quite-empty bags of fast food. Belle was munching lazily on a double cheeseburger, and Amy was slurping up the last of a milkshake. They were wearing their regular clothes, but they didn't seem to fit quite right. They were bulging around their midsections. The buttons on Amy's shirt were visibly tighter than usual, and Belle's tight dress made her look like she was smuggling an inner-tube around her middle.

"... Hey, Donna," Amy said between bites.

Donna stared at them in silent shock. "Wha...? What ha...?"

"What's wrong?"

"... You guys are... I mean... I don't want to be rude, but..."

Belle finally seemed to cotton on. "Oh, this," she said, holding up the fast food bag. "Yeah, we... went undercover, I guess you could say."

"Oh yeah," agreed Amy. "We had to look inconspicuous, so we had to be paying customers."

"What?" Donna asked. "Why did you need to be undercover? You work for the school newspaper! Everyone knows that! You were just supposed to ask questions!"

"We did! We have a report and everything!" said Belle as she sat down and took more food out of the bag. "It's just... I don't know... the more we talked to people..."

Amy finished. "The more we realized they had a point!"

"A point? About what?"

"That we as women shouldn't be spending all our time trying to stay thin just to please men! I mean, what's the point of that? I hate eating salad and granola all the time!"

"And exercising is kind of a drag," agreed Belle. "I mean, I'm getting all sweaty and gross just so some loser who's only into my body will like me? I'll just find some guy who likes fat chicks and enjoy my food, thank you!"

"Yeah, I mean, look at Eric Forman," said Amy. "He's totally into Jackie, and she's enormous!"

Donna groaned at the mention of her ex and put her face in her hands.

Amy winced. "Oh, sorry. I forgot. You've been broken up for so long now, I didn't even think."

Donna shook her head before looking up at them again. "That... is not the point," she said, determined not to lose it. "You guys were supposed to get info on why women around here were gaining weight."

"And we did!" Belle exclaimed, pulling out a folder from her backpack. "All of our notes, compiled right here for you to use at your discretion!"

She slid the folder across to Donna, and she took it in her hands and skimmed through the neatly-written notes. Some interesting quotes in here. Some very nice work. The girls had certainly been thorough.

She glanced up at them as they had returned their focus to the food they were consuming.

Very thorough, indeed.

"God, this is my fault," she sighed, setting the folder down sadly.

The girls looked up. "What is?" asked Amy.

"I sent you into the lion's den. Look at what the assignment did to you!"

Belle looked perplexed. "What do you mean? If anything, I feel liberated!"

"Me, too!" agreed Amy, before glancing down at her forming potbelly. "I mean, not so much around the middle, but nothing a nice pair of stretch pants can't fix. They're all the rage around here these days."

Donna grimaced. This was so wrong. Was she being an idiot? How could she be the only one who saw how wrong this was?

"You'll have to take us shopping sometime, Donna!" Belle said eagerly.

Donna's head came up. "... Huh?"

"Well, you can show us what to buy! I mean, we're not about to stop eating, so we need to be ready!"

"Yeah, I've never been in a plus-size clothing store before!" said Amy, her excited smile emphasizing her small double chin. "It might be fun to go together!"

Their delighted expressions were so bemusing that Donna managed a half-smile. "... Yeah... Maybe we will...," she said quietly.

Although, she was sad to admit, Jackie would've been better suited to picking out clothes for these girls. She always had the best fashion sense. But Donna couldn't go to her old friend now. Not after what she'd said.

Shaking those thoughts out of her head, Donna gathered up all the papers. "Okay, I'm gonna get started and try to have this ready by tomorrow morning. You two get going."

"Okay!" said Amy, already getting up. "Come on," she said to Belle. "If we're quick, we can hit the burger place before the crowd gets there."

"Oooh, great plan!"

Donna had the perfect view of the two young investigative journalists scurrying away, their growing backsides swaying back and forth as they walked out the door and back into the hallway, leaving behind the empty food containers and wrappers. Shaking her head, she left the mess for now and scooted over to the typewriter to get started. She already had a pretty good idea of how she wanted to word this article.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna reconvenes with her investigative team

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Fez was hurrying down the hallway, hoping he could meet up with Rhonda in time. They had agreed to meet after school, and he assumed it meant he was going to enjoy a fair amount of making out, followed by a trip to Fatso Burger, or maybe the Hub, or maybe somewhere else. He knew food was usually the way to his Big Rhonda's heart. He was almost skipping as he made his way down the hall and to the front of the building.

Right away, he saw her standing outside on the sidewalk. That beautiful head of strawberry blonde hair, checking her watch and leaning against a tree. Beaming, he scurried outside and up alongside her. "Rhonda, my lovely!" he said, immediately kissing her on the cheek. "Are you ready for a fun-and-Fez-filled day?"

Rhonda smiled awkwardly in a way that any level-headed guy would've noticed was an "everything-is-not-okay" smile. But this was Fez we were talking about, so he didn't notice.

"Fezzie...," she said slowly. "We need to talk."

Fez shrugged cluelessly. "Okay, sure! What shall we talk about? I hear there continue to be distress in the Middle East..."

Rhonda closed her eyes. She knew she had to be patient. "No, I mean, about us."

"Ah, then this is about where we should go for dinner?"

"No, I mean, about our relationship."

"Oh... Oh! I think I see where this is going."

"Okay, good. I was really worried -- "

"We are finally going to have sex!"

"... Huh?"

"It is a moment I have long been preparing for. I can not guarantee that it will go well. In fact, there may be crying involved. Ninety-five percent of which will come from me..."

"No! God no, Fez, we're not going to... do it."

Fez's face fell. "Oh... Why not?"

"Because... Fez, I have to ask you something."

"Okay... and then we have sex?"

"No! We... ugh... sex is not on the table right now. We're going to have this talk, and once I have the information I need from you, we go from there."

"Very well. But I am not a wealth of information, I feel I should inform you. I only recently learned that Grant is in Grant's Tomb."

Rhonda sighed. He was so endearing, she almost hated putting the relationship on the line like this. But she needed to know for certain.

"Fez... do you only like me because I'm fat?"

Fez's eyebrows skyrocketed in genuine surprise. "No, of course not!" he exclaimed. "I like you because you are Rhonda! The 'big' part has nothing to do with it!"

"Are you sure?"

"Absolutely! You are my favorite person go for long walks in the park, even if they only last ten minutes, and we spend another hour on a nearby bench..."

Rhonda blushed bashfully.

Fez continued. "And I love watching cop movies and 'I Love Lucy' with you, and the way you laugh, the way you move..."

About to be overwhelmed by the heaps of praise, Rhonda cleared her throat to silence him. "Yeah, but... I dunno... it doesn't feel like you were into the relationship for a while. Like, you were kinda distant towards me, and then... when I started really getting fat... that's when you started to show interest in me."

Fez seemed to have been brought up short by that. For a few seconds, his mouth opened and shut as he struggled to find something to say, and Rhonda felt the dread getting worse.

At last, he seemed to find something to say. "Well... you are partially right...," he said slowly. "For a while, there was a period where I wasn't sure about us..."

"... You weren't?"

"Yes, but it had nothing to do about your appearance."

"It didn't?"

"No. Absolutely not."

"Then... what was it? What changed?"

Fez swallowed. It wasn't going to be easy, but she deserved the truth. "Well... for a long time, before we met, I always had a thing for Jackie."

"... You... did?"

"Yes. I was always frustrated that she was with an idiot like Kelso. A beautiful idiot, I concede, but I always believed I was better for her. But when they broke up, I tried going out with her, and she turned me down, saying we should be friends. I thought I was okay again, and then I met you, and I was very happy. But then... she started going out with Eric, and I felt so upset... I mean... Eric is my friend, but I thought I was such a better choice than him... I was... a little bitter..."

Rhonda listened to all this. This wasn't at all what she was expecting, but... it still wasn't great to hear. The idea that her boyfriend had still been hung up on another girl for a time when they were together wasn't the best ego boost. "So... you like Jackie?"

"No!" Fez said quickly. "No, no, no! I did like Jackie, but... the longer we were together, the more I realized how lucky I was to have you! You're the best thing that ever happened to me, Rhonda! And that includes the time I discovered blue M&Ms!"

Rhonda smiled slightly, but it still wasn't enough. "Fez... I just don't know... I mean... this is all so much..."

Fez felt his stomach plummet. "So... what does this mean?"

"I don't know... Like, I want to be understanding... And I want to believe that you really like me... But if you're still hung up on Jackie..."

"I'm not! Rhonda, I admit, I had my head up my ass for a while, but I still like you more than Jackie! I mean, Jackie was a first crush. You're a woman! I could see a future with you I didn't think was possible!"

Rhonda smiled sadly but was still uncertain. "I... I don't know Fez... I mean, I want to believe you, but... I'm having all these doubts now."

Fez swallowed. "Do you... want to break up?"

"I don't know yet. I need to think about all this. I need to... I need to think. By myself. For a while. So... I dunno. I want to put this on hold for a while, okay?"

She could see the tears forming in his eyes, although bless his heart, he was trying to keep it together. "I see... Well, that is... that is fine," he managed to force out. "I... I accept that is... what you want... Fez will give you space."

Rhonda reached out a hand to him. "Fez, I'm sorry, but I need this."

Fez sniffled. "Yes, I respect that. You... take all the time you need.... Now... if you'll excuse me... I will go find Kelso and cry on his big manly shoulder. Good day."

"But Fez -- "

"I said 'good day'!" he wailed, almost sobbing, before turning and walking quickly away before he finally broke down.

Rhonda slumped against the tree. That hadn't gone at all like she'd thought it would. She believed that he liked her for more than just her body, which she'd been worried about. But now, this new information. It would be one thing if it had been a long dead crush, but it had been going on for a long part of their relationship. She had no idea how to process that.

Great. Now she could feel tears welling up in her eyes as well. Had she just lost Fez forever? Would she be able to forgive this? And if she did, would he forgive her for sending him away like this?

Whimpering, she turned for the parking lot to find her car.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Rhonda has a talk with Fez about their relation...

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Jackie hadn't heard from Rhonda in days. At first, she didn't think much of it, but when she didn't get any calls, she began to worry. Then, she didn't show up for school a couple days. Rhonda was one of those nerds who loved school. She was immediately filled with an overwhelming sense of dread as she took her daddy's Lincoln and drove over to her friend's place. Probably broke a view traffic laws, but dammit, her friend needed her.

She parked the car as legally as she could and scurried up the walk to the front door, jamming her finger into the doorbell, and then lightly bouncing up and down as she waited for an answer.

The door finally opened, and Rhonda's tall slim bespectacled mother answered, looking bewildered. "Oh, Jackie! Thank goodness! I'm so glad you're here! Maybe you can help my Rhonda with her... boy problems... before things get any worse!"

"Worse than what?" Jackie asked.

Rhonda's mom shook her mom sadly and guided her towards her daughter's bedroom.

Jackie's mouth fell open at what lay inside.

Rhonda was surrounded by empty burger containers, candy wrappers, pizza boxes and ice cream cartons. There were a few discarded forks and spoons everywhere. At the moment, Rhonda herself was atop her bed, lying back against a giant pile of pillows, and a entire chocolate creme pie atop her already swollen gut. Her face was covered in food stains, crumbs and cream. She looked exhausted. Her eyes were all red and puffy from crying, and there were plenty of tissues littering the place.

Jackie blinked at her miserable friend in shock, looking over to her mother. "... I'll see what I can do," she whispered.

Without another word, Rhonda's mother turned and left the girls to their own devices.

Rhonda didn't seem to have noticed Jackie. She was too busy spooning the pie bit by bit into her mouth. She was in her pajamas, but the buttons on the front were wide open, so her enormous stomach was exposed in its globular glory. After a few seconds, though, she glanced up and saw her friend staring at her with a mixture of shock and concern, and she froze with the spoon right at her lips.

"... Jackie?"

"Rhonda, what's wrong? What happened?"

Rhonda lowered the spoon back into the pie. "I... talked to Fez."

"Oh? Did it... not go well?"

"Well... he said he'd like me no matter what size I was..."

"... And?"

"And then he said...," Rhonda sniffled, "... that he'd had a crush on you for years..."

Jackie blinked. "Oh that. Yeah, he did for a while, but nothing came of it."

"He said... He said he was jealous when you started dating Eric..."

"... Okay, I guess he would be, but why...?"

"He and I were dating when you and Eric started dating."

"... Oh... Oh god... Oh Rhonda, I... I don't know what to say..."

Rhonda shook her head sadly. "It's okay. It's not your fault. And he said he got over it, and he wanted to be with me... But it's just... It's like, the beginning of our relationship is different now! I thought he only had eyes for me, but... he was still hung up on you! And that changes our history!"

Jackie's heart broke for her friend. "Rhonda, I'm so sorry. And you're right. It does make things different."

"He says he still wants to be with me... and I believe him. And I want him. But... it's... I'm not ready. Not right now. I just... I don't know what to do with myself! I mean, what am I? A consolation prize? He couldn't get you, so he settled for me?"

Jackie patted Rhonda's knee. "Well... Rhonda, I don't know. You're in a very tricky situation. But I want you to know that regardless of what Fez feels for either of us, I don't want it to effect our friendship. You were there for me in a very difficult time when Donna ditched us, and I don't want to lose you."

Rhonda smiled through her tears. "Awwwww... Jackie, I don't want to lose you either! You're the coolest friend I've ever had!" She sniffled. "I'd give you a hug, but I'm covered in crumbs. Plus... I don't think I can move."

Jackie giggled, observing the mess. "Yeah... was gonna say... You really went to town on all this."

"I know. When I'm sad, I eat." She smiled a little more. "Well, when I'm happy, I eat. Also when I'm mad. Or nervous. Or excited. Or... gosh, no wonder I'm so fat."

They both laughed. Despite the shitty situation, they had each other. They sat in companionable silence for a while until the good mood began to waver.

"So...," Rhonda sighed. "What should I do?"

Jackie pondered for a moment. "Well... it's a tricky situation you find yourself in... and I don't have all the answers... but... I do know one thing you should do."

"What's that?"

"You should share some of that pie with me, because that is way too big for you to eat in one sitting."

Rhonda stared, and then she laughed. She pulled a clean fork out of her drawer and handed it to her friend, and they proceeded to happily devour the pie.

Within an hour, they both were lying back on the bed, squeezed tightly together, with Jackie giving Rhonda's extremely overstuffed tummy a much-needed belly rub. There were still things to figure out, but hey, at least finishing the pie was a good place to start.
