1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Finding Fez had been a slight challenge.

First of all, the guys hadn't really seen him. He'd been hanging around the basement all depressed and morose until he started playing really depressing music, and Red finally told him to go home until he got his act together. Eric, Hyde and Kelso had tried to hang out with him after that, but he was such an incredible bummer now that they lost the will to continue doing so. They figured he probably went home.

Second, and probably more important, they didn't know where his home was. They'd never been to his host parents' house, so they had no address to go by. It had taken a bit of research, but eventually, they tracked the house down, thanks in no small part to the school directory and Kelso hitting on the secretary.

The guys had offered to help Fez, but she made it clear that this was something between the two of them, so they backed off. She knew exactly what she needed to say.

When she got there, his host parents let her in. They were super-religious, which was extremely annoying. They wanted to make sure they weren't about to have "filthy un-Christian sex" in the house, so the door had to stay open. Still, she would not let that deter her. She stepped into Fez's room and saw him all miserable and depressed in a freakin' race car bed.

"Damn...," she murmured, looking around the room with all the awesome toys. "Fez, this place is like Toys R Us."

Fez pulled the blanket over his head. "What do you want?" he moaned.

"To talk to you. I've seen Rhonda."

Fez peeked out from under the blanket. "Is she okay?"

"Not really. She's miserable without you."

"... Really?"

Jackie crossed her arms. "Fez, you understand what the problem is, right?"

Fez nodded sadly. "I do. I have let my selfishness break my poor Rhonda's heart. And now we are over. Never to cuddle again."

Jackie crinkled her nose. "Okay, listen, Fez, you guys are not over. She didn't break up with you. She just needs some space. But I promise she's just as upset as you. But you need to understand. You made her feel like she was a consolation prize. That she was second best. No woman should ever have to feel that."

"I know...," Fez sighed. "I feel horrible. But I don't know what to do."

"Well then... it's a good thing I'm here."

Fez looked up at her in bemusement. "... Wait, what?"

"Fez, if you want Rhonda back, you need to show her that she's the best girl ever. That she is the most beautiful creature on the planet, and that you need her in your life."

"How do I do that?"

Jackie smiled. "Food."

"Food?"

"Food, Fez. Lots and lots of food. All her favorites. You know her favorites, right?"

Fez didn't even blink. "Extra-large pizza with sausage and green peppers, cookies-n-creme ice cream, hot dogs with relish, movie popcorn with extra thick butter..."

"Okay, okay, just make a list of her absolute favorites. Then, you're taking her on a date. Wear an actual suit, take her to a nice location, and for god's sake, don't be creepy. You're going to woo this girl back into your life. Understood?"

"But... Rhonda said she wanted space? What if she says no?"

"Don't worry about that. I'll get her ready. Just gotta have patience."

"And money," Fez pointed out. "I mean, Jackie, I have dreamed of doing this for a girl for years, but reality always reminds me that I am a dirt poor high school senior."

"Don't worry. I steal my dad's credit cards all the time. Finance is no problem." She smiled. "Let's get your girl back."

Fez smiled uncertainly, starting to look more like his old self. "You really think this will work?"

"Fez, trust me. The way to a girl's heart is through her belly."

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Jackie managed to get Fez on board with her plan. Now she just had to convince Rhonda. She knew her friend missed Fez and wanted him back, but it was a matter of convincing her that it was a good idea. She didn't really trust her instincts right now, seeing as how she was still upset.

Thankfully, it wasn't difficult to find her. If she wasn't in the library, she'd be in the cafeteria. She walked in and spotted her at a lonesome table and a huge pile of food on her tray. Good lord, if she was trying to stress eat the school food, she must be pretty desperate to make the sad go away.

She approached tentatively. "Hey, Rhonda."

Rhonda peered up from behind her mountain of carbs. "Oh, hey, Jackie," she said awkwardly. "I was just... I mean, I'm fine! Just... y'know..."

"... Hungry?"

"So hungry. It's like... Fez not being here has left a huge gap in my life, and I'm trying to fill it with food. But I keep digesting the food, and I just... keep filling it up..."

Jackie gave a small smile. "Rhonda, that's okay. Nothing wrong with that. But you might wanna cool it a bit, because I talked to Fez."

"... You did?"

"Yeah, I wanted to straighten things out. He really misses you."

Rhonda looked cautious. "... He does?"

"Yeah. He was just lying in his race car bed, wrapped in blankets and all depressed."

"His race car bed?"

"Long story. The point is, he is miserable without you, and while he's willing to wait until you're ready, he really wants you back."

Rhonda's chubby face seemed ready to either smile or cry. "Oh, poor Fezzie... I shouldn't enjoy hearing this, should I?"

Jackie shrugged. "Up to you."

Rhonda absently ate another fish stick, but Jackie considered it progress that she had slowed down.

At that moment, Eric walked up to their table, carrying something. "Hey, ladies," he said, kissing Jackie on the cheek.

"Hey, baby. What's that?" she asked.

Eric held up the something. It looked like a large booklet. "School newspaper."

"Oh... That's what the school paper looks like?"

"You've never read it?" asked Rhonda.

Jackie shrugged. "I have enough reading to do between school and Nancy Drew." She looked back at Eric. "Since when do you read the school paper."

"I usually don't, especially since Donna and I broke up, but apparently, there's an article in here generating some buzz."

"Let's see."

Eric put the paper out in the middle of the table for the girls to see. They stared at the headline.

"OBESITY EPIDEMIC INFLATES WOMEN OF POINT PLACE"

"... Oh, god," muttered Jackie.

"Donna?" asked Rhonda worriedly.

"Donna," Eric confirmed.

Jackie was still reading. "The female population of Point Place, Wisconsin, is going through what can only be described as a 'fat revolution'. People are overeating at a much faster rate, with little to no shame or discretion. Women in particular are being effected by this epidemic, with many displaying a very blasé attitude towards their increasing girth, while others have seemingly embraced it. Health experts are worried what this weight explosion could mean in long-term."

They all stared at the paper in silence.

"... Not exactly unbiased, is she?" Eric muttered.

"God, this is ridiculous!" Jackie complained. "So the women around here are gaining weight! So she feels the need to shame everyone with an article just to make us feel bad?"

"Well, if that's the plan, it doesn't look like it's working," Rhonda remarked, casting a glance around the cafeteria.

Eric and Jackie followed her gaze to their fellow patrons. Several girls were looking considerably more bloated than usual. Some were straight up stuffing their faces with food, either from the cafeteria or from home. They could also see a few also thumbing through the school paper, and they definitely did not look happy.

"I don't think Donna's going to be getting Editor of the Year anytime soon," Eric remarked.

"How can she do this? She used to be all Mrs. Empowerment! Now she can't stand that women are eating what they want instead of trying to please males? Isn't that basically what feminism is? Wanting to empower women to make their own decisions?"

Rhonda shrugged. "Maybe... she's just feeling self-conscious and doesn't know how to deal with it?"

"Well, boo hoo!" Jackie griped. "She wants to lose weight? She should lose weight! She shouldn't make the rest of us feel like crap just to make herself feel better!"

Eric put a hand on her shoulder. "Do you feel like crap?"

Jackie scoffed. "Hell no! But I'm pissed at her for trying!"

Eric smiled. "Well, how about this?" he said, taking the paper and tossing it aside. "We just ignore it. She wants to throw a childish tantrum and make everyone feel like crap? We don't give her the satisfaction of giving her hell for it."

Jackie pouted. "But I enjoy giving hell!"

"I know, I know, but let's just let it go for now. Donna's lashing out, so let's just leave her to it. Okay? Besides, judging by the looks on some of our fellow students' faces tells me that we won't have to do anything if we wait long enough."

"He's right," grinned Rhonda. "So many fat girls getting angry up in here."

Jackie looked around again, and she saw several students of varying weights were gathering around anyone who had a paper, and they were getting increasingly agitated with what they were reading. Some looked like they were going to cry, but others were getting furious. Mutters of "who does she think she is" and "she's one to talk" and "what a bitch" were reverberating throughout the cinder block room.

She smiled to herself. "Oooooh, Donna Pinciotti, you have dug yourself a nice big grave."

"That's right, look on the bright side," Eric chuckled.

"Of course. And you're right, Eric."

"For once."

She ignored him. "We shouldn't bother with what Donna is up to. We have more important issues to deal with. Like reuniting Fez with Rhonda."

Rhonda shifted awkwardly. "I want him back," she said quietly. "But I don't really know what to do. How do I just walk to him and tell him I want him back? I don't want him to think the fight didn't matter."

"Don't worry," said Jackie. "I'm already working on it. If you're free Saturday afternoon, I think we can arrange something."

Eric smiled as he watched his girlfriend set to work meddling in peoples' lives, and also smiled as he realized his ex was going to be in trouble soon.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna's article has gone out

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
The next few days were decidedly not good for Donna. She had sent that fat-shaming article out with the hopes that it would wake up the women of Point Place to what was happening to them. That women would realize that they needed to eat healthier and exercise and maybe not let this happen to them anymore. That she would be the town hero or something thanks to her awesome kickass journalism skills.

Except that didn't happen.

"More hate mail, boss," Matt sighed as he tossed her a few slips of paper.

Donna didn't bother lifting her head from the desk. "Let me guess. More of the same?"

"Probably. I try not to read other people's mail."

It didn't matter to Donna. She'd had plenty of angry letters from her fellows students. Many of them calling her out for trying to shame them for their weight and eating habits, and for sticking her nose where it didn't belong. For expressing her "fatphobia" through a false concern for their health. Oh sure, there'd been some letters of support, but they only came from the incredibly shallow, who thought fat people were "gross" or "ugly", and that didn't make her feel any better. If nothing else, it just made her feel worse.

"Matt... have I made a horrible mistake?" she asked.

Matt shrugged. "Maybe. But hey, that's journalism. You're not always going to please everyone."

"It just... felt so right at the time. I don't know what I did wrong."

"Well, I'm sure you'll figure something out soon. We just gotta come up with a completely different article in time for next week." He grabbed his backpack before adding, "And maybe a printed apology." He left.

Donna groaned and rubbed her eyes. This was hell. She'd managed to turn half the school's population against her in one fell swoop. She was so stressed she hadn't really eaten lately, which she wanted to be proud of, but she was absolutely starving and hated it.

Her thoughts were interrupted when she heard two heavy sets of heavyset footsteps heading her way. She knew it would Amy and Belle right away, so she didn't bother looking.

Her two reporters had continued to pork up since she'd last seen them, having gone from their once slender forms to a pair of rather lovely fatties. Amy's stomach had developed a nice fold in the middle, and Belle's butt was taking the lead in her growing body.

They stood over her for a few seconds, but Donna still didn't move.

Belle finally cleared her throat. "Donna...?"

"Yes?" Donna sighed.

"We're here to resign."

That got her attention. Donna's head jolted straight up. "What?!"

"Donna, if this is the kind of paper you're going to be running, shaming people who did nothing more than gain some weight, then we don't want to be a part of it."

"Yeah," agreed Amy. "It just hurts that you said those things about fat people. Especially since we've gained weight."

"Yeah, I mean, do you think we're 'shameless gluttons'? We'd never have helped with this story if we'd known this was the direction you were going to take it."

"You totally took the quotes we got out of context!"

Donna's dumbfounded expression hadn't changed the entire time they'd been talking, but now she was starting to realize she needed to form some kind of response. "You guys can't just resign! You're two of my best investigators!"

"I'm sorry," said Belle sadly, "but we have to think about our journalistic integrity. We want to be serious journalists someday."

"Yeah," agreed Amy, "not jerks being mean to people for being themselves."

"I wasn't being a jerk! This is a big problem in Point Place! Women are getting fatter, and it needs to be investigated!" Donna cried, leaping to her feet.

"Why is it any of your business they're gaining weight?" Belle demanded. "People aren't living up to your standards, so you attack everyone?"

"Or are you feeling insecure about your own weight, and you're taking it out on everyone else?" Amy added.

Donna froze. "I... I didn't... I'm not..."

"Donna, we're sorry if you're uncomfortable with your weight, which is a shame because you really are beautiful, but that's no excuse to just attack people for their own choices. As long as they're not harming anyone else, what right do we have to interfere?"

Donna was still stunned by the accusation and didn't say anything.

"... Donna?" asked Belle. "You okay?"

After a tense pause, Donna slumped back into her chair, a blank expression on her face.

"... I accept your resignations," she said quietly.

Amy and Belle didn't know how to respond, so after another silence, they just nodded, gathered their things and waddled out of the room.

Donna sat in a stupor, not sure what to do now. She'd just lost two of her staff. Hell, she'd just alienated herself from the entire school. How had this happened?

And... were they right? Did she only publish that article out of her own hatred of her own body?

Damn. How had she become this? How had she gone from being a self-empowered independent woman to a self-hating appearance-obsessed vindictive bitch?

Realizing she was all alone, Donna stood up and took a few moments to look down at her enormous body. She had to be at least 300 hundred pounds by now. She ran her hands up and down her extra-large thighs and jiggled her huge double belly. How had she eaten herself so huge? She shook her head sadly. In her heart, she knew there wasn't anything wrong with her being this size. And she knew she was wrong to have gotten on everyone's cases in such a public way.

She sighed heavily and gathered her things. She wasn't sure what to do right now, so she might as well go home. She threw away the hate mail and made the long waddle to her car.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna faces backlash for the article

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna pulled her car into the driveway and cut the engine. She sadly hauled herself out of the car and waddled her way to the back door. Right away, she could hear lots of talking coming from inside, and she saw a few unfamiliar cars parked along the street. Groaning with dread, she opened the door and poked her head inside. She found the kitchen to be simply brimming with food. Fried chicken, buffalo wings, mashed potatoes, green beans, peach cobbler, steamed veggies, deviled eggs, finger sandwiches... they all lined the counters.

"Oh my god...," Donna groaned. What was her lunatic mother doing now?

Speak of the overweight devil, Midge came waddling into the kitchen. "Sweetie, you're home!" she said cheerfully.

Donna regarded her mother. The older woman must've been close to 350 pounds by now. Her clothing was one hundred percent workout garb, just barely able to hold in her enormously flabby body. It didn't stop her belly from peeking out, and her ass from half-mooning the room.

"Mom, what's going on?"

"Oh, just another get together with the ladies. It was my turn to host this week. So I had a bunch of pre-cooked food brought over."

"Seriously? Mom, that's insane!"

"Oh, don't worry, dear! I used your dad's credit card!"

"No, I mean... How many of you are there?"

"Goodness me, I'm not sure," Midge mused, never having been good at math. "There was just barely enough room in the living room for everyone. Here, give me a hand to wheel some of this outside to everyone."

Midge grabbed the cartload of fried chicken, while Donna sighed heavily and decided to at least bring the veggies.

When they emerged, her heart almost stopped. The room was full of overweight women of every size, all talking animatedly while simultaneously gorging themselves on several plates of food. There were several plates going around, and a few empty trays and carts in the room that had been clearly been loaded previously.

"All right, girls!" Midge exclaimed cheerfully. "Take some and pass it around!"

The women grunted as a group before passing around the next trays of food, not even bothering to say thank you as they tucked in.

Midge took the empty trays and wheeled them back into the kitchen. Donna hurried after her.

"Mom, what the hell is going on? It looks like there's twice as many women here than the first time!"

"Probably because there are," Midge replied, tidying things away. "We've had a lot of new women join up recently!"

"And they're all here to gain weight to spite their husbands?"

"Oh, not all of them are married! Some of them are single and just tired of constantly trying to look 'sexy' for men! And even some of the ones who are married aren't doing it out of spite! Their husbands have accepted them for who they are! I wish more men were like that -- accepting of a woman's size so long as they love them..."

Donna saw the wistfulness in her mom's eyes. "I take it Dad's not... accepting..."

Midge smiled sadly. "Not really, no. It's been a real eye opener. But then again, we always had problems before all this. Maybe renewing our vows was just out of fear of losing each other... but maybe... that's what needs to happen after all."

It didn't make Donna feel any better to hear that, but she had to admit, if her parents were just going to fight all the time, maybe a divorce was just what was needed. Feeling overwhelmingly sad, for both her family and her mother's feelings, Donna went over and gave her mother a hug. Midge was taken off-guard, but she was delighted by the gesture and returned, for once understanding the deeper meaning behind it.

They stayed like that for a long time, but Donna slowly withdrew and looked her mother in the eye.

"... I'm hungry."

Midge smiled and wheeled over the tray of mashed potatoes. "Come on, sweetie. Let's have dinner."

They reentered the living room, finding that, despite the many people porking on them, there was still some fried chicken left. They got the mashed potatoes into rotation, and Donna took what was left of the chicken and started eating it. Wherever Midge had ordered this stuff from, it was really good. Just the right blend of spices to keep it interesting without setting her mouth on fire. She ate maybe five pieces before the vat of mashed potatoes made it around to her. She spooned up the very last of it, pleased to find there was still plenty left.

As she plowed through the food, she saw that the dishes were getting increasingly fuller as they came round to her. Clearly, all the women who had gotten here first were getting full, having finished several trays before she had even gotten there. She found herself being passed several servings of the most delicious food she'd ever had.

That small voice that told her to lose weight was silent for the moment, and she was happy for it. She was too depressed to worry about calories right now. She'd made an ass of herself at school. Alienated a lot of people. Now her parents were probably going to split up - for real, this time. She didn't want to think about life. She just wanted food. To eat. To Eat. To EAT.

And that's what she did, for a long time. Just cram her fat gut full of food. Load up. Carb up. Fatten up. Never mind about the future. Never mind about her career. Never mind about moving from this spot. Just eat until she couldn't anymore.

The night wore on, and soon, one by one, the group of overfed women came to their senses and began to depart, one by one, until they were all gone. Midge tidied away the carts and trays, ready for the catering company to collect them in the morning. She loaded them into the kitchen and collapsed on the sofa, feeling very stuffed after yet another successful eating party. Her enormous stomach gurgled from the food she'd consumed.

She threw a glance at the corner of the room. Clearly, she'd not done as much eating as her daughter.

Donna was passed out, with an empty tray in her lap that had contained something clearly very good, given how she'd licked every last bit of food off of it. Her jeans were unzipped, and her huge double belly was on full naked display, her two pudgy hands atop it, her sausage-like fingers interlocked. Her breathing was very labored, sprinkled with the odd belch and hiccup.

Midge smiled. She was too comfy on the couch to get up and send her to bed or even a blanket, but she was glad to see her daughter let loose for once. Maybe this was something they could do together after all.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Midge is throwing another "fat party"

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna woke up with the taste of so many different flavors in her mouth. She smacked her tongue against the roof of her mouth and grimaced at the horrid flavors. She swallowed them down and grimaced at herself before realizing where she was. She was in the corner between the staircase and the wall of her living room. She peered downwards. Good lord, her stomach was out and completely bare. Feeling suitably embarrassed, she pulled down her XXXL shirt in an attempt to cover it but found that it only really covered the top half at this point. She'd have to suck in a little to cover it entirely.

Holy crap on a cracker, what did I DO last night?? she thought.

As the memories returned to her bit by bit, she groaned internally. She'd only gone and made the biggest pig of herself ever, that's what. She could barely move. She stretched all the kinks out of her body before she gently rocked herself back and forth, until she finally got herself up onto her feet. She looked around, but was surprised to see how little debris there was. She walked into the kitchen, trying in absolute vain to button up her pants, and found Midge working at a mighty-fine looking breakfast of pancakes and waffles. Loaded with butter and syrup, of course.

"Good morning, Donna!" she said cheerfully. "Waffle?"

Donna blinked. "Uh, mom, what happened last night?"

"You don't remember?"

"It's all... kind of a blur."

"Oh... well, you joined my friends in our weekly dinner buffet, and after about a dozen trays of the most delicious food on the planet, you... kinda passed out."

Donna dreaded the next question. "Did I... unbutton my pants before or after everyone left?"

"Oh gosh, I don't remember exactly. Definitely before a few people went home."

"Oh god..."

"Sweetie, don't worry! It wasn't a big deal! Happens at these parties all the time! God knows I've had to unbutton my pants time and time again during these parties!"

Donna shifted awkwardly before deciding to sit down at the table. "So... how'd you get this place so clean?"

"Oh, the catering company took away most of the mess."

"... Wait... Does that mean they saw me passed out with my fat gut on full display??"

"Probably."

"Mom!"

''They didn't comment on it if they did! It's probably par the course for them!"

Donna buried her face in her hands and hissed mournfully.

Recognizing that her daughter was unhappy, Midge quietly fixed a plate of waffles and passed them over to her.

Donna lifted her head and stared at the plate resentfully. "You seriously think waffles are going to make this better?"

Midge also nudged over the maple syrup.

"... Okay, maybe a little better," Donna sighed as she took the bottle and poured a very generous helping all over the waffles. Once satisfied, she dug in.

"So how are things at school?" Midge ventured.

"Sucky," Donna sighed. "I... published a very dumb article in the school paper that offended a lot of people, and now almost the entire school hates me."

"Oh, I'm sorry, sweetie," Midge said kindly. "Still, you don't have to worry about that for long. You graduate in a couple months. Then you probably won't have to see them ever again."

"In a small town like Point Place? I probably will be seeing them at some point."

Midge thought for a few seconds. She'd been cooking an idea in her head for a while now - it always took her a while - and she decided it was time to present it.

"What if... you didn't live in Point Place anymore?"

Donna blinked. "Well, I'd been thinking about college, definitely. Of course, most of them would probably going to the University of Wisconsin..."

"What if you didn't live in Wisconsin anymore?"

"Mom, what are you getting at?"

Midge took a deep breath before continuing. "I'm thinking about moving to California."

"California? Why?"

"Sweetie, we know things between your father and I aren't going to improve. I'm going to talk to him a bit, but... I feel like this is right. I'd like to wait until after you graduate and you've made your decision. But I'd really like it if you came with me. If you really want a fresh start, this is a good opportunity for one."

Donna stared at her mother in mid-chew, and suddenly, all those emotions started flowing through her again. Her mother was really considering this? The logical part of her told her that it was for the best if her parents split up, but... she just couldn't deal with all this right now. Not when she'd only been awake for seven minutes.

Midge saw the pain on her daughter's face. "You don't have to decide right this second!" she continued quickly. "Just... think it over. Okay?"

"Yeah... okay... Can you pass the butter, please?"

Midge obliged, and Donna proceeded to slather the entire stick of butter on her breakfast.

They ate in silence for the rest of the morning.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna awakens the next morning

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
It was a Saturday afternoon.

Rhonda paced back and forth worriedly. She was wearing a very nice dress - sapphire blue with patterned sequins - and had her hair done up. Jackie had tried to get her to wear contacts, but she'd refused. Fez liked her glasses. And they made her eyes all boogery. She paced nervously around her house. Her parents were mercifully leaving her alone. All they knew was that she was going on a nice date. Mainly because that's all Rhonda knew, too.

Jackie's dad's Lincoln pulled up to the house. With a quick goodbye to her parents, Rhonda scurried down the walk and into the passenger seat. The whole car lurched as she settled herself, and they were half-certain the bumper had briefly touched the pavement from the new load.

"Well, there go the shocks," Jackie sighed.

"Sorry, I'm just... really nervous, y'know? You haven't told me anything."

"Look, we've already established that you and Fez want to get back together and that you're willing to forgive him. But you need a romantic kickstart to get your relationship going again. So don't worry - I've got Fez all set up at your romantic rendezvous."

Rhonda smiled bashfully. "Oh... Jackie, you didn't have to do all this."

"It's okay. I wanted to. You've been a great friend for me since Donna ditched, and you've been a big help with school. I'm gonna miss you when you graduate and head to college."

"Oh, I'm not going to go far. Besides, I'll still need you for fashion advice. And we should still have our lunches."

"I totally agree. In fact, lately, I've been thinking we should expand to brunch as well."

Rhonda giggled. "You mean, we should expand at brunch?"

"Yeah, girl!" Jackie whooped, holding up a hand for a high five, which was gladly given.

It was a ten minute drive to the location, but when they got there, Jackie didn't get out of the car. She simply gestured to Rhonda's door.

"You're sure about this?" Rhonda asked nervously.

"Absolutely. I told him exactly what to do. That being said, if he says anything stupid, I had nothing to do with it."

Rhonda heaved herself out of the car, and Jackie winced as she felt it tilt back in her direction. She drove off into the distance, leaving her fat nerdy friend standing on the curb outside a small forest surrounding a lake.

"Rhonda...?"

Startled, she whirled around to find Fez dressed in a nice suit, complete with a necktie. "Fez?!"

"I am here for our date."

"Oh, good...," Rhonda said cautiously. She was fighting very hard to smother a smile threatening to take over her whole face. "How've you been?"

"Oh, I am fine. You, though, have only gotten more beautiful in our time apart."

The smile won out. "Awww, Fezzie... I've gained five pounds since you lost saw me."

"Then I can't wait to see them."

Rhonda snickered. Don't blame Jackie, she reminded herself. "So... what is this date?"

Fez smiled and gestured behind him towards a small hill through the trees. "This way, m'lady."

Rhonda walked past him, walking gingerly down the hill - very glad she'd ignored Jackie's orders to wear heels - and made it to a grassy ledge over the lake. Her mouth fell open.

It was a picnic. But not just any picnic. She could see a pizza box, some plates and three large coolers, one of which was already open and full of glass bottles of Coke.

"Oh, Fez! This is so sweet!" she squealed, hurrying over to the large picnic blanket.

"I am so glad you think so, my dove. It was a lot of work, and that was just dealing with Jackie. She originally wanted us to do this at night, but I pointed out that would require a few candles, and that would only attract insects. Apparently, I am not a very romantic man."

Rhonda smiled fondly. "Wanting to keep your girlfriend pest-free is very romantic, Fez."

Fez smiled and gestured for her to sit.

Once they had their bottoms parked on the blanket, he passed her a coke and the pizza box.

"Oh, Fezzie, my favorite!" she exclaimed.

They were soon proceeding with the meal. Although Rhonda tried to be generous and share some, Fez really only got couple of slices while she devoured the remaining six. They ate in relative silence, listening to the waves crashing and enjoying the warmth of May. It was so rare to have a warm day in Wisconsin.

Soon, the pizza was gone, and Rhonda was leaning back, wiping her fingers with a napkin so she could rub her stomach without staining her dress. "This is a very nice spot, Fez," she said quietly.

"Thank you. Jackie helped me scout it out. We wanted an ant-free zone for this picnic. We would test out different spots by leaving food out for hours and making sure no insects swarmed them."

"Sounds intense."

"It was... Rhonda?"

"Yes?"

"Jackie said that you missed me while we were apart. Was that true?"

"Of course it was. Did you really miss me?"

"I did, indeed."

"... And do you really have a race car bed?"

"I do. Rhonda - I am sorry I made you feel like you were a consolation prize. You are no consolation. And you are so much more than a mere 'prize'. You are a woman. The woman of my dreams. A woman who shares my passion for candy and making out."

Rhonda smiled. "And you're my Fezzie. The man who treats me like a queen."

"Always, my sweet. And ooh! Speaking of sweet!"

Fez reached into another cooler and this time pulled out a pint of cookies n cream.

Rhonda's face lit up as she took it and the spoon. "Oh my god, kick ass! My other favorite!"

"And there's plenty more where that came from, your majesty. Tonight, you are a queen. This is all to show you that you will never be second best in my heart."

Rhonda peered into the cooler and saw several more frozen goodies awaited her inside. Her mouth was practically drooling over them all. "Oh man... If my gut rips out of this dress, Jackie and my parents are all gonna kill me."

"They shall have to go through me first. Now eat."

Smiling, she took a spoon and snuggled up under his chin, already going to town on her ice cream. They stayed like that for hours, watching the water and enjoying each other's company. And every time she finished something, Fez would just reach into one of the coolers and hand her something else. And there was a lot. Ice cream sandwiches, popsicles, cookies, whipped cream... so much sweetness in her tummy.

And when there was nothing left to hand her, she was too stuffed to sit up anymore. Thankfully, he'd brought a pillow for her to lie down on. She leaned back, patting her painfully full stomach. Fez reached over and gently gave her a belly rub. It was nice, but Rhonda was feeling a bit randy.

"No, Fez...," she moaned. "Do it... like this..."

She reached down and pulled the dress up and over her huge belly. Fez's eyes widened slightly, but he was clearly excited by the possibility. He got up and straddled her, providing further proof that he was excited. He put his hands on her rock hard belly and rubbed gently up and down its entirety.

Rhonda let out a moan of delight as she let him feel every inch of her enormous stomach. Hands behind her head, she enjoyed the feeling of him on top of her, his hands roaming up and down her distended gut... and tentatively to other places as well, making her moan in unexpected pleasure. And then he started nibbling her earlobe, sending her senses all a-tizzy. She instinctively grabbed him and started making out with him.

"Oh god... Fez...," she moaned.

"My god, you're beautiful," he replied breathlessly.

"Unnngh... you're driving me crazy... I'm so stuffed and bloated... I need you..."

"I am yours for the taking..."

Driven by her out of control hormones, Rhonda started sliding her panties down, then forcibly grabbed Fez's zipper with a determination she didn't think herself capable of.

It truly was an excellent date.

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna found herself wandering the halls quite a bit during school. Between cramming for finals and continuing work on the school paper, she was kept very busy. She'd managed to find a couple replacements for Amy and Belle, but they weren't really serious journalism students like her. She'd had to accept them anyway, as they were the only ones willing to take the jobs. She'd inadvertently given the school paper a bad name with her "fat shaming", so the others were working overtime to do get their good name back. She was relieved the others on the paper had stood by her, but she'd decided to step down as editor-in-chief and let the others go back to their way of reporting.

It didn't help her spirits much that the subscription rate had increased once the previous format was reinstated. But that's high school for you.

A week before finals, Donna did a mental recap of life at school. She was now an outcast. Before, she'd simply been in a self-imposed exile, working all the time and reducing socializing. Now, there were very few willing to make eye contact with her, let alone talk to her. She knew on some level she deserved it, but this was getting out of hand. California was looking more appealing all the time.

Then, one day, by chance, she spotted Hyde sitting outside the school, skipping class once again. Not seeing anyone with him, Donna decided to take a chance. She slipped outside and approached him at the bench he was sitting on.

"Hey, Hyde."

Hyde glanced up, then did a brief double take. He hadn't seen Donna in months. Probably back when she had weighed only 200 pounds. Now, at least 100 pounds later...

"Donna?"

"Hey. How've you been?"

Hyde cleared his throat to reassert his "zen". "Oh, I'm okay... You?"

"Been better."

"Yeah, I read the article in the paper."

"You and everyone else, apparently."

"If it makes you feel any better, I think that was the highest-selling issue."

"Not really."

Donna sat down next to Hyde, trying to ignore how much of the bench she was taking up and how far he had to scoot over to make room for her.

"Look, Donna, I'm not gonna tell you what to say or do, but... what the hell prompted that article? I mean, I'm not into the fat chicks, personally, but that seemed a tad aggressive."

"It was a lot of things," Donna replied. "I like to think part of me was reacting with genuine concern to what's happening around here... but another part of me is thinking... maybe I haven't learned how to be comfortable in my own body. I mean, I'm supposed to be this modern forward-thinking self-assured feminist, but... I got all insecure about my weight."

Hyde nodded. "So you let that bleed into the article."

"Yeah... and now I'm this big social pariah. I can't believe I let my own insecurities control me. I mean, who am I to judge people based on their eating habits? They're not hurting anyone else. If someone went out of their way to criticize my lifestyle, I'd be mad as hell."

"So what's your game plan?"

Donna shrugged. "At the moment? Just make it to graduation without being tarred and feathered. How about you? What're your plans?"

"Gonna stick it out at the Foto Hut with Leo for a while longer. It's a good job. But we'll see what happens."

"Good to see you're staying the course."

"Stick with what works."

"So what about the rest of the gang? How're things with them?"

"Well, Kelso's still banging away. We figure he's eventually get someone pregnant. Things should start getting interesting after that."

"I imagine they will. How's Fez? He still with Rhonda?"

"Oh yeah. They had a rough patch a while back, but they're fine now. Fez came galloping into the basement a few nights singing his 'I did it' dance."

"Oh, god. Kinda glad I missed that."

"Yeah, I won't nauseate you with the details."

Donna chuckled, but her smile soon faded as she remembered one other unpleasant fact. "And... Eric and Jackie?"

Hyde bit his lip briefly, but he soldiered on. "Still together. He's going to stay in town for a year, keep working at Price Mart, and wait for Jackie to finish high school. Then they're talking about heading up to Madison for college next year."

Donna nodded distantly. "Wow... good for them."

"Yeah... they're surprisingly strong."

That wasn't really what Donna wanted to hear, but at the same time, she felt happy for Eric. He'd found someone who shared his kink, and it ended up being Jackie. They'd found each other. That didn't mean it didn't sting. He was her first love, and she would always love him, in a way. Maybe one day, when all this drama was behind them, they would be fine, but for now, she was still miserable at the very thought of him with anyone else, especially her former best friend.

Hyde noticed how quiet his old friend had gone. "You okay, Big D?"

"... Yeah, I was just thinking."

"Uh oh."

"Shut up, dillhole. My parents are talking about separating again."

"Oh... sorry."

"No, it's okay. I mean... they haven't been getting a long for a while now. It'll be good for them. It's just... my mom wants to move to California, and she invited me to go with her."

Hyde blinked. "Wow."

"Yeah."

"What'd you tell her?"

"That I'd think about it. I wasn't sure at first, but... well, there's not a lot for me here. Everyone in Point Place has more or less cast me out. I'm only bringing the school paper bad publicity. I've more or less severed ties with everyone. Plus... it's kind of hard living next door to Eric these days..."

Hyde nodded sympathetically. "Yeah, I get that... So you're gonna go?"

Donna blinked as she realized how this was lining up. "... Yeah, I think I am. I mean, there are plenty of good colleges in California. And I'm sure I can pursue my journalism career there."

Hyde smiled. "Well, best of luck to you. But do yourself a favor, Big D -- don't just plan a career. Plan a life."

Donna smiled back. "Thanks for the heartfelt concern, Hyde."

"Ahh, get bent."

Donna gave her friend a hug before getting up - much to the apparent relief of the bench - and waddled back towards the school. She caught sight of her reflection in a nearby window and quietly marveled over how big she was. She hadn't bothered to weigh herself in months, but she was certain she was well and truly over 300. Maybe over 315.

You know, she thought to herself, it's not that bad a look...

There were at least twelve empty burger wrappers surrounding her. Twenty-one french fry containers. A couple empty cups - one for sodas and one for milkshakes. A few empty mustard and ketchup packets. Lots of empty mayo packets.

Laurie smiled to herself as she tucked into her thirteenth cheeseburger of the day. It was amazing how much she could consume in an eight hour shift. Plus, at two dollars and eighty cents an hour, she was doing pretty good for herself. She considering asking Peter for a raise. He was totally convinced he had a chance with her. All the free food, drinks and constant uniform upgrades were obvious signs. She had him wrapped around her increasingly-fat finger.

And speaking of fat, holy crap, was Laurie fat.

She had been pushing to find out just how much she could get away with consuming every day. It amazed her how much she could get away with. She constantly went home overstuffed with fattening greasy delicious Fatso food. She would go home with a very full belly and then enjoy whatever her mom made for dinner on top of it all. She went to bed and promptly passed out into the best food coma ever.

Then, she'd spend her days off just patrolling the town and bars, finding sexy guys who were super into fat chicks. Holy crap, they were amazing. She didn't know how she'd been missing out on these people. If she'd known she could still find awesome sex while grossly overweight, she'd have let herself go years ago. She was finally able to embrace her inner sloth and her inner glutton.

Peter, of course, was still completely convinced that she was in love with him and was going to make out with him at some point, so he kept letting her get away with stuff. While most of her coworkers hated her for it, a lot of them hated Peter more. Peter was such a prick most of the time, they kind of liked seeing him get strung along, not to mention endanger his job just for the chance of a make out session with this fatso.

And she was so-o-o-o-o-o-o fat.

Laurie's belly was now entirely in her lap. Her boobs rendered her original uniform shirt a sports bra. Her ass now needed two stools. She wasn't sure how much she weighed, but she assumed it was somewhere around 350 at this point.

She fixed herself one last milkshake for the day and heaved herself off the stools to punch out for the night. Her replacement, a petite girl named Angela, had to wait for her to squeeze her way out of the drive thru station. Her overstuffed stomach was pressed against the wall as she heaved herself out.

Angela just leaned against the far wall with an annoyed look on her face. "Had enough free food for the day, Laurie?" she drawled.

Laurie responded with a dismissive sneer. "Scooch over, tiny," she replied. "Eat a few cheeseburgers and cast a shadow."

She popped herself free and waddled past. Angela rolled her eyes and headed for her station. "Keep this up and you won't be able to fit back there."

Laurie rolled her eyes and headed to the back room to punch out. But Angela's words stuck with her. She had a point. She had spent the last few months merrily getting fatter and lazier, and there was only so much room back there. As she punched out and headed for the restroom to clean up, she had to admit, she was getting too big. She pondered to herself - how could she fix this? She considered asking Peter for a promotion, like a desk job, but that would involve way too much responsibility, and she wasn't in the mood for that. She needed something else.

As much as she reveled in the free food, she realized she wasn't going to be able to make this work forever. She needed something long term. Something with lots of eating and no thinking.

She turned a few times like a runway model, admiring her reflection as she chugged her shake down. She slapped her belly a few times. She was so stuffed after such a long day of pigging out on the clock. Smiling to herself, she waddled out into the open, and then made a point of slowing down past Peter's office. He glanced up, like he always did, and she made sure to smile and wink at him, and he dropped his pen on his desk. For a moment, she thought he was going to chase after her, but she was somehow faster than him and walked off. She enjoyed listening to him crash on the floor as she scurried out the door into the summer air.

The bus ride home was uneventful, but she was determined to think of something to fix her problem. She enjoyed the free food, but Fatso Burger was not going to work forever. She couldn't stay in the drive-thru station all the time, not when she was getting too big to fit back there, but it was the best place for a daylong gorge. What else could have that freedom?

Then, it started to form in her head.

There were so many fat-loving guys around. Maybe one of them would be interested in fattening her up for life. Someone who would be willing to let her sit on her ass all day, bring her food, let her watch TV and have constant fat sex with her.

An excited smile split across her face. There had to be some kind loser out there who would be up for that, right? She absently cradled her belly in her hands. She'd be sure to make sure to wear some of her old clothes next time she went out.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Laurie makes progress at Fatso Burger

choices: Donna meets a guy at the food court
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna wandered the mall in silence. She tried listening to the distant music on the P/A system, but she was still in a daze. She was seriously thinking about moving away from her life. Moving to California with only her mother. She was more or less on board with the idea of her parents finally splitting up, but this a pretty big bridge to cross.

Of course, she was now hated by all her classmates, so most of the colleges in the area were out of the question. There were just too many people who knew her and her article. A move would ensure that she didn't have to worry about anyone knowing her. A fresh start.

She wandered around the plus-size clothing store, looking for some new jeans and some new t-shirts for the upcoming summer weather. She had graduation to think about as well. Maybe focus on those finals so she could get into a good school, huh? But as she wandered, she began to realize how crowded this place was. When did it become so popular? Then, she began to notice just how large some of these women were. Several plump, fat and/or enormous women were going through the various articles of clothing. Comparing prices, comparing sizes, comparing colors... Donna watched all of this in stupefied silence for a few moments before a couple of extra-fat asses bumped into her. Wincing, she got moving again, lest she screw up the overweight flow going on in here.

Donna managed to find a couple shirts and a pair of jeans she liked before getting in line. She stood awkwardly in the small store, watching the lady fatties bob back and forth between each other like a bunch of bell buoys in a storm.

While she waited, she felt eyes on her, and she turned to see the fat girl standing behind her gazing at her intently.

"... Can I help you?"

"Aren't you Donna Pinciotti?" the girl asked.

Donna groaned. Did this girl go to her school? Had she read the article? "...Yes," she sighed.

"Is your mom Midge Pinciotti?"

Now Donna was confused. "Yes?"

"My mom goes to her dinner parties! She loves them! They're great friends!"

Relief began to flood Donna's brain. "Oh!" she said with a shaky laugh. "Yeah, okay! Great! That's... that's great!"

"I swear, my mom used to be such a stickler about my weight, but after she met your mom, she's loosened the reigns a lot."

"Well, I'm glad to hear that..."

An older woman who was easily twice Donna's size turned to look at them. "I'm sorry, girls, did you mention Midge Pinciotti?"

Donna smiled awkwardly. "Yeah, she's my mom."

"Oh, sweetheart! You're Donna! She's mentioned you! I host those dinner parties sometimes, and oh my gosh, they are just fantastic! I hardly ever go home hungry!"

Another woman with a potbelly joined in. "Oh, I've heard of Midge Pinciotti!" she exclaimed. "My friend Debra knows her! She got me started on this new 'high fat' diet!"

Donna's brow furrowed. "High fat?"

"Yes, and you know what? She was so right! We shouldn't have to worry about our weight just to please men!"

"Exactly!" said another young fat woman. "We should be eating whatever we want whenever we want, and if we happen to gain some weight in the process, that's no one else's business!"

Donna found herself next in line at the cash register, so she had to disengage from the conversation for a couple minutes, but when she turned back, she found that several of the women were talking very animatedly about her mother. Some of them knew her, others knew of her, many knew people who knew her...

As she stepped backwards out of the store wide conversation, she began to put the pieces together. Her mother. She was the cause of the weight gain epidemic. She'd started some kind of weird ripple effect that was spreading across Point Place and getting into the heads of all the women in town. The whole mindset that it shouldn't matter what a man thinks of a woman's weight -- it had all come from her mother!

Then, something occurred to her. Her mother had only had that idea because of Donna herself putting that idea in her empty bimbo brain in the first place. None of this would be happening if she hadn't had that one sit down with her mother months ago.

In fact, this was all Eric's fault. That skinny twitchy little nerd had been trying to fatten her up. If he hadn't done that, she wouldn't have felt the need to justify her weight, thus setting off the domino effect, thus fattening the town.

Donna clutched her shopping bag as she tried to rub her temples and get a grip on herself. She tried to relax a little. This wasn't entirely Eric's fault. After all, Donna had never at any point stopped herself from eating. In fact, she'd been gaining like crazy since Eric left. Couldn't really blame every single extra pound on him.

And it wasn't her fault Midge listened to her advice. Midge could've just blown it off. Not her fault she decided to listen to - and completely misinterpret - her daughter's poorly thought out words.

And these women - it wasn't her mom's fault they gained so much weight. They had choices. They could've gone about their lives and eaten celery the rest of their lives. But no, they wanted to pig out. In the end, they were all masters of their lives. No one made them do anything. They had all decided to do this.

Donna looked at her body. All 300 pounds of it. She had decided to become this. She had let her inner-love of food take control. It wasn't exactly a turn on, but dammit, she had decided that food was more important than her figure.

At that moment, several of the women came waddling out of the store with their purchases, talking animatedly about how much they enjoyed eating and the pros and cons of their new sizes.

The girl she'd been talking to at the beginning of the insanity came over. "Hey, we're all gonna hit up the food court! You in?"

Donna blinked. Was this happening? "Uh... sure!"
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna finds the source of the town's weight...

choices: Donna has a talk with Midge
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Donna could only imagine what this plus-sized brigade was going to look like to the various food court employees on duty tonight. She stood back and watched as they swarmed, dividing themselves up to the various little restaurants. She wandered around, looking to the hamburger joints, the pizza places, the taco stations, the ice cream parlors... Hell, even the cookie store was full of people looking to start dinner with some dessert.

There was a cascade of orders coming from each direction --

"I'll have a double stacked with cheese, extra pickles, extra large fries -- "

" -- extra pepperoni, extra sausage, ooh, and an order of breadsticks -- "

" -- and don't skimp on the cinnamon bites! Those are the best ever -- "

" -- an extra-large cola... You guys still do free refills, right? -- "

" -- and sprinkle it with oreos and peanut butter sauce, and y'know what? Gimme TWO -- "

" -- is this really all you have? Oh, I suppose I'll make do with just twenty, but they better have candy in them -- "

Donna watched them all in amazement. Those poor servers and cashiers were working quickly to keep up with the sudden onslaught taking place before them. All these women, all making pigs of themselves, spending hard-earned money on whatever junk food they felt like eating in that moment. How were they doing this?

But watching them all made her feel positively ravenous. She got in line at the nearest pizza place and ordered two slices of pepperoni. She took the tray with her food and cut across to the nearest hamburger joint, getting a number two with extra cheese and mustard. Then, she carried it all over to the ice cream parlor, getting a huge chocolate chip cookie dough sundae, coated in butterscotch. She got an extra large Dr Pepper from the drinks fountain and waddled her way over towards a lone table with a two chairs. She took one, brought around to the other, and sat down on both simultaneously. Enjoying having her entire butt stabilized, she set to work on her feast.

As she did, she looked out amongst all the fatties in the food court. Damn, these women could eat. Between talking animatedly about food, they were also cramming fistfuls of whatever they could into their faces. Burgers, fries, pizza, hot dogs, tacos, nachos, cookies, cakes, ice cream... Their faces were stained with anything and everything. Girls who hadn't been anticipating a group gorge were unbuttoning their jeans, giving their bellies room to grow. Some had worn elasticated waistbands, and even they needed to loosen them up a bit.

One woman had gotten at least three milkshakes from the burger joint, and she was clearly frustrated with how slow just sipping through a straw was taking. She popped off the plastic lid, removed the straw, tilted her head back and just chugged all three of the damn things. She rubbed her swelling stomach while her fellow eaters encouraged her. Some even went to get shakes themselves.

Nearby, a young girl - probably the skinniest of the bunch, looking to be around 220 pounds - was almost literally inhaling an entire foot long meatball sub. She didn't stop for anything. Just munch that thing down until the entire foot was in her gut. When she was done, she leaned back and licked her fingers contentedly.

Donna worked her way through her own food. The burger was cooked to perfection. The fries were nicely salted. The pizza was gooey and greasy. And it all mixed nicely with the enormous ice cream sundae. It was such an enormous repast that it took her at least half an hour to eat it all. Especially all that ice cream. Even when she was just down to the melted parts, she took a page from her fellow eaters and just held the bowl up to her lips, chugging it down.

Goodness knows how much time passed after that, but at some point, Donna registered that it had become very quiet. She lolled her head over and saw all the women who had descended on the food court had by now descended into a collective food court. Pants were open, some shirts were either unbuttoned or rolled up, and greasy stained hands were rubbing enormously overstuffed stomachs. Some were still sipping on sodas, licking up ice cream or peering around for more food, but overall, everyone was looking very full and very happy.

Donna was steadily coming out of her own stuffed-stupor as well. She peered down and saw that her own stomach was crammed tight. Her once-roomy jeans were unbuttoned. When had she done that? She looked at all the empty food containers before her. Had she had that many before? Did she go back for more? It certainly felt like it. She leaned back in her two chairs and marveled at what she had accomplished. How did she fit all of this inside her gut?

She hefted it in her meaty hands. Her massive, massive gut...

Her eyes flitted around. All these massive, massive guts...

It was a long time before anyone felt like moving. But alas, some had families to go home to, some had things to do, lives to return to, etc. Donna found herself joining them in the incredibly difficult task of hefting themselves to their feet. She took in as deep a breath as she was capable of - not the easiest thing when she was this full - and re-buttoned them. She had just gotten herself situated when she saw a member of the cleaning crew standing nearby, waiting for her to finish. She blushed at him.

"Er... I imagine you don't see nights like tonight all that often," she said with a nervous smile.

"Not really, no," he replied. "But thanks for all the extra business." He set to work clearing the trash away.

Donna heaved herself away. Might as well get back to her car and re-adjust the seat again. She planned on waiting for most of the crowd to waddle away rather than mingle with them, but to her surprise, many of them approached her. They thanked her and said to thank her mom for opening their eyes to the wonderful world of food. They said their lives were far richer and far more satisfying knowing they no longer had to worry about diets and being thin. They were free from a lifetime of "dietary tyranny", as one lady called it.

Donna didn't really know what to think. If Eric hadn't tried to fatten her up last year, this probably wouldn't have happened. But, she reminded herself, they had all made their choices. It wasn't up to her. She simply smiled and thanked them, and then watched as they all waddled very slowly out of the mall towards the parking lot.

It wasn't the healthiest of revolutions, she pondered as she brought up the rear, but hey, it was a start.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Food court feeding frenzy!

choices: Donna wants to stay in Point Place
Donna wants to move to California
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
The ride home was super awkward for the overstuffed girl. She would really have to get a longer seat belt if this kept up. She couldn't breathe for the entire trip. But she made it in the end, and when that seat belt unclicked, it was the most glorious feeling in the world. Her stomach surged forward and filled the rest of the space between her and the steering wheel. She let her head loll back and gave herself a brief belly rub.

At last, Donna got the door open and heaved herself out of the car. She briefly thought this would be easier with a boyfriend who could give her a hand, but she thought to herself, why should she be reliant on a man to get her out? If she was going to be fat, she would be totally self-sufficient.

Although, after nearly three minutes of hauling herself out of the car, she thought maybe having someone to help her wouldn't be so bad...

"Donna?"

Donna froze at the familiar voice. No, no, no, she wasn't ready for this moment. She did not want to see him...

But there he was. Garbage bag in hand over his parents' garbage can. His eyes were wide and his face slack as he took her visage in. Holy crap, he still looked as cute as he had the last time she had seen him - when they broke up.

"... Eric," she said, trying to keep her emotions even.

Eric seemed to weigh his options for a moment before he decided on a course of action. "I... haven't seen you in a long time."

"Yeah, well... been busy, y'know."

"Yeah... Hyde said he saw you not long ago."

Donna winced. "Yeah?"

"He said... your parents were splitting up again. I'm... really sorry, Donna."

"Oh... oh yeah, that's... it's no big deal. I mean, it is, but... it's for the best. They're just arguing all the time now."

"Yeah, he said your mom was thinking of moving to California."

Donna stayed silent. Did he know?

"... and... he said you were thinking of going with her."

Yep, he knew. Her eyes fell to the pavement, not wanting to see his face. He might look hurt. Or worse, she might look indifferent.

"... Donna, you're really thinking of moving? I mean... I know you always wanted to get out of Point Place, but this is... going a little far, isn't it?"

"I know... But Eric... there's nothing here for me anymore. I've been so focused on my career that I more or less exiled myself from my friends."

"But your friends are in that basement right now, Donna! You could come and see them!"

"No. I can't. Not after what's happened. Not after what I did to Jackie. The things I said to her..."

"I honestly think if you just talked to her, she'd forgive you."

"... I just can't... Not after what I did... That article I wrote..."

"Yeah, I meant to ask about that... Why did you write that?"

Donna took a deep breath and steeled herself. "Because... I didn't like how big I was. I hated what I had become. I just... couldn't get comfortable in my body. But I felt so bad afterwards... and not just because of all the hate mail I've gotten these last few days... I started really looking deep inside myself, and I realized I was projecting my own self-loathing onto others."

Eric winced. "Donna, I'm sorry. It's my fault you gained weight in the first place. You wouldn't have gone through all this if I hadn't manipulated you."

Donna waved him off. "It's okay, Eric. Really. The truth is, I realize now I was living my life the way society wanted me to. Trying to be thin and 'conventionally attractive'. But now, I swear, food is amazing. I mean, I don't know if it turns me on like it does for others, but... I like it. I feel more natural like this."

"Really?" Eric was genuinely surprised.

"Yeah, I feel free to embrace my inner-glutton!"

Eric chuckled. "Well, that's great, Donna. I'm glad this has worked out for you."

Donna smiled sheepishly. "Yeah... I'm sorry I didn't realize this while we were still together."

"Well, I mean... You have to admit, we had problems before any of this started."

"... Yeah, I know. You're right," she sighed, trying not to sound like she had just been slapped. She knew they had talked about this during the actual breakup, but this reiteration that he had accepted it and moved on didn't make her feel any better. "Um... I'm gonna go inside. I need to study for finals."

"Yeah, sure. Hope I see you around sometime."

"Maybe, sure."

She turned and walked back to her house. She heard the sound of the trash bag being put in the can, and when she went to glance back, she saw that he had already disappeared around the hedge that divided their yards. Didn't even stay to watch her go. She felt a small piece of herself crumple and die. He was really done with her. Probably heading back to Jackie right now. Just knowing that her first love had truly moved on was not good for her ego.

She didn't know how, but somehow, despite making an utter pig of herself at the mall, she wanted to pig out more. Just enough to drown whatever emotions she was feeling right now. Damn that twitchy little nerd boy for breaking her heart like this.

The minute she was inside, she set her purchases down and made a direct line for the fridge. She pulled it open, scanned its various contents, and found herself face to face with an enormous bottle of ranch dressing. Suddenly craving it more than ever in her life, she snatched it, wrenched open the top and put it to her lips. She threw her head back and started chugging it down frantically, clutching her belly as she did so. Get it all down. Let the flavor wipe your memory. Forget all about Eric Forman. Drown the heartbreak that she'd lost him. Drown all that logic that he was right that they were wrong for each other. Smother every last bit of sadness with this thick rich delicious dressing. Let every calorie sedate that sadness she felt inside herself.

Then, she ran out of dressing. The empty bottle hung over her head as she peered inside and saw just how empty it really was. And this was a jumbo-sized bottle. The only way to eat salad. And she'd just consumed it entirely. On top of everything she'd had at the mall. It was too much.

Clutching her enormous stomach, she dragged herself over to the living room and gently lowered herself onto the couch. She rolled up her shirt and gave her double belly a rub. She felt ill.

She lost track of how long she was there, but it must've been a while, because the door opened, and in waddled Midge, wearing a very stretchy out fit that was covered in food stains. She came waddling through the door looking dazed. As she closed it, she looked over and saw her daughter lying back on the couch, clutching her stomach.

"... Everything okay, sweetie?" she asked.

Donna groaned. "Mom... I ate too much..."

"Awww, sweetie, you poor thing!" Midge cooed, coming over and patting her daughter's tummy. "How does that feel?"

"Mmmm, feels good..."

"Good, good..."

A pause. Then...

"URRRRRRRRRRRRP!!"

Donna looked up at Midge in shock.

To her credit, Midge looked a little embarrassed. "Sorry, I just came from a massive dinner party, and now I'm feeling a little..."

"Massive?" Donna finished.

Midge blushed. "Yeah... just a tad. But goodness, sweetie - feels packed full in here!"

"Yeah, I went to town, all right."

They sat in silence for a few minutes.

After a while, she looked up at her mother, and she realized something important.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna runs into Eric

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
"I want to move to California with you."

Midge's eyes lit up. "Oh, sweetie, do you mean it?!"

Donna gave a small smile. "Yeah... I mean... things have been so hectic here. The way things ended with Eric, I've kind of estranged myself from my friends... I just want a fresh start."

Midge put a hand on her daughter's shoulder. "I understand. Maybe we can research apartments in Los Angeles tomorrow. Find ourselves someplace nice."

"Yeah... and when we get there, maybe we can spread the word some more, y'know? Maybe we can get another family of housewives together and get them into food."

"Oh, I like that idea! We can spread the word from coast-to-coast!"

Donna smiled. "Mom, we're in the midwest. Not exactly a coast."

"Oh... Maybe we can move to Florida in a few years once we're done liberating the women of Cali."

That got a laugh. "Maybe we can, Mom... Oof. It kinda hurts to laugh when I'm this full."

"Believe me, I know," Midge sighed, settling herself down on the floor by the couch. "You should've seen the spread at Barb's house. I swear, I may have gained another five pounds just sitting there. It took three of them to get me back to my car. All that juicy, succulent meat, coated in the best barbecue sauce... and mashed potatoes - I swear, there was a pound of butter on them... and just plate after plate of stuffing and turkey and cornbread... I haven't had good cornbread in so long! I swear, it was all so -- !"

"Mom! Seriously!" Donna half-yelled, half-giggled. "I'm too full to think about food!"

Midge moaned in ecstasy. "But Donna, it was amazing! I just had to have more and more... and get so big...," she said in a panty sort of voice. "Just eat up every last bite of that thick rich chocolate cake..."

Donna seriously wanted to get up and leave, but she was too stuffed and bloated to even think about movement. She grabbed a pillow and quickly covered her ears.

Midge was still talking and talking and talking... until she found herself reaching down between her legs, and she realized what was happening. "Uh... excuse me a second, sweetheart. Mommy needs to get a... thing from her closet!"

"Oh god...," Donna muttered pathetically.

It took a few tries to roll herself back onto her feet, but soon, the almost-perfectly globular woman was up and waddling up those well-worn stairs again.

Donna pretended she was going to bed for her own sanity.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Donna wants to move to California

1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Red and Kitty stared at their enormous daughter standing on the other side of the kitchen, who was beaming away proudly.

"You're what?" Kitty asked, not quite scarcely believing it.

"I got a promotion at work!" Laurie repeated with a big chubby grin.

"Well, that's... that's wonderful!" said Red, clearly also not quite believing it. "Promotion to what?"

"They want me to be a manager!"

"... Really?" Kitty was narrowing her eyes, not quite able to tell if she was serious or not.

"Really! Here's the thing, though. They're opening a new Fatso Burger in Chicago, so my boss wants me to transfer down there. He's going to help me find an apartment and everything! And with the raise that comes with it, I can actually afford one!" She thought about that. "Well... a small one... but hey, it's a start, right?"

"So... you're moving out?" Red asked, now looking more like he simply wanted to believe it.

"Yes, daddy!" she said cheerfully. "I'm moving to Chicago!"

"Well, that's wonderful! Sweetie! When do you leave?"

"Oh, straight away. Probably sometime this weekend. I'm just so excited!"

"Then that's what's important, isn't it, dear?"

Kitty blinked, still not quite comprehending what was happening. Then, she plastered on her fakest smile and stood up. "Well, we are just so proud of you, sweetie! Aha ha ha ha ha!"

Both her parents pulled her into a big hug - which was tricky, given how large she was by this point.

After a bit more excitement, they departed for the living room, and she went outside to sit on the porch for a while. As she lowered her enormous self into the sturdiest chair she could find, she couldn't help but notice Eric and Jackie standing nearby, giving her a blank look.

"Oh, what do you two losers want?" she sneered.

"Just to know what's really going on," Eric replied. "Because there's no way in hell you got a promotion."

"Yeah, when I last saw you there, you flat out admitted that you were just in it for the free food," added Jackie.

Laurie gave a chubby smirk. "Just can't believe that I did that good a job, huh?"

They continued their blank looks.

"Yeah, you're right. Even I don't believe that," she chuckled. "So no, I'm not getting a promotion. I'm quitting."

"Which makes me believe the apartment story is quite true, either..."

"Eh, it's kinda true." Laurie acquired a devilish grin. "I met someone."

"When?"

"About a week ago."

"Sounds like solid grounds for a relationship."

"Oh, don't be disgusting. It's a not a 'relationship'. I hate those. He's just a walking talking sex toy as far as I'm concerned."

"Lovely..."

"So you're just using him for sex?" Jackie demanded, looking at her with vague disgust.

"Not just sex," Laurie protested.

"Money?"

"Not just sex and money..." Laurie smiled again. "It's food."

Eric and Jackie were brought up short. "... What?"

"I'm using him for food. He has a well-paying job. Makes seven figures a year. And he's absolutely wild about fat chicks. The fatter the better, as far as he's concerned. And I'm all in favor of being fatter and better. So, he's going to give me a room at his apartment in Chicago, and I'm going to live there as his good little piggy. He comes in and brings me food, gives me sex, and then he leaves me the hell alone. I have full access to everything in his place, access to whatever food I want whenever I want. I get to sit on my ever-widening ass and pork out, then get porked, and not do a damn thing."

Their expressions must've been comical, because Laurie started giggling at them.

"Oh, like this isn't your dream I'm living out, you two dorks. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to go where you're not."

With a hefty grunt, Laurie heaved herself to her feet and waddled away, leaving the two teens very stunned.
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.title: Laurie announces she's moving out

choices: Donna and Midge are ready to move to California
Donna has one last talk with Jackie
1321111111121111111121112111111111111112.content:
Eric enjoyed it when they had dinner at Jackie's house. Her parents were still never home, and the maid was a private sort who kept to herself, so they had plenty of privacy to do whatever they wanted. One thing he liked doing, however, was making food for her. Since he had found himself in a relationship with a girl who had a hearty appetite, he thought it pertinent to learn how to perform the task himself. He doubted he'd ever make enough money for servants anyway. Best to develop the skills required for the foods she desired (hey, that rhymes!) and be able to fill her tummy all the time.

Jackie had been doing pretty good for herself as she rounded out her junior year. She'd been steadily climbing in size, although she had slowed lately. Around the time she reached 300 pounds, she decided to get in some exercise just to keep herself relatively healthy. Obviously, this was not a healthy lifestyle in any sense of the word, but she still wanted to stay alive. Therefore, she went for long walks, did some light exercise and made sure to include plenty of fruits and veggies in her diet.

That didn't mean she wasn't gorging herself frequently, of course. Hell, just the other day, she'd eaten a dozen doughnuts in one sitting.

Eric finished cooking the meal on the big fancy Burkhart oven. He had decided to keep it simple tonight, so he had made a very simple spaghetti and meatballs. His mom had taught him how to do it, so the food was almost guaranteed to be amazing. It was an enormous pot, filled to the brim, and it was all set. He grabbed a pair of tongs and started piling it high. He knew she was hungry. Once it was fully loaded, it was towering very high, with at least five meatballs on it. Making a much more sensible-sized bowl for himself, he put them both on a tray along with their drinks and carried them over to the dining room.

There was Jackie sitting with her chubby fat face smiling at him. She was so lovely. She'd done her hair up and everything. He smiled in return and set the food down before her. She giggled when she saw the difference between the two bowls.

"Oh god, you can tell who's the big eater around here," she chuckled. "You could stand to gain a few, too, you know."

Eric shrugged cheerfully. "I could never deprive you," he replied.

"So thoughtful."

"Naturally."

Afterwards, she'd spent the next couple of weeks lying low, choosing to send out applications to various colleges in California. She'd found brochures for some interesting ones, many of which had exemplary journalism programs. She was accepted to a few of them, and she made appointments to tour them in the coming weeks. She couldn't wait to get her career started.

She seriously debated whether or not she should say goodbye to her friends, but in the end, she decided against it. Things had been said. Things she didn't think she should be forgiven for. At least, not right now. Maybe the next time she visited.

One thing she was thankful for was her parents managing to part on good terms. Bob and Midge accepted that they simply weren't meant to be, and it was time to move on. Bob even gave them the nice car to take on the road trip.

Midge, for her part, was very excited. They were going to stay at her parents' house in Malibu for a while before she found a good job close to Donna's school. Her folks had already sent her the details for some decent jobs - mostly desk jobs that didn't require much thinking, which suited Midge perfectly.

She was also looking forward to spreading the "gluttony gospel", as she liked to call it. She was determined to teach the skinny ladies of California how to enjoy food and not worry about what others thought of them. If it all worked out, she was planning to write a screenplay about it. The world needed to know it was okay to be obese.

At last, the big day came. Donna hugged her dad goodbye before loading the rest of their suitcases into the car. She got into the passenger side seat, and the whole car listed to the right. Midge soon got into the driver's side seat, and the car evened out again. Her mom had to readjust her seat as her enormous gut was pressed against the steering wheel.
