13311121121111111111111111111111.content:
And so, the weeks spun on. Once a week, depending on how their schedules lined up, Laurie would take Jackie out for a day of feasting. They mixed it up a bit, sometimes going to fast food or pizza places, but other times, going to nice places with cloth napkins and everything. Jackie at least enjoyed the chance to go out and enjoy something "cultured" for a change.

It was awkward, however, when she started to notice that the food was really starting to effect her waistline. She had a very long way to go before she caught up with Laurie, but the changes were starting to become more noticeable. Her belly was rounding out, her butt was getting bigger, her breasts were filling out, and her arms were expanding enough that she didn't feel comfortable in short sleeves anymore. She felt really self-conscious. It was one thing to be doing this in the privacy of her own home, but now she was out and about where everyone could see her.

She didn't know how Laurie did it. The bloated blonde didn't seem to care how big she got, not to mention how big she was still getting. She ate what she wanted, when she wanted, where she wanted. She seemed to acquire tunnel vision whenever she was out in public, making a gluttonous pig of herself. She shoveled away whatever was put in front of her, regardless of any judgemental stares she received. How the hell did she get that confident? But then, Laurie had always been confident. That was how she had so brazenly made her way through life with only a wink and a sexy smile - not to mention whoring her way through town.

Jackie, on the other hand, was a walking talking cloud of nervous shouting trying to hide the fact that she was scared of what people might think of her if she didn't. That bitchy personality was part of an elaborate defense program to disguise the fact that she was really scared to be vulnerable. It was why she believed more in fairy tale romance than real adult romance - because love was just so much better when it was scripted. Of course, it was difficult when guys wouldn't follow the damn script she had prepared for them. Michael hadn't followed it, going on cheating on her several times. Steven, however, rarely, if ever, tried to follow it, preferring to ad-lib his way through the daily scenes. It was something that had drawn her to him. He rarely put up with her crap, and that had forced her to be more real with him.

That was probably why she was so scared she was going to lose him. She didn't want to lose that realness she'd found. What if he really didn't still want her after gaining a hundred pounds. She hadn't yet, but she'd weighed herself recently. It was a gain of ten pounds. Ten whole pounds. Ten more pounds of Jackie Burkhart in the world.

Well, she thought, there's just more glorious me to go around.

She wasn't sure if she actually believed that, but it made her feel better about it.

Today, it had finally become May, and that meant that Eric and Donna's wedding was coming up. They'd heard bits and pieces of the wedding plans in the postcards and phone calls from Madison, but things between the engaged couple were strengthened by being together in college. Jackie had, of course, been selected to be the Maid of Honor, while Laurie had agreed to be a bridesmaid. They would need to find a few more bridesmaids as well. Brooke's name had been bandied about, but they still hadn't had a confirmation yet - seeing as how she was seriously getting really pregnant at this point.

Jackie and Laurie were both lounging on the couch, enjoying some Saturday afternoon lunchtime. Laurie had obtained some sub sandwiches, and they were both eating them in front of the TV. Big frothy root beers sat on the coffee table - upon coasters, of course, lest Kitty had a conniption. Laurie had long since finished hers and sat with her full belly in her hands. Jackie was about halfway through. She wasn't about to rush herself.

Just then, Kitty came bounding into the living room doing a happy little jig. "Eric just called! He and Donna are coming home!"

Laurie raised an eyebrow. "Did they flunk out already? Even I lasted longer than that."

Kitty shot her a stern look. "No, they didn't flunk out! The semester's over! They're coming back for a few weeks! Oh! And that means more wedding preparations!"

Jackie sat up. "Oh god, I hope Donna picks out decent bridesmaids dresses. And it better not be anything green."

"Ew," agreed Laurie. "Trust Donna to pick out something ugly."

"Now, now, girls," Kitty admonished. "Donna makes the decisions. A happy bride is a... happy bride." She hurried back into the kitchen.

Jackie looked down at her rounded belly worriedly. "Oh god... I hope the dresses are fat-friendly."

Laurie waved her off. "Ehh, they'll measure us in all the right places. Accommodate the extra... space."

"What's Donna gonna say when she sees my measurements?! What if she laughs at me?!"

"For what? Gaining weight? Why would the 'look-at-how-feminist-I-am' Donna mock you for gaining weight?"

"Well, I mean... I used to mock her for her size before..."

"Donna was never fat."

"Compared to me, she was huge. I was tiny."

"And now you've acquired some actual mass. Your width will match her height."

Jackie held her head in her hands. "Not helping."

"Oh, just suck it up. She's not going to make fun of you. And even if she does, so what? You think I get through each day without some loser shouting some fat-related insult at me?"

"... Really?"

"Oh, sure. People roll down their car windows to call me a 'fatass' or a 'whale'. Just give em the figure and move on. If they can't accept it, move on. Their tiny narrow little minds can't handle the sight of something outside of their idea of beauty."

"I don't know if I can do that..."

To her surprise, Laurie put a hand on her knee. "Hey, yes, you can. Believe me. You're tough. You're strong. You're Jackie freakin' Burkhart, and you don't take shit from anyone. Notably me," she added with a friendly smile.

Jackie looked at Laurie's plump face and saw the genuine kindness and support in it. Who would've thought it would've taken gaining fifty pounds to make her into a decent human being? A small smile worked its way onto her face. "Thanks, Laurie. I'll try."

"That's my girl."
13311121121111111111111111111111.title: Laurie continues to take Jacke out for food

choices: Donna and Jackie see each other
133111211211111111111111111111111.content:
Everyone was excited when the familiar Vista Cruiser pulled up in the driveway a few days later. Red, Kitty and Bob were there to greet their returning children for their summer break.

Hyde and Kelso went outside straight away to join the reunion, but Jackie held back with Laurie and Fez in the kitchen. She was still feeling self-conscious about her recent weight gain and not sure what Donna would say when she saw her. She paced back and forth behind the fridge. "Oh god oh god oh god oh god...," she moaned.

"Jackie, will you please just chill?" Laurie admonished. "You're gonna wear a groove in the linoleum, and that's just gonna make it harder for me to sweep in here."

"I know, I know, I just... I'm just nervous. I'm ten pounds heavier than when they last saw me. What will they think?"

"That there is more of you to love?" Fez suggested.

"Oh please. Eric hates me. He'll make fun of me."

"Hey, come on. Don't be like that," Laurie replied. "Eric's not that kind of guy. He likes you deep down. Besides, if he ever said a negative word about it, Donna and Hyde would beat the shit out of him."

"Ai, this is true," Fez agreed. "And he bruises like a banana, so he will not take that chance."

Jackie continued to wring her hands awkwardly, even as she heard voices and footsteps heading towards the house. She shrank back into the shadows.

Eric walked in through the kitchen door, followed by Hyde and Kelso, and was immediately grabbed by an enthusiastic Fez. "Eric, you have returned home to us!" he cheered, hugging the skinny college student so hard his ribs squeaked.

"Oof! Hey, Fez," he grunted. "Good to see you."

Laurie smirked at the expression on her brother's face as his friend squeezed the life out of him. She put a hand on her husband's shoulder. "Okay, sweetie, don't snap him in half. He's so brittle, you know..."

"Gee, thanks, sis," Eric grunted as he righted himself. "Glad to see you didn't destroy the house in the past nine months we've been away."

Laurie smiled. "I missed you, too, little brother," she said, suddenly pulling him into a hug as well, with similar results as the previous one.

"Oof!" Eric grunted. "Did everyone get stronger while I was gone?"

"That, or you've gotten scrawnier," Hyde deadpanned.

"Yeah, we didn't think that was even physically possible," Kelso sniggered. "Do you even cast a shadow anymore?"

Laurie released her brother. "At least your continued scrawniness is a testament to how hard you're working in college. Good to know all the wasted nights doing laundry and dishes on your behalf weren't for nothing."

"You truly are a saintly woman, my love," Fez swooned.

Laurie smiled at the corny line. "Oh, get over here, if you're gonna talk like that," she said, wrapping her arms around Fez and kissing the snot out of him.

Eric, Hyde and Kelso quietly observed the prolonged impromptu make out session, trying to find the wallpaper interesting to distract themselves.

Eric jerked his head at the couple. "Still?"

Hyde shrugged. "We're all pleasantly surprised."

"I see... So where's Jackie?"

Laurie and Fez broke the kiss and glanced over at the fridge, but of course, Jackie had disappeared. Her nerve had clearly faltered.

"She's here somewhere," Laurie sighed. "Probably downstairs."

"Yes, I am afraid she is feeling a little subconscious lately," Fez said sadly.

"Self-conscious sweetie."

"Jackie? Jackie Burkhart? Self-conscious?" Eric asked, sounding a tad disbelieving.

"Oh yeah, she's porking out," Kelso said without thinking.

Hyde promptly slugged him on the arm, causing him to yelp in pain.

"Ow! I meant it in a nice way!"

Laurie put a hand on Eric's shoulder. "Look, Jackie's gained... a little weight," she said quietly.

Eric raised an eyebrow. "How 'little'?"

"Does it matter? She's feeling insecure about it, so even though it violates the laws of nature, you need to be nice to her, okay?"

"Or else," Hyde added, holding up the still-clenched fist he'd just used to hit Kelso.

Eric shrugged. "I wouldn't dream of mocking Jackie for her appearance," he replied. "Her taste in music, TV, movies and magazines, certainly, but not her appearance."

Hyde looked at him for a long moment before nodding in acceptance. "Okay, as long as it's the same stuff the rest of us mock her for."

"Yeah, and to be fair, she gives as good as she gets," Kelso added. "Last week, she criticized me for watching Starsky and Hutch."

"Ugh, that girl has no sense of poetry."

"I know!"

Laurie rolled her eyes. "Well, thanks for being understanding, Eric."

"Oh sure. I mean, I can't really afford to be judgemental anyway, considering."

"Considering what?"

As if on cue, the screen door slid open, and in walked Donna. All eyes turned to take in the sight of the redhead, and Fez and Laurie felt their eyes widened in surprise.

Donna had put on weight. And not just a bit of weight. A lot of weight. She had a noticeable gut, an undeniable double chin, some impressive-sized boobs, and a backside that wobbled back and forth as she walked. Her eyes were a bit downtrodden from what they assumed to be embarrassment, but a small hopeful smile sat upon her face as well as she held out her arms awkwardly.

"... Hey, guys!" she said.

Fez managed to relocate his brain and broke into a smile. "Donna, you have returned as well! Happy day for Fez!" he cried, running across and hugging the bejeezus out of her. Donna, of course, felt no ill-effects from said hug, simply hugging the happy little foreign man back.

"Hi, Fez! I missed you so much!"

Fez pulled back. "How much?"

Donna pulled a package of Twizzler out of her pocket and handed it to him. His eyes lit up.

"Oooh, candy! I missed you, too!"

Laurie smirked at the candy her husband had better be sharing later. "Hey, future-sister-in-law," she said, approaching coolly.

Donna blinked at the sight of Laurie. She had not been expecting to see how much Laurie had ballooned since they'd last seen each other at Thanksgiving. She'd been plump then, but holy cow - she'd ballooned up impressively. "... Laurie!" she exclaimed. "You're... It's so good to see you!" she faltered.

Laurie rolled her eyes at the lame save, but gave her a hug all the same. "You're looking good," she said.

Donna pulled away, her face red. "Yeah, well... I don't know. I mean, I know I've gained some weight, and it shouldn't be a big deal. It's just... y'know..."

Laurie put a hand on the other woman's shoulder. "Donna, relax. It's just a different kind of sexy."

Kelso nodded. "Yeah, I mean, you should see Brooke. She's almost nine months pregnant, and she's still smokin' hot. I never knew fat chicks could still be so alluring."

Donna raised an amused eyebrow. "'Alluring'? That's a big word for you."

"He and Brooke mostly hang out at the library," Hyde supplied. "He likes to let us know when he's learned a new word."

Donna sighed. "I'm just dreading seeing Jackie. You just know she's going to be super-critical about this, and I feel self-conscious enough."

Laurie shared a look with the guys. They were all clearly debating how to play this. She raised an eyebrow in their direction, signalling for them to follow her lead.

"Yeah, well, I wouldn't worry about that, Donna," she said. "I mean, I know she can be a bitch sometimes, but she's still your best friend. She won't judge you."

Donna stared, unimpressed. "You're kidding me, right? This is Jackie we're talking about. I love her to death, but she's going to have words with me about this."

Kelso put a hand on her shoulder. "Donna, trust me on this one. I think she'll be understanding."

"Yes," agreed Fez. "Jackie has changed since the last time you saw her. A lot. I don't think she'll be judging you."

Donna shuffled awkwardly. "You guys really think so?"

"She's in the basement right now, if you want to see for yourself," said Hyde.

"I dunno... Maybe I should work up to that."

"Donna, you ought to do it now," Eric said, gently taking her hand. "Best to get it over with. Besides, I know how much you've missed her. She's probably dying to see you."

Donna gave a small smile. "You think?"

"Come on," Laurie said. "We'll all go down together, okay?"

Kelso snickered. "Out of context, that sounds so wrong." But Hyde nudged him in the ribs.

Laurie ignored them. "We'll be your support team. What do you say?"

Donna looked oddly moved. "Wow, thanks, Laurie. That's... surprisingly sweet of you."

Fez smiled, putting an arm around Laurie. "That's my wife in a nutshell."

"Come on," Laurie said, turning around and leading the way.

They followed Fez and Laurie towards the basement steps. Donna looked over at Hyde and Kelso and nodded in their direction. "Still?"

"They're surprisingly stable," Hyde replied.
133111211211111111111111111111111.title: Eric and Donna eventually arrive

choices: Laurie takes Donna and Jackie out for girls only dinner
1331112112111111111111111111111111.content:
Jackie knew she was being cowardly. She knew she needed to go back upstairs and face Donna. Let her see how big she'd gotten. How she'd broken her own "beauty rules" and let herself get fat. What was she supposed to do? Blame Laurie for everything? Not a bad scratch, but shifting blame wouldn't shift the weight either. Nor would it remove the sight of her fat self from Donna's brain. She tried to pace around a bit, hoping it'd burn a few pesky calories, but she just got tired very quickly and had to sit down for a minute, followed by a craving for some ice cream from the deep freeze.

She tried to think rationally - never a strong suit of hers. She tried to remember what Laurie had told her. No one's opinion matters but your own. For years, she'd pretended that was how she felt. Now she needed to actually feel it. Swallowing, she forced herself back onto her feet. She could do this. She could get up those stairs and show Donna that, yes, this was who she was now, so take it or leave it.

Then she became nervous again - what if Donna did leave it? What if Donna walked out on her? She didn't know if she could handle it.

Her thoughts were interrupted by the door opening upstairs, and she heard the footsteps coming slowly down the steps. From the way they were creaking, she guessed one of them was Laurie. She turned and saw her and Fez coming down towards her.

"Okay, look, you guys," she said frantically. "I know I said I'd see Donna, but I'm not ready yet. I need more time. I probably just need a cuter outfit or something. Maybe a shower and a new hairstyle. Something to make me feel more confident, okay? Because I'm just not ready for Donna to see... me... like... this?"

She trailed off when she saw that more were coming downstairs, including a redhead who looked very familiar.

Donna stared back at her with a stunned expression, which was just what Jackie had feared. Except she hadn't expected that stunned expression to be such a plump one. Those full cheeks, the developing double chin, the ballooning boobs, the bulging belly... Her best friend was just as big as her, if not slightly bigger! She was completely lost for words!

Donna herself, meanwhile, was finishing coming down the stairs, on her side of the basement, staring at the chubby brunette standing by the couch, looking at her in utter disbelief. She tried to control her mouth from sliding all the way open, but she couldn't help it. Not that she felt too badly about it, seeing as how Jackie's expression was about the same. She stared at her friend's jelly jar of a belly, her rosy cheeks, the slightly-strained buttons on her top...

She felt a bony elbow in her side and realized that Eric was nudging her closer to Jackie. She briefly saw that he looked surprised, too, but as always, he was being the supportive boyfriend. Taking that as her cue, she slowly approached the other girl, wincing slightly at the sound of her jeans as her thighs rubbed together.

The two girls stood face to face in the basement, looking each other over.

"Donna...?" Jackie breathed.

"Jackie...," Donna breathed back.

"Wha...? What...?"

"When did...? How did you...?"

And in that instant, they both saw the apprehension in each others eyes, and they felt all their anxiety start to crumble away as small smiles split across their faces. The joy of seeing each other again, coupled with the bemusement at their mutual weight gain, they started to giggle. Then the giggles became full on laughter as realized the absurdity of the situation - how they couldn't believe they'd both been so afraid of the others opinion when they were both in the same boat.

The remaining members of the group watched all of this from the washer and dryer with growing concern.

Fez whispered and tapped his forehead. "Are... are they... y'know... going insane?"

"Possibly," Eric replied, "but at least they're not scared of each other anymore."

Donna and Jackie didn't seem to hear them. They just kept laughing and laughing, falling into each others arms and hugging each other tightly.

Kelso smiled. "Oh, good. They're cementing their friendship with some girl-on-girl action. Laurie, how about you get in there and make it a threesome?"

"Pfft, you all wish."

"Except me," Eric said pointedly.

"Except you."

Donna and Jackie collapsed onto the couch from laughing so hard, faces red and tears pouring down their faces. They finally came out of the hug and started to calm down.

Pleased that the ordeal was over with, the rest of the gang joined them around the TV to swap stories of the past year, and maybe even pass a few joints.
1331112112111111111111111111111111.title: Donna and Jackie see each other

choices: The girls get measured for dresses
Laurie is constantly tempted by food
13311121121111111111111111111111111.content:
Laurie insisted that Donna and Jackie join her for a girl's night out to discuss the wedding. Donna was apprehensive about what her future sister-in-law's idea of a "night out" until Jackie explained it was just going to be a very big dinner.

"Are we sure we should be eating any big meals when we're already this big?" Donna asked apprehensively.

Jackie shrugged helplessly. "Laurie's on this whole thing now. She likes being fat. It agrees with her."

So they all piled into Jackie's car and set off into the night. They found the local buffet that Laurie only ate at when she wanted to be super-stuffed. After all, it was a night for celebration, what with Donna getting married and Jackie graduating high school.

This will be a night to remember, she thought gleefully.

It wasn't long before they walked inside. Laurie could hear her stomach rumble at the sight of the all the food laid before them. Donna and Jackie followed her quietly, also amazed at everything.

"Oh my god...," Donna said quietly. "Look at all this."

"It's a fat girl's paradise," Jackie muttered. "Laurie says she comes here twice a month. Sometimes with Fez. Sometimes without him."

"How did this happen? What's up with her?"

"My theory is since she's settled down, she's got all this pent up sexual energy, so she channels it by eating. And she had a lot of sexual energy..."

They saw Laurie had acquired a table, and they joined her. "Okay, it's time to grab trays and load up! Just remember not to take the entire plate off the buffet. For some reason, they get mad when you do that..."

Laurie led the way to the buffet line, and right away, she started piling whatever she could get onto it - fried chicken, roasted chicken, pork chops, whatever meat she could get her hands on.

Donna's mouth hung slightly open. "Holy crap, look at her go... She really is into this."

"Told ya," said Jackie. "She knows what she wants."

The two younger girls loaded up their plates with what they could find that appealed to them, although they were a trifle startled by just how much they found appealing. Their plates were loaded pretty full before they sat down at their tables.

"I can't believe this," Donna said sadly. "I mean, do I just have no self-control anymore?"

Jackie shifted in her seat, eyeing her own pile of food with reluctant desire. "Yeah, about that...," she said. "What happened there, exactly? I mean, you were still thin when you visited last Thanksgiving."

Donna sighed with frustration. "I just... I don't know... College is hard, you know? I mean, it's a good kind of hard. I love what I'm doing. Like, it's challenging, but the rewards at the end are great. I just... I don't know. There isn't a lot of time to go a gym or exercise... and take out is always convenient... And there are some great restaurants in the area... So, when I'm stressed and out of options, it turns out... I eat."

"You eat."

"And not just eat. I mean... eat. I gorge, I stuff, I inhale... One time, while I was working on an article for class, I ate an entire chocolate pie all by myself."

Jackie's jaw dropped. "Donna!"

"I know, I know... I felt so embarrassed when I realized what I had done that I tried to hide the pie tin under the rest of the recycling. Didn't help - Eric found it anyway."

"What did he say?"

"He was just annoyed I didn't save any for him. I made it up to him and got another pie. I think he got one piece out of that one."

"Damn..."

"And now I'm worrying, is this what it's always going to be like? Is my journalism major going to make me fatter? I mean... I wouldn't mind it that much since I love the work, but... I don't know. Eric's been so supportive, considering how stressed he's been at college. It took him all year to find a major, and even then, he's been there for me..."

Jackie smiled slightly. "Good to know the scrawny neighbor boy didn't let you down."

Donna smiled back. "Yeah... and he's so nice about my weight gain. I mean, he's always ready for sex, y'know? Like, this hasn't been a turn off for him in the slightest."

"Actually, it hasn't been for Steven either," Jackie said thoughtfully. "I honestly thought it would be, but he hasn't said a word about it."

"Probably because he knows you'd kick him in the shins if he did."

"That's beside the point. I'm beginning to think... what if he really does love me for more than my body?"

Donna blinked. "You really didn't think he did?"

"Well... I mean, I hoped, but I wasn't sure if he did."

"Clearly, he does. Jackie, he's crazy about you - not what waist measurement you are."

Jackie tried to smother the cheesy grin on her face. "Yeah... my puddin' pop loves me..."

Donna laughed. "Oh god... I'm so calling him that when we get home."

"Don't you dare! That's my humiliating nickname for him! Get your own!"

They both laughed, once again appreciating being together again and feeling that friendly familiarity they enjoyed so much.

The laughter faded, however, when they both heard heavy footsteps coming their way, and they turned in shock to see Laurie waddling towards them with two plates in her arms that were simply loaded high with stacks of food. She set them down on the table between them with a heavy thump before plopping her fine ass in the chair.

"Laurie, there's no way you can finish all that,' Donna said in alarm.

Laurie raised an eyebrow and gave her usual smirk. "Just watch me." She grabbed a fork and started to dine on one pile of food. She moaned with pleasure and dug deeper into it.

"So!" Laurie continued. "Wedding talk! Have you picked your dress out yet?"

Donna realized she was being spoken to and blinked herself out of her stupor, picking up her fork. "Uh... no, not yet. I was going to do that here. Didn't want to lug a nice dress all the way down from Madison."

"And you better believe you're taking me with you," said Jackie. "I'm not letting my best friend walk down the aisle in anything remotely frumpy."

Donna chuckled. "What would I do without you?"

"Probably get married in plaid flannel."

"Hey, don't knock it til you've tried it."

As they ate, their eyes drifted back towards Laurie, who was still working her way through all the food. Chicken, pork chops, steak, shrimp, french fries, mac n cheese... She was showing no signs of stopping.

"So...," Donna said, hoping to say something that would get the gorging girl to look at her. "... Laurie, I was wondering if you wanted to be a bridesmaid?"

Laurie looked up, a chicken leg poking out of her mouth. For a moment, she looked stupefied, but then she removed the bare bone and asked, "Me? A bridesmaid?"

"Yeah, I mean... you're Eric's sister, and Fez's husband. And you helped me and Eric get out of Point Place and into college. I mean, you don't have to if you don't want to..."

But Laurie looked strangely moved. "Donna, I'd love to!" she practically squealed. "I've never been a bridesmaid before! Thank you so much!"

Donna was slightly taken aback by Laurie's enthusiasm, but she couldn't help smiling back. "Okay, great! Awesome! Now I just need one more. I really wish I had more female friends at times like this..."

"None of your feminist club friends will do it?" asked Jackie.

"Not without serious compromises being made, like wearing jeans and tank tops. I mean, I understand that marriage is a symbol of man's control over women, but I still want this to be pretty, you know?"

"Then maybe ask Brooke. I'm almost certain she won't give birth in the middle of your wedding."

Donna lit up. "Oh yeah, are she and Kelso still a thing? I mean, do you think she'd be willing to walk down the aisle with them? Or does him knocking her up mean she wants to kill him?"

"No, no, they're good. They're giving the whole relationship thing a try. Mixed results, but so far so good."

They heard a clatter next to them and saw Laurie setting down a fork on her first plate, which was, to their shock, empty. She moved on to the other one and continued eating like nothing had even happened. She ate with one hand while clutching and rubbing her belly with the other one.

Donna shook her head. "You know, Laurie, it would be great if you can actually fit into your bridesmaid dress when the wedding arrives, y'know?"

Laurie waved her off dismissively. "Oh, I'll be fine. Once I'm measured, I'll cool my jets for a while. I mean, the wedding's, what, in two weeks? I can last that long."

Jackie raised an eyebrow. "I'm sure."

"I can! I totally can! Just because I enjoy eating doesn't mean I have no self-control!"

Donna and Jackie smirked. "Well, considering you're talking with your mouth full, I hope you're right."

Laurie sneered and swallowed her latest mouthful, only to automatically shovel more into her mouth. She swallowed that too, but then filled it up less than a second later. There was just so much food, and it was all so good...

Ten minutes later, Laurie leaned back in her seat, and even then, her stomach was still pressed against the table. She rested her hands atop her belly and rubbed it soothingly. She looked back at Donna and Jackie, both of whom were still working on their first plates. They were eyeing her swollen belly as it rose and fell, and it made her realize they had a point.

"... I'll try to -HIC!- ... control myself...," she said sheepishly.
13311121121111111111111111111111111.title: Laurie takes Donna and Jackie out for girls onl...

133111211211111111111111111111111111.content:
The days that followed were tough for Laurie. She had promised that she would behave herself and not eat too much between now and the wedding, if only to fit into whatever dress she was destined to wear. She snuck the odd goodie here and there to sate her sweet tooth, but it wasn't enough. She missed that super-stuffed-bloated feeling after a huge feast. She missed needing Fez to rub her swollen belly when she was too full to move.

For his part, Fez had been supportive of her decision, helping her eat healthier for the time being. It wasn't so much that she disliked fruits and vegetables - it was just hard to fill up on them. Fez would bring home produce from the grocery store, and she'd eat them all in seconds flat. She'd be full enough to get through the day, but that was it. Her lower lip was getting a decent workout from all the pouting she was doing. She didn't know how Donna and Jackie could live like this.

Speaking of whom, Donna and Jackie weren't able to live like this either. They were determined to maintain their current size and maybe even shed a few pounds before the wedding, but to their embarrassment, they found it difficult to do so. Any time they saw something sugary or salty, they heard their tummies growl in hunger. Even just the sight of pork chops or a hot dog made them go crazy with desire.

At last, however, the day came when they stepped into the bridal boutique place, and it was time for everyone to get their measurements. Donna went for her wedding dress while Jackie and Laurie went to have their bridesmaids dresses fitted. Brooke was busy at the moment, being pregnant and all, but had assured them that once they gave her the details, she'd get a pregnant-friendly version of the dress.

Donna, being the bride, went up first. She was very nervous. She got up on the stool in her underwear, feeling very silly about the whole thing. It was one thing to be fat around friends and family. Here, she was being measured by total strangers. In a public place. Okay, it was technically a private room, but still. She looked at herself in the mirror. Really examined her flab. Her belly that spilled over her waistband a bit, her boobs practically crammed into her a bra she should've thrown out ages ago. She tilted her head at the mirror and angled herself a tad... Oh dear god, was her ass starting to sag??

Meanwhile, Jackie was in another room, also being measured. She winced when she saw the numbers around her arms alone. How had she gotten this big in a few weeks?! Okay, so she wasn't enormous or anything. She'd been so tiny to begin with, at the moment she was probably closer to "chubby" than "obese". Still, ten pounds was nothing to sneeze at. It was a miracle she'd only had to go up a couple sizes. Her chubby little belly jiggled as the tape measure was wrapped around her. She didn't dare look.

Laurie, in the third room, was hardly concerned with how huge she was. She occasionally weighed herself. Last she'd seen, she was two hundred and eleven pounds. She'd immediately had a good wank about that, very pleased with herself. However, now that she was "behaving" she was constantly hungry. She had to force herself not to stop off at Fatso Burger or the pizza place, to not buy nothing but cake and cookies at the supermarket, and to certainly not raid the fridge and cupboards after midnight. Seriously, why was binging so much more fun after midnight?!

Donna looked at several dresses. Trying to find the one that just felt right. She looked at the size she'd be wearing - Large. She was a "Large". She cursed the stress of college for driving her to food, and the deliciousness of fried and fatty foods in particular. Great. Now she wanted a double cheeseburger dripping with cheese. Hell, right now, she could eat three of them. No. Stay strong. Think of the wedding. Just gotta hold out another week.

Jackie looked her dress up and down. Lavender - just like she'd told Donna to go for. She was a "Medium" now. She couldn't believe she'd ever be a medium. She looked at the curve of her belly in the mirror. Good god, she looked pregnant. And not the cute kind of pregnant. At least, that's what she thought. She looked like she'd done nothing but eat cake for months. Now she was thinking about what kind of cake Eric and Donna would have at the reception. Chocolate cake with white frosting was traditional, but there were so many kinds to try, right? Damn. Now that was all she could think of. She was worried that if she made it to the reception without gaining anymore weight, she'd probably just eat half the cake herself.

Laurie admired the dress. It was beautiful. It was also an XL. She was an XL. She couldn't help but smile at the sight. It was so fitted, it hugged her figure, revealing every roll. Her waistline alone had been thirty-five inches. She jiggled that waistline as she admired the reflection. Pity she had to stay right at this size for a while. She knew she could do it. She had to do it. Had to do it for them, to prove that she could. And also because she was part of the wedding, and she didn't want to let them down. Damn it, when had she developed this caring feeling for her brother's friends? Still, she could do it. That being said, once the wedding was over, she was going to have a feast to remember. A gorge fit for a very fat queen. She briefly fantasized about Fez having to roll her out the door afterwards.

She waddled out into the open and saw Jackie leaning against a post in the waiting room. "Looking good, Jackie," she said, smiling brightly as she approached.

Jackie shuffled awkwardly. "You really think? It's a bit tight..."

Laurie put an arm around her and made her look in a nearby mirror. "You look smokin'. You're gonna drive Hyde crazy in that."

Jackie looked at her chubby reflection for a long time, taking in every detail, and a small smile appeared on her lips. "... I do look pretty cute."

Just then, another door opened, and out stepped Donna. Jackie and Laurie stared in amazement. The white dress fit her tall yet plump figure perfectly, sparkling and flowing majestically. She had a small smile on her face, but it was clear to anyone she was holding back a girlish urge to jump up and down excitedly. "Well...?" she asked in an unusually timid voice. "How does it look?"

Jackie and Laurie looked at it, then at each other, and then started bouncing up and down eagerly, squealing with delight.

"Donna, you look beautiful!" Jackie cried.

Donna let out a deep breath and started laughing joyously. "Oh my god, you guys do, too!"

All three girls ran toward each other and started jumping up and down, jiggling furiously and causing the room to shake a bit, causing a few people to think maybe there was an earthquake. There wasn't. Just three beautiful fat women jumping up and down in their wedding attire.
133111211211111111111111111111111111.title: The girls get measured for dresses

1331112112111111111111111111111111111.content:
The big day had finally arrived. Eric and Donna's wedding was upon them. Everyone was scurrying around, getting everything ready, especially Kitty and Jackie - the mother of the groom and maid of honor - trying to ensure that everything was perfect.

"More flowers, dammit!" Jackie bellowed at the decorators. "If I see one pew without a bouquet on it, heads will roll!"

Kitty, meanwhile, was cooking up a storm. No one was sure why, considering it was a catered event, but it kept her from going insane from the knowledge that her baby boy was all grown up.

This was hell for Laurie. She came into the kitchen that morning and saw all the food on the counter and felt her stomach groan. She'd gotten by all week, determined to maintain her current size long enough to survive the wedding. She was doing it for her brother, she told herself. And her soon-to-be sister-in-law. She appreciated that Donna had put her in the wedding, and that the group were more or less accepting her as a friend. It was hard to believe it had already been a year since that fateful camping trip, wherein she was barely tolerated. Amazing what twelve months and fifty extra pounds could do.

When she got to the church and saw Jackie's drill sergeant routine, she decided that maybe it would be for the best if they went to make sure the outside was looking nice - primarily by dragging Jackie by the arm until she was outside in the warm summer air.

"God, it's like I'm surrounded by idiots," Jackie grumbled, clutching her forehead.

Laurie nodded. "Yeah, but how come that's starting to stress you out now?"

"I swear, if this wedding isn't perfect, I am going to kill someone! I swear!"

"Jackie, respectfully, I'm gonna have to ask you to chill. Everything's fine. The guys are with Eric, Donna's mom is with her, my dad's making sure no one's drinking or doing dope on the premises... which is ironic, cuz I think you could do with both right now."

Jackie rolled her eyes and put her hands on her hips, looking around the parking lot. "... God, I hate this. I hate everything."

Laurie raised an eyebrow. "You're hungry, too, huh?"

Jackie's bitchy face melted into her whiny face. "Yessssssss!" she moaned. "I can't stand this anymore! It used to be so easy not eating all the time, and then you come along, and now I've tasted the nector! I know what it's like to eat whatever whenever, and I can't live without it anymore! I need fooooood!"

Laurie patted her shoulder. "I know, I know. We just gotta hang in there. We're doing it for the soon-to-be Mr and Mrs Pinciotti."

Jackie laughed briefly at the joke before giving way to her pouty face again.

Footsteps behind them made them turn and see Brooke walking up. They took a moment to admire the maternity bridesmaid dress she was wearing. Her massive pregnant belly swayed back and forth as she waddled up to them, beaming away. "Hey, Jackie! Hey, Laurie!"

Jackie smiled through her pout. "Oh, Brooke, you look beautiful!"

"Totally got that sexy pregnant thing going for you," agreed Laurie.

Brooke smiled bashfully. "Thanks. You look incredible, too."

"Oh, we know," Laurie replied.

"Yeah, considering the fact that we're starving!" Jackie added.

Brooke nodded. "Yeah, Michael mentioned the wedding diet. If it's any consolation, so am I."

"Ugh, and that's worse for you because you have a baby that needs nourishment," Jackie whined.

"I had a good breakfast this morning," Brooke laughed. "I'll be fine."

"Good for you. I'm starving!"

"The reception can't happen fast enough," Laurie sighed, rubbing her empty belly. "Seriously, when I leave tonight, there's gonna be a few popped stitches in this dress."

At that moment, Joanne popped out of the church and looked relieved when she saw them. "Oh, here you all are," she sighed. "You need to start keeping an eye on your bride. She's in here ranting about pizza."

Jackie, Laurie and Brooke all stared at each other. "Good lord, it's spreading," Laurie whispered.

The three girls all hurried into the bride's changing room where Midge was trying calm her daughter. "Honey, we can't order a pizza right now! You don't want to stain your dress before the ceremony!"

"Mom, I don't care right now! I'm starving! I feel like I could eat an entire pizza by myself! No, two pizzas! Three! With ham and sausage and pepperoni and --"

"Slow down there, cowgirl," Laurie admonished. "You're just making the rest of us hungry."

"I'm sorry, it's just... I miss food, dammit!"

"Don't we all?" moaned Jackie, clutching her stomach. "I'm so hungry I could eat a whole tub of ice cream in one sitting."

"Well, I don't have any ice cream," said Brooke, pulling out her purse, "but I do have some snacks in here." She produced four chocolate bars and held them out to the three women.

"... You carry candy bars in your purse?" asked Jackie, looking both relieved and bemused.

Brooke smirked. "When you're pregnant, you're hungry all the time. Also sore, tired, annoyed and horny."

"We'll settle for hungry," said Laurie, gratefully taking the chocolate bar. "I think whatever calories I get from this won't take effect until after the wedding, so I should be fine."

"Agreed," said Jackie, taking her own.

The four women sat in the dressing room, eating chocolate and generally trying to calm down. Soon, with the sugar in their systems, they felt their nerves settle.

"Much better," said Donna. "Brooke, you may have just singlehandedly saved this wedding."

"The least I can do," Brooke replied, rubbing her pregnant belly. "God, I'm ready for this kid to be born. It's been almost nine months exactly. I'm ready to friggin' pop, y'know?"

Laurie tilted her head, admiring the perfect sphere of Brooke's belly. "Yeah...," she murmured. She wondered what she'd look like with a belly that perfectly round. Minus the actually having kids part, of course.

At that moment, Midge popped her head in the door. "Okay, girls, the ceremony's about to begin! Donna, your ass of a father is on his way here to walk to you down the aisle. I'm so proud! See you in a minute!" The door shut again.

Everyone looked at Donna, who just shook her head fondly. "That's my mommy dat said dat," she said, and they all laughed.

Getting in some last minute hugs, Laurie, Jackie and Brooke scurried outside to join up with the respective groomsmen. Eric was twitching nervously in his suit, but Red and Kitty were making sure that he was all right. Kitty was doing her very best not to cry.

"Come on, you two," Red said sternly. "We're going to do this right, okay? No tears, no twitching. Just get up there and do it."

"I'm sorry, Red," Kitty sniffled. "It's just... my little boy is..."

"All grown up, Kitty. Yes, we know. But we need to get him up there before he misses his plane for his honeymoon tomorrow."

The gang all smirked at the scene as Eric rolled his eyes. Jackie linked arms with Hyde, practically beaming, and not just because he'd agreed to remove his sunglasses for the ceremony. Brooke linked arms with Kelso, who was hiding a shy smile as she did so - they had really grown closer these last few months. Laurie, meanwhile, stood between the two couples with Fez, who was smiling genuinely at the fussing Formans.

"Laurie, do you wish we had a wedding as beautiful as this?" he asked quietly.

Laurie shrugged. "Oh, I dunno. Ours wasn't so bad."

"I suppose. I just wish my best man hadn't been that gentleman with the speeding ticket at the courthouse. I had to pay half of his fine."

Laurie gently tightened her grip on his arm. "One thing we never did - we never had that honeymoon...," she said, giving him a sexy smile.

Fez's smile broadened. "Ooooh, we should go to Disneyland and eat cotton candy all day!"

"I think that can be arranged."

They heard the organ start up, and they knew it was time. Eric made his way down the aisle with Red and Kitty, and one by one, each couple made their way down the aisle. Laurie enjoyed hanging onto Fez's arm, but she had to admit, watching her little brother tie the knot with the woman of his dreams was heartwarming. She usually hated those little reminders that she had a heart underneath it all. But seeing Donna's nerves completely melt away when she heard Eric's admittedly touching vows was a sight to behold. She never thought her own brother could ever move her to tears, but it did. They made it through the ceremony without a hitch, although Kitty and Bob had both cried through the whole thing, and Kelso and Fez had almost been the ones to "object" until Hyde silenced them with a glare.

Soon, Pastor Dave had pronounced them man and wife. "You may now kiss the bride."

The newly-minted husband and wife kissed to a round of applause. Laurie clapped eagerly, because as happy as she was that the ceremony had gone well, she was even happier to know that the next best thing was about to start.

The wedding reception!
1331112112111111111111111111111111111.title: Time for the wedding!

choices: Wedding cake for all the hungry ladies!
13311121121111111111111111111111111111.content:
Soon, everyone was in the banquet hall for the reception. The place was crowded with relatives, all milling around, catching up, reminiscing and pretending they liked each other.

The bride and her bridesmaids wandered through the packed hall, trying to make their way to the buffet table. They had survived the whole wedding, and it was time to finally have some food. Much to their dismay, there was a big crowd around the table.

"Ugh, look at all these people," Laurie moaned. "I could be eating all that right now."

"Patience," Donna replied. "We just gotta get in line and load up with whatever we can."

"I can't believe we got the small styrofoam plates," grumbled Jackie. "Should've gotten regular big ceramic plates. I'm probably gonna have to make so many trips up here."

Just then, Midge came scurrying up to her wedded daughter. "Donna, come on! It's time for the meet and greet!"

"The what?"

"You and Eric have to meet and greet all the people who came to your wedding! I wonder if that's why it's called a 'meet and greet'..."

Donna groaned as she was dragged away from the group towards her husband and a big line of people she didn't recognize.

"Well, more for us," said Jackie with a shrug.

Just then, Hyde hurried over. "Jackie? Did you know anything about a best man speech?"

Jackie blinked at her surprisingly flustered-usually-zen boyfriend. "...Yeah? You're supposed to get up before everyone and recite your carefully planned and well thought out best man spee-- " She stopped at the look on his face. "Oh, for god's sake! Don't tell me!"

Hyde shrugged. "No one told me anything about this! If I'd known, I'd have let Kelso or Fez be the best man. Then I could at least have the joy of watching them fail!"

Jackie sighed. She looked in the direction of the food, and then at Hyde, before letting out a frustrated growl and grabbing him by the collar. "Come on, let's write this thing. If I don't, you'll just rip off Air Supply lyrics or something."

Hyde let out a nervous laugh. "What?! I don't listen Air Supply! I don't know what you're talking about!" he yelped.

Laurie and Brooke laughed as they disappeared into the crowd.

"And then there were two," Brooke murmured.

Then, from the direction of the dance floor, Kelso meandered up, looking surprisingly shy. "Er, hey there, ladies," he said, trying to sound all manly and stuff. "I was wondering... y'know, if maybe... perhaps... Brooke, maybe, you'd like to... y'know... that thing y'do on the dance floor and stuff..."

Brooke tried not to laugh. "Michael, I'd love to."

A big goofy grin split across Kelso's face and he took Brooke's hand. She gave one last helpless shrug to Laurie before allowing herself to be dragged out onto the dance floor.

Laurie shook her head, then realized she was on her own. Looking this way and that, she tried to see if Fez was going to pop out of nowhere and drag her into another wedding related activity, but she didn't see him anywhere. For a moment, she was relieved she wouldn't be stopped from finally having a decent meal, but then she felt a little sad that her husband wasn't coming out to ask her to dance or hang out or something. Where was he?

Sighing to herself, she made her way over to the buffet table, hoping she'd be able to at least get something good. Not a bad spread. Fried chicken, scalloped potatoes, mashed potatoes, devilled eggs, green beans, glazed ham... lots to choose from. She was just about to grab a plate when she felt a hand on her shoulder, and she found herself turning towards the brown eyes of Fez.

"Laurie, my darling, there you are!"

"Fez! I was just about to get something to eat."

"Oh, good. Let me show you where we are sitting."

Laurie turned where Fez was pointing, and her mouth fell open. There was a table with only two chairs, and it was covered in a mountain of food, all in the styrofoam plates, taking up the entire space.

"Oh, Fez...," she murmured, feeling drool forming in her mouth.

"I know you have worked so hard to stay the same size for this lovely dress," Fez said kindly. "So I wanted you to finally enjoy getting out of it."

Laurie smiled and hugged him tightly. "You know how to treat a fat girl right." She released him. "Now then... let's go stuff me silly!"

She practically ran over to the table and sat in her chair, admiring the table full of food just for her. Licking her lips greedily, she started to eat. Oh god, it had been a long two weeks, but she'd made it. She'd kept the dress nice and snug all the way through the ceremony. Now she could relax and eat, eat eat. She didn't care what it was - she just wanted it in her belly.

Fez was a champ. He knew better than to interrupt, and instead, he settled for helping. He'd pass her plates, hold up a glass of water for her to sip from, go get more if it seemed necessary. His wife's appetite was insatiable, and he was only too happy to help her.

Laurie ate like a real trooper. All the food groups adequately represented, and she just gobbled them all up. So many fruits and vegetables, of course, but she really made good work of all the meat and grains provided, too. So much ham and chicken. And so many biscuits and dinner rolls.

But of course, the best part was dessert. They weren't allowed near the cake yet, but there were loads of pies and cookies to consume. Fez brought her plate after plate of goodies, and she ate as much as she could. All the while, that dress was feeling tighter around her growing middle. She had been hunched over when she started, but now, she had to lean back and sit almost completely straight while her massive belly swelled with the sudden onslaught of sugary treats. It pressed hard against the table, the top half bulging onto the table.

But that didn't stop her. She grew so full she couldn't feed herself, so Fez naturally fed her instead, placing cookies and slices of pie into her waiting mouth. She loved this so much. Her man feeding her, her stomach swollen and in absolutely pain, the flavor in her mouth... this was heaven.

After what felt like years (it was more like an hour), it was over. Laurie had eaten every last scrap of food Fez had brought her. He had noticed she was slowing down a while ago, so he figured he'd better stop for now. He waited to see what she'd say.

She let out a very large belch that may have startled a few people sitting near them, but she was too stuffed to care. Her stomach bulged against the table's edge, with both her hands on top of it, rubbing it gently, with a dazed look on her face. She was covered in crumbs from her gorge, but she didn't care about that either. She was just so stuffed.

Fez scooted closer and nuzzled her, putting a hand on her stomach and rubbing it as well. "Feeling better?"

Laurie nodded. "Unnnnngh... that was amazing. I don't think I can move an inch."

Fez's eye wandered out to the main area, and he saw activity taking place. "Looks like they're getting ready to cut the cake."

Laurie's eyes widened with renewed vigor. "Let's get over there."

"Are you sure? You're a bit... full, aren't you?"

But Laurie nodded vigorously. "I'm fine... HIC! I just gotta get over there befo-HIC!-hore they give away all the be-HIC!-hest pieces!"
13311121121111111111111111111111111111.title: Big buffet reception time!

choices: Laurie finally returns the next morning
133111211211111111111111111111111111111.content:
The cake was enormous. No one was one hundred percent sure why it had happened. The most popular theory was that Bob had read the description wrong or given the wrong measurements or whatever. In any case, it sat upon the table, almost the same height as Kelso, who was the tallest of the main group.

Eric and Donna were cutting pieces together - relieved to have something to do that wasn't shaking hands and pretending they remembered all their relatives - but Donna's hunger was beginning to cripple her, so Eric agreed he would handle it for a while. In the meantime, she took a piece of cake and sat down with Jackie and Brooke.

"Oh my god," she gasped. "I'm exhausted. I don't know how other newlyweds do it."

"Don't be so negative!" Jackie said, swatting her arm. "Some of us would like to get married someday! Don't spoil it for us!"

Brooke moaned with joy as she finished her latest piece of cake. "Mmmmm... Donna, your dad picked good cake."

"It's one of his special powers," Donna smiled, eating her own. "God, you're right. This is good. I should get a second piece."

Jackie scoffed. "Try to keep up, Mrs Forman. I'm already on my third."

Brooke smirked and raised her hand. "Fifth." They both stared at her in surprise. She shrugged. "I'm pregnant! Baby wants cake!"

Jackie patted her own small bulge of a belly. "God, to think a few months ago, I would've freaked out about this. Now, I don't care. I just want more cake, dammit!"

"Me, too," said Donna. "But you know what? It's good to subvert the traditional values that say a woman must be thin to be attractive. I mean, during the Reconnaissance, fat women were revered and admired."

"True," agreed Brooke, resting her hands atop her round belly. "I'm kinda gonna miss this part of being pregnant - getting to eat whatever whenever."

"You should join us," said Jackie eagerly. "It'd be fun to have a fourth girl on the pig parade!"

Donna's eye fell on a particularly interesting sight. "Speaking of a pig parading..."

Jackie and Brooke followed her gaze and spotted a very bloated Laurie waddling up through the line with Fez as her support.

"Good god, look at that gut," said Jackie, covering her mouth in shock. "She looks like she swelled up like a balloon!"

"Poor Fez," added Brooke. "He's trying to hold her up. She's so determined, she doesn't even notice!"

"She'll make it up to him later, probably..."

"Jackie, please don't make me lose my appetite."

They observed from their table as Laurie, now one of the last people to get in line, eagerly started loading up on cake. She took the extra knife and started cutting huge slices off the back where no one was really paying attention, putting them on plates for Fez to take away. He would slip them onto a nearby table while she stood at the table, eating whatever slices he couldn't carry, and then when he returned, he took the next batch.

Donna's mouth was hanging open. "Does... does she really think she can eat all that?"

"Looks like she's going to try," remarked Brooke.

"Oh god, this means we're going to need a custodian soon," Jackie moaned. "I knew we should've sprung for the cleaning service."

At last, Laurie was finished, and she and Fez went to the nearby table. They counted at least fifteen pieces of cake, not including the few she'd already had at the serving table. She looked so full and bloated already, but she showed no signs of caring as she started shoveling cake into her mouth. One piece was quickly finished before she moved onto the second, and that quickly gave way to the third.

"Holy crap...," said Donna, in complete awe.

"It's like watching a wheat harvester," agreed Brooke.

After watching her consume five pieces, Laurie seemed to be feeling very full. Her stomach was so round, it looked like a bowling ball. She finished pieces six and seven, and she was partway through the eighth when she stopped for a moment, looking confused. They briefly wondered if maybe she'd had too much. But then, she let out a hefty belch, and she resumed eating. More and more cake went down into her vast belly.

Around the twelfth piece, she began to slow down. She leaned back, her belly pressed up against the table, a look of exhaustion on her face, but she kept eating. She made it through the thirteenth, and then the fourteenth... and all that was left was the fifteenth.

But it looked like she'd had it. She let the fourteenth plate fall to the floor, her arms dangling helplessly at either side. She was stuffed to the gills. Was she done?

But then, Fez took that last piece, and the plastic fork, and to their surprise, he began to feed her the last piece. She looked utterly miserable, but she still smiled at her husband as he fed her, bite by bite, never forcing her or rushing her. Just letting her eat at her own pace. A few minutes later, the cake was gone. He set the plate down, rubbed her forehead, and then rubbed her belly with the other, gently kissing her forehead.

"That is... so sweet...," said Brooke, very surprised by her own words.

"Yeah, it... kinda is," Donna added.

Jackie pouted. "I wonder if Steven would feed me and rub my huge tummy?"

Donna shrugged. "Eat half a wedding cake and find out," she joked.

To their surprise, Jackie got up and grabbed a plate, heading for the cake. Donna and Brooke watched her in alarm.

"Jackie, I was kidding!"

"I know, I just... the thought of Steven rubbing my fat belly! I got horny! And hungry!"

Brooke nodded knowingly. "Sometimes, Michael rubs my tummy, and it's just so sexy. It's another reason why I'm sad I'm going to give birth soon. I'm going to miss my belly rubs."

Donna shifted in her seat. She had to admit, the thought of Eric rubbing her overstuffed stomach to sooth how full she felt sounded wonderful. She grabbed a plate and hurried after Jackie, getting some more cake for herself. And because she was a considerate person, she brought a few pieces back for Brooke.

The three women pigged out on cake all night, letting one piece segue into the next. They ate until they felt sick, and then they ate a little more. By the time the night was over, all three were sitting at their table in a veritable sugar coma.

Eric came over, finding them in a pile of empty paper plates and crumbs. He gently tapped his bloated wife on the shoulder. "Donna...?"

Donna jolted awake. "Huh? Wha...?"

"Donna, it's getting late. If we want to get some sleep before the honeymoon in NYC tomorrow, we should probably get going, y'know?"

Donna belched in response, looking very embarrassed afterward. "Sorry, I... you're right. Let's get going." She got to her feet, which was a challenge in her overstuffed state.

Noticing the commotion, Jackie and Brooke hefted themselves to their feet as well, huge bellies protruding and gurgling with cake. They followed Eric and Donna to the door, where they also found Hyde and Kelso waiting for them.

"Where're Laurie and Fez?" asked Jackie, sleepily leaning into Hyde.

"They cut out early," Hyde said with a shrug. "Said they had things to do."

Kelso grinned mischievously as he supported Brooke. "Which probably means they're doin' it!"

"Michael, they're not necessarily have sex," Brooke admonished.

"You don't know them like we do," said Hyde dryly.

Eric cleared his throat. "Well! We're gonna take off. Get some rest before the honeymoon."

Kelso grinned again. "You're gonna do it, too, huh?"

Donna scowled. "Kelso... I mean, yeah, probably, but come on..."

Eric smiled. "We just wanna thank you guys for being here and supporting us so we could get this far. Thank you so much for helping us get married."

Jackie cleared her throat expectantly.

Eric rolled his eyes. "And thank you, Jackie, for being a kickass maid of honor and getting everything ready. You really saved our butts."

Jackie beamed sleepily. "Damn right, I did." Her expressions softened. "We love you guys, even if some of us our too zen to admit," she said, giving Hyde a knowing look, to which he merely smirked in response.

"We love you guys, too," Donna said, fighting back some tears. As stuffed as she was, she was still emotional.

The group all pulled into a group hug - even Hyde was willing to let his guard down and join in just this once - before breaking apart and letting the newlyweds take off for their honeymoon. Jackie and Brooke quietly reflected that Donna's dress was holding together remarkably well, considering how stuffed she was underneath.

Jackie was quietly regretting not getting a maternity dress like Brooke. They may look like a tent, but at least she'd have had more room.

They were all exhausted at this point, so the two couples split up, and Jackie leaned on Hyde as he took her back to the El Camino. Once they were inside the cab and Hyde had started the motor, he helped Jackie with her seat belt.

"So...," he said at last. "Wanna tell me why we noticed you gals trying to make the cake disappear piece by piece?"

Jackie moaned. She was too full to feel embarrassed. "I dunno...," she whined. "It was just so good, and we were starving, and I just... Steven?"

"Yeah?"

"... I ate too much."

Hyde chuckled as they pulled out onto the road. To Jackie's surprise, he reached over and put a hand on her sore tummy, gently rubbing it in small circles. She glanced over at him as he focused on the road, and she felt her love increase immensely. They would most definitely be doin' it tonight.
133111211211111111111111111111111111111.title: Wedding cake for all the hungry ladies!
