1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The next morning, Jackie woke up to the feeling of Hyde's lips on her cheek. She stirred and groaned at being woken.

"Gotta go to work, doll," he said quietly in her ear. "I'll see you at dinner, okay?"

"Mmmhmmm," she mumbled sleepily.

"Okay, have a good one. Love you."

"Mmmmm I luv you too...," she replied, already mostly asleep again.

She heard the sound of his boots leaving, so she assumed he was leaving, too. She stayed in his cot under the basement for another hour before she decided it was time to get up. She forced herself up, looking around. She saw her bridesmaid dress slung haphazardly over a chair. She smiled briefly as she remembered what a relief it was to have that thing off, allowing her belly to stretch. Speaking of which, she realized she was totally naked right now. There was her belly, poking out, with a few fresh stretchmarks going down the front of it. She gave it a jiggle. She couldn't believe how much she'd eaten the night before. She rolled over and observed herself in the mirror. She'd installed it herself because Hyde didn't want one. She stood to her full height and admired her body. She looked at her growing belly, her growing booty, her growing thighs, her growing breasts, and she thought to herself:

Damn, I'm cute!

Pleased with herself, she grabbed a few spare clothes she had lying around for nights when she stayed over impulsively. She found a stretchy pair of shorts and one of Hyde's t-shirts so she'd at least look presentable. She tiptoed into the basement, finding it to be around 11 in the morning. Pleased with herself, she plopped down on the couch and grabbed a magazine to skim through.

She was probably there for almost ten minutes before the side door popped open, and she looked up to see a familiar head of blonde hair.

Laurie grinned dopily. "HIC! I'm back!" she said in a husky voice.

Jackie stared at her. Her hair was a bit messy. She was clearly a bit drunk. And when she walked all the way in, she saw that her stomach had swollen to twice the size it had been last night, protruding through a massive hole in the front of the bridesmaid dress she was still wearing.

"Laurie, what the hell...?"

But Laurie just chuckled drunkenly as she stumbled inside, kicking the door shut behind her. "Oh man," she laughed. "Whatta night! Oh man, that was heavenly!"

She plopped down on the couch next to Jackie, putting her feet up on the table and both hands atop her enormous stomach. It was so utterly stuffed that it didn't even jiggle. She looked about as pregnant as Brooke.

"Laurie, what happened to you? What'd you do? Wha...? Where's Fez?!"

"Relax, he's at work. I took a cab home. Ohhhh, man, did we ever have an awesome night last night!"

"But where'd you go? Last we saw you, you were eating cake!"

"Oh yeah. Well, after the cake, and Fez feeding me, I felt horny as hell, so I took Fez to an empty banquet hall, and he fucked me on the dining room table."

Jackie's mouth fell open. "... You what?"

"Three times!"

"Laurie!"

The bloated blonde plowed on. "Then, when we finished, I was hungry again, but there was nowhere open. So we went to the nearest twenty-four hour grocery store and just loaded up on whatever looked good. I must've eaten enough to feed thirty people. A whole box of doughnuts, a pint of ice cream, a bunch of bananas, some strawberries, a whole six pack of beer... And I was so stuuuuuffed after that, I let him take me in the back of the car. We're lucky the cops didn't find us." She laughed drunkenly without a hint of shame.

Jackie just stared at her, slack-jawed and regular awed.

Laurie continued. "So then, the sun was coming up, so we stopped off for a light breakfast. Just a few pancakes and a few chugs of maple syrup. We got some sleep at his place, then he had to get ready for work, so he took off, I raided his host parents' fridge, got a cab, and here I am."

"You just... ate through the entire night?"

"And had sex. Plenty of sex. Oh my god, for a guy who's only slept with two women, that husband of mine is talented...!"

"Ewwww, I don't wanna hear about that!"

Laurie chuckled. "Oh like you and Hyde didn't have totally awesome cake-stuffed sex last night, am I right? I saw you girls pigging out. I'll bet Eric and Kelso got some action, too."

Jackie blushed. "Yes, we did have sex, and it was amazing, and he didn't even care that I'd made a pig of myself. My Steven loves me, fat or thin."

Laurie smiled and patted her shoulder. "Told ya he would."

The tender moment was interrupted when she let out an extra long belch that reverberated against the cinder block walls. She let out a sigh of relief and sank deeper into the couch. "What a night...," she said in a husky voice. "I can't for you and Hyde to get married so we can do this all over again!"

Jackie rolled her eyes. "Good god, how do you not have indigestion right now?"

"A belly of iron, l'il lady," she replied, slapping it all the way across. The great taut orb gurgled and sloshed with the sounds of her late night feast. She rubbed it gingerly. "And hey, I kept my promise. Made it through the wedding without ruining the dress."

"No, you just... waited until afterwards."

"Details, details... Good god, I'm stuffed. I wish Fez were still here. All this weight in my stomach, pressing down... I need to be fucked so hard right now..."

Jackie went red again. "Okay, that's nice. I think I'll just make tracks for next door..."

Laurie waved her off. "Oh, don't get up!" she drawled. "I'll just... find a place to take a little nap until I've... digested this glorious feast..."

It was like watching a turtle that was stuck on it's shell try to right itself. She was stuck under that mammoth belly, trying to rock herself back and forth until she was in a sitting position. She pushed as hard as she could, but she was so utterly full that she couldn't even make her legs stand.

Groaning to herself, Jackie got up from the couch and proceeded to haul Laurie forward, pulling with all her might, until at last, she had the bloated bimbo up on her feet. Both of them gasping for breath after this exertion, Laurie nodded a silent thanks to Jackie before turning and waddling back to Hyde's room. Jackie watched in a stupor as she swayed unsteadily, her massive stomach like a wrecking ball, until she made it to the doorway and disappeared inside. She heard the sound of something heavy hitting the springs, followed by another belch.

Shaking her head, Jackie sat back down with her magazine and read in silence for a while.

However, she didn't get very far because she started to hear very unsettling sounds coming from the back room.

Specifically, Laurie gasping and groaning as if in pain. For a while, Jackie wondered if she had hurt herself.

But then she heard her wail, "Ohhhhhhh, fuuuuuuuck...!"

Yelping, Jackie tossed the magazine away and hurried out the door.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Laurie finally returns the next morning

choices: Red's well enough to work again - time for Laurie to get a job
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
A week passed, and to everyone joy, the Vista Cruiser pulled into the driveway, signalling the return of Eric and Donna Forman. Except, of course, Donna had decided all her stationary would say Donna Pinnciotti-Forman. Everyone was there to welcome them home. Kitty and Bob were waiting with huge hugs. Red gave Donna a hug and Eric a handshake - and then told him the lawn needed mowing. Eric attempted to remind Red that he didn't live there anymore, but one foot-in-the-ass comment later, he was taking the mower for a walk.

Jackie and Laurie, however, took an interest in Donna. They could tell the redhead had enjoyed the honeymoon considerably, not just from her smile, but also from her size. The buttons on her plaid shirt were a tad strained, and they were mentally trying to recall whether that particular shirt had fit when they last saw her in it. So naturally, they took her aside to Laurie's room for a bit of girl talk.

"What was it like?" Jackie asked eagerly. "Did you meet anyone famous? Did you meet a movie star? Did you meet Johnny Carson?! Are we gonna be on the Tonight Show?!"

Donna blinked in amusement. "Er, in the order of the questions... Nice, no, no, no, and what the hell?"

"You look like you had a good time," said Laurie, breaking out her candy stash. It was usually just for her and Fez, but she figured he'd understand if she shared with the girls.

"It was the best," Donna smiled, grabbing a candy bar. "I swear, we did every touristy thing imaginable. Central Park, Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, Time Square... We even saw a homeless guy take a leak on the street."

"New York, New York - it's a helluva town," Laurie chuckled.

Jackie bit into some peanut butter cups. "Yeah, I hope when Steven and I get married, we go somewhere classy. Like Paris."

Donna rolled her eyes. "Yeah, I don't see Hyde going to Paris, France. Maybe Paris, Tennessee..."

Laurie smirked. "So what else did you do?" Donna opened her mouth. "And please, leave out anything that involved having sex with my little brother."

Donna closed her mouth. "Well... not much else, actually."

Jackie closed her eyes in despair. "Oh god... They'll have to burn the city to the ground."

"Come on, you must've done something else...," Laurie insisted.

Donna looked down sheepishly. "Well... we... went to a lot of restaurants."

Jackie raised an eyebrow. "Oh yeah?"

"Yeah... oh my god, there's so much to choose from in New York City! So many different countries represented by so many different cuisines! And it was like... I just couldn't get enough! I must've gained five pounds altogether from this honeymoon!" She put both hands on her belly and jiggled it for emphasis.

Laurie chuckled. "Yeah, you really put some miles on the ol' gut," she said.

"Look who's talking," said Jackie dryly.

"Look who's talking about who's talking!"

Donna rolled her eyes. "God, when did all three of us get addicted to food?"

"It just kinda happened," Laurie shrugged. "But who's complaining? Food's awesome. And being fat is a major turn on."

Jackie snorted. "I don't know about that. I admit, I don't mind it like I thought I would, but I don't think it's an aphrodisiac for me."

"Me neither," said Donna. Then, an impish smile crept across her face. "Not that Eric's minded..."

"Ugh! What did we just get through talking about?!"

"Well, come on! Has Hyde minded the newer 'fluffier' Jackie?"

Jackie fidgeted for a few seconds as the memories of the wedding night came back to her, and she felt a small smile force its way onto her face. "I mean... no, I guess... I mean..."

"Jackie, you're like a shy little schoolgirl!" Laurie squealed, patting her knee. "What happened?"

"... Steven gave me a belly rub the night after the wedding, and it led into sex!"

Donna and Laurie squealed delightedly. "Oh my god, that's so sweet!" Donna gushed.

"I know! It's like... it was so sensual! I was so full! And he was on top of me, and I had his big strong hands on my stomach, and... oh god, I need to stop! I'm getting hot just thinking about it!"

Laurie laughed knowingly. "I know the feeling. When I think about what Fez does to me when I'm overstuffed..."

"Yeah, yeah, I remember you practically having to roll yourself into the basement that morning. You wanna show Donna what happened to your dress?"

"Oh, god, how bad was it?" Donna asked.

"Her stomach appeared around the corner about three seconds before she and the rest of her dress did."

Laurie simply leaned back and patted her stomach with one hand while eating her fourth candy bar with the other. "It was glorious. I just wish I'd known years ago what being fat would do to me..."

"You'd probably be so big you couldn't even move," Donna replied.

"Shhhh, don't turn me on."

Donna and Jackie rolled their eyes disparagingly. But they had to admit, since she'd gotten fat, Laurie was happier than she'd ever been before. Hell, not just happier. She was a lot more helpful, caring and downright kind - things they never would have thought her capable of. So while it may not be completely healthy physically, it was certainly healthy mentally.

They silently watched as Laurie absently lifted her shirt up, revealing her enormous swollen stomach underneath. They stared at how perfectly round it was - no folds or anything. Just a perfectly round belly. She rubbed it contentedly and smiled at them, and they realized she was watching them watch her.

Then, wordlessly, she held out the candy box for them.

Smiling, they all worked hard to finish it.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Eric and Donna return from their honeymoon

choices: Laurie and Fez start looking for an apartment
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
All too soon, the joy of the wedding weeks were over. Eric and Donna were soon off in the Vista Cruiser back towards Madison for summer classes. That meant it was time to get back to the usual routine. Laurie resumed doing chores while Red recuperated.

However, almost a year since it happened, the doctors had good news for the elder Forman - he was fully recovered and could go back to work now. In fact, he was already looking at purchasing an old disused muffler shop in town. He was looking forward to going back to work, having grown bored with "relaxing" and "lowering his stress levels".

As he was now free to go back to work, that meant Kitty could finally cut back on hours at the hospital, which meant she was more readily available to do stuff around the house.

Which meant Laurie was more or less redundant.

With Red down at the shop and Kitty doing chores, she was without anything to do. She didn't mind at first, but after a few days, she got bored. Watching TV while she did laundry had been doing something. Watching TV while not doing laundry was just empty. She needed something to do. Some kind of task. She wished she hadn't wimped out of beauty school. But then again, maybe that was for the best. She loved working on her own hair - she wasn't sure about working on anyone else's.

She hadn't forgotten about hers and Fez's plan to one day get a place together. It would have to be soon, seeing as how his host parents would figure out he'd graduated at some point and kick him out of their house. It also made her wonder where their actual kid was, but that wasn't their problem.

Thankfully, Fez was having no trouble with employment. He'd already left the hotel to take a job at a local salon as a shampoo boy. He was loving it there. She was tempted to look there, too, but as much as she loved Fez, she wasn't up for actually working in the same building as him all day. She liked having her own time so she could appreciate him at the end of the day.

She poured over the want ads. She knew she didn't want to go back to school. She wasn't even sure how she'd gotten into college in the first.... oh right. Sex. It was also sort of how she'd graduated high school.

She considered work at Fatso Burger, but she decided against that, too. She wasn't exactly good at the whole 'self-control' thing, so she would probably eat everything in sight. She briefly enjoyed that fantasy before deciding that food services were not the answer. She also toyed with the idea of Price Mart, for as a cashier, she wouldn't be as tempted as she'd be too busy ringing up groceries to eat them, but the pay was the barest of minimum wage. If she wanted to pay half the rent, she'd have to find something a bit trickier, therefore ensuring better pay.

One day, she found a want ad for a receptionist at an office building. Requirements included good people skills, organizational skills, filing, typing, talking on the phone, etc. She looked at the company details. It was a temp agency. Small office building uptown. And the pay looked good, not to mention the dental insurance. Deciding it was worth a try, she set up an interview.

When she got there a few days later, she made sure she looked professional. She used what money she had saved to purchase a dark blue pantsuit, hoping it looked professional enough. She used the fake charm she'd so finely honed over the years to ensure she stood out among the applicants, showcasing her people skills and generally being very amiable. And okay, she may have flirted lightly with the interviewer and failed to mention she was happily married, but there'd be time for that revelation later. She did very well, and they said they'd be happy to have her.

Pleased with her day's work, she strolled out the door and looked around happily, taking in the area around her job. She liked what she saw. A few fast food joints, a gas station loaded with sugary snacks, and a discount clothing store. She would need discount clothes after all the eating she'd be doing at the other places.

She saw her reflection in a shop window and couldn't help but feel proud of herself. After so much time wearing jeans, sweats and t-shirts, it felt good to be wearing nice clothes and taking some pride in her appearance.

She just hoped that her office chair was sturdy enough for her.

Time for a trip to the nearby Wendy's. Celebration was in order.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Red's well enough to work again - time for ...

1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once Laurie was comfortable at her new job, she and Fez agreed that it was time to start looking for their apartment. This was not an easy task, but they didn't need a big place. Just big enough for the two of them to be comfortable and not have to hang around the Forman house all day. Red was always eager to have less kids hanging around the house, so he was quick to offer any money to help them out. While Fez felt a little odd accepting money from his father-in-law, Laurie was more than happy to do so. As much as she'd learned and grown in the past year, she would always have that small part of her that knew how to work the "daddy's little girl" angle.

It took longer than expected to find a place, however. First, there was a matter of finding someplace affordable. Even small apartments were a bit pricey, they found. They also wanted something not too far away from the main group. With Eric and Donna off in Madison, they didn't want to fracture the group too much. Plus, it needed to be a reasonable distance from their jobs. They needed to save money on gas, after all.

The search took place during the better part of the summer. During the early part, lots of things happened that were crazy and exciting enough to prevent it from being boring. First, Brooke finally had hers and Kelso's baby, a beautiful little girl named Betsy. Sadly, Brooke had been talked into moving back to Chicago to live with her mother. Kelso was saddened, but he also agreed that since he was off to the police academy, it would be good for her to have extra help in raising the child. She also agreed to visit once in a while.

Not long after that, they made the discovery that Hyde's dad, Bud, was not in fact his dad, but some rich businessman named William Barnett. Imagine everyone's surprise when he turned out to be black as well. Thankfully, after a slightly awkward start, they soon hit it off with their shared love of government conspiracies and "circles". Turned out he owned a chain of record shops named "Grooves", and he got Hyde a job running the Point Place shop, which the gang loved because they could hang out and jam while he made money. Naturally, Jackie was both proud of his success and thrilled her boyfriend was suddenly from money.

And during all this, Laurie was still steadily gaining weight. Thankfully, most of her work was done from behind a desk, so movement wasn't an issue. She typically wore dresses as well, so her belly was free to grow as desired with discomfort. She frequented all the fast food joints in the area, a different one per day. Plus, there were always snacks to enjoy at work. Seemed someone was always bringing doughnuts, and Laurie always ate whatever ones were put out. After all, she was a workin' girl, and she needed to stay fed so she could focus on work. Otherwise, she'd be all whiny and pouty, and that didn't make for good business.

It was well into September 1979 that she and Fez finally had a breakthrough. An apartment had become available uptown, not far from work, and a decent distance from the Forman house and the record store. It was a small place, one bedroom, one bath, but it was nice, clean and within their price range. Of course, it turned out Fez had a longstanding rivalry with the landlord, Fenton, but Red soon put a stop to any infighting when he made it clear he would not let anyone stand in his little girl's way. They were free to move in within a few weeks.

They were all set by October. Red and Kitty donated some furniture, as did Bob and Joanne, creating an interesting clash of styles that gave the place it's own feel. Naturally, there was a housewarming party. Hyde, Jackie and Kelso all brought beer and snacks. Kitty brought a casserole. They even invited WB in the hopes it would make him feel like part of the family. He, of course, didn't know them well enough to bring a decent gift, so he just gave them cash. As soon as they counted the amount, Laurie knew she should invite him over more often.

At the end of the night, after everyone else had gone home and Fez was tidying up, Laurie went to take a shower. She reached behind the counter and pulled out the new bathroom scale she'd gotten for herself recently. She stood upon it, sucking in her considerable gut to see the number.

224

On her petite frame, this was pretty big. She looked at herself in the mirror. Her huge breasts, her engorged belly, her ballooning ass, her thunderous thighs... She smiled slightly at the sight, unable to help feeling pleased with herself.

And then, a tiny bit of excitement shot through her - the holidays were coming up! All the more opportunities for a good gorge! So much feasting to be had! So much to consume! Eating and drinking as the weather cooled! She couldn't wait!
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Laurie and Fez start looking for an apartment

1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Laurie looked herself up and down in the mirror. She felt a little silly dressed as a giant pumpkin for Halloween, but it was the only costume she could find that fit her at the moment. It was supposed to be stuffed with foam, but she was so big now, she didn't need it. She was supposed to put on orange face paint as well, but she felt dumb enough. But Fez had wanted to do costumes this year, so she went with it. Her parents were throwing a Halloween party - why her dad would ever agree to such a thing eluded her - and they were all going. Laurie loved a good party. Food and booze galore.

Fez stepped out of the bedroom in his costume - Willy Wonka, king of all candy and Fez's hero. He gave the purple coat a twirl and tipped his chocolate brown top hat. "Are you ready to depart, my lovely? We have so little to do and so much time!" He pretended he'd made a mistake. "No, wait. Strike that. Reverse it."

Laurie smirked. He was so cute sometimes. "Yeah, yeah, I'm ready. Just hope nobody decides to make me into a pie..."

"If they do, I'll have the Oompa Loompas attack them. Now come! Let us be off! To the candy!"

Laurie smiled as she followed him out the door. Candy was definitely going to be the main course tonight. She didn't care how she got it. She just wanted it.

When they got to the Forman house, the place was decorated with orange and black streamers, a few plastic jack-o-lanterns and bowls of chips, sodas and beers. Kitty was frantically scurrying around the house, dressed as one of Dracula's brides, while Red himself was dressed as Dracula, complete with fake blood dripping down his chin. Ah, so this was all about scaring the neighborhood punks. Should've guessed.

Soon, everyone started showing up. Hyde was dressed as a pirate, albeit at the bare minimum with only a plastic sword and belt, captain's hat and eye patch over his usual clothes. Jackie was dressed as his wench, her considerable potbelly protruding proudly over her belt. Kelso showed up later with a visiting Brooke and Betsy. He was dressed as Emmett Kelly the clown, while she was dressed as a lady clown, and little Betsy in a clown onesie - being too young for face paint.

Another thing she was too young for - trick or treating. Kelso understood that, as a child only a few months old, she wasn't old enough to properly take part in candy gathering - she wasn't even on solid food yet. But Brooke had agreed that, as it wasn't too cold, and as long as they had her back at a reasonable hour, they could take her out trick-or-treating. Fez and Laurie, of course, wanted to come along as well, carrying buckets for the candy. If Betsy couldn't eat candy, they'd just have to do it for her.

Lucky for them, Betsy was big on the adorability factor, and she was already pretty good at smiling, even if she didn't have a clue what was going on. This got a lot of people practically fawning over her and pouring loads of candy into the buckets. Most places only had the small "fun size" candies, but there were also a few that had gone for the full-size candy as well.

It amazed them how much candy they got based on a five-month-old's cute outfit and toothless smile. Both buckets were nearly half-full by the time they had rounded the block. One thing that took them by surprise, though, was when they came to a house where no one was home, but they'd left out a full bowl of bite-size chocolate bars.

"Oh hot damn," Laurie exclaimed. "Jackpot! Load 'em up!"

Fez eagerly grabbed the bowl and started to fill up the buckets.

"Pretty sure we're only supposed to take one," Brooke said uncertainly.

"Oh, come on, Brooke!" Laurie replied snottily. "This is the chance they take! Besides, who's gonna find out? It's the perfect crime! We're already in disguise!"

"She speaks with wisdom," Fez agreed, finishing his pouring. He picked up his bucket and grunted under the weight, the plastic handle warping.

"Man, what a haul," admired Kelso. "We're gonna be the envy of every kid in Point Place."

"I still feel bad just taking all of it," said Brooke.

Laurie handed her a Three Musketeers. "Here. Maybe that'll make you feel better."

Brooke looked at it for a long moment, then sighed and took the candy bar, taking a bite out of it. "Damn you."

Smirking triumphantly, Laurie led Fez over to the next house.

Kelso stood with Brooke, Betsy in his arms, watching her munch on the candy bar. "So... does this mean if I give you candy, you'll do stuff?"

"No, Michael."

"Oh... not even... y'know... that?"

Brooke looked at him for a long moment, then felt a small amused smile on her lips. "Well... I'm not ruling anything out..."

The night wound on, but all too soon, it was time for them to head back so Betsy could have her nap. Fez and Laurie reluctantly agreed, even though their massive buckets were loaded to the brim.

"You guys are never going to be able to finish all that," laughed Kelso. "Take it from someone who's tried to live on candy. At some point, you just start throwing up and you have to see a dentist."

"Relax, moron," Laurie sneered. "We're not gonna eat it all in one sitting."

"Of course not," agreed Fez. "This shall last us until at least after Thanksgiving."

"Well... I mean, that's an optimistic viewpoint, but yeah, longer than tonight."

So they went back to the Forman house and set the candy aside to partake in party games with everyone else. Fez was an absolute master at bobbing for apples. Jackie somehow made it through an entire bowl of dip with only one bag of chips. At one point, Brooke left Betsy with an eager Mrs Forman so she and Kelso could disappear and ... do things. All in all, it was a good Halloween party.

The drive back to their place was slightly awkward as Fez was driving with one hand and unwrapping candy with the other. Fortunately, they made it home alive. They got out of the costumes, had a sexy shower together, and then watched a hokey scary sci-fi flick on TV. They sat there, with Fez noticeably frightened by the cheesy special effects, while Laurie reclined with her head in his lap, letting him feed her candy. He took some for himself, naturally, because he was an addict, but he loved her enough to share the bulk of it with her. Laurie ate piece after piece. Peanut butter cups, Kit Kats, M&Ms, Snickers, Hershey Bars, they all were gobbled up.

Fez finally couldn't stand the horror movies anymore and decided to turn in early, but Laurie elected to stay up a little longer and enjoy a few more. Robot Monster came on - a schlocky black-and-white fifties flick about an alien gorilla with a deep-sea diving helmet on who wandered around trying to invade Earth - and she continued eating the candy. She ate and ate and ate well past midnight. The resultant sugar buzz was pleasant for a while, but as she finally made it halfway through the bucket, she began to notice that she wasn't really getting that "pleasantly full" feeling she enjoyed.

In fact, she was feeling a little sick.

By the time she was three thirds of the way through the bucket, she was feeling very sick.

She sat up on the couch, hearing her stomach make rather frightening gurgling sounds. She laid there for a long time, whimpering a bit as she rubbed her belly and silently wishing that Fez would wake up and come back to rub it for her. God, she hardly ever felt like this. Bloated, achy, sickly, like she wanted to barf... She hoped she wouldn't. It'd be a waste of dedicated trick-or-treating. She was scared to move.

But she had to, if only to get to the cabinet. She had lots of antacids. It was a necessity when your hobby was overeating. Hopefully, they would help in a chocolate overdose situation. Just a matter of making it there with the contents of her stomach remaining inside. She gently got into a sitting position and forced herself up, listening to her stomach bubble as she did. A small belch broke free, but she managed to remain calm. Any anxiety would just make it worse.

She rubbed her stomach in a circular motion as she made it to the cabinet and got out the antacids. She got a glass of water, let them dissolve therein, and gulped it all down. God, those tasted weird. She settled herself back down in an easy chair, trying to relax. Her stomach continued to hurt for a long time, and she continued to let out those little burps, worried one of them would end messily, but thankfully, nothing happened. After half an hour of sitting still, the stomachache finally dissolved, and she felt well enough to make her way to the bedroom and join her husband in some much-needed slumber.

As she got comfortable in bed next to him, she realized this was the first time in a while she'd done a major stuffing and it hadn't gone all that well. It was a good lesson that too much candy was not good for a body.

Of course, that's not the lesson she took from it.

Instead, she believed that she was loosing her ability to eat massive amounts of food. That simply wouldn't do. Not when Thanksgiving was a few weeks away. She was looking forward joining her family in a massive all-day gorge-athon. She was going to wear a dress that was slightly too big so she could grow into it while she was at the table.

Well, she'd just have to do something about this. She was going to start "prepping" for Thanksgiving. She would get her stomach used to holding gargantuan meals again, increasing their size every time. She smiled eagerly at the thought as she slipped off to sleep.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Spin on to Halloween

choices: Fez takes her out for one last "training session"
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The next few weeks were epic for Laurie.

Every day between Halloween and Thanksgiving, she made it a point to eat as much as she could every single day. She'd make big sandwiches for her lunch breaks. She'd stop off at a few fast food joints on the way home, supersizing every order. Double cheeseburgers, extra-large fries, large milkshakes, all gave their lives to the cause of preparing her for her Thanksgiving feast. She munched and guzzled and slurped and chomped her way through each and every meal. Each and every fast food drive thru attendant soon began to recognize her voice through their staticy intercoms as she drove through and ordered her latest feast.

To her delight, Laurie soon found that she wasn't experiencing the same overstuffed misery of Halloween night. That "pleasantly full" feeling she got from each meal was comfortably achieved. So even though her stomach was probably primed for Thanksgiving by the end of the first week, that didn't stop her from supersizing it every day after that. There was still so much fast food to eat fast.

On top of all that grease and salt she was consuming, she also had dinner with Fez at home. After cheap and quick food in public, she'd come home to find nicely-grilled chicken or porkchops waiting for her, with a variety of vegetables, fruits and grains to consume. In his spare time, since he'd learned his wife was quite the glutton when she wanted to be, Fez had decided he'd better learn to cook, and Laurie was all too happy to taste everything he made. Their dinners were small, considering they were on a budget, but combined with what she was putting away before reaching home, Laurie would slouch away from the table more than stuffed.

As the days turned to weeks, and Laurie's appetite grew, so did her waistline. Her clothes quickly became very tight, to the point that the button on her "fat jeans" finally burst off on the way home from Burger King. She was half-startled and half-aroused by the sight of her stomach springing forward and planting itself firmly against the steering wheel. She looked around the car at the dozens of fast food bags and wrappers. She had definitely done a good job training.

Since her office didn't have the strictest dress code, and she was behind a desk most of the time, Laurie got a pair of stretch pants to accommodate her growing gut. She briefly toyed with maternity pants, but that seemed a step too far. She got some cute colorful stretch pants that had plenty of give and no buttons to pop off.

As they got nearer to the big day, Laurie decided one evening - after consuming two cheeseburgers, half a dozen doughnuts, a pint of ice cream and a large Dr Pepper - to get out the scale once again and see what she weighed. She stripped down to her underwear and stood on the scale. She had to hold her gut back just to see where the little needle came to a stop. She peered down in silent wonder as it halted by a number.

245

Her mouth hung open in stupefied silence. That was unbelievable. She'd gained over twenty pounds in just a few short weeks. She hefted her massive stomach in her hands. It was so perfectly round. She looked at her meaty fingers, her thick juicy arms, her gargantuan boobs... She turned around and admired that huge fat ass in the mirror. She smiled to herself.

Damn, she was sexy.

And also damn, she was full. She couldn't stand for much longer.

She waddled off to the living room to join Fez for some late night snuggling. The big day was almost upon her. She was ready for it.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Laurie trains for Thanksgiving

1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was finally Turkey Day.

The big day had at last arrived.

Laurie was all set. She put on a nice dress that had plenty of give, so she'd be able to eat to her heart's content. And food aside, she was looking forward to catching up with family. Eric and Donna would be returning once again, while Kelso had invited Brooke and Betsy, along with - as a token of goodwill - Brooke's mother. He was hoping that by having her over, she'd see that he was a good father and would be okay with Brooke eventually moving back to Point Place. Hope sprang eternal.

They arrived around 3:00. The game was on, so most of the guys were in the living room, reacting to whatever nonsense was currently going on. Laurie could rarely keep her eyes open during sports. She casually poked her head in the room and greeted her father, along with Bob and a few other men in her family. She rolled her eyes at their antics as they cheered on the game before crossing to the kitchen where she found Kitty and Joanne and a few other women working away.

"Oh, Laurie! Good! You're here! Keep an eye on those yams for me! I need to make sure the turkey's okay!" Kitty scurried away, trying to do several things at once.

Laurie raised an eyebrow, but did as she was asked. "Fez, why don't you join my dad in the living room and watch football?"

Fez winced. "I do not care for football. Or sitting with your dad. Especially during football. He'll only get mad when I don't cheer correctly."

Joanne chuckled. "Sweetie, it's the Cowboys versus the Oilers. Your father-in-law only cares about the Packers. You're going to be fine."

Fez looked nervous, but he went into the living room all the same, just as there was a massive group cheer.

"They'll eat him for breakfast," Joanne sighed, going back to making stuffing. "So... how're things?"

Laurie shrugged as she helped move food around. "Good," she said amiably. "They're good."

"Apartment's not too bad?"

"No, it's a nice place. Love the furniture you gave us."

"Good, good... Looking forward to dinner?"

Laurie bit back a small smile. "Yeah, I guess so... Why?"

"You're practically drooling over the devilled eggs."

Laurie quickly backed away from the food in question and tried to look innocent. "What?! I mean... it just looks good! That's all!"

Joanne smirked knowingly. "I know, I know... Can't wait to stuff yourself at the table, right?"

"I... well, I mean..." Dammit, Laurie wasn't used to feeling flustered.

"Trust me. You're not alone," Joanne continued, patting her own stomach. "Got my elastic waistband pants on today. One of the reasons we agreed to Brooke's mom coming over is she's going to bring a few dishes as well. We're guaranteeing there will be more than enough to go around."

Laurie smile widened. "So we're all just gonna go nuts today, huh?"

"There won't be a buttoned pair of pants in the house."

At that moment, the sliding door slid open, and in walked Hyde carrying a bag of groceries. "Okay, I couldn't find shiitake mushrooms, so I got Uncle Ben," he said, setting the bag on the counter.

"Thanks, Steven," Joanne said, already rooting through it.

Then Jackie came scurrying in with another bag, wrapped up in her coat. "Steven - when your girlfriend has a bag of groceries, you're supposed to carry it for her!"

Hyde shrugged. "I already had one. Felt like sharing."

Jackie glared at him and put the bag down on the counter before huffing away. "Come on, Laurie," she grumbled. "Let's go to your room."

Laurie allowed herself to be grabbed by the arm and dragged upstairs towards her old room. She wasn't surprised to see how bare it was, save for the old bed and make up table. Clearly, her mother had plans for this room. She'd already started making Eric's old room into a sewing room.

Jackie got out of her hat, scarf and overcoat. Laurie couldn't help but be impressed by what was hidden underneath. She was wearing a lovely dinner dress that had the loveliest bulge in the middle. Her pot belly had grown since she'd last seen it. She looked at least four months pregnant.

"God, Steven is so annoying sometimes! He doesn't know how to be a gentleman at all!"

Laurie rolled her eyes. "Yeah, how dare he expect you to carry a single bag of groceries!"

"Hey, I had a half-gallon of milk in mine! You don't think that's asking just a bit too much?"

"God, you must be out of shape if you're whining about that."

Jackie looked affronted, which just made her double chin more prominent. "I'll have you know I'm in perfect shape! I'm just... you know..."

Laurie playfully poked her friend's belly. "Round?"

Jackie swatted her away and put her hands over her stomach. "No... I mean, yes... I just... Ugh. Don't men just bug you?"

"Nope. Not really."

"Seriously? You and Fez never fight?"

"Well, sure, once in a while, but then we have makeup sex, and it's all over."

Jackie shook her head. "Man, who would've thought you and Fez would be the most stable couple ever?"

Laurie shrugged. "Definitely not me. But here we are."

Suddenly, there was a knock at the door, and they turned to see it creak open, and Donna looked inside. "Hey, Hyde said you were both in here."

"Donna, thank god," Jackie sighed with relief, walking over to her. "You will not believe the crap Steven puts me through!"

"Yeah, I heard about the single bag of groceries," Donna deadpanned, walking all the way in.

Now that they could all get a look at each other, Laurie noticed that Donna, while definitely dressed nicely, was also sporting some extra poundage since the last time they'd seen her - which, if remembered correctly, was just after their honeymoon back in May. She looked so utterly plump. Slightly bigger than Jackie, but not quite up to Laurie's girth. And unlike Jackie, who seemed to be gaining more in the gut, Donna was gaining a bit all over, but her ass was looking particularly voluptuous.

"Lookin' good there, Big D," Laurie remarked.

Donna blushed. "Yeah, well... More like Big DD now," she said, holding her massive boobs up for emphasis.

Jackie raised an eyebrow. "Still stress eating?"

"Kinda? I mean... things are starting to get better at school now. I just... I really like eating lately, y'know? Like, all the time. Lately, I've had this thing for Italian food, like pasta. And there are so many carbs in pasta, but it's so good. There's this little Italian place not far from campus. Eric and I go there once a week." She paused, sheepish, before adding, "And sometimes, I go there by myself. Their lasagna is amazing."

"Sounds nice," said Jackie. "Me, I didn't realize until lately, but I've got a serious sweet tooth. I've started keeping pints of ice cream in the deep freeze buried under all the popsicles and stuff. And oh my god, it's like I can never have enough doughnuts! There's this little bakery in town that makes the best doughnuts. I once got a dozen just to tide me over for a few days. I finished them all in two hours." She patted her stomach. "I swear, I've gained so much lately, I could probably beat Eric or Fez at arm wrestling. I mean, we'd have been pretty evenly matched before, but still..."

Laurie smirked. "I just can't get enough of everything," she said, running her hands up and down her side rolls. "There's so much food out there to choose from. I'm like the ultimate omnivore - a strict 'all-of-the-above' lady. I see it. I eat it. The end. It's just the best."

"Well, at least you're not picky," Donna chuckled. "Dinner's gonna be interesting, I take it."

"Oh, you better believe it. I've been training for weeks, in case you couldn't tell," she said, hefting her belly under her dress. "Trying to make my stomach stretch out more and more so I can eat myself into a coma."

"Well, that's a relief," said Jackie. "I was honestly worried I'd be the only porker at this party."

"Pfft! Are you kidding?" scoffed Donna. "I think we might as well face it, girls. We're fat chicks now. To hell with traditional body standards. We like good food, and nothing will stop us."

"Damn right," said Laurie proudly. "Now let's see about dinner, shall we?"
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Thanksgiving Day - Part I

choices: They can't wait and start raiding the deep freeze
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The three ladies made their way downstairs just as Hyde was opening the front door for Kelso, Brooke, Betsy and Brooke's mother. Laurie took a moment to observe the group. Kelso and Hyde were already talking about something stupid - as was their habit - while Brooke was greeting Mrs Forman and introducing her to her mother, but Mrs Forman was too busy fussing over Betsy to take much notice.

While the two men chattered and the two moms fawned, Laurie beckoned to Brooke to join them. Brooke patted her mom's shoulder and followed them into the kitchen. Right away, they saw the amount of food simmering on the stove and already laid out in front of them.

"Oh my god, this looks amazing," said Donna.

"Yeah, I mean, it's always amazing how it comes together every year, but man - your mom went into overdrive," agreed Jackie.

Laurie nodded. "Well, she's got extra help from Joanne this year. The two of them going at it together doubles the food output right there."

"And my mom has loads of food in tupperware containers waiting in the car," added Brooke with a knowing grin. "She was actually kind of happy to be cooking so 'little' this year."

"Oh god," laughed Donna. "We're all gonna have to be rolled out of here."

Brooke rubbed her own stomach. Even though she was no longer pregnant, it still protruded considerably, albeit in a much more flabby fashion. "God, you know, I was always kind of hoping to get back in shape after I gave birth, but it's like... I enjoy sitting around doing nothing, y'know? And mom helps so much with Betsy, and she's always doting on me... I feel like I'm going to just regain all the weight soon."

Laurie put an arm around her. "Welcome to the club."

Kitty suddenly came scurrying into the kitchen and started working again, taking things out of the oven and sticking things in the microwave. "Oh, girls, it's so wonderful having everyone over for Thanksgiving! I swear, we'll be swimming in leftovers for weeks!" She let out her trademark laugh before hurrying over to the fridge. "Oh dear, I think I got too much whipped cream... Oh well! We'll find a use for it!"

Donna peered into the fridge. "Mrs Forman, there's, like, ten cans in there."

"I know, I know. They were on sale. I wonder if it'll go good on turkey... Oh, never mind. That's what gravy is for. I swear, I must've made half a gallon of the stuff. Joanne keeps adding things, though, so that helps. And your mother, Brooke, brought some scrumptious-looking casserole. I hope she doesn't mind me interrogating her for the recipe later!" She laughed again before going back into master chef overdrive.

The girls all wisely decided to stand back for now. The wonderful odors wafting from the dishes before them were driving them each a bit insane. They decided they would hang out with the guys in the basement until it was time to start eating. But even as they departed, their bellies were rumbling. They compensated for their hunger by getting popsicles out of the deep freeze. Maybe they could tide them over until it was time to start eating.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Thanksgiving Day - Part II

1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
At last, the waiting was over, and it was time to partake in some Thanksgiving feasting. The tables were all put together throughout the living room, with plenty of room for everyone. They stared in amazement at the amount of food that sat upon the table. It was a wonder the tables weren't about to collapse under their immense weight. They all took their seats 'round the table, all couples paired off in their spots - Eric and Donna, Hyde and Jackie, Fez and Laurie, and Kelso and Brooke sat towards the end with Betsy's highchair between them.

Kitty had Red say grace, during which he thanked the lord for their health, their togetherness and for allowing football to be played on Thanksgiving, and then, it was time to eat.

For a moment, Laurie felt paralyzed. She'd dreamed of this moment for so long. Where was she supposed to start? But then, to her relief, Fez started spooning food onto her plate, and she began to relax, rubbing her stomach eagerly. It amazed her how hungry she was. She'd been holding back all day. The joy of what was to come had been exhausting. Now that it was actually here, it was like she was in a dream. So much food to consume.

She glanced around the table as she started getting food for herself. Donna was already piling on the extra food, while Jackie was pouring gravy all over everything she'd already accumulated. She glanced down at Brooke, who, while also tending to Betsy's needs, was also loading up on whatever she could reach. Kelso was actually being very attentive as he took over feeding their daughter so she could focus on food for a while. She licked her lips and continued piling stuff onto her plate. God, there must be eight different kinds of potatoes alone. She poured on the gravy and slathered on the butter. She fidgeted in her seat - her ass was slightly uncomfortable now that it had started spilling over the sides. Maybe next year, she'd need two chairs.

And that thought just made her even more excited, and that made her hungrier. She couldn't wait anymore. With an absolute heap of meat and sauces on her plate, she dug in.

Around the table, most of the adults were talking about what was going on in their lives. Kelso practically gushed about how things were going with Betsy, Bob and Joanne were talking about taking a cruise later in the year, Eric was doing well in college and on his way to becoming a teacher, and Hyde said the record store was doing great, even though with 1980 around the corner, he wasn't sure what to make of some of the more recent developments in music. Jackie, of course, was all over the new music, which just confirmed everyone's fears that it was crap.

Donna chipped in about her journalism major occasionally, but she was too focused on eating right now to care much. She worked so hard in college that it was fun to finally kick back and consume. She ate with a reckless abandon she hadn't known herself capable of.

Jackie was more or less silent as she consumed food herself. She had been smart not to put on anything too restricting. She knew what this holiday was about. She wasn't about to let her fabulous clothes get in the way of the glorious free for all laid out before her. A little turkey here, some butter-soaked cornbread there, a few spoonfuls of stuffing to the left, a gravy-drenched blob of mashed potatoes to the right... She was in hog heaven.

Brooke was putting in her fair share as well. Maybe it was from having to tend to a baby for the last few months, but she hadn't really had a lot of opportunity to eat much except snack food and whatever her mother got her. She relished the thought of consuming plenty of real food. God, there was a lot right now. She had a huge pile of turkey on her plate, and she was determined to eat as much of it as she could.

And so it went on, for what felt like hours. Huge portions of food going 'round and 'round, seemingly in a never-ending cycle. Once they'd made a sizeable dent in their plates, something else would be passed down that would prompt them to fill up the hole they'd made. Still so much more to eat, eat, eat.

One by one, the people seated around the table began to get full and finish. Everyone was content to stay at the table and chat, though, about whatever came to mind from current events to distant memories. And that was good, because the four girls were still stuffing their faces. There was still so much to eat. How could anyone be done yet? Cranberry sauce, scalloped potatoes, green beans, casserole, sausage, glazed ham, stuffing, potato salad, steamed carrots...

There was no end in sight!

But of course, all good things come to an end. One by one, they all began to have their fill. Brooke dropped off first, absolutely crammed full, with her face covered in cranberry sauce and gravy. A few minutes later, Jackie gave up next, pushing her at last empty plate away with a grunt, hands atop her now-enormous belly and a sleepy pout of on her face. Fifteen minutes later, Donna had had enough as well, letting out a quiet sigh as she reached under the table to cradle her overstuffed belly in her hands, rubbing it gently.

Now Laurie was the only one left. She made sure to laugh when everyone else laughed, like she was really engaged in whatever conversation or anecdote was taking place, but really, her mind was on keeping her plate full. The other girls kept watching her out of the corner of their eyes, keeping an eye on how much she ate. She just kept going back for more. More turkey, more stuffing, more potatoes. God, how many carbs could one girl consume? The bloated blonde babe was sweating and almost certainly slowing down, but there were no signs of stopping yet.

Laurie's stomach, meanwhile, was stretching to almost inhuman lengths. It was getting stretched to the point her loose dress was actually starting to feel tight. But she couldn't be done yet. There was still so much left. And she'd waited for this day - trained for this day - for so many weeks. She'd finally admitted it to herself that she was an utter and complete glutton. Before, she'd been obsessed with sex and having it no matter what. Now, she was obsessed with food and eating it no matter what. And she wasn't about to quit just because she was swollen like a beachball.

But then she felt something pressing against her stomach. Something smooth but hard. She peered down to find that it was the edge of the table. She'd actually eaten enough that her stomach was pressing against the edge of the table. She felt that tingling sensation downstairs as she realized just how sexy this was. But she also realized just how utterly stuffed she felt. Not to mention tired. All that turkey... crammed into this humongous stomach of hers. She finally laid down her fork, placing both hands atop her rock hard belly. That was easily the most she'd ever consumed. A cursory glance at the clock showed that it was an hour and a half later that when they'd all started. She'd been eating nonstop for a solid ninety minutes at least. She held back a burp and got as comfortable as she could. Good lord, even leaning back, her stomach was still pressing against the table.

She barely got a few minutes in to relax before the door suddenly burst open, and in walked Kitty with a tray of pumpkin pies.

"Okay! Who's ready for dessert?" she laughed.

All four girls sat up a little straighter at the word, and that just made their stomachs slosh slightly as their contents shifted. There was so much pie now. More than enough for everyone. And it smelled amazing. Looked delicious. Kitty took a can of whipped cream and put little dollops on each slice. Their mouths watered. And even better, scoops of ice cream were being placed alongside each slice that got passed down.

Donna, Jackie and Brooke each took a piece. They were so utterly stuffed, they weren't sure if they could do it. But dammit, it looked so good, they were going to try anyway. Just got to get those single slices down, and they'd be fine. Easier said than done, though. Getting each bite into their mouths was a challenge. All of them clutching their full bellies, rubbing them and taking deep breaths between each bite.

Laurie, of course, was hardly going to stop at just one. Not that it wasn't difficult for her to do, so dangerously overstuffed, but she was hardly going to give up. She took the first piece and slowly ate it, but then, as everyone was listening another one of her dad's war stories - just as good a sleeping potion as tryptophan - she managed to hook one of the pie tins with her fork and drag it closer. Still about three-quarters of pie left. She'd quickly make short order of that.

Donna, Jackie and Brooke all came out of their misery just long enough to glance up and notice what Laurie was doing. Good god, the woman was going to finish off an almost entire pie with a stomach as big and bloated as that?!

But Laurie was undeterred. She ate. No giving up. No fear. Just ate. Ate every last bit of pie. It took ten minutes, but she did it. The pie was soon completely and utterly consumed.

Laurie slumped in her seat again. This time, her stomach was so huge that it didn't just bulge against the table, it seemed to bulge onto the table a little bit. Maybe it was just the bad posture, but her stomach was so bloated, it was a miracle she hadn't exploded by now.

Kitty announced it was time to start cleaning up and put things away, shooing everyone away to sleep off their meals. Red and Bob both collapsed onto the couch to take a little nap. Eric, Hyde and Fez found themselves roped into helping with dish duty while Kelso stayed behind to help Brooke's mom put Betsy down for her nap.

That just left the four bloated females around the table, all clutching their bellies of varying sizes.

It was, in their opinion, a truly wonderful Thanksgiving.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Thanksgiving Day - Part III

1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was a long time before anyone felt like leaving the table. The four women just sat there, rubbing their bellies and quietly hiccuping or burping when the mood struck them. There were some feeble attempts to move, but none of them felt like it truly. They just leaned back in a stuffed stupor, silently wishing for the transporter beam from Star Trek to beam them up and put them to bed. That's what they needed - to lie down, propped up by pillows, and digest this insane onslaught they'd dared to call dinner.

Kitty and Joanne worked away at the wreckage of dinner, tidying away the dishes and leftovers. As she came over to take away Laurie's plate, Joanne winked broadly at the bloated blonde. "Impressive work," she whispered. "I remember a time when I could put that much away." She slapped her now-stuffed stomach for emphasis before departing.

Laurie didn't reply. She was too dazed. It was like being drunk, but somehow more... pleasant. She felt... cozy. Like, as if swallowing a bowling ball had made any stress completely melt away.

Donna, Jackie and Brooke all began to stir, however. They were a bit uncomfortable from sitting for so long and felt like moving. Red and Bob were still passed out on the sofa. The guys were by now down in the basement for a post-Thanksgiving "Circle". Kitty and Joanne were working in the kitchen. Not a lot of options except...

Upstairs.

The trio glanced at each other nervously across the table. They were to stuffed move upstairs. Definitely too drowsy. But they didn't want to stay down here for too long. They wanted to lie down and take a nap.

With a grunt, Donna decided to be the first one to try. She scooted her chair back and determinedly hoisted herself up, bracing against the chair, until she was finally back on her feet. She took a moment to stare at how enormous her stomach was. Probably twice as big as when she'd arrived. She let out a deep breath as she peered down at the rounded bulge, noting the rolls of fat creating a dent in it.

Jackie was next. The usually perky brunette moaned slightly as she hauled herself onto her feet. She was surprised by her knees knocking as she tried to summon the necessary strength. Her own stomach also seemed to have doubled in size, perfectly spherical, like she was pregnant with twins. Her dress looked like it was covering a beach ball. She held it in her hands, accentuating the curve and looked very pouty as she tried to soothe it.

Brooke struggled as well. While she hadn't been as big as them when she arrived, she was definitely looking pregnant again now. She had surprised herself with how much she'd put away. She had thought that her milk-engorged breasts would be causing her problems, but now she was even more in danger of tipping over forwards thanks to this gut of hers being so heavy.

The three of them looked at each other's stomachs in silent wonder. How were they capable of consuming so much in one sitting? How were they not exploding all over the place?

Then, all eyes fell to Laurie. They saw her, slumped in her chair, practically asleep. Her face was covered in various juices and sauces - although how she'd gotten through that without staining her clothes was nothing short of a miracle. She had both hands on her stomach, which looked as though it could double as a globe. A really big globe. It rose and fell with every labored breath. Her mouth hung open ever so slightly in a daze.

Realizing they couldn't just leave her there, all three women decided they would have to move her themselves.

God, this was gonna suck.

Donna came around and pulled Laurie's chair back, heaving her gut out from under the table, revealing it to be slightly bigger than it had seemed initially. Then, with Brooke's help, she lifted Laurie out of her seat, and they both draped an arm over their shoulders to help her stand.

With Jackie guiding them like she was guiding an airplane to the terminal, they all made their way for the stairs. It was a very long walk. Laurie was moaning quietly and not helping at all. Her massive stomach swung back and forth like a mighty wrecking ball with every step. Groaning and complaining, they waddled their way up the stairs towards Laurie's room.

It took almost twenty minutes, but they did it.

Jackie opened the door, and they all got inside. They got their shoes off and looked over the room. The bed was clearly big enough for two of them. Figuring that Laurie was in such a stupor that she wouldn't care where she slept, it was democratically decided three to one that she would sleep on the floor. Fortunately, Kitty had added several decorative pillows to the bed, so they laid her out on her back and placed a few under her head for support. Jackie and Brooke would share the bed, while Donna took the remaining pointless pillows to sleep on the floor as well. Fortunately, it was still the same plush carpeting as before, so it wasn't nearly as bad as it could've been.

The four bloated beauties lay in companionable silence. They were well and truly rooted to their respective spots. They lay perfectly still, not wanting to jostle their bellies too much.

From her spot on the floor, Donna discreetly lifted her dress to peer down at her overweight body. God, she had so many rolls. Like little hills and bunkers of fat. She ran her hands up and down them, enjoying the feeling as her fingers caressed every bulge of flab.

Jackie felt a small whimper in the back of her throat as she silently wished Steven were here to give her another belly rub. Of course, that would just make her want sex, and she was in no fit state to hold hands, never mind any hanky panky tomfoolery. God, she was practically pinned under this overstuffed stomach.

Brooke was still marvelling at her unbridled gluttony. She really hadn't expected that. But it had been so... liberating. She had always been the smart girl. The valedictorian. The brainy beauty. The sensible one. And now... she lay stuffed and bloated with three other women. How did this happen? She peered down at her rounded stomach and gave it a rub. Not that she minded. She liked these girls, and she liked the group. And she loved being able to eat all the time. Maybe she could put off losing the pregnancy weight for just a bit longer...

Laurie, meanwhile, had a brain full of mush. She couldn't think. Couldn't speak. Hell, she could barely breathe. This had been everything she hoped for and more. God, she was fat. If one small thought could work its way through her tryptophan-riddled brain and make itself known, it was that. She was so fat. And she was going to get even fatter after this. She wanted to feel like this all the time. So fat and bloated she couldn't move without assistance. That her stomach stuck straight up in the air, inflated like a balloon, filled with juicy delicious food that she had forced herself to eat. Until she had to be rolled away from the table. Until she got so wide she was wedged in the doorway.

She watched as her stomach towered over her. It rose and fell. It gurgled and sloshed as it struggled with digestion. She let a dopey smile split across her face. This was bliss. True heaven. To be so utterly gorged and fit to burst. To just lie here and gurgle away. She wanted to reach up and rub her stomach, but she couldn't get her arms to work. She felt so helpless.

And she loved it.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Thanksgiving Coma

choices: The girls force feed Laurie the rest
Someone hears the commotion and investigates
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Donna awoke some considerable time later, still feeling a bit bloated. She rolled over and was surprised to find a blanket covering her that hadn't been there when she fell asleep. Curious, she looked around the room, forcing her eyes to adjust to the darkness. She saw Laurie still on the floor, lying flat on her back, arms splayed out and her stomach still poking straight up like she'd swallowed a basketball, but she had a blanket over her, too. She could make out Jackie and Brooke passed out on the bed.

She lifted the blanket off and rolled over. She could feel the contents of her stomach sloshing as she moved. She stretched a kink out of her neck and dragged herself wearily over to the door. Getting to her feet, she peeked out side and saw the house was silent. But there was still a light coming from downstairs. She made her way down, relieved the task was easier now that she'd digested some of her massive dinner. When she got there, she saw the light was coming from the kitchen. She passed inside and saw Kitty in her curlers and nightgown, putting things away.

"Oh, Donna! There you are!" she said with a laugh.

"Hey, Mrs Forman... what time is it?"

"Oh, coming up on 11, I'm afraid. Just locking everything up. Did you want to go across to your dad's house?"

"Er... no, I'll stay in Laurie's room with the girls tonight for now. Where is everyone?"

"Well, Eric's asleep in his room. He saw you girls passed out upstairs and got you some blankets. Steven's in his room, Fez is asleep on the basement couch and Michael took Betsy and Brooke's mother home. They'll look after her until morning, and then he'll come back to pick up Brooke. He just didn't want to disturb her while she slept."

Donna smiled slightly at the thought of Kelso being considerate for a change. "Were you just going to bed?"

"Oh yes, are you going to stay up for a bit?"

"... Yeah, just a bit."

"Okay, just turn out the light when you're done. Goodnight, Donna!"

"Goodnight."

Kitty scurried off through the kitchen door and up the stairs.

Donna hung around for a moment. She didn't know what to do with herself, really. She could probably get some sleep on the living room couch now that it was unoccupied. Maybe join Eric in his room - although his bed probably wasn't big enough for both of them anymore.

Then, she felt her stomach rumble and realized she was kind of hungry. It amazed her that she could still be hungry after her gorge this evening. Still, she ought to eat something, otherwise she'd just wake up with a headache. She ventured over to the fridge to see if there was a snack or something inside.

She was greeted by at least nine cans of whipped cream.

Staring at them all in bewilderment, she quickly shut the door. No, she thought, don't even think it. She grabbed a cookie from a nearby jar and made her way back upstairs. She wasn't about to go down that road of gluttony again. She hurried, jiggling the whole way, back upstairs to Laurie's room. Maybe just a little too quickly, and a little too loudly.

She shut the door, but her commotion had caused the other three to stir. Jackie managed to find a bedside lamp and switch it on.

"What the hell is going on?" Jackie moaned.

"Sorry," whispered Donna. "Just... went for a cookie..."

"What time is it?" Brooke asked, wiping the cobwebs from her eyes.

"Nearly 11. Kelso took your mom and Betsy home. Should be back tomorrow, so you can stay the night."

"Oh... good..." Brooke looked around the room. "So... anyone else kinda... hungry?"

Jackie's eyes bulged. "Are you kidding?! After everything I ate tonight, you think I'm hungry?!"

"Are you?"

"... Okay, yeah, I am, but that's not the point!"

"Well...," Donna said. "There's plenty of leftovers."

"Ugh. No more turkey. I'd sooner starve than eat anymore of that."

Donna's mind flitted back to what she'd seen. "Well, it's either that or the nine cans of whipped cream in the fridge."

Jackie and Brooke stared at her. Even Laurie managed to sit up and look her in the eye.

"... Well...," said Brooke. "That's just ridiculous."

"Yeah! Exactly what I thought!"

"I mean, there's no point in even trying to consume all that whipped cream," added Jackie, sounding not very sure of herself.

"Not even a little," said Donna.

"So... we're not having any?" asked Brooke.

"Absolutely not."

"... Good..."

They all sat in silence for a moment, thinking about all that whipped cream. Sitting the fridge. Waiting for them. Calling for them.

At last, Donna found her voice. "You know what? I forgot to turn off the light in the kitchen. I'll go do that."

Jackie heaved herself out of bed. "I'll help you!"

"Same here!" agreed Brooke, just barely making it to her feet.

"Wait, I'll help, too!" cried Laurie.

But the other three didn't stop. They scurried downstairs. Laurie was forced to struggle her way onto her feet. Her stomach was still swollen from her holiday gorge. It took a lot of rocking back and forth to get her into a sitting position. Then she had to roll over onto her hands and knees so she could use the bedpost to brace herself, forcing herself onto her feet. Her stomach weighed a ton, and she wasn't even remotely hungry, but she just had to get after them. Practically carrying her stomach in her hands, she waddled awkwardly after them.

Donna, Jackie and Brooke made it quietly to the kitchen, not daring to make a sound, lest they wake anyone else up. That would just spoil the whole thing. What was the point of midnight snacking if everyone knew about it? The element of secrecy just made it more fun. The pulled open the fridge door, and there they were. Nine glistening cans of whipped cream.

"Well!" said Donna. "Are we going to bother with the pretense, or...?"

"Oh, just move over," grouched Jackie, reaching into the fridge and pulling out a can, shaking it up a bit.

Donna and Brooke did the same.

The door opened, and in waddled Laurie, out of breath. "Don't you dare start without me," she whined, still holding her stomach in her hands.

"Are you sure you should have any?" Brooke asked, regarding her friend's protruding stomach. "You already had a lot to eat at dinner. More than any of us."

Laurie smirked despite herself. "Oh, honey, when it comes to dessert, there's always room in my stomach. Now pass me a can. Let's get our 'chug' on."

Donna shrugged and tossed her a can, which she deftly caught. She joined them in shaking the cans up for a while before they popped the tops and put the nozzles in their mouths, like throwing back a bunch of beers. The creamy white goodness filled their mouths, and they gulped them down.

Jackie finished her first guzzle. "Awwww, yeah, that's the stuff," she sighed.

Brooke licked her lips. "It's moments like this that make me worry I'm going to be a bad influence on Betsy."

"Oh, please. Kelso's got that totally covered," laughed Donna. "Overeating is nowhere near as dangerous as falling off the water tower."

"Take your point." Brooke chugged even more cream.

They continued to consume the cream for a long time. Not saying a word. Just chugging it all down. It took a while, seeing as how Kitty had gotten the extra large cans.

Donna, Jackie and Brooke had to pause for a bit at times for air, plus rubbing their stomachs. They were beginning to get full again. Their stomachs were becoming taught and firm once more.

Laurie, however, just kept going. Even breaths. Steady pace. Just let it slosh and swish down her throat, adding to the monstrous pile of content within her growing gargantuan gut. She kept rubbing it in concentric circles, honestly feeling like she could pop at any moment, and that was enough to make her continue. She moaned softly as it forced its way down.

All too soon, the other girls had to call it quits as their respective cans ran out. Donna, Jackie and Brooke lowered the empty containers and staggered a bit, leaning against whatever was convenient - the fridge, the counter, the table - as their stomachs sloshed with their new load.

"Ughhhh...," moaned Jackie, rubbing her beach ball belly. "I'm probably going to have to go up another size once this is all over."

"Well, on the bright side - shopping trip," Donna reminded her.

Jackie lit up. "Ooooh yeah! I can go down to the mall and see if they - ugggggghhhh... Don't get me excited! My tummy's too full for thinking about a shopping spree!"

Brooke chuckled. "Man, that hit that spot," she groaned, running both hands on either side of her belly. "All topped off."

Laurie had finished hers as well. She made absolutely sure it was fully depleted before setting it aside and waddling over to the fridge. She pulled out another one of the remaining five and started shaking it.

The others looked at her, aghast.

"You're not serious," said Jackie flatly.

"Deadly serious," replied Laurie in a husky voice. "It's all about finding your limits. And then surpassing them until you just can't anymore. And then surpassing that, as well." She flicked off the cap and started chugging once again.

The other three stared at her in open shock. How as she doing this? They watched as she rubbed her stomach, which seemed to actually be getting visibly bigger by the second. Her wrinkled dress was smoothing out its creases around her midsection, and she still showed no signs of stopping.
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: Midnight snack!
