1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
With their own bellies filled to the brim to be comfortably stuffed, Donna, Jackie and Brooke watched in silent fascination as Laurie downed her second can of whipped cream. On top of the first one. And both of those on top of the massive Thanksgiving feast she'd just had. Her stomach seemed to actually be growing right before their eyes. She was rubbing it soothingly, moaning softly as she swallowed down more and more whipped cream.

Brooke found her voice. "Should... should we do something?"

Jackie shrugged helplessly. "Like what? Get a mop after she blows up?"

"Well, I mean... stopping her seems like a good idea."

"I'm not sure. She seems rabid right now."

"That's not foam, Jackie," Donna pointed out.

"I know, I know, but still. I don't feel safe going over there right now."

"Well, we ought to do something! Otherwise, she's going to make herself sick!"

Then, Laurie's knees buckled and she clutched her stomach. For a silly moment, the girls thought she really was going to explode. But she simply sank into one of the chairs by the table, leaning back as she finished off the second can. When she let it fall from her mouth, she let out a gasp for air, patting her taught stomach and letting out a belch.

Jackie tried to look nonchalant. "... Better?"

Laurie licked the remnants of the whipped cream off her lips. "... More... I wan' more..."

Brooke's jaw dropped. "You can't be serious!"

"Very serious...," Laurie gasped, fanning herself. "I want more... I just... can't move right now..."

Jackie rolled her eyes and made for the fridge.

"What are you doing?!" exclaimed Brooke.

"Getting her more. What else?"

"Jackie, she'll just barf all over you," Donna warned.

"Oh yeah? Well, let's see if this bitch's stomach really can handle anything."

Laurie licked her lips and smiled devillishly. "Good girl, Jackie. Bring it here."

She held out her hand but Jackie shook her head as she shook the can and popped the top. "Oh, no. We're doing this my way."

She tilted back Laurie's unsuspecting forehead and plugged the whipped cream into her mouth, squeezing the nozzle and letting it spray straight down her throat. The older blonde was momentarily stunned, but then, she felt pleased. Not just pleased. Pleasured. She moaned heavily as the cream continued to pour into her expanding stomach. She rubbed it with both hands now, feeling it grow like a balloon. A cream-filled balloon.

Donna and Brooke watched in amazement.

"How is she doing this?" Brooke demanded.

"I don't know...," Donna murmured. "But now... I'm intrigued." She went to the fridge and got out another can of whipped cream and started shaking it.

"Donna!" exclaimed Brooke.

Donna shrugged. "We're gonna find her limits. She's gotta give up at some point."

It took a few minutes, but soon, Jackie's can was emptied, and Laurie was slightly bigger than when she'd started. She lifted up her dress and rubbed her bare belly, which looked like it was pregnant with triplets now.

"Ready for your next one?" Jackie asked, faux-sweetly.

Laurie nodded, tired but still eager. "I wan'... more...," she slurred, clearly food drunk.

Donna smiled excitedly, like she was embarking on something terribly naughty, before she scurried over and started feeding Laurie her next batch. She watched as she gulped it down, moaning in ecstasy. She could only imagine what it must be like, to be stuck like this, being force fed an endless stream of sweet goodness. She briefly wondered if Eric would ever go for this kind of thing when they got back to Madison...

All too soon, the whipped cream ran out. Fortunately, Jackie had gotten the next one. Laurie moaned as she began to consume it, but at no point did she indicate for the others to stop. While she rubbed her stomach, Donna began rubbing it as well, curious as to what it felt like. It was rock hard. Tightly packed. Not even the tiniest of jiggles. Her stomach was officially as rock hard round as a bowling ball.

Meanwhile, Brooke just watched all of this, having absolutely no idea of what to do. What kind of crazy Thanksgiving was this? All this gluttony was ridiculous. No shame. No realization of how bad this was. And this was bad. Soooooo bad. The kind of bad thing that a sensible smart librarian shouldn't be engaged in.

And maybe that's why she took out the remaining spray can of whipped cream from the fridge and started shaking it up.

By now, Laurie was enormous. That stomach of hers must've expanded to twice the size it'd been when she'd started. She looked very nearly comatose. There was the faint glisten of tears in her eyes from the pain she must've been in. Her head lolled back like a wet rag. Both hands rest atop her swell. She didn't seem aware of her surroundings anymore.

Brooke stood over her, uncertain. "Laurie...?" she ventured. "This is the last can. The very last. Do you want it? Just say so."

Laurie didn't seem to hear her, and for a moment, the girls considered stopping. But then, the beached blonde made a sound that took them all off-guard.

"... More..."

Brooke blinked, astonished. "More?!"

"I... want.... more...."

Donna and Jackie looked at Brooke.

"Well?" asked Jackie. "What're you waiting for?"

Feeling like she was teetering on the precipice, Brooke took a chance and put the nozzle in Laurie's mouth, gently squeezing, being careful to keep the flow slow and gentle. Laurie let out a moan of pleasure that sounded like half-joy half-sob. The tears were really pouring from her eyes now. God, she must be in agony.

Donna and Jackie knelt at her side to help her rub her belly. They could swear they could feel it stretch from how much was packed inside. How was she not getting sick from all of this? What was keeping it all in? It was incredible.

It was at least seven minutes before Brooke depleted the very last of the whipped cream.

Laurie laid there for a long time, sprawled in the chair, legs splayed apart, and her big ol' gut plopped out over the waistband of her panties, which were looking like they'd rip off at any time.

Donna cleared her throat. "Laurie...? You okay?"

Laurie slowly lifted her head to look them in the eye. Her mouth hung open in a super-stuffed-stupor. Then, to their alarm, her eyes widened as she seemed to realize something was going to happen, and their heard a loud gurgle come from that enormous pale orb she called a stomach. They all involuntarily took a step back, thinking all that whipped cream was about to come back.

Instead, Laurie let out one of the biggest burps they had ever heard in their lives, causing them all to leap into each others arms in terror before they realized what was happening.

When the belch ceased, Laurie let out a sigh of relief and smiled happily. "Ohhhh, that's so much better," she moaned. "Ugh... that was just... Oh my god, girls, that was... so... amazing...! Makes me wanna... ooh... go downstairs and wake up Fez and just have him on that ratty old sofa."

Jackie crinkled her nose. "Ewwwww..."

Laurie hiccuped before patting her engorged stomach. "Oh, man... So stuffed... God, I'm full."

"I can imagine you are," said Brooke, looking her over. "It'll be a miracle if you can even move."

Laurie snorted. "Pfft! Who cares about moving? If nothing else, I'll be on time for breakfast tomorrow."

"How can you want breakfast at a time like this?!" demanded Donna.

"Well, I don't want it now! Duh! I'll probably want it more in the morning... Ugh, this chair isn't all that comfortable, though... Come on, let's get me to upstairs."

"How the hell are we supposed to do that?" Jackie whined.

Laurie held out both arms with a patronizing expression. "Well, getting me on my feet would be a good start."

After a group eye roll, the girls reluctantly helped Laurie to her feet. Her stomach sloshed from the movement, causing her to hiccup again.

It took even longer to get her back upstairs in the condition she was in. It was almost midnight by the time they made it. Working carefully and gently, they lowered her to the floor up against some pillows and laid her out. Her stomach stuck straight up in the air like a mound of flesh. She rubbed it and let out a small moan.

"Thank you, girls," she swooned sleepily. "This... has been the absolute best Thanksgiving ever..."

"Glad we could help," sighed Donna, giving the other girl's stomach a gentle pat before heading back to her blankets.

"Ought to do it again next year," added Jackie sardonically.

"Why wait til next year? I'm free next Wednesday!"

"Good night," snapped Brooke, thudding back down on the bed.

Laurie shrugged and continued to contentedly rub her stomach. So huge. Enormous. And so full. She wasn't sure if it would be right to start masturbating right here in the room with the others drifting off to sleep, but dammit, she wanted to so bad. She tried to reach down there and try, but dammit again, she could reach around her stomach when it was this swollen. Pouting in the dark, she tried to get comfortable. She looked forward to being back in her own bed tomorrow night. With her Fez by her side. She'd have to stuff herself again just so she could enjoy him rubbing her belly like it was now...
1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.title: The girls force feed Laurie the rest

1331112112111111111111111111111111111111.content:
And so came the end of the 70s. It had a been a wild ride in Eric Forman's basement.

Everyone had gathered for New Year's Eve. It was one of their favorite holidays. Mainly for all the booze. The roll on into 1980 would not be remembered. Everyone had come over. Absolutely everyone. Even a recently-returned Leo, much to their delight.

The guys were down in the basement, having one last circle to salute the brain cells they'd all toasted during the 70s. The adults had all broken into their little mingle groups. Kitty, of course, was drunk off her housewife ass.

So that just left the girls in the kitchen, making short order of the snacks and goodies lying around.

Since Thanksgiving had ended a month ago, their appetites had only increased, and they were steadily getting used to copious amounts of overeating. Lots of fatty snacks, greasy meals, sugary sweets and so on were constantly passing their lips and into their eager bellies.

Donna continued her love of carbs. Lots of pasta and bread items. She was a constant visitor at the Italian restaurant near campus and continued to frequent it to the point the servers all knew her name and what she would order based on the day. Her waistline had paid the necessary toll for such indulgence, but it was her ass that was accumulating most of the weight. It wasn't a problem, aside from finding pants that fit for long. She had to wear sweats a lot. Still, Eric didn't seem to mind the extra poundage, and he was always eager to grab her ever-widening seat when the opportunity arose. Only in private, of course. He was a gentleman, after all.

Jackie's sweet tooth had more or less dominated her life. If it was sweet, she wanted it. She always grabbed a candy bar or three at the check out line. She stopped off for ice cream on the way home from work almost daily. She even had a special stash in her bedroom that was just for her. Plenty of Twinkies, Ding Dongs, Nutty Bars, M&Ms, Kit Kats... It had to be kept in a very large cardboard box beside her bed, and she was constantly adding and subtracting to and from it. She carried most of her weight in her belly. It was nice and round without a single fold, making her look very pregnant. Whenever she ate her fill, to the point where she couldn't even breathe from being so stuffed, she could always rely on her Steven to rub any pain away.

Brooke was the thinnest of the bunch, but that wasn't saying much. Her baby weight never went away, and it only accumulated after that, especially in her bosom, much to Kelso's obvious delight. That wasn't to say the rest of her wasn't doing a good job expanding as well. She was discovering a healthy appreciation for meat. Kelso was very good at cooking and grilling things like pork chops and chicken, having been practically raised on it, and he was always eager to cook for her. She wasn't about to complain. And he was still a very attentive father to Betsy, making her wonder why she had ever doubted him. Who would've thought getting knocked up at a Molly Hatchet concert would be a good life choice for her?

Laurie was, of course, the biggest and proudest of them all. While the other three were content to just gain weight as it came, she was actively achieving it. While they all had personal preferences, she preferred all of the above and more. Always more. It was never enough for her. Gotta eat it all. Munch and guzzle and slurp and gulp. Stretch that belly out so it could more. She had gained a good five pounds from Thanksgiving alone, and it was only increasing. She was certain she would be at 300 pounds sometime in the next year. She didn't know what her plan was after that, but she was going to enjoy the ride. Her belly was enormous - so large that it forced her legs apart when she sat down. She was gigantic. It was a wonder to some people she could still move.

But she was content with her life. Properly content for the first time in years. She was married to Fez, a man who adored her and treated her like a queen - and always bringing her food. She had a good job that paid well, enabling her to continue her fattening lifestyle. She had repaired relations with her family, finally having stepped up and helped out when they needed her, thereby helping them achieve their happiness. Plus, now she had real friends - friends that she could count on and talk to and, more importantly, eat with. She never would've guessed that her younger brother's loser friends would be the social circle she had unknowingly needed.

She contemplated all of this as she and the girls finished off every last scrap of food that had been set out. The reasoned that everyone would be too drunk to care at this point, so no point in wasting it. All the chips, cookies, cheese and crackers had been consumed. Jackie had even devoured an entire bowl of guacamole - some of it still smeared on her face. All four girls leaned back in their seats around the table, bellies full and protruding out from under their respective tops.

Donna sipped a glass of champagne. "So...," she sighed, rubbing her taut gut. "Plans for the new year? Anyone?"

Jackie sipped her own glass as well. "Gonna apply at the TV station for that internship. Then slowly claw my way up to the top and become a producer."

"Gonna Mary Tyler Moore this bitch?" Laurie smirked.

"You know it," Jackie replied, giving her a high five. "And at some point, I'm going to drag Steven Hyde's ass down the goddamn aisle and marry him. Just gotta get him onboard first."

"Oh, please, he's totally onboard," laughed Donna. "He's been probing me about jewelry all month."

"Oh my god, are you serious?! Oh my god...!"

"So now that we've established that you're living 'happily ever after'...," droned Laurie, "... how about you, Brooke?"

Brooke held her own glass in one hand and rubbed her bloated stomach with the other. "Oh, I dunno...," she drawled, clearly a bit tipsy. "Gonna enjoy every moment of my Betsy-boo while she's still small... Gosh, she's so teeny-tiny... How do babies do that? Be so little?"

Jackie rolled her eyes. "Brooke, you know I love my god-daughter, but holy crap on a cracker, do you have the baby goggles on."

"Yeah, where everything your baby does is amazing because it's your baby," Donna added. "Happens to all new mothers."

Brooke harrumphed indignantly, but the harrumph gave way to a belch, ruining the effect and causing her to pout. The others chuckled.

"And what's up with you and Kelso?" Laurie asked slyly. "Things still good between you two?"

A small smile split Brooke's face. "Yeah... things are real good. He's talking about moving to Chicago so we can get a place together."

"Awwwwwwww!!" the girls swooned drunkenly.

"How 'bout you, Laurie?" Donna asked, her glass now empty. "Any plans for the 80s?"

Laurie shrugged. "Same ol', same ol'... Kinda hard to plan for the future when I'm so happy in the present, y'know? Got my Fezzie, got my home, got my job, got my constant barrage of fabulous food... What more can a fat girl want?"

The others rolled their eyes. "That's right. Show off, why don't'cha?" Jackie slurred, already looking for more to drink.

At that moment, all the guys came walking up from the basement.

"Huh boy, look at this mess," Eric sighed playfully. "Told ya we shouldn't have left them alone together."

"Kiss my ginormous fat ass," laughed Donna drunkenly.

"What, here? In front of everyone?"

"Ugh, why don't you burnouts go back downstairs?" Jackie groused.

"It's almost midnight," Hyde replied, putting a hand on her shoulder. "Time to say goodbye to the 70s."

Jackie looked touched. "Awwww, and you wanted to spend the first moments of the new decade with me?"

"And there's beer up here." She gave him a swat in the stomach for that.

"Still kinda bummed we're almost to the 80s and there hasn't been a moonbase or anything yet," Kelso added. "I mean, it's only twenty years until 2000 gets here. It's gonna be a rush to get all those flying cars in the air!"

Brooke bit back a smile. "Michael, we've been over this..."

Kelso rolled his eyes. "I know, I know, it breaks the laws of physics, but still...!"

Kitty popped her head in the door. "Kids! Come on! Only a minute left! Then the balls drop! Oops! I meant 'ball'! Sorry. Little too much champagne. Aha ha ha ha ha!" She ducked back into the living room.

Eric sighed fondly. "Another Forman family tradition is upheld." He took Donna's hand and helped her to her feet and into the living room.

Hyde and Kelso did the same for Jackie and Brooke, and they ventured into the next room as well.

Fez, of course, had to grapple with Laurie, who was much heavier than the others. He tugged on her arms, and she pushed against the chair with all her might, until finally, she was upright and ready for motion. He playfully jiggled her stomach.

"Looks like my little beluga whale enjoyed herself this evening."

Laurie smirked devilishly at him. "Come on," she said. "When the new year starts, my lips better be on yours, and those hands better be groping my ass."

"Only if you do the same for me."

"Deal."

She waddled after him through the door. She let out a small yelp as she was briefly wedged between the door and the frame, but Fez deftly popped her free.

The seconds ticked away, and the 70s faded into the past.

Laurie looked around the room of friends and family. With a belly full of food and her husband's arms around her, she knew the 80s would be kick ass. 300 pounds would be a cakewalk.

And now she wanted cake...

As the clock struck twelve, she leaned her lips into Fez's and kissed him, and indeed, she felt his hands digging her to thick juicy ass.

Goodnight, Wisconsin

It was Friday night and Inara was sat in her quarters, which were dark apart from a few candles placed around on various surfaces providing some small light. Captain Renalds had insisted that Serenity run with minimal power, due to the ever increasing threat of the Alliance and so most of the lights on the ship had been turned off, much to everybodys annoyance. Inara ran a brush through her amazing dark hair, pulling it away from her face and letting it fall gracefully over her shoulders. She was still brooding over Mals latest insult he had offered her way earlier that day, as he had referred to her as a prostitute (which she was, but she loathed the term) and also said that she dressed like a 'genie', in reference to her fine silk, belly dancer style clothing. Truth be told there had been a lot of tension on the ship of late not only between her and Mal, there seemed to be clashes happening almost daily, as everybodys tempers began to fray due to their predicament. Jayne was fighting Mals orders at every turn, as he longed to be rid of the 2 fugitives they had aboard (who were the reason for the Alliances attention), but every time the pair came to blows Mal always had his way leaving Jayne to sulk some more. Inara was getting frustrated that she was unable to find work anywhere due to the fact that they never stayed anywhere for long enough for her to even find a client, but this didn't seem to bother Mal; on the contrary Inara believed he preferred it that way. Inara stood and examined herself in the mirror but not out of vanity, she was just making sure that she looked the best she could as all companions must keep themselves properly. Standing at 5ft 7 weighing only 106 pounds Inara was astonishingly beautiful, her skin was golden and soft and her figure was trim and perfect. It was no wonder why her clients often fell in love with her, and also no wonder why Mal harbored secret affections for her.

What happens next?

142111.content:
Inara was brought from her slight trance by movement outside her room.

"What do you want?" She called out moodily, knowing exactly who it was.

Sure enough Captain Reynolds poked his head round the corner, and Inara rolled her eyes in annoyance.

"Just thought I'd inform you that we're gonna be landing soon" He said simply.

"Oh, will I actually be able to find a client on this landing?" She said, the hostility showing in her voice "Or is it a a 20 minute landing, a fight, and a hasty exit like last time?"

"You know how Jayne gets after a couple of whiskeys" Mal said simply, "If that guy hadn't of given him the hairy eyeball, I'm sure that guy would still have his eyeball"

Inara looked uninterested at Mals attempt at humour so Mal moved on quickly.

"If all goes well this could be a long stay, we need work to you know. I'm sure you'll have enough time to... do... what you do..." He trailed off at the end deliberately, and Inara narrowed her eyes at him.

"Well good then, if that is all you may now leave" She said.

Mal stared at her for a few moments before turning on his heel and leaving the room, leaving Inara glaring after him. Although she refused to show it to Mal this news had actually brightened her spirit considerably. It had been many weeks, possibly even months, that her and the crew had been allowed to get away from the ship for more than an hour and she thought it would do them all a lot of good.

What happens next?

1421111.content:
Before landing on the planet, Inara checked the video monitor to see if there were any potential companion clients on the large, wealthy planet they were about to land on. She was disappointed to learn that Mal was landing his ship on one of the few planets in the verse' where enlisting the services of a Companion was taboo, although not illegal. "Dang you, Mal!", Inara thought to herself. Sure enough, only one potential client came up on the screen: A wealthy, good-looking, eloquent and well-mannered man named Sloan. Considering the client's good looks and charm, and the Companion taboo on this planet, Inara wondered why Sloan would want, or have need of, a companion to fulfill his "needs". A look at the client's requested services showed the answer: He liked to see skinny women eat large amounts of food and.gain weight. "I'm NOT doing that!" Inara thought out loud. "I'll wait till the next planet we land on. I can't ruin my perfect figure!" Unfortunately, Inara's predicament would not be that easy to get out of...

Several Hours After Landing....

While she was spending time with her fellow crew members in a pub on the planet, Mal walked up to the crew with a troubled look on his face. "Well, I have got some good news, and some bad news," Inara rolled her eyes. "Just tell us what's going on..." Mal gave Inara a serious look, and she added,"Captain Reynolds." He continued, "the good news is, I gave our clients the supplies, they ordered, and they even gave us more money for getting them here early, enough to pay for the parts we need for Serenity, and feed the whole crew for about six months!" "We need to work for generous, wealthy people more often!" Kaylee exclaimed, clearly exited at the prospect of finally getting Serenity back into prime condition. "What's the bad news?" Zoe asked. Mal sighed. "We can't fly anymore without the parts we need, and there being shipped her from about halfway 'cross the 'verse. It will take about a month or so for them to get here. Until then, we can't go anywhere!" The other crew members did not seem to upset with that prospect. After all, this was a nice planet, and they had not been planet side for any significant length of time for months. Inara, however, was very concerned. She would have to be Sloan's Companion now, and for a whole month, no less! She couldn't leave the planet, and if she did not get another Client for a whole month, she could be dropped from the Companion's guild! Therefore she had no chose but to take Sloan on as a client, fulfill his strange request for a month, and try to lose weight before she had another client, there was simply no way out of it! Reluctantly, Inara said goodbye to her friends and told a surprised Mal that she had to be on "client business" until they left the planet. Without another word, Inara left for Sloan's estate...

At the Estate...

Sloan immediately ran out to greet Inara as soon as she entered his grounds. He was just as good-looking and mannerly as his view-screen message had made him look. "So pleased you could join me, Inara! I have tried to get others Companions to visit, but they did not like my....alternative preferences. I do hope that fulfilling my requests won't cause you any discomfort. I know that you are only here for a month, but, full disclosure, I plan to make you as plump as I can!" Sloan signaled his request pat Inara's slender stomach, and she reluctantly nodded in agreement before he did so. She decided if she had to do this, it would be better for both Sloan and herself if she pretended to enjoy the prospect of being fattened. "Actually, I had always wondered what it would be like to just let go, eat whatever I want, and get fat, but I didn't want to lose my position as a companion! This should be quiet fun!" Inara lied. Sloan almost lit up at the prospect, "In that case, we will have to feed you even more than I anticipated this month!" Come now. let me show you to your dining room and bedroom!" "Are they next to each other?" Inara asked, puzzled. Sloan laughed. "Let me show you!" He led Inara to a very large room that was already filled with exotic foods from around the verse', both Alliance-controlled and "Independent"(well, kinda) worlds! A little under four hours later, Serenity was landing on the planet. Inara had found her client; a kind man named Richter, who she immediately set out to meet after a hurried goodbye to her ship mates. Her and Richter had liaised before, and she always enjoyed his company so she was quite looking forward to their engagement. She found Richter waiting for her at a nearby market, and she smiled at him as she approached.

"Hello Richter" She said, the warmth in her voice genuine.

"My Inara... you look so beautiful!" He said, and she smiled sweetly at the compliment.

The pair left arm in arm, heading towards Richter's luxurious home. After a short walk they found his place at the top of a steep hill, it's white walls noticeable from a long distance away.

"Wow" Said Inara, "I forgot how beautiful your home was"

"Not nearly as beautiful as you my dear" Said Richter, kissing her neck and she giggled.

The house stood 3 stories high and was bathed in the shadows from the orchard that surrounded it. The orchard was bustling with activity as Richter's workers worked hard picking apples from the many trees which were then packed for distribution. Richter was a very wealthy man, though his wealth didn't come from his orchards as they were there specifically to provide for the markets. Richter led Inara inside through the huge main doors into the extravagant entrance hall, where they were greeted by some of Richter's house staff. Richter looked at them, before checking up and down the hall.

"Where is Christine?" He asked.

"She was right behind us, I'm not sure where she went" Replied a rather severe looking old woman.

Little did Richter know that "Christine" (who had also operated under the names "Saffron", "Bridget" and "Yolanda") was watching the group keenly from a small hole in the wall. She had seen Inara approaching the great estate and as soon as she had her mind quickly turned to revenge. "Christine" was actually a very successful con artist, who had been thwarted on two separate occasions by Inara and her ship mates of the Serenity. Before Inaras arrival she was planning to steal Richter's fortune, but upon seeing Inara her plans immediately changed. Inara would pay for the humiliation she had exacted on her she thought with an evil smile.

Christine watched with amusement, hidden behind a nearby wall, as Inara stormed onto the ship. The rest of the crew followed and when they were all gone Christine jumped the wall and ran to the ship. She had previously stowed away on Serenity, and during that time she had familiarized herself with some of the ships secret hiding spots. One such spot was located on the far side of the ship and it allowed an entrance to the cargo area which she now used hurriedly before Serenity took off. The next day Inara awoke in her private cabin and whilst stifling a yawn scanned the room blearily. She discovered that she was fully dressed, a fact that confused her a little and she tried her best to recall what had happened the day previous.

"Uhh.. What..." She wondered aloud in confusion, frowning slightly as she poked at the slight bump at her midriff which she couldn't decide was just her own imagination or not.

She found that her memory was incredibly cloudy and vague, almost like she were trying to recall a dream lurking just behind the memory centre of her brain and she frowned as she tried to remember something useful. Her attempt was in vain, because try as she might she just couldn't remember anything though little did she know that her crew mates could have filled her in on some very interesting developments. After eating every member of the crews breakfast yesterday, Inara had fallen asleep and been left in the med bay while the rest of the crew went about their daily business. It hadn't taken long for Inara to awaken again, and when she had done she was just as ravenous as she had been before without anybody around to stop her. Over the period of the day Inara had made a serious dent in the crews food reserves, to the point where Jayne had suggested that they should just lock her in her private quarters before she had eaten everything they had. With some difficulty, and with a greater use of team work than the crew often managed to display they managed to pull the gluttonous beauty from their precious food reserves and carry her to her own quarters, which she was promptly locked in. Inara had then fallen into a serious coma, which is what she had just awoken from now. She groggily rose from her bed, but before she could further investigate the feeling of hunger began to rise inside of her once more. It wasn't long before Inara had lost all of her facilities and her mind became fixed on very simple, almost animalistic agenda; eating. She headed towards the door of get quarters, but no matter how hard she desperately pulled at the handle it wouldn't budge. She was about to throw herself at it in an attempt to break it down but somewhere deep within her brain a thought came to her. Under her bed she had a large box, which contained all the gifts and presents which had been brought for her by her satisfied clientele over the years. These gifts were very luxurious, and often quite expensive, but the important thing for her right now was that there were alot of tasty treats amongst the jewellery and perfumes. In her normal state of mind Inara would never have dreamed of eating these, as despite how luxurious they were they were incredibly calorific and being in the line of work that she was she couldn't risk the slightest fluxuation in her weight. This discipline had been long forgotten by this point however and Inara now practically flung herself under her bed, tearing at the box and flinging any inedible items over her shoulder carelessly. The edible morsels she found were shovelled into her greedy maw and she moaned in pleasure at the glorious and complex flavors she experienced. There was at least 9000 calories worth of treats in the box, but even so it disappeared all too quickly and when it had Inara wasn't even close to being satisfied.

"What??! Fay-Fay duh pee-yen!" Growled Inara in mandarin at the blinking red light and alarming noise that proceeded it, indicating her shuttles low fuel reserves.

Inaras options were basically take her shuttle to this dark and seedy place or return to Serenity, the latter being obviously the best option but due to Inaras ravenous hunger she was not currently operating very logically. Suddenly her grumbling belly made the decision for her, as there was going to be more food on this planet than there would be on Serenity and at present that was the only factor that mattered.

.....

"Welcome to Talingo" She said "Are you here for business or pleasure?"

"Food" Inara blurted out

"My name is Lana" Said the woman, breaking the silence "What is yours?"

"Inara" Inara replied, breaking out of hunger trance for a moment "Where are you taking me?"

"Oh just to my own personal premises" Said Lana, in a off hand and deliberately vague manner "You will be well looked after there I assure you... And you'll be well fed of course"

The promise of being fed overruled any misgivings Inara had about the situation and the two continued through the 'entertainment' hub of the planet. Heads turned at the sight of such a well kept and beautiful woman walking through the back streets as she followed Lana to her premises.

Lana lead Inara through to a large and lavish dining area, which was empty and quiet in stark contrast with the bustling sexual activity of every other room.

With a seductive grace she held the pole and got to work for the hooting crowds. 145332222111.content:
Like most of Greendale's facilities, the classroom set aside for economics wasn't exactly top of the line. It had been crudely converted from an old science lab, with Bunsen burners next to the mixers, beakers and test tubes interspersed between the bowls and other crockery. This didn't bother Annie however, who was almost giddy with excitement.

"This is going to be so great, a class with just us, no Abed, Pierce, Jeff or Troy." Annie said happily, rubbing her hands together.

Britta nodded sceptically. "I wish we could have picked something slightly more inspiring than a baking class..."

"Come on now Britta, this isn't about your precious gender roles, this is about an easy A!" Shirley scolded her. "Now, where's the professor?"

"Wassup, bitches!?" An all too familiar voice rang out from behind them, causing them to jump.

"Chang? What in the hell are you doing here?" Shirley asked, turning to face their diminutive nemesis.

"That's Señor Professor Chang, Miss Bennett."He smirked, holding up a framed certificate. " I'm an accredited baking teacher!"

"No. Way." Britta gasped, her mouth dropping open.

"Yes way, Miss Per-ray! Turns out a two week online course and a one time payment of three hundred dollars is all it takes!"

With that, Chang pushed passed them, awkwardly vaulting over their counter (sending a mixing bowl clattering to the floor and almost kicking Annie in the face), before spinning around and calling the class to attention.

"Listen up! Everybody needs to split into pairs for the semester. Pairs will be given a shared grade, and no swapping or changing of partners will be allowed. Go!"

"Oh no!" Annie said anxiously. "What will we..."

"I dibs Shirley!" Britta interrupted suddenly, grabbing Shirley by the upper arm.

"What? B-but..." Annie stuttered, only to be interrupted once again.

"Miss Edison, where's your partner?" Chang said snidely, running his finger down a clipboard.

Annie looked around, but everyone else was already paired off.

"There aren't enough people, I don't have a partner." she explained, glaring at Britta.

"Well then, I guess you'll have to work twice as hard then. To your station, chop chop." He replied, shooing her away.

"But..."

"I said chop chop!" Chang yelled , slamming his clipboard down on the counter, causing her to squeak and hurry to the vacant station.

As she pushed her hair back behind her ears and tied her apron strings, Annie looked over hopelessly at Shirley and Britta. Shirley waved sadly, and Britta shrugged and mouthed 'sorry'.

"Okay students! Today, so I can get some idea of just how hopelessly inept you are, I want you all to make the simple cupcakes found on page fourteen of your recipe books. You have thirty minutes. Go!"
Chang yelled out his instructions in his usual over the top style, before sitting down at his desk and taking out a magazine.

Annie quickly riffled through the thick volume sitting on the counter. The book was old and stained, and some of the pages were missing, but the cupcakes seemed simple enough.
She hurriedly gathered the ingredients and began to mix them together. Flour, sugar, butter, milk... As she stirred she glanced over at Shirley and Britta, who seemed to be having a lot more more fun than she was, joking and laughing, something about eggshells...

Eggs! Annie had forgotten to add them! She was a few steps beyond that stage, but she hurriedly added the eggs and grabbed the electric mixer, hoping the extra power would make up for it. By the time she put them in the oven, she was five minutes behind the others, and she wasted another five minutes on adjusting the temperature setting.

She got started on the frosting, but that part of her recipe was obscured by some ancient spillage. She leaned over towards Shirley but Chang cried out without even looking up.

"No consultations! If you must talk, talk to your partner!"

"But I don't..." Annie began, but Chang only shushed her.

She did her best, mixing cream, butter and sugar together in a small bowl, but it didn't look quite right. She only just had time to pull the baked cakes out of the oven and dab them with the frosting before Chang yelled that time was up. He got up and walked around the tables, tasting each group's cupcakes. Mostly he shook his head, passing some comment, others, like Shirley and Britta's, he gave a begrudging nod to.

When he worked his way around to Annie, he picked up a cupcake and gave it a critical stare. With a sigh, he took a small bite, only to immediately spit it out, spraying her with crumbs.

"Disgusting!" He yelled, retching and sticking out his tongue dramatically, throwing the rest of the cake to the ground. "F! You get an F!"

Annie's face went from surprised to annoyed. "What? But no one else even got a grade!"

Chang squinted at her, scraping her tongue with his fingernails. "Oh, I'm sorry, I meant you all get an F, thanks to Miss Edison and her toxic cupcakes!"

"They're not that bad!" Annie protested, turning to appeal to the class, before noticing the glares she was receiving. Even Shirley and Britta looked put out.

"Class dismissed! I need to go wash out my mouth." Chang declared and exited swiftly, followed by most of the students, who were still grumbling as they passed her.

"It's okay Annie, its just Chang being his usual insane self." Britta consoled her once the others had left. "Come on, lets go to the library."

"No, I should probably clean this up first." Annie sighed. "I'll catch up with you later."

As the sink filled with hot water, Annie was still fuming about what had happened. Her cupcakes weren't that bad, surely? She picked one up and took a bite, chewing thoughtfully. The icing was a little gritty, and the cake itself was kind of doughy, but it was still perfectly edible. As if to prove it herself, she finished that cake and took a second. They were actually kind of tasty, she decided.

As she cleaned, washing the utensils and wiping down the counter top, Annie continued to eat the cupcakes, eventually working her way through the entire dozen, minus the one Chang had thrown to the floor. By the time she took off her apron, she was feeling a little too full, her stomach pressing against the waistband of her skirt. She unconsciously readjusted it before heading to the library.

She would show Chang. She just needed a little practice.

Her chocolate bundt cake looked perfect, and she had followed the recipe to the letter. She had been thrown off by Chang's surprise appearance last time, that was all. Once again Chang made his way around the table, cutting a slice from each cake and tasting them, before assigning a grade. They all seemed quite low, Cs and Ds mostly, with the occasional B. Shirley and Britta's only got a C, Annie noted, a little smugly. Finally he made his way around to Annie.

"Ah, Miss Edison. I hope your baking has improved, I just got the taste of those cupcakes out of my mouth." He said snippily, looking her up and down.

Annie didn't say anything, but simply pushed forward the cake for him to try. He cut a thin sliver, and tentatively scooped up a forkful, and tasted it. He chewed it thoughtfully, then leaned over and opened his mouth, letting the half eaten cake fall on to the counter.

"Disgusting. F." He said, marking it down on his clipboard.

Annie's face fell and she stomped her foot. "What? It's perfectly good!"

Chang turned back with a smirk. "Oh, I'm sorry Miss Edison, I forgot that you were a fully accredited baking teacher, and capable of judging these things."

Annie pouted as he returned to his desk, informing the class that they were dismissed. Shirley and Britta immediately came over to console her.

"Forgot about it Annie, he's just a jerk." Britta told her.

"I'm still here." Chang said loudly, gathering up his fallen cards.

Ignoring him, Shirley patted her arm. "Yeah, he's just a weird, sad little man."

"But it's not fair, my cake wasn't even that bad." Annie insisted, having tried some herself. It was a little dry maybe, and there was kind of a weird aftertaste, but it was still good.

Shirley and Britta nodded sympathetically, turning down her offer of trying some, before leaving for their next class. Annie wrapped her cake in some cling film and brought it down to the fridge at the back of the classroom. The students could store their baked goods here until they were ready to take them home at the end of the day.

The sight of the fourteen other bundt cakes inspired Annie. There was no way they could be that much better than hers, right? Maybe she should check, to see just how unfair Chang was being.

Before she knew it, Annie had a knife and was carving off a slice off the first cake. It was certainly rich and moist, but maybe too moist, almost soggy, she decided, after finishing off the slice. It was certainly no better than hers had been, that was for sure. The same went for the next cake, and the next one, and the one after that.

By the eight slice, Annie was feeling pretty full, but she was determined to see it through. She pulled her skirt down a little to give her belly some more room, and cut another slice. The icing on this one was too thick, the next one was a little burnt. Britta and Shirley's was okay, if a little sticky. With the fourteenth and final slice, Annie had eaten roughly an entire cake, and it showed, her stomach sticking out over her skirt and pressing against the fabric of her sweater. She let out a little burp and wiped the chocolate from around her mouth, feeling pleased and only a bit queasy. There was nothing wrong with her cake, it was just Chang being Chang, she was sure of it now. She put her cake inside and closed the fridge, reminding herself to come back for it later. One good thing about this baking class, at least she could save money on dinner.

"Where the hell is my TV guide?" Chang asked aloud as he stomped into the classroom.

Annie stuffed the rest of the brownie into her mouth and got down on her hands and knees, trying not to make any noise. She could hear Chang moving around, and prayed he wouldn't notice her satchel still sitting by her workstation.

"Maybe I left it..." Chang was muttering, moving back towards the door. Annie, her cheeks still bulging with chocolate, let out a little sigh through her nose, only to immediately regret it as he turned back around.

"Wait." He said, taking a step towards where Annie was hiding. She was sure she had been caught, only to hear the sound of turning pages. She risked a peek up over the counter top, and saw Chang leading through a recipe book. He stopped on a certain page, scanned it, and shrugged. "Yeah, that'll do."

With that, Chang finally left, and Annie got to her feet with a groan, brushing crumbs from her knees. As she chewed and swallowed the last of the brownie, she glanced at the recipe Chang had settled on. "Chocolate Chip Cookies." She read with interest, pulling the book towards her. This must be what Chang was planning for their next class...

Looking around furtively, Annie carefully tore the recipe out of the book, folding it neatly and slipping it into her bag. As she headed to the library, smoothing her sweater down and adjusting her skirt, she smiled. She had a whole weekend to master the recipe, and then she would really show Chang.

***

The next morning Annie got up early, ready for a long day of baking. The previous afternoon she had picked up all the ingredients and hauled them back to her small apartment. Without bothering to change out of her pink pyjamas, she set to work measuring out the quantities and mixing them together, following the recipe exactly.

In under half an hour, she had her first batch of cookies cooling on a wire rack. Striving to be as scientific as possible, she sat down with a pen and paper to record her thoughts. Having eaten three of the cookies, she decided that they were a little too chewy, and marked this observation down. Despite the chewiness, Annie continued to munch on the cookies even as she mixed up the next batch, using a little less flour this time.

This process repeated itself over and over, as Annie baked, tasted, adjusted and baked again. Each time she would discover a new flaw, whether it was a lack of crunch or a bad cookie-to-chocolate chip ratio. And each time she would devour every single one, regardless of flaws. She didn't mean too, she just couldn't help nibbling as she worked.

By early afternoon she had finished off seven batches, and her pyjama top, which had already been a little snug, was struggling to contain her bloated belly, the buttons straining. After a brief nap on the couch she got her second wind, baking and consuming another five batches, each time a little bit closer to that elusive perfection.

When she finally decided to call it a day, she had eaten almost a hundred and fifty cookies. Her stomach bulged out like she was pregnant with triplets, her pale skin exposed as far up as her belly button after she had undone the buttons to prevent them from popping off.

As she crawled into bed, moaning softly and letting out the occasional belch, Annie was bizarrely proud of her accomplishment. At this rate, by Monday morning she would know how to make the greatest cookies of all time.
145332222111111.title: Research and Experimentation

1453322221111111.content:
Monday morning arrived at last, and Annie couldn't wait for baking class. Another day of intensive baking (and eating) meant she was now sure she could bake the perfect batch of cookies. It also meant that she was having a little trouble fitting into her clothes.

The extra pounds that had accumulated around her hips had made her skirt almost impossible to fasten. It took a good ten minutes of tugging and squeezing before she finally managed to get it closed. As well as digging in uncomfortably, it also gave her an impressive muffin top all the way around, which her yellow cardigan didn't quite cover. It didn't help that her belly had bulged out another few inches, putting pressure on the garment's buttons.

Aside from the extra effort it took to get her clothes on, Annie didn't really notice her weight gain. She was too excited by the idea of finally showing up Chang and getting the A she deserved.

She had gotten to the study room in the library early, with a tupperware container of her carefully crafted cookies, in order to look over her notes and memorise the adjustments she'd made. Gradually, the others started to arrive.

"Ooh, cookies!" Troy smiled, reaching for them, only to have Annie slap his hand away.

"Sorry Troy, I need those." Annie said apologetically, before grabbing one for herself and nibbling on it as she made some more notes.

"Man, what's up with her?" Troy asked Abed quietly as they took their seats.

Abed looked at Annie critically. "Hmm, inconsistent characterisation, bizarre plot line, increased girth... Seems to me like poorly written fanfiction."

Troy narrowed his eyes. "Huh?"

"Shut up, Abed." Britta said hurriedly, but Annie hadn't even noticed. "She's just... really focused on getting a good grade."

"Looks like she's been focusing on getting fat! Ha!" Pierce guffawed at his own 'joke', drawing glares from Shirley and Britta and an eye roll from Jeff.

Annie was still engrossed in her cookies however, and didn't even look up. Eventually the group broke up as they each headed for their first class.

In the home economics lab, Annie smiled broadly when Chang announced the days recipe, Chocolate Chip Cookies of course, and quickly set about the well practiced motions of baking. Fifty grams less flour than the recipe said, an extra three ounces of butter, half a dozen little changes that made a big difference. Soon Annie was removing a tray of perfectly baked cookies from the oven, golden brown and studded with delicious chocolate chunks. She just about resisted the temptation to eat one, instead arranging them neatly on a plate and waiting for Chang to come around.

As usual he saved her for last, grimacing over his clipboard as he picked up a cookie.

Annie looked smug as he took a bite, chewing thoughtfully. Finally, he spoke.
1453322221111111.title: Monday morning, Annie is ready.

choices: Annie bides her time and waits for next week.
Annie demands that Chang and her go see the Dean
14533222211111111.content:
“Meh..” Chang half heartedly expressed, making a note on his clipboard.

“MEH! How on Earth are these just MEH!” Annie yelled in her trademarked breakdown voice. “I put my heart and soul and mind into these pieces of baked heaven, and all you can say is MEH!”

“Well, I was about to give you a B- miss Edison, but due to that little outburst I’m going to need to drop few points in the presentation department.” Chang said with a slight smirk. “Here you go, enjoy this freshly baked F I got you.” Chang continued with an even less hidden smile.

Annie knew Chang was immune to her fluttering princess act and that she had to think of something else if she wanted to beat this tyrant.
14533222211111111.title: "Meh."

choices: Dean puts Annie in charge of tasting the entire class and grading them.
Dean puts the entire class in charge and says they must taste and grade everyone
145332222111111112.content:
“That’s it we’re going straight to the top!” Annie yelled, taking Chang slightly by surprise. “You’re coming with me!” Annie said grabbing Chang by the shirt, along with a handful of cookies, and pulled him out the door.

“Uhhh, should we follow them?” Britta asked trying to process what just happened. “Not my fault little Miss Princess can’t bake.” Shirley said packing up her things to go home.

----

Annie shoved Chang through the door of the Dean’s office slightly out of breath from this sudden use of energy, which she happily refilled with a few of her cookies. “Out!” she yelled at Professor Duncan who seemed to be having a meeting with the Dean, kicking him out of the door.

“Annie, what seems to be the problem, you look all flushed?” The Dean asked surprised but with his usual sincerity for one of his favourite students.

“Chang has some sort of vendetta against me and refuses to give me a good grade for my baking!” Annie exclaimed. “Here try one.” Annie said shoving a cookie in the Dean’s face, taking few others for herself.

The Dean took a few hesitant bites, but then excitedly finished the rest. “Mmmm these are delicious. Chang, why would you give this a bad grade?” Dean asked with slightly more genuine sincerity then before.

“Well sir, not to be disrespectful, but I am a trained food professional and your inexperienced mouth is not trained to notice all the nuances of flavour and body in baked goods like myself.” Chang said matter-of-factly, finishing off the glass Duncan left behind. “And if we are going to continue this ridiculous conversation I’m going to need another glass of water.” Chang finished holding out his newly acquired glass.

“Uhhh Chang, that wasn’t water.” The Dean said in a slightly surprised voice and suspicious voice. “That was raspberry vodka; I was just talking to Professor Duncan about his drinking problem before you and Miss Edison barged in.

“Uhhhhh.” Chang hesitantly said now with both Annie and the Dean glaring at him. “Yeah Chang what’s up with that?” Annie asked.

“Ok, cards on the table.” Chang said finally breaking down. “I may have possibly been born without taste buds.” Chang said looking back and forth between the two. “Aaand, I may have been taking out a bit of my aggression by giving a bad grade to Miss Princess here.” Chang confessed before quickly getting up and sprinting out the door.

“Well then, it looks like you will be getting your passing grade after all Annie.” The Dean said trying to figure out what to do next.

“YES! Thank you Dean! I knew Chang was up to something!” Annie excitedly announced doing a slightly jigglier then normal victory dance.

“Not so fast Miss Edison, with Chang gone we’re going to have to come up with a new plan for how to run the baking class.” The Dean continued looking quite serious.
145332222111111112.title: Annie demands that Chang and her go see the Dean

1453322221111111121.content:
"What are you talking about?" Annie asked, as Dean Pelton sat down behind his desk.

"Well, let's just say that Greendale has had enough problems with professors who are, shall we say, completely and totally unqualified." He paused here to glare at Chang. "We need to keep this baking class running as smoothly as possible."

Annie sat down opposite the Dean, eating another cookie from her diminishing handful. "But you can't leave Chang in charge. He can't taste anything!"

The Dean began moving some files around on his desk. "What if we left Chang to oversee the class, but assigned him a Teaching Assistant, someone who could actually taste the food and, well, 'advise' him about the grades."

Annie brushed some crumbs from her cleavage. "But where would you find a qualified TA?"

The Dean picked up a cookie. "Well, I can't imagine anyone more qualified than someone who could bake cookies as good as these."

Annie's eyes shone. "Me? But, I mean... There are other... Shirley would be..."

"That TA would of course get an A plus for the course, along with two additional credits and a small... very small... salary."

Annie couldn't resist that offer. "I'll do it!"

As they shook hands, Chang piped up. "Don't I get a say in this?"

Annie and Dean Pelton spoke simultaneously. "No."

choices: Chang actually starts being a decent teacher and helps Annie.
Once a Chang always a Chang.
14533222211111111211.content:
Annie was hyped prepping for the next baking class, if there was one thing she loved more than being teacher’s pet, it was being the teacher. The class’s next assignment was strawberry shortcake, which happened to be one of her favourites, and Annie was determined to be the leading authority on the matter. She had three days to prep for the class which she spent reading different recipes and giving each one a test run. Annie got into a routine of researching the recipes during her breaks and preparing the shortcake when she got home. Every night ended with Annie chowing down on her tasty results while absent mindlessly watching her favourite medical drama on her laptop, taking the occasional note on her baked goods in her trusty notepad. By the time she had finished her pan of goods, the food coma set in and she would pass out on her couch rubbing her bloated belly trying to subdue the dull pain.

When Annie woke up for her first official day as a TA she was psyched. She played over everything she learned from her “research” in her head while she got dressed, not noticing that she was showing more cleavage than normal since she couldn't get her last button closed, or that it took a longer than normal amount time to get her skirt on. Somewhere in the back of Annie's constantly multitasking mind she knew something about her physique had changed, but all of her brain power was focused on doing the best job she could do for today's class.

-Class Time-

“Ok class, so it has come to my attention that my grading scheme may not have been the most fair in the past, so Miss Eddison here will be your TA for the rest of the year.” Chang announced in his best teacher voice. “I will take a preliminary tasting of your creations and will take notes, Miss Eddison will circulate the classroom to help you during the class and will taste test your creations after class has ended, on her own time...” Chang said while shooting Annie a glare. “You will find out your grade next class after me and Miss Eddison compare notes. And with that, today's assignment is strawberry shortcake, you may begin.” Chang finished.
14533222211111111211.title: Adventure's of Super TA: Episode 1 Shortcake

choices: Jump forward a month for Annie: Super TA.
145332222111111112112.content:
Annie bounced around the class room helping each student with their shortcake, meanwhile Chang sat at his desk throwing pencils at the ceiling quietly singing “Kiss from a Rose”. By the end of the class Annie was surprised at how hard it was to be a TA and how out of breath she was. Chang’s “grading” process was him going around the class nibbling a small piece of the student’s creation and then writing notes in his notepad *which was just a game of tic-tac-toe he kept losing against himself*.

“Alright Miss EqualTreatmentOfEveryone, go do you job and leave your grades on my desk. I’m gonna go take a nap.” Chang said walking out the door after the class ended.

And with that Annie’s task began.

Annie started with tasting a slice of each person’s cake and graded it based on her ideal shortcake requirements, a total of 14 slices in all. Even after having both breakfast and lunch Annie was surprisingly hungry and was able to make her way through the 14 confections only having problems with the last piece. By this point Annie had pulled her skirt down a bit to let her bloated belly breathe, exposing her well fed cake-filled muffin top to the world.

In Annie’s teaching plan she decided in order to make the perfect bell curve she had to decide which student’s cake was worthy of an A, which of course required additional “evaluation” of the top 3 cakes. It took multiple tastings and the unfastening of her skirt but Annie came to the surprising conclusion that Garret was actually the top of the class. “Must be his constant state of panic that enhances the flavour” She thought to herself.

With a sense of a job well done, Annie finished her grading list and headed out, being sure to pick up a chocolate shake on her way home because all that cake made her a bit parched.
145332222111111112112.title: Chang’s never Chang.

choices: Next week is Halloween, Annie prepares a special class
Britta decides to talk to Annie
1453322221111111121122.content:
"Okay class, by now your cakes should be cooled and ready for decorating." Annie announced from the front of the classroom, moving over to the one she had prepared earlier. The cake, a Black Forest gateau, was topped with a thick syrup glaze and dotted with tiny pine trees crafted from dark chocolate.

"Now this is just a guide," she said, gesturing to the cake, "so feel free to simplify your decorations. These ones might be a little complex."

She wasn't just being boastful, she must have carved and consumed a whole forest's worth of trees before she perfected the technique.

Nibbling on a leftover bar of the rich chocolate, Annie strolled around the classroom, looking over the students' attempts and offering advice or praise. Chang meanwhile, was napping in an armchair at the front of the class.

As the weeks had passed, Annie had taken more and more control over the baking classes, responsibilities that Chang was more than happy to relinquish. As well as grading the assignments, she was now in charge of choosing the recipes, providing demonstrations and even beautifying the classroom.

The once dingy former science lab was now bright and clean, with the last of the Bunsen burners and old test tubes cleared out, along with some chemicals she found in a cabinet, the smell of which had left her feeling lightheaded for hours. She had added a few homey touches, the aforementioned armchair, rescued from the curb outside her building and thoroughly disinfected, along with potted plants for the windowsills and an embroidered wall hanging reminding students to turn off their ovens. She had even wheedled some extra funding out of Dean Pelton for some proper baking supplies, primarily by bribing him with a supply of fresh cookies.

The other major transformation was Annie herself, the near-constant eating inevitably resulting in more than a few extra pounds. Her stomach had grown into a significant belly, sitting snugly beneath her bright yellow apron. Her face and even her arms had also rounded slightly, giving her a somewhat cherubic appearance. These areas aside, the majority of her weight gain had settled in her lower half, her hips spreading and her thighs thickening, putting her skirts under constant strain. Her ass, once small but firm, had rapidly eclipsed her bust as her most notable feature, growing large and jiggly. It swayed slightly from side to side as she walked around the classroom, drawing more than a few stares from the male students.

"Wow, Shirley, that looks great!" Annie said, once she got to her friend's station. The cake in question was decorated with an intricate swirl of leaves and vines, with three blossoms made of white chocolate.

"Thank you Annie." Shirley replied, unable to keep the hint of smugness out of her voice.

Of all the students in the class, most of whom barely cared, Shirley had had the most trouble with Annie effectively taking charge of the class, especially after she gave her a B on the first assignment she graded. Since then she had been quietly but intensely determined to reach the top of the class and prove it was her who should have been selected as the Teaching Assistant. A goal that was impeded by the surprise baking talent of...

"Garret!" Annie said with a gasp. "That's amazing!"

The awkward young man squirmed, standing next to his elaborate dessert. It was a perfect mirror glaze, the shiny surface reflecting Annie's chubby face as she admired it. Picked out in milk chocolate was the word 'Schwarzwald'.

"It means Black Forest, in German!" Garret told her in his stilted, screeching way. Annie was hardly listening, entranced by the sight and smell of the cake. She licked her lips as she reached for a knife, and cut herself a generous slice.

She let out an audible moan as she took her first bite, the rich chocolate, thick cream and tart cherries combining perfectly on her tongue. She took another, larger, bite, then another, then suddenly the whole slice was gone.

"That was perfect Garret." She said breathlessly, licking the chocolate from her fingers and around her mouth. "Top of the class again."

"B-But you haven't even tasted mine yet!" Shirley said anxiously, hurrying over with a slice of her cake.

Annie began to say something but Shirley didn't hesitate, cramming the cake into her open mouth.

Annie's eyes widened but she didn't protest as her cheeks ballooned with the delicious confection. She chewed and swallowed as Shirley pressed the thick slice into her face, crumbs falling down and bouncing off her tight apron. By the time it was gone her face was a mess, chocolate and icing all around her mouth, a rivulet of cherry syrup running down her chin.

"So who's is better?" Shirley asked.

Before Annie could speak, the bell rang.

The rest of the class quickly filed out, leaving their cakes on their worktops for grading, leaving just Annie, Garret, Shirley and the still sleeping Chang.

Annie looked thoughtful, then smiled, revealing teeth stained with chocolate. "I'm not quite sure. Maybe I should have another slice of each?"

It took thirty minutes and half a gallon of milk for Annie to finish both cakes, with Shirley and Garret watching in agitation. Alternating slices, and occasionally bites, she kept finding reasons to go back and compare, new criteria to judge by. Moistness, sweetness, lightness, richness... Every time she had no choice to call it a tie.

By the time she finished, Annie's belly was round and taut as a drum, pressing hard against a painfully tight apron. She could barely stand, leaning her significant rump on a creaking stool.

"So who won!?" Shirley demanded once again. Garret looked even more uncomfortable than usual, avoiding looking at Annie's swollen stomach.

"So-OH-rry Shirley." She said finally, letting out a belch as she spoke. "But Garret's was -URp- better."

Shirley glared, first at Garret then at Annie, before gathering up her things and storming out.

Garret quickly followed, thanking her and mumbling something about missing his next class.

Alone aside from the unconscious Chang, Annie reached behind her and fumbled with her apron strings. Just when she thought she might have to cut her way out did the knot finally give. She sighed as she slipped it off, allowing her bloated belly a little more room to breathe. She rubbed it gingerly, accidentally smearing chocolate across its pale surface.

She massaged it a little harder, causing her to let out a few more belches. She needed to make some room, she still had a whole class of cakes to grade.
1453322221111111121122.title: One month later...

choices: Annie makes it to the party
14533222211111111211221.content:
Halloween was always enthusiastically celebrated at Greendale Community College. As well as decorations lining the halls, many students attended class in costume, adding a further air of festivity. Baking 101 was no exception, and there were a number of ghosts, ghouls and various pop culture references populating the classroom. Their instructor was also in on the act, wearing a form-fitting spandex skeleton costume under her yellow apron.

"So as you can see, these 'spooky cookies' make a delicious Hallowe'en snack, perfect for handing out to trick or treaters, or even for a more grown-up costume party." Annie said, holding up a cookie frosted to look like a jack'o'lantern. "Speaking of which, I hope to see you all at the annual Greendale Halloween party, tonight in the library."

The bell rang to signal the end of the lesson, and while the other students quickly dispersed, chatting and discussing their plans for the evening, Britta and Shirley made their way to front of the classroom.

"Ooh, I can't wait for the party later!" Shirley said, clapping her hands. "I spent so much time on my costume, it's going to be great."

"Yeah, it should be a real hoot." Britta agreed. She was already wearing her costume, a baggy green T-Rex outfit. "Do you need a ride home Annie?"

"No thanks Britta, I need to finish off a few more things then I'll be heading straight to the party." Annie explained, already measuring out ingredients.

Annie had been thrilled when the Dean asked her to provide some refreshments for his Halloween party, even offering to pay, and had spent the whole week testing recipes and mastering the art of creepy yet delicious decorating. As well as the spooky cookies there were bloody eyeball cakepops, chocolate covered tombstones, and ghostly cream-filled cupcakes.

All the extra work had meant she didn't have time to put a costume together, but luckily she still had last year's one hanging neatly in her closet. The skeleton costume was a little snugger than she remembered, but she had still managed to squeeze into it that morning.

Bidding her friends goodbye, Annie set to work, baking and decorating. As usual, this involved plenty of testing and tasting, making sure that everything was just right. Nothing went to waste of course, if a cookie or cake didn't meet her exacting standards she would simply munch it down, careful not to get any crumbs on her costume, which was slowly growing tighter and tighter. It also meant the whole process took a little longer than she thought it would.

She finally finished icing the last of the cupcakes with only ten minutes until the party started. She quickly packed them into a large Tupperware container and stacked this on top of the other three boxes of tasty confectionery. After washing her hands and hanging up her apron, she was just about ready to go when she noticed that there was one cupcake left over. She was already feeling pretty full, but there was no room left in any of the Tupperware...

With a shrug, she crammed the whole thing into her mouth, cheeks bulging as they filled with cake and cream. She chewed and swallowed, letting out a sigh of satisfaction that quickly turned into a shriek of surprise. Her costume, already put under significant strain by her more curvaceous figure, could take no more, and the cheap spandex split along the centre, from just below her breasts to just above her hips, allowing her bloated belly to burst out. She looked down in shock at her stomach, her pale pink skin sharply contrasting with the black and white costume.

"Crap." She said quietly, offering an honest if not particularly eloquent assessment of the situation.

"Annie? Are you in here?"

Already perturbed, the sound of Jeff's voice sent her into full-on panic mode, especially when the handle of the door began to turn. She couldn't let anyone, especially Jeff, see her like this! Without any other thought, she ducked down behind a table, and was rewarded with the sensation of her costume tearing again, right across the rear end. She bit back a groan as the door swung open.

"Annie?" Jeff called again. She stayed quiet, hoping he wouldn't notice the stack of Tupperware.

"She must have already gone to the library." Troy suggested from out in the hall, before Pierce's gruff voice joined in the discussion.

"Let's go, I want to get there before Leonard eats all the free taco mix."

Jeff responded with his usual request that Pierce shut up, but seconds later the door swung closed again, and a few more second later Annie allowed herself a sigh of relief. Grabbing the edge of the table and hauling herself to her feet, she twisted her head to try and assess the damage. There was a large crescent shaped hole, exposing the seat of her plain white panties as well as a significant amount of her expanded butt cheeks.

What was she going to do? She couldn't go to the party with her ass hanging out and her belly on full display, but she still had to deliver the food. Where could she find another costume on such short notice?

Her eyes lit up as she realised the obvious solution.
14533222211111111211221.title: Next week is Halloween, Annie prepares a specia...

choices: Annie has some unusual tutoring techniques
14533222211111111211222.content:
"I think I'm going to say something." Britta said for what Troy reckoned had to be the hundredth time. And that was only since they had sat down to lunch twenty minutes ago.

Across the cafeteria, Annie was sitting at a booth by herself, practically surrounded by Tupperware containers. Every so often she would dip her hand into one of the boxes and retrieve some sort of baked good, take a few bites and then make some careful notes on a pad of paper. Once the pastry was gone she would brush the crumbs from her notepad and the process would repeat itself.

Britta hadn't really minded when Annie took over their baking class, even when she had insisted on splitting up all the pairs, which meant Britta could no longer just sit back and let Shirley do all the work. She was happy for her friend, who seemed so excited about her new job. Sure she had put on a little weight, but she had been under stress, and hey, it was college. A small part of Britta, one she tried her best to suppress, was actually glad the perfect little Miss Edison had finally succumbed to the Freshman Fifteen.

However, once it became clear that the Freshman Fifteen was rapidly turning into the Freshman Thirty, Britta began to have reservations. Far be it from her to impose some artificial standard of body image, but she couldn't help but feel concerned. She wanted to ask the rest of the group what they thought, but she felt Annie wouldn't appreciate her talking to Jeff about the subject, and Shirley had been acting even more passive-aggressive than usual whenever Annie's name came up. She hadn't even bothered with Pierce, and Abed just kept babbling something about fanfiction. That left Troy, so she had invited him to have lunch. She had just broached the subject when they spotted Annie sitting just a few tables away. Watching her for a few minutes had elegantly proven Britta's point, and since then she had simply been arguing with herself about what to do.

"So what do you think?" Britta asked finally, turning back to Troy.

"Uh-huh." He said distractedly, still looking over at Annie.

Britta followed his gaze and saw that Annie's dark green skirt was hiked up on one side, exposing an acre of pale milky thigh. Britta rolled her eyes and stood up from the table, having at last made a decision. Troy didn't even notice her leave.

It took Annie a minute or two to notice her arrival, she was so intent on the cookie she was eating. She had chewed, swallowed and even jotted down a few notes before she realised Britta had sat down across from her.

"Oh! Hi Britta." She said cheerfully, already reaching for another cookie.

"Hi Annie." Britta said, in a sympathetic voice. "I need to talk to you about something."

Annie looked confused, then nodded in understanding. "Is it about your grades?"

"No, it's- wait, what's wrong with my grades?" Britta asked.

Annie looked confused again. "Don't you check the online noticeboard I set up? I post the grades for each class at the end of the week."

Britta looked at her blankly.

"Well, um, you've gotten an F for the last three classes. Technically you're failing." Annie told her.

"How am I failing?!" Britta asked, with a mixture of shock and anger.

"Well, remember those butter cookies we made yesterday?" Annie asked, handing her one from the open box. Britta shoved the whole thing into her mouth and began to chew.

"It'sh good." She said, spraying crumbs across the table. "What'sh the problem?"

Annie smiled sadly. "That was one of Shirley's cookies." She reached for another box and popped open the lid. "These ones are yours."

Peering inside, Britta saw that her cookies were much smaller, flatter and paler than the one she was eating, as well as being slightly burned.

"Oh." She said, swallowing in embarrassment and nearly choking.

"Yeah..." Annie said kindly. She reached over and patted her friend on the shoulder, her belly bumping up against the table.

Britta was stunned. She had taken Baking to pad her grades, not to tank them.

"If you want, I could give you a little tutoring, maybe some extra-credit assignments?" Annie offered, before taking a bite from another one of Shirley's cookies.

"Really?" Britta asked hopefully. "That would be great."

"We can start now!" Annie said excitedly, squeezing out of the booth and gathering her notes. "Could you carry those boxes for me?"

Once Britta gathered the Tupperware into a wobbly stack the pair made their way out of the cafeteria together.

"Wait, if my cookies were so bad, why were there only five left?" Britta asked as they walked. "I made like, two dozen."

Now Annie looked embarrassed, a slight flush coming to her chubby cheeks.

"Well, I wanted to give them a fair chance."
14533222211111111211222.title: Britta decides to talk to Annie

145332222112.content:
"And that's why mathematics is inherently sexist." Britta explained, as they walked past the large bronze statue of Luis Guzmán which stood at the center of the Greendale Community College quadrangle.

Annie frowned. "But I was always good at math."

"Exactly." Britta nodded, sipping her coffee. "That's how it perpetuates itself."

Annie was about to ask another question, but was interrupted by a large anthropomorphised soda can.

"Hey ladies, are you ready to get 'Joost'?" The muffled voice from within the foam costume asked then, waving its arms excitedly.

Britta rolled her eyes, but Annie was curious. "What's 'Joost'?" She asked, clasping her books to her chest.

"'Joost' is the cool new energy beverage that all the hipsters are chugging!" The mascot yelled, turning around and grabbing two cans from a large box. "It's packed with the essential guanines and esters you need for your 24/7 lifestyle, now available in Cherry-Melon and Kiwi-Strawberry!"
