***

Santiago was walking down the bustling sidewalk, ignoring the wolf-whistle of a construction worker. This morning Sergeant Jeffords had assigned her, Boyle and Diaz to a robbery in an apartment building, just a few blocks from the station.

She had volunteered to go get some coffees and meet them there, taking any opportunity for a little extra physical exertion. This was probably made pointless by her decision to get a hotdog on the way there, and another on the way back, but she tried not to think about that.

She was wiping some mustard from her chin when she entered the lobby, walking across to the elevator and pressing the up button with her left hand, a small tray of coffee cups balanced in her right.

"Sorry Miss, the elevator's out of order." The doorman called from behind his desk.

Santiago was so dismayed she didn't even bother to tell him that it was 'Detective', not 'Miss'. She double checked her notebook, confirming with a groan that the crime scene was on the 27th floor. She could have jogged up there without breaking a sweat two months ago, but these days she was a little winded after getting up from her chair.

She slipped her notebook back into her pocket and headed for the stairwell. By the second floor she could feel the perspiration beading on her forehead, and by the seventh floor she was sweating freely. The very tops of her thighs were rubbing together, chafing slightly.

It was times like this that she was glad that she had given up on regular underwear weeks ago, sick of picking out painful wedgies, and had switched to thongs. These were much more comfortable, though it had increased her embarrassment when her pants split open after she bent down to get a snack from the vending machine.

On the 13th floor she stopped to catch her breath.

"Halfway there." She told herself, leaning against the handrail.

She needed another break at the 20th floor, and another at the 23rd. Damp patches were spreading from under her arms, dark against her white blouse. Finally she arrived on the 27th floor, still clutching the tray of now cold coffees. She stepped out of the stairwell and wiped her brow, panting.

"Santiago! Stop him!"

She looked up to see a scrawny white guy sprinting towards her. Despite her exhaustion, instinct and training kicked in, and within seconds he was down and handcuffed, with her not inconsiderable weight pinning him to the floor. The tray of coffees had been sacrificed, the cold caffeinated liquid now soaking into the carpet.

"Nice moves Santiago." Boyle said as he trotted over, with Diaz following behind.

"We found this idiot returning to the scene of the crime, but he bolted." Diaz said.

Santiago nodded, still short of breath. Diaz helped her to her feet while Boyle dealt with the suspect.

"You okay?" Diaz asked, looking her up and down. Her shirt had become untucked, exposing a crescent of her belly, and she was still breathing heavily.

"I'm fine." Santiago said quickly, trying to disguise how out of shape she had gotten. "Just, uh, you know, adrenaline rush."

She smiled and hurriedly tucked her shirt back in, difficult due to the snugness of her waistband.

"Whatever. The techs will finish up with the scene, you want to get some breakfast?"

Santiago had actually had breakfast before work, not to mention the two hotdogs. But after her exertions, she decided she had earned a snack.

1453322222211.content:
There was a buzz of conversation around the hall as people began to take their seats, having exhausted the supplies of coffee and sugar cookies available from the refreshments stand.

At the table at the front of the hall, Leslie turned to Ann with a smile.

"Another day, another public forum."

From anyone else this would have been a complaint, but Ann knew that her friend's enthusiasm for civic engagement in the political process was inexhaustible, and had possibly even increased since she had been elected to the city council.

The same couldn't be said for April, who was sitting on the other side of Leslie, tapping away at her phone. As the last few people sat down, Leslie banged her gavel and called the meeting to order.

The point of the forum was to discuss the location of a new Paunch Burger restaurant, across the street from Pawnee Central High School. Leslie was against it, of course, and had hoped to raise support from the community.

It wasn't going well.

"No sir, this is an issue of public health, not "nightmarish Orwellian fascism." Leslie said with admirable restraint. "Next question?"

A woman in the third row stood up. Leslie stifled a groan as she recognised who it was.

"Kathryn Pinewood, Pawnee Restaurant Association." The woman announced, turning to face the rest of the attendees. "And I'm here to defend Paunch Burger against any baseless allegations made by government busy bodies."

To Leslie's dismay, this was greeted with a round of applause. She glanced at Ann, who gestured for her to re-take control.

"Um, this forum is simply to warn people about the danger of exposing our youth to unhealthy eating habits..." Leslie began, but Kathryn interrupted her.

"Thank you for that question Leslie." She began, speaking into a microphone she seemed to have conjured out of nowhere. "Can I just say that Paunch Burger is committed to ensuring our children's health for generations to come, and recent additions to our menu include the Super-Fruit-Smoothie and the Green Garden Salad."

Ann jumped to her feet to pre-empt any more applause. "Oh please. The 'Super-Fruit-Smoothie' doesn't contain any actual fruit, and your salads are just onion rings, bacon bits and cheese!"

Kathryn was unfazed. "Onions are vegetables." She stated confidently. "And as well as these 'healthy' options were are introducing the new 'Paunch Burger Deluxe Junior'. All the flavour of the classic 'Paunch Burger Deluxe', with only twice the calories."

"That doesn't make any sense." April countered, without looking up from her phone. "You corporate hag."

Kathryn ignored the insult, turning back towards the front. "Now Councilwoman Knope, I'm sure you and your associates would never condemn something without even trying it first."

With these words, the doors swung open and three busty women wearing sexed-up versions of the Paunch Burger uniform and carrying heavily laden trays entered the hall. They made their way down the aisle to murmurs and wolf-whistles, as the smell of burgers permeated the hall.

"This is ridiculous!" Leslie protested, as the trays, multiple burgers on each one, were placed down in front of her.

"Come now Councilwoman," Kathryn said sternly, "the only thing that's ridiculous is you, denying our children the right to delicious burgers without having eaten one yourself. Just try it!"

With that she began to lead the assembled citizens in a chorus of 'Try it! Try it!".

Leslie exchanged looks with Ann and April, then looked down at the burger that had been put in front of her. It was enormous, two quarter pound patties, three buns, four slices of American cheese, garnished with bacon, onions, and an entire fried egg. The noise from the crowd was almost deafening now, and she knew that there was only one way to shut them up.

It took both hands to pick up the massive burger, and grease dripped down on to the table as she lifted it to her mouth. Taking a deep breath, and opening her mouth as wide as possible, she bit into it, managing to get a little bit of everything. As she chewed, her eyes widened, and silence filled the hall. When she finally swallowed, she let out a gasp.

"Holy crap, this tastes amazing!" She moaned, immediately taking another, larger bite.

The crowd let out another round of applause, and Kathryn Pinewood smiled wolfishly. "Won't you other ladies try one?"

April shrugged and followed Leslie's example. Ann was more hesitant but she couldn't deny that they smelled delicious. After a few more seconds she gave in and grabbed a burger, and was soon pigging out alongside April and Leslie, the latter of whom had almost finished her first burger and was eyeing a second.

"Three more satisfied customers!" Kathryn announced smugly. "Now who wants a free t-shirt?!"

The three Paunch Burger spokesmodels reappeared, now armed with t-shirt cannons, and began firing them into the crowd, who reacted with whoops and cheers.

Leslie knew that she had just suffered an embarrassing political defeat, but right now all she cared about was eating these delicious Paunch Burgers!

***


Once the last of the t-shirts had been distributed and the excitement ended, the hall emptied fairly quickly, until the only people left were Kathryn Pinewood and the three representatives of the city government.

Leslie was the worst off, having somehow managed to pack away four of the enormous burgers. Her stomach had swollen to the size of a basketball, popping the button on her pants and straining her blouse. She was sitting back in her chair, tentatively poking her belly and letting out the occasional hiccup.

April and Ann had both eaten three, matching each other bite for bite. Ann looked queasy as she rubbed her bloated stomach, while April just groaned before letting out a series of small burps.

Kathryn Pinewood walked over to the table, ignoring their obvious discomfort.

"I have to hand it to you Leslie. I never could have convinced them without you." She reached into her pocket and removed what looked like three gold credit cards, featuring the Paunch Burger logo.

"These are Paunch Burger Gold cards," she explained, handing them each one. "With them, you can get unlimited free food from any Paunch Burger location in Pawnee. Just my way of saying thanks."

Leslie belched. "We don't want your free, urp, food Ms Pinewood."

The corporate spokeswoman smiled. "Fine. Feel free to throw them away."

With that, she left.

April picked up her card. "Wow, they have our names on them." She said, running her fingers over the embossed plastic.

"Oh, cool!" Ann said, before noticing Leslie's expression. "Or, you know, terrible."

Leslie struggled to her feet. "Kathryn Pinewood may have beaten us today, but the final decision on the new location isn't until the end of the month. We're each going to go home, destroy these cards, and come back tomorrow with three fresh ideas."

"Right!" Ann said enthusiastically, while April rolled her eyes.

***

After making their way back home, each woman found she was exhausted, and just wanted to crawl straight into bed. As for the Paunch Burger Gold card, Ann decided to leave it until the morning, while April just forgot. Leslie got as far as taking the scissors out of the drawer, and was preparing to snip when the memory of those burgers stopped her.

Maybe she would use the card, just once. Then she would throw it away.

Just once.
1453322222211.title: Pawnee Public Forum No. 1487c

14533222222112.content:
If Paunch Burger had been the only issue that Leslie had to deal with, she might have hardened her resolve and destroyed the Gold card. But of course, she had a dozen other things on her mind. Chairing various committees, attending city council sessions, meeting with constituents, overseeing the river restoration project, finalizing the Parks department budget, there was always something that needed doing.

Making it worse was the fact that Ben had been called back to Washington for a few weeks to do some emergency intervention on an ailing Senate campaign. At the end of a stressful day, she felt herself craving Paunch Burger, and having the Gold card in her purse made resistance all but impossible. Despite her misgivings, and constant pledges to stop, she was soon eating there at every meal, and stopping in for snacks whenever her schedule allowed.

Leslie did her best to hide her new routine from Ann and April, unaware that they had also given in to the temptation of Paunch Burger.

April treated her new appetite for Paunch Burgers like she did most things: with almost total indifference. Rather than torture herself about it like Leslie, she simply gave in and ate whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted. If she tried to keep it a secret from Ann and Leslie, it was only because she didn't want to have to listen to a lecture about healthy eating.

Ann was probably the most conflicted. She had read numerous health department reports, studied the correlation between restaurant locations and obesity rates, and had personally treated dozens of patients who had suffered Paunch Burger related heart attacks. And yet, all that only served to make them more irresistible to her. It was like she could taste every single calorie.

So they all secretly indulged themselves, unaware that the others were doing the same. But however hard they might have tried to hide their new eating habits, there was no hiding the effect it was having on their figures. Needless to say, Paunch Burger certainly lived up to its name.

***

"So, Ann, any progress with the 'Don't eat food you found on the ground" public health campaign?' Leslie asked, sucking in her stomach, afraid the buttons on her jacket might be unable to take the strain.

"Oh, yeah, we finished the graphics for the posters, and I scheduled a press conference for next week." Ann told her, holding a bundle of folders in front of her rounded belly.

The door to the conference room swung open, and April entered carrying a large paper bag. Her own prominent potbelly was peeking out from under her t-shirt, but she appeared unconcerned as she sat down and opened the bag, taking out a burger. She unwrapped it and was about to take a bite when she noticed them both staring at her.

"What?"

"April, you've been eating Paunch Burgers?" Leslie gasped.

"Yeah. They're really good, and they're free." She said coolly. "Plus, I saw you there yesterday."

"Leslie!" Ann chided, squeezing the files a bit closer to her midsection.

"I saw you there this morning, Ann." April said, biting into the burger.

Ann's face reddened slightly, and she let the folders drop to her lap.

"Okay." Leslie said, breathing out and letting her stomach surge forward. "So we've all been eating at Paunch Burger. That's okay. We're all adults, we can still object to one being placed next to the high school."

She unbuttoned her jacket, giving herself a little more room to breathe, before turning to the white board, to which she had tacked up pictures of the other members of the city council. "Well, Councilman Jamm will definitely side with Paunch Burger, and Milton will do whatever Jamm does. I already convinced Councilman Hauser, so that leaves Dexhart."

"Well, he'll go with whatever seems the most popular." Ann said distastefully, having had a few run-ins with the infamously lecherous Dexhart.

" Exactly." Leslie smiled. "So, we need ideas as to how to convince people to oppose the new location."

Ann nodded and tried to think, but she was soon distracted by the aroma emanating from the bag at the other end of the table. Leslie was also unable to concentrate, looking longingly at the burger April was eating.

"April, could we have some of those?" Ann asked, licking her lips.

April stuck out her bottom lip, pretending to think about it, but Leslie was impatient.

"Come on April, hand them over." She demanded, snatching the bag.

"No way!" April said through a mouthful of burger, snatching it right back.

There was a brief struggle, before the bag spilt right down the middle, spilling burgers across the table. Suddenly the three women were scrambling to grab as many burgers as they could.

After the scuffle, they all ended up with three burgers each, and promptly set about stuffing their faces. Within minutes, they were all gone.

Leslie's pink blouse was now struggling to contain her bloated belly, triangles of creamy flesh visible where the buttons were straining. April's t-shirt had ridden up even further, exposing her belly button, and the button in her jeans had popped open. Ann's dress was bunched up around her middle, and she was fumbling to unbuckle her belt. She finally undid it with a gasp of relief, before letting out a cacophonous belch.

"Geez, Ann." April said, wrinkling her nose in disgust.

"I don't get it." Leslie panted as she leaned back in her chair. "I've eaten Paunch Burger before, but it was never this good."

Ann grunted, picking a sesame seed out of her teeth. "Maybe they changed the recipe?"

"Maybe the secret ingredient is people." April suggested spookily, as she rubbed her swollen belly.

Leslie gave her an exasperated look, but then thought differently. "No, but they still might be doing something illegal. A new additive, something the FDA hasn't approved yet. If we could expose them, that might be all we need to sink the new location."

Ann looked doubtful, but Leslie was on a roll. "April, can you help me with this?"

April groaned at the prospect of more work. "I still need to find a sponsor for the new pet adoption center. You said you'd help." She added, with an air of accusation.

"I will, right after I deal with this. I need to make a phone call." Leslie rushed out of the conference room, slamming the door behind her.

There was a brief pause.

"You know..." Ann began, but April had already got up and left the room.

"Yep. Cool. See you later." Ann sighed.

"Thanks for coming in Shauna." Leslie said, as the reporter for the Pawnee Journal took a seat.They were meeting in her City Council office, after Shauna shot down her suggestion to meet in the parking garage.

"Well, you called me sixteen times in four minutes, so I figured it must be important." Shauna explained, taking out her notebook and clicking her pen.

"Oh, you won't need that, this is off the record." Leslie said quickly, leaning against her desk. "I have a story suggestion for you." She paused, looking around before leaning in closer. "Rumor has it that Paunch Burger is using a new ingredient in their burgers."

Shauna didn't look impressed. "So?"

"So? They're using addictive new ingredients that haven't been approved for human consumption." Leslie insisted, exaggerating slightly.

Shauna was still skeptical. "What's your source on this?"

"Um..."

"Listen, Leslie, I can't just write a story based on wild accusations from an unnamed source. Now, if you wanted to make these accusations on the record..." Shawna made to start writing, but Leslie actually slapped the pad out of the her hand.

"Sorry! No, I can't. But you really should look into it. Just think of the headline: 'Paunch Burger Exposed, Crusading Reporter Uncovers Scandal, Credits Heroic Whistleblower..."

Shauna held up her hand, laughing."Fine Leslie, I'll do it. No promises as to an article, but I'll see if there's anything worth reporting."

"Thank you Shauna." Leslie sighed, catching her breath. "Off the record."

Shauna leaned down to pick up her notebook, incidentally getting a good look at Leslie's belly. Judging by the size of it, she appeared to be about five months pregnant. Even if the Paunch Burger story was a dead end, this trip might not have been a complete waste of time.

As she saw the Shauna out, Leslie's thoughts turned towards lunch. Maybe she would get a salad from the Executive Dining Hall... Although there was a Paunch Burger just down the street.

1453322222211211.content:
Ann always looked forward to the days she got to work at the hospital. As much fun as it was working with Leslie and the others at City Hall, she sometimes felt a bit out of her depth. It was nice to get back into her element.

Recently another advantage of going to work at the hospital had been getting to wear scrubs. The loose, elasticated clothing was much more forgiving of her expanding figure than her usual wardrobe. Unfortunately her weight gain was no longer confined to her midsection, with her lower half seeing its fair share of growth. Her thighs had thickened slightly, and her juicier ass now stuck out prominently behind her.

"Morning Doctor Harris." Ann said cheerfully, handing him a clipboard.

"Nurse Perkins." The physician nodded, looking her up and down. "Have you put on weight?"

Ann glared at him, but he didn't seem to take any notice. She knew she had gained a few pounds, more than a few, but she had hoped it wasn't that noticeable. As she began her morning rounds, she could feel her underwear riding up further and further with each step. She grimaced and tried to ignore it.

Most of her morning was spent going from room to room, taking patient histories from new admissions.

"And how many times a week would you eat fast food?"

"Yes, fried chicken counts as fast food."

"No ma'am, you have to include weekends."

She felt a bit hypocritical lecturing her patients about their eating habits, but in another way it gave her a strange thrill. It was oddly exciting, hearing them list off the all the fast food they'd eaten that week, and realizing that it wasn't half as much as she had.

By the time her lunch break came around, Ann had built up a serious appetite. She grabbed her jacket and hurried to the nearest Paunch Burger. The lunch rush meant there was a twenty minute wait, leaving her only fifteen minutes to eat. She ended up eating some of it on the go, finishing off the last burger just as she reached the hospital. As she wiped her mouth with a napkin, she imagined all the damage her meal was doing to her body. Arteries clogging, blood pressure rising, insulin spiking... So bad, and yet, so good...

***

Meanwhile, April was sitting at her desk in the Parks department. Unusually, she was actually doing some work. She still needed to find a sponsor for the pet adoption center, and the deadline was looming.

"...so as you can see, sponsoring this project would be the right decision for your business." She explained, in the strained manner she used when she was trying to be polite.

"And if... No... But please, think of the... Fine. I hope your store burns down and all your teeth fall out!" She slammed the phone down in frustration.

She had called almost every business or organization in town, and none of them showed any interest in sponsoring the shelter. With a sigh she reached into the paper bag sitting on her desk and pulled out a burger. After getting breakfast that morning she had ordered another twenty burgers, and had gradually been working her way through them as the day progressed.

Her potbelly had grown rapidly into a proper paunch, resting in her lap whenever she sat down. The only other area of significant growth had been her chest, her perky little 32 Bs swelling into substantial 36 Cs. Andy had been unable to keep his hands off them, especially since she had outgrown all of her bras. Right now she was making do with an old tank top underneath her striped blue sweater. She had attempted to stretch it down over her stomach, bit it kept riding back up to just above her belly button.

As she ate the burger, she looked through the folder, searching for a number she had yet to call.

"Uh, April, could you make some copies for me?" Jerry asked, standing awkwardly in front of her desk.

"No, but I need you to make some copies for me." She picked up a random sheet of paper from her desk and handed it to him. "I need a hundred copies, alternating between blue and red ink, by three o'clock. It's an emergency."

"Oh geez." Jerry cringed, grabbing the sheet and hurrying out the door.

April rolled her eyes and returned to the list, looking for a company she had yet to approach.

"The Glitter Factory, no, JJ's Diner, no, the Quiet Corn, no..." She mumbled, checking them off one by one. There was only one business in town she hadn't called.

She shrugged, cramming the rest of the burger into her mouth and dialing the number. It rang half a dozen times before someone picked up.

"Paunch Burger Corporate Headquarters, how may I direct your call?"

***

"Shoot!" Leslie groaned.

"What's wrong?" Ben asked, his voice slightly tinny through the computer's speakers.

"Oh... I was just expecting a call from someone, they still haven't gotten back to me." Leslie explained, somewhat truthfully. While she was still waiting on a call from Shauna Malwae-Tweep, the real reason for her exclamation had been her pants button popping open for the hundredth time as she sat down.

"Is it the maintenance department?Your webcam has been broken for almost a week ."

Leslie felt a little guilty. The only problem with her webcam was the strip of duct tape she had placed over the lens. She still wanted to video chat with Ben, she just didn't want him seeing how chunky she had gotten. As well as her growing gut, supported by thick love handles, her hips had widened by a good few inches. Her face had grown rounder too, and a second chin was now visible whenever she smiled.

"Uh, yeah, they said they needed to fly in a specialist, then there was a problem with the union..." She lied, standing up and attempting to do up her fly.

"Just to fix a webcam?" Ben might have been more suspicious, but he well aware of how inefficient the civic government could be. "Never mind. I'll see you this weekend anyway."

She froze, eyes widening. "Um, actually, I can't come to Washington this weekend because... I have to help Ann... install her new... humidor." She grunted, finally refastening her pants.

Ben looked surprised. "Oh. I didn't even know Ann smoked."

"Really? Wow, I guess you need to pay more attention. Okay, love you sweetie, bye bye bye!" Leslie ended the call with a few taps of the keyboard, before slumping back down into her seat. This time the button actually broke, ricocheting off of her desk and landing neatly on top of her ample belly. She sighed and put it in the drawer with the others.

She then opened another drawer and took out a burger.

14533222222112111.content:
"Leslie, are you sure this looks alright?" Ann asked, turning around with a worried frown.

They were in Leslie's city council office, doing some last minute preparation for Ann's press conference. They had finished going over her speech, but now she was back to raising concerns about her outfit.

"What are you talking about, you look... fine." Leslie said, leafing through her folder.

Ann narrowed her eyes. "See, it's that little pause before 'fine' that worries me."

She had called Leslie in a panic that morning, when she discovered that none of her clothes fit. Well, she could still squeeze into her old sweatpants, but nothing she could wear for a press conference.

Of course, there were no shortage of plus-size stores in Pawnee. Leslie had visited one a few days previously when she burst out of her last pantsuit. Ann was more reluctant to shop at a place that provided double-wide dressing rooms, but in the end she had no choice. They didn't have time to try anything on, so they had just picked out a variety of skirts and dresses, avoiding anything that would cling too tightly to Ann's expanded ass and thickened thighs.

After grabbing a few blouses and some underwear, they just had time for a quick stop at Paunch Burger before heading to City Hall.

Safely ensconced in Leslie's office, Ann had gotten changed, swapping her sweat pants and t-shirt for a skirt and blouse. They were a little... snugger than they might have hoped, mainly due to Ann's insistence that she didn't need the extra extra large. With Leslie's help she had managed to get the skirt fastened, though it restricted her movement a little. The blouse wasn't much better, hugging the curve of her belly and breasts.

"So you're sure I look okay?" Ann asked one more time as they made their way to the press briefing room.

"Seriously Ann, you'll do great." Leslie reassured her, before reaching into her pocket and pulling out a cigar. "Also if Ben asks, you smoke these all the time."

Ann pocketed the cigar without comment and, taking a deep breath, tottered up to the podium.

Despite her misgivings, it went pretty smoothly. She simply gave a brief speech on the new initiative and unveiled the new public awareness posters.

While Ann talked, Leslie stood at the back of the room, fruitlessly scanning the assembled journalists and photographers for Shauna Malwae-Tweep. She had called the Pawnee Journal multiple times, but apparently Shauna hadn't been into work in almost a week. Leslie couldn't help but remember April's suggestion that Paunch Burger was making their burgers out of people...

"And so the Department of Public Health urges all Pawneeans, that 'no matter what you found, leave it on the ground.'" Ann smiled, having come up with the slogan herself. "Any questions?"

Immediately a woman sitting in the front row stood up, and Leslie got an eerie sense of déjà-vu.

"Kim Terlando, Pawnee Sun." She announced, holding up a digital recorder. "To clarify, Ms. Perkins, you are the person in charge of this new 'health initiative'?"

"...Yes." Ann replied warily.

"So you are saying that Pawneeans shouldn't eat food that has been on the ground?" Kim continued, as though this was a strange opinion for someone to hold.

Ann glanced at Leslie, who shrugged."Yes, that's exactly what I'm saying. Our studies have shown that..."

But Kim apparently wasn't interested in what the studies had to show. "Ms. Perkins, would you care to make a comment on this set of photographs?"

With that she strode forward and handed Ann a brown envelope. "There are copies under each of your chairs." She told the other members of the press.

There was a general rustling as the envelopes were retrieved, followed by murmurs of surprise. Leslie hurried forward and grabbed one for herself.

The first photo showed Ann in her nurse's scrubs, emerging from a Paunch Burger carrying a bag of food. It was obviously a recent photo, judging by the size of her belly and thighs. The next few photos showed her reaching into to bag and pulling out a half-eaten burger as she walked, licking her lips. In the next photo Ann looked distraught, and the burger was clearly visible on the ground.

"Oh no..." Leslie moaned quietly, flipping rapidly through the photos now. Ann looking from left to right, apparently failing to spot the photographer. Ann bending down, awkward with her bloated belly. Ann standing back up, triumphantly holding the burger.

And the final, damning photo which showed Ann, blissfully taking a huge bite of her slightly disheveled burger.

Leslie looked back up at Ann, who looked like she was about to throw up.

"Any comment Ms. Perkins?" Kim asked with a superior smirk, as cameras began to flash and the other reporters got to their feet, crowding forward.

"I... I... I..." Ann stammered, but Leslie came to her rescue. She bustled her way in front of the podium, making good use of her added bulk.

"This press conference is over!" She yelled, pushing a camera away.

Ann tried to make a break for it, but she must have moved a bit too fast. She let out a shriek as her skirt split right up the side. The cameras continued to flash as she waddled out, clutching her skirt with both hands to protect her modesty. Leslie tried to break through the mob, but an accidental elbow to the gut sent her reeling backwards. By the time she caught her breath Ann had disappeared, bringing the press with her.

She wasn't alone however, as a familiar face was standing at the back of the hall. Kathryn Pinewood waved cheerily.

Leslie frowned. So Paunch Burger had something to do with this...
14533222222112111.title: 1100-Department of Public Health Press Conference

145332222221121111.content:
April was lying on the couch, wearing nothing but panties and Andy's Reggie Wayne jersey. Once upon a time she would have been drowning in excess fabric, but now it was actually a little tight. Her bare legs had thickened as well, luscious thighs running down into chubby little cankles.

Champion, the three legged dog she and Andy had adopted, hobbled over and began licking the sole of her foot. She squirmed, but was too comfortable to do anything about it.

The loud, insistent knocking at the door was more difficult to ignore, though April gave it her best shot. Finally, with a groan of frustration, she rolled off the couch and wobbled to her feet. Her sizeable paunch sagged down in front of her, and as she stretched her unrestrained breasts bounced up and down. She slouched her way to the door and pulled it open.

"Go away." She scowled.

Leslie ignored April's customary rudeness and pressed a newspaper into her hands.

April unfolded the paper, which turned out to be the Pawnee Sun.
Her eyes widened as she examined the front page.

The first thing that caught her attention was the lurid photo of Ann, grease dripping down her chin as she bit into a burger. Her eyes flicked to the headline.

"Do as I say, not as I chew?" She read with a smirk, looking up at Leslie, who seemed less amused.

"I know, it's terrible. There's more on pages two, three and five." She said, pushing past April and going inside. "Whoa." She gasped, as she saw the state of the house.

Since Ben had left for Washington, April and Andy had reverted to their less-than-sanitary living habits. Trash, at least half of which was made up of Paunch Burger wrappers, bags and cups, littered the floor. Leslie picked her way through the debris, almost slipping on a pile of baseball cards.

April didn't notice, still fully absorbed in the newspaper. There were more photos inside, including the ones Kim Terlando had revealed at the press conference, and the ones from the press conference itself. She grinned at the sight of Ann desperately trying to hold her skirt together.

Leslie perched herself on the arm of the couch, difficult with her ample backside. "Paunch Burger is behind this." She explained, "Kathryn Pinewood was at the press conference."

April looked unimpressed. "So?"

"So go put on some pants." Leslie said, standing back up. "We need to go find Ann, and figure out exactly what Paunch Burger is up to."
145332222221121111.title: Pawnee Parks Department- Saturday: CLOSED

choices: Ann needs a little help getting out of the booth...
1453322222211211111.content:
Once April had gotten dressed, pulling on a pair of black leggings and slipping on her sneakers, they got in Leslie's car and drove in the direction of Ann's house.

"Okay April," Leslie began after buckling her seatbelt around her belly. "I've come up with a six-point plan for making Ann feel better. Step one..."

April responded by turning up the radio until Leslie was completely drowned out.

"Welcome back Pawnee, you're listening to Crazy Ira..."

"And the Douche!"

The usual barrage of sound effects that always accompanied Pawnee's own morning zoo radio show filled the car. When they finally died away, it was Crazy Ira who spoke first.

"And our most requested clip this morning continues to be Nurse Ann 'Porkins'-" Here he was interrupted by a brief burst of oinking and squealing, "-taking her 'Hypocritic' Oath. Here it is, one more time!"

To Leslie's horror they then played the audio from yesterday's press conference, starting with Kim Terlando's invitation for comment, followed by Ann's stuttered response, her own voice calling an end to the the event, and finally the sound of tearing fabric and Ann shrieking as her skirt split open.

Throughout the recording, Crazy Ira and the Douche could be heard laughing uproariously.

"Douche, didn't you used to date this woman?" Crazy Ira asked once they finally calmed down.

"I sure did Ira, and let me tell you, I'm not surprised she got so fat." The Douche admitted."She always did have a weakness for sausage!"

They both laughed again, as a woman's voice saying 'Me so horny!' was played on repeat.

"Well Ann, if you're listening, come on down to the studio, we've got plenty of food lying around." The Douche joked. " In fact, for every burger you eat off the floor, we'll give you ten bucks towards some much needed liposuction."

The sound effect of a cash register opening was followed by a salacious sucking noise.

As they burst into laughter again, Leslie reached over and turned off the radio in disgust. April made a noise of protest but Leslie ignored her.

They rode in silence for a few minutes, before April spoke up.

"If we have to do this, can we get something to eat first? We just passed a Paunch Burger."

Leslie should have said no, but she was actually feeling pretty hungry. She had gone to JJ's diner for breakfast, and had ordered her favourite, a stack of waffles with extra whipped cream, but somehow it just hadn't hit the spot. The bacon and eggs hadn't done the job either, or the pancakes. By the time she left she had eaten her way through half the menu, but she still hadn't been satisfied.

She pulled a u-turn and soon they were entering the extra-wide double doors that marked every Paunch Burger location. Despite her big breakfast Leslie's mouth started watering as soon as she heard the bubble of the deep-fat fryers. She was already mentally preparing her order, but stopped when April grabbed her by the arm and pointed over to the left.

Leslie looked and gasped as she realised what April was pointing at.

It was Ann, sitting alone in a booth, wearing a light grey sweatsuit with her hair pulled back into a ponytail. She had been there for some time judging by the large pile of burger wrappers and other debris on the table, not to mention the size of her stomach. Her top had been zipped up originally, but it appeared to have been forced open from the bottom upwards, exposing the lower half of her incredibly bloated belly. As Leslie and April watched, she unwrapped another burger and took an enormous bite, her cheeks bulging as she chewed.

Leslie hurried over, with April trailing behind, and sat down opposite her best friend.

"Ann! What are you doing?" She asked in a hushed tone, glancing around the restaurant to see if they were being observed, but the other patrons seemed to be fully absorbed in their meals.

"Does it matter? I've already been completely humiliated." Ann told her, suppressing a belch before taking another bite of her burger.

"If it helps, I never had any respect for you." April told her, forcing Leslie to scoot over as she squeezed in beside her.

Ann didn't even bother to glare at the younger woman, which worried Leslie even more. She had never seen her friend looking this dejected.

"Come on now, it wasn't that bad. I'm sure most people didn't even hear about it." She assured her.

Ann responded by taking out her phone and holding it up for Leslie to see.

"Wow. That's a lot of missed calls."

"It's also trending on Twitter."Ann told her bitterly."Hashtag 'Porkins'."

Hearing this, April took out her own phone and investigated, snickering as she did so, while Ann resumed stuffing her face.

Leslie could see she was losing them, and slapped her hand on the table.

"Listen, both of you, there's something happening here, something bigger than all of us."

"It couldn't possibly be bigger than Ann." April said without looking up.

Leslie shushed her and continued.

"Paunch Burger is trying to undermine us. They're planning something, not just the location near the school, something that could affect all of Pawnee!"

Ann wiped her mouth and took a sip from her soda. "How do you know?"

"Well, right now it's just a hunch." Leslie admitted. "But I'm sure that they're up to something, and we need to find out what."

Ann and April looked less than enthused, but Leslie pressed on regardless.

"Ann, you need to see what's really going into these Paunch Burgers. Get some samples and being them down to the lab, see what they can find out."

"Leslie, I'm a nurse, I don't have a 'lab', and even if I did..." Ann tried to explain, but Leslie wouldn't hear it.

"April, you need to find out everything you can about Paunch Burger, go to City Hall and check the records, planning permission, anything that might tell us what they're doing."

"Sure, I'll get right on that." April said, unwrapping a burger for herself.

"What are you going to do Leslie?" Ann asked, adjusting the waistband of her sweatpants and rubbing her swollen belly.

"First, I'm going to have something to eat." Leslie said, unable to ignore the rumbling in her stomach any longer, "And then, I'm going to find out exactly what happened to Shauna Malwae-Tweep."
1453322222211211111.title: Paunch Burger Action Committee: Emergency Meeting

choices: On Monday, Leslie calls a meeting...
14533222222112111111.content:
"Oof..." Leslie groaned, reaching down to undo her pants button. She had definitely overdone it, eating until her belly was once again straining the buttons on her shirt.

April had eaten her fill and disappeared without another word, but Ann was waiting for Leslie to finish her meal, partly out of politeness, partly due to the fact she was stuck, her incredibly swollen belly wedged against the table.

Leslie slurped down the last of her milkshake and wiped her mouth delicately with a napkin before recommencing her strategy session.

"Now, we need to find Shauna Malwae-Tweep. This could take a while, as she isn't answering her phone, and she hasn't been to work in days. We need to get her home address, and start compiling a list of possible locations that she might have... Yes Ann?"

"Isn't that her over there?" Ann said, pointing across the restaurant.

She craned her head around and saw that Ann was right. Shauna Malwae-Tweep was standing in line just opposite them, though she hadn't noticed them yet. Leslie was immediately relieved to see that she was okay, but her relief turned to shock when she noticed the journalist's midsection.

The usually skinny Shauna was now sporting a sizeable gut, which bulged out over the waistband of her skirt. As Leslie and Ann watched, she untucked her blouse and re-adjusted it, giving them a brief glimpse of her rounded belly.

"I guess that's one mystery solved." Ann remarked.

By the time Leslie managed to extricate herself from the booth, Shauna had already reached the counter, and was fumbling through her purse.

"Looking for your Gold card?" Leslie asked, causing the other woman to look up in alarm.
When she saw who it was, she seemed to relax.

"Hello Leslie." She said, without pausing her search.

Leslie was astonished by her lack of reaction. "What are you... When did you... How could you sell out to Paunch Burger like this?"

Shauna, to her credit, looked a little remorseful, but refused to let herself be bullied.

"I'm sorry Leslie, but this story you put me on to is way above my pay-grade. If you knew what I know now, you would do the same thing." She looked Leslie up and down, taking in her expanded figure. "Though some people might think you already have."

Leslie's outrage returned. "Well, you just tell your new friends at Paunch Burger that Councilwoman Leslie Knope is not for sale. I will find out what they're up to, and I will put a stop to it!"

She struck a defiant pose, which was slightly undermined by the fact that her fly was down.

"By, the way, this entire conversation has been off the record." She added, folding her arms across her chest.

Shauna nodded disinterestedly, having finally retrieved her Gold card. As she began to order, Leslie returned to the booth where Ann was still sitting.

"Could you give me a hand here Leslie?" Ann asked, attempting to suck in her stomach enough to free herself. But her friend wasn't listening.

"This proves that Paunch Burger are up to something." She said, grabbing her own purse from the table. "We need to find out more, and fast. See you later Ann."

With that she walked quickly out of the restaurant, leaving the double doors swinging in her wake.

Ann sighed and slumped back down against the plastic seat. This was definitely a low-point, and from now on she would...

"Ooh!" She said, spotting an unrated burger partially hidden under a pile of napkins.

Maybe just this last one...
14533222222112111111.title: Paunch Burger Action Committee: Lunch Break

choices: Meanwhile, Leslie and April are on the road to Eagleton.
Elsewhere, a meeting is taking place.
145332222221121111111.content:
It was Monday, and Leslie had decided to call a meeting of the entire Parks department. She would need all the help she could get if she was going to defeat Paunch Burger. Unfortunately, turn out was less than spectacular.

"Where is everybody?" She asked in exasperation, looking around the near-empty conference room.

"Well, it's Justin Timberlake's birthday, so Rent-A-Swag is having a special 'sales event' in his honour."
Ann said, explaining why Tom wasn't there. She was dressed in her nurse's scrubs, testing the roomy pants to their limit, perching rather awkwardly on the edge of her seat. She was concerned that if she sat too far back she would get her ass wedged between the arms of the chair. It had taken the intervention of a manger and an application of lard to free her from the booth on Saturday, and she was not eager to repeat the experience.

"And Donna is still on vacation." She continued, shifting her balance once again.

"Well, what about Ron?"

"He said he couldn't make it." April yawned, scratching her belly. The top she was wearing barely reached halfway to her belly button, providing similarly scanty coverage up top as well. "He's super busy right now."

Leslie rolled her eyes, as from where she was standing she could actually see Ron, sitting at his desk with his arms folded, staring straight ahead.

"So no one is turning up for this meeting?" Leslie asked in exasperation. "We can't do this all by ourselves!"

"Good morning, Leslie!" Jerry smiled as he bustled into the conference room. "I heard this meeting was top priority, so I cleared my schedule, I am free all day. Plus, I brought donuts."

"Actually Jerry, I don't think we'll be needing you today, you can go back to your desk." Leslie told him, taking the box of pastries off his hands and shepherding him towards the door.

She pushed it closed behind him and immediately opened the box, grabbing a chocolate covered donut and cramming it into her mouth.

After her encounter with Shauna, Leslie knew that she had to stop eating Paunch Burgers. While she had been successful so far, doing so required her to eat almost constantly. It wasn't ideal, but it was definitely an improvement, even if she hadn't gotten rid of her Paunch Burger Gold card just yet...

She ate another three donuts before she felt ready to commence the meeting.

"So, what have we found out so far?" She asked, licking some raspberry jelly off of her fingers.

"Well, it will be a few days before we get the results back from the lab." Ann said, grabbing a donut before Leslie ate them all. "They should tell us what exactly these new and improved Paunch Burger's are made of."

Despite her previous protestations, Ann did have a connection with a technician at the hospital who had been willing to run a few tests, in exchange for a date. She had been pretty surprised when he asked her out. They had flirted a little before, but he didn't seem to be put off by the fact she had put on weight. If anything he seemed more interested.

The most difficult thing had actually been getting a Paunch Burger for him to test, as the first two times she tried she ended up eating the burgers before she got them back to the hospital.

"Good work Ann. Let me know as soon as you hear anything." Leslie said, while subtly moving the rest of donuts out of her reach. "April, what have you got for me? April?"

There was no reply, unless a rasping snore could be considered a reply. April was asleep where she sat, her head tilted forward until her face was almost resting in her vast cleavage, cushioned by her double chin.

Leslie sighed and clapped her hands together, startling April out of her slumber.

"What?" She asked sullenly, wiping a string of drool from her mouth.

"Did you find anything that might tell us what Paunch Burger are up to? Any permissions requested, any plans filed?" Leslie asked exasperatedly.

April picked up a folder and looked through it, flipping through the pages and perusing them carefully.

"No." She concluded, dropping the documents back on to the table.

"Really? You couldn't find anything?" Ann asked, narrowing her eyes. April had never exactly been a dynamic worker, and her new diet had propelled her to new levels of lethargy. It seemed she grew lazier with every pound she gained. She had even stopped working on the pet adoption centre, the one project that she had ever seemed to care about.

"Hey, don't blame me, Ann." April replied tartly. "Paunch Burger isn't even incorporated here, it's based in Eagleton."

"Eagleton?!" Leslie gasped, almost choking on a mouthful of half-chewed donut. She coughed, thumping her chest before she managed to swallow. "I should have known those snooty Eagletonians would have something to do with this."

Ann was sceptical, and was about to interject when April spoke up "I tried to access the records over the phone, but they said there was a six-week waiting period for non-Eagletonians."

Leslie scowled. "Those snobs. Well we'll just have to go over there right now and get those records in person."

April nodded and got to her feet, while Leslie grabbed the remaining donuts and stuffed them into her purse.

"Wait, Leslie, don't you have a city council meeting this afternoon?" Ann said, trying to get her friend to stop and think for a minute.

But Leslie refused to be reasoned with.

"Sorry Ann, this is more important. Sometimes being a politician means breaking the rules!"

With that she was gone, April practically pushing her out the door. They crashed straight into Jerry, sending the stack of documents he was carrying flying.

They had vanished before the papers even hit the ground, leaving Ann to hurry out and help gather them up. She bent down without thinking, and winced as she heard the now all-too-familiar sound of fabric ripping. She turned her head to assess the damage, silently regretting her decision to try out her new thong.

choices: Back at Eagleton City Hall, they go through the records.
Meanwhile, April is enjoying the festival.
1453322222211211111121.content:
"I really think we're on to something here." Leslie said excitedly, as they pulled out of the parking lot.

April nodded, fidgeting with her seatbelt, which was cutting uncomfortably into her breasts.

"Can we stop for something to eat?"

Leslie shook her head. "No time."

April pouted. "Come on, there's a Paunch Burger drive-thru right there."

Leslie licked her lips and slowed the car slightly.

"No!" She said firmly, shaking her head and stepping on the gas. "There's some snacks in the glove box."

April opened the small compartment, which was packed to the brim with various packages of candy, cookies and potato chips. Leslie reached over and grabbed a bag of gummy bears, tearing it open with her teeth and pouring them into her mouth. April chose a box of chocolate-chip cookies, popping them into her mouth two at a time and munching steadily.

They continued to snack, and the supply of junk food was significantly depleted by the time they pulled up in front of Eagleton City Hall.

After getting out of the car and throwing the keys at a snooty looking valet, Leslie hurried up the steps to the elaborate glass fronted building, causing her belly to bounce freely. April followed at a slower pace, munching on a large bar of chocolate.

"May I help you?" The man behind the counter asked, looking Leslie up and down.

Leslie took a second to catch her breath, tucking her blouse back in. "I... I need to see any and all records... relating to the Paunch Burger corporation."

"Oh I'm sorry," the man replied, in a tone suggesting he was anything but, "but the head of our records department is out of office at the moment, and she would need to authorise the release of any documents."

Leslie wasn't going to be beaten so easily. "Well, when will she be back?"

He shook his head. "Oh, she won't be back today, she's a judge at the Eagleton Food Festival."

"Food festival?" April asked, having arrived just in time to hear the last two words. "Where?"

The man looked down his nose at April's exposed midsection, but answered her question.

"In Pennington Square Park, just across the street."

***

After hurrying over to the park and paying the exorbitant thirty dollar entry fee for non-Eagleton residents, Leslie and April began to search for the judges.

Unfortunately, everywhere they went they found that they had just missed the judges, the food stuffs already bristling with ribbons of various colours.

They were also hindered by the fact that everyone was extremely generous handing out samples, offers that Leslie and April were unable to resist.

By the time they exited the cake pavilion, almost an hour after they began their search, they were both being slowed down by their increasingly full stomachs.

"We'll never find them at this rate." Leslie said anxiously. "We should split up."

"Fine." April said, brushing some crumbs out of her cleavage. "You go that way, I'll check this way."

Leslie nodded and followed the signs for the 'cookie marquee', waddling slightly due to her swollen stomach. She entered the tent, which smelled delightfully of vanilla and cinnamon, and scanned the crowd. The place was packed, which gave her hope that the judging was still going on.

She began to force her way through the crowd, her added bulk useful for once. There were scattered yelps as she accidentally trod on people's toes, but eventually she made her way close to the front. The last two rows were more stubborn than the others however, and refused to let her through. She could hear that an announcement was being made.

"And the winner in the shortbread category is..."

Leslie glanced around for something she could use to see over the crowd, and spied a folding chair leaning against the edge of a table.

Afterwards, Leslie hoped that maybe the chair had already been faulty, and that's why no one had been using it. She didn't want to believe she was heavy enough to cause the entire thing to collapse underneath her.

Either way, that was what happened, sending her flying forwards and crashing into a display table stacked high with elaborately frosted cookies, which also collapsed.

Groaning, she was pulled from the wreckage by two men, as the contestant whose entries had been crushed complained bitterly.

"Leslie? Is that you?"

Leslie looked up to see her ex-best friend and opposite number at the Eagleton Parks department, Lindsay Carlyle Shay, wearing a sash emblazoned with the word 'JUDGE'.

As Leslie was helped to a different, sturdier chair, Lindsay followed behind her.

"Leslie, what are you doing here?" She asked once they were alone. "And what happened to you?" She added, taking in her rival's expanded figure.

Leslie gave her the abridged version of events, mainly focusing on the sinister angle of Paunch Burger's agenda, glossing over her addiction to their mysteriously delicious food.

"We need to know what Paunch Burger is planning." Leslie concluded. "And that's why I need to find the head of your records department."

"Well, you're looking at her." Lindsay said, picking a mostly intact cookie from Leslie's hair. "And if they're as 'evil' as you say they are, I guess we should check them out."
1453322222211211111121.title: Unscheduled Diplomatic Visit to Eaglton, Indiana

14533222222112111111211.content:
Lindsay frowned as she clicked the search button one last time.

"I'm sorry Leslie, there's just no record of Paunch Burger doing any business in Eagleton."

They were back at City Hall, in Lindsay's office. After dragging April away from the pie-eating contest, they had gone straight there. April was lying on the couch, her mouth still stained with blueberry filling, while Leslie and Lindsey huddled around the desk.

"Frankly, they would never have met Eagleton's restrictions on saturated fats in food products."

Leslie furrowed her brow. "But that's impossible. April said that..."

She was interrupted by a knock on the door. It swung open to reveal the man from the front desk.

"Ms Shay, there's a call for Ms Knope on line two."

"Thank you Brandon." Lindsay said, waving him away. She picked up the phone and handed it to Leslie, before pressing the flashing button.

"Hello?"

"Leslie? Thank god! I've been trying to reach you for an hour." It was Ann, and she sounded stressed.

Leslie pressed the phone to her ear. "Ann, what's wrong?"

"You've got to get back here, now!" Ann told her. "They called a special session of the city council, and they're going to vote on the new Paunch Burger location."

Leslie gasped, but her mind worked quickly. "Okay, Ann, you need to stall for time. Citizen filibuster, phoney bomb threat, whatever it takes."

"I'll do what I can, just hurry!"

Leslie dropped the phone and ran out of the door, yelling a garbled thank you to Lindsay and promising that they would do lunch some time.

Lindsay bent down and picked the phone up off the floor. As she stood back up, she noticed that Leslie had left her jacket behind.

A rasping snore drew her attention to the couch, where April had apparently fallen asleep. A string of blueberry drool dripped from her open mouth on to the expensive white couch.

"Don't mention it Leslie." Lindsay sighed. "Any time."

***

Despite momentarily getting wedged in Eagleton's City Hall revolving door, Leslie made the journey back to Pawnee in close to record time. Her car screeched to a halt outside City Hall, and cursing Pawnee's lack of valet parking, she hurried inside.

She ran through the building and burst through the double doors of the city council chamber.

"I'm here! I'm here, stop!" She panted, bending double as she attempted to catch her breath. Clutching at the pain in her side, she looked up at the other members of the city council, who were watching her with a mixture of bewilderment and contempt.

"You're too late Knope." Councilman Jamm said with a sneer. "We already voted."

"No..." Leslie wheezed, as Ann helped her into a chair.

"I'm afraid he's right Leslie." Councilman Hauser said. "The new Paunch Burger location was approved three to one."

"Yes, despite the best efforts of this hefty mulatto gal." Councilman Milton added, drawing an indignant glare from Ann. "We had to threaten to eject her from the chamber."

Leslie squeezed her friend's hand in silent gratitude, then took a deep breath and stood back up.

"Gentlemen, you can't possibly call this a legitimate vote. I was given no warning about this special session, and therefore..."

"Nice try Knope." Jamm interjected. "But we called your office yesterday and left a message with your staff."

"It's true Leslie." Hauser confirmed. "I double-checked with one of your people this morning and they said you knew about it."

Leslie looked confused, but Ann was already piecing it together.

"Who did you talk to?" she asked, sounding like she already knew the answer.

Hauser paused as he tried to remember. "I think it was that young woman who's always scowling and muttering under her breath."

Leslie gasped. "April?"

Ann snapped her fingers. "I knew she was up to something!"

"But why would she do this?" Leslie asked, biting her lip. "There must be some explanation..."

Jamm cleared his throat. "I'm sure this is very interesting to you ladies, but some of us have custom ski boot fittings to get to. Let's put a bow on this sucker."

Councilman Dexhart seconded the motion, and Hauser adjourned the session with a bang of his gavel. As the other council members filed out, Leslie was still reeling. They had lost, and it seemed that April was the one who had betrayed them.

145332222221121111112111.content:
Leslie had followed Councilman Hauser all the way to his office pleading for an appeal but she didn’t have a bureaucratic leg to stand on. The vote was official and Leslie had no grounds to challenge that. Leslie and Ann now had their larger asses parked on the steps to Pawnee City Hall trying to piece together what options they had left.

“Come on Leslie, you’re not beat yet” Ann tried to console Leslie with a gentle rub on Leslie’s upper back. Ann couldn’t help but notice the developing rise and fall of back fat creasing into a roll along the once smooth posterior. “Couldn’t we still Rally Public support against it? They may have permission to build there but that doesn’t mean we have to let them.”

Leslie pulled her face from its pocket between her folded arms and cleavage and let out a mopey sigh. “Ann you brilliant beautiful delicious dollop of cream cheese…” Ann stopped her consonant massage and gave Leslie a worried look “Sorry, I’m starting to get pretty hungry” Leslie put a hand to the butterball gut she had developed. “Ann you’re right, I can’t let them win like this!” Leslie’s passion for public service beginning to build once more “Paunch Burger cannot be allowed to bully its way through the flawed but wonderful world of government procedure! I’ll find enough loop holes and ancient clauses to keep them from breaking ground as long as it takes to put a stop to this for good!”

A familiar BMW pulled up to the front of city hall and a thick pair of legs swung out trying to find support on the sidewalk. Leslie and Ann pulled themselves up from their stoop and began to advance towards the car. With a little help from inside April managed to rolled herself out and get herself standing as several empty burger wrappers tumbled out with her. She turned back to Lindsay huffing “Just call that number and ask to speak to Emily West, she’s the PR director for Paunch Burger and she’s a wiz at getting things like those restrictions cleared out of the way.”

“April!” Leslie squawked as soon as they reached the bottom of the steps “You betrayed me! You betrayed Pawnee!” April retrieved several Paunch Burger bags from the car before shutting the door and shifting her weight to turn and face Leslie who wasn’t finished. “I cannot believe you lied to me and helped those… those, evil, manipulative thugs to pass this vote!”

“Look, I’m sorry alright?” April sighed in her own way that showed no real remorse but still showed she meant it. “They said if I didn’t help them with this they were going to revoke our gold cards!” April’s voice took on a low whine “Leslie, I can’t lose this card. It’s too amazing; I get so much free food with it!” As if to emphasize her point April held up the three brown bags that bore the Paunch Burger logo and sizeable grease spots climbing the sides of them.

“Oh, you and your stupid Gold card! Leslie sneered with a cross tone “I’m so mad that I’m… I’m taking one of those!” Leslie reached out and snatched on of the stuffed bags of fast food and tore it open. She had done so well to resist the temptation until now but Leslie was stressed and angry, not to mention hungry. She just needed something to eat to calm herself down a little. She tried to look disappointed at April while fumbling to open the bag and grab a burger as fast as her fingers would allow. She passed the bag off to Ann who also couldn’t resist the temptation. Leslie tore open the wrapped and too a big needy bite. Her Scowl instantly melted away, the flavor making her knees weak.

“Oh god was it always so good?!” Leslie moaned practically in ecstasy with her mouth still full. Ann not in a rush to indulge this habit but unable to resist now that Leslie had made such an outburst was quickly unwrapping one for herself too.

“Oh god!” Ann exclaimed in a similar state “No, there is something different about these!” She cried and greedily took several more bites filling her cheeks.

April’s expression was one of guilty remorse “They’re the new Paunch Burger Deluxe Junior Triple…”

Leslie wanted to scold April some more but she was too busy relapsing her burger addiction into a second one. Ann was furiously licking her fingers trying not to do the same. “I’ve never seen those before, I haven’t even seen them advertised” Ann said sucking the last bit of grease from her thumb

“Well that’s the other thing I’ve been meaning to tell you…” April looked down and away from Ann and Leslie “Paunch Burger also threatened to take away my other perk if I didn’t help…”

“Waff othr purk?” Leslie chomped with her mouth full.

“I’ve been getting advance access to their new stuff they are planning to unveil… Things they will unveil as a part of new sponsorship deals.” April felt like she needed a burger now to ease her mind and moved to pluck one from the bag in Leslie’s hands “The Deluxe Junior Triple is going to be announced when they hold the press conference for the pet adoption center.

“You sold out the pet adoption center to Paunch Burger?!” Ann was shocked. “That’s the one job I’ve ever seen you show the slightest pride in and you let it get taken away-no you gave it away to some large corporation that’s just going to use it to market to kids already in need of companionship?”

“I’m very disappointed in you” Leslie said unconvincingly as she was going for burger number three. Ann had also lost her defiant posture and was getting her second.

“Look, I Don’t know... Leslie they’re so good!” April tried to rationalize “I’m not strong enough for this, they showed me the new burger and they said I could order them any time I wanted with my card if I just gave them the contract…” April ran her hand through her hair trying not to get emotional “I mean your friend seems to think I did the right thing…”

“Who?” Leslie slurped some sauce into her mouth as it tried to run down her lip “Lindsay? You told Lindsay about this and she wasn’t as outraged as I am?”

April pouted and fussed about for a moment “On the way here I asked her to stop at Paunch Burger, I needed a snack and I knew this was coming when I got back. I actually… shared my feelings with her I was so stressed out. She did say the same things as you at first so I made her try the burger herself, she didn’t want to but I was stronger than her, after she finished her third she said she could see how I let myself get taken in by them. She didn’t exactly sound like she was upset about it though…”

“That still doesn’t excuse betraying your friends and selling out your pride!” Leslie was mad again but digging into the bag for more. “…What’s this?” She asked pulling out a larger carton with the paunch burger logo. Opening she found it was full of small fried balls of some sort. Not even waiting for the explanation she plucked one out and popped it in her mouth. “Wow!” Leslie’s eyes lit up and she grabbed several more.

Ann also had to try one but after she overcame the look of bliss she cocked her head to the side and examined a second fried ball “Wait, you said you got advance access to new items for new sponsorships…” Ann said piecing the situation together. “That’s plural… What other sponserships are there…”

April didn’t answer and looked away again

“April…” Ann called her name in demand of an explanation

“They’re the new Butter Bites…” April mumbled

“This fried butter?!” Ann reeled in horror and put the ball back. She had to slap Leslie’s hand away from grabbing more. “What other sponsorships have you given them?” Ann interrogated.

“I let them see some of the proposed projects the parks department didn’t give funding to…” April snatched the butter bites from Leslie and scooped a large handful up with the plump fingers to stress eat. “I let them put in funding for a few projects without telling you… These are what they gave me for the campaign to place a bench every twenty feet on Pawnee sidewalks… The one you both said was a bad idea and didn’t approve… I kinda let them slip the paper work past you…”

“You went under my nose and gave Paunch Burger fast track approval to projects you knew I was against!? That does it little missy!” Leslie said getting genuinely upset now “As of right now you are on suspension! Without pay!” Leslie boiled with civic rage “I can’t even look at you!”

Leslie grabbed a second bag from April’s hands and stormed back into the government building. Ann turned and gave April a disappointed shake of her head and followed Leslie. April was left on the sidewalk with only one bag of fast food left to console her.

1453322222221.title: Mindy

145332222222111.content:
Dr Mindy Lahiri hadn't always had the curvaceous, womanly figure that was the subject of much envy and desire. Before she started college, she was slim, skinny, downright scrawny. But away from the supervision of her parents, introduced to the wonders of beer, late night pizza and a generous dining hall plan, her weight ballooned. She gained the freshman fifty rather than the traditional fifteen, with most of it settling in her hips and ass.

A summer spent under her parents watchful eyes carved a few pounds off of her widening rear, but by the time she returned home for Thanksgiving they were back, and had brought reinforcements. Her weight increased slowly but steadily over the next three years thanks to instant noodles, beer bongs and ice cream binges, and by the time she was accepted into Columbia Medical School, Mindy weighed just over two hundred and fifty pounds.

In the end it wasn't health concerns that convinced her that she needed to lose weight, but rather the photos from her senior year spring break trip. She looked like a beached whale in her red two piece swimsuit, especially next to her best friend Gwen's svelte physique. A summer of rigorous diet and exercise dropped her down to two hundred, and throughout med school her weight continued to fluctuate, gradually trending downwards.

When she finally graduated, she was hovering right around one hundred and fifty pounds, and had been, more or less, ever since.

This morning however, she stepped on to the scales and watched them tick up to one hundred and sixty two pounds. She placed her hands on her spreading pot belly and frowned.
145332222222111.title: Weight Gain

1453322222221112.content:
In the end, Mindy decided not to worry about her few extra pounds. It was just a little winter weight, nothing more. She got dressed for work, trying to ignore the little extra effort it took to fasten her skirt, the little bulge of flesh that muffin topped out over her waistband.

She resolved to have a light breakfast, a resolve which broke down when she reached the bagel shop. She ordered a double bacon and cream cheese bagel, though as a compromise she decided to get a skim milk latte, with only a single shot of caramel.

"Morning Dr. L." Morgan said cheerfully as she walked out of the elevator, wiping her mouth with a napkin.

"Good morning Morgan." Mindy replied. "Any mail?"

"Only this." He reached behind the counter and pulled out a large, expensive looking box of chocolates.

Mindy looked surprised. "Who sent them?" She asked, taking the hefty box.

Morgan shrugged. "The note just said 'For Dr. Lahiri, thanks for everything'."

"Must be from a patient." Mindy said, examining the box as Morgan walked away. 200 luxurious milk chocolate over rich caramel centers...

She made it to her office, and even opened one or two emails, before giving in a opening the box. The chocolates, laid out in rows on a paper lined tray, were delicious, and she ate a dozen without really thinking about it.

Throughout the morning, Mindy continued to graze on the tasty treats, grabbing a few every time she had a spare moment. Her concerns about her weight were forgotten, as she focused on the demanding daily routine of an OBGYN.

When lunch rolled around, she had emptied the first two trays, exactly one hundred of the chocolates.

"Anything for lunch Dr. Lahiri?" Betsy asked, pen and paper in hand.

Mindy looked guiltily at the half empty box. "Just a smoothie, I think. Bananatastic. With energy boost."

Betsy smiled and wrote down the order. She was still smiling when she stopped out of the office door, but once it clicked closed behind her, it changed instantly to a worried frown. Morgan hurried up to her.

"Well?" He asked expectantly.

"Bananatastic smoothie." Betsy told him in a hushed tone.

He laughed, quietly. "Perfect. Make sure to get an extra large."

Betsy looked conflicted. "Morgan, I don't know if we should be doing this."

Now Morgan frowned. "C'mon Bets, we agreed that we'd do whatever it takes to get Dr. L and Dr. C together, and this is how we do it."

Betsy nodded. "I guess so."

Morgan took her by the arm and lead her to the elevator bank. "Now bring that smoothie to me when you get back, and I'll mix in a few scoops of the weight gain powder. We'll have Dr. L porked up in no time."

***

Mindy's smoothie was delicious, if a little thicker than usual. She slurped down the whole thing in a manner of minutes, her stomach bloating out slightly further, bulging visibly under her sweater.

In the afternoon, she had some appointments with patients, all in various stages of pregnancy, from baby bump to ready to drop. She put the chocolates away in a desk drawer, and told herself it was to look professional, not to avoid sharing them with her patients.

She was just finishing up for the day when Morgan came in with a thick slice of cake on a paper plate. A birthday party in another office was the vague explanation, but Mindy didn't even listen, setting about the red velvet with a plastic fork. She never questioned free cake.

Morgan looked on, grinning evilly.
1453322222221112.title: Someone is fattening Mindy up.

14533222222211122.content:
"That was some good cake" Said Mindy, once she had finished "If... There happened to be any left over... Please feel free to drop it by my office... You know, waste not want not or whatever"

Morgans evil grin widened at this request, as he realised his plan was going to be even easier than he had ever imagined.

"Well your in luck there Doc" He said "As it turned out that nobody wanted the cake... It's low fat you see, some people are funny about that"

"Low fat? Holy crap" Exclaimed Mindy "In that case please bring it by, I'll give it a good home"

"Sure thing" Said Morgan, before whispering "A good home in your chubby gut"

Within moments Morgan had returned, and placed the substantial cake on Mindys desk. Of course the 'low fat' statement had been a complete lie on Morgans behalf, as the cake could scarcely have contained more calories than it did (Morgan had added a generous amount of weight gain powder to the thick icing). He smiled as he saw Mindy slaver, her eyes wide in greedy anticipation of the gorging to come.

"Thank you Morgan" She said, trying to compose herself in front of her colleague "Now I would be alone... Um paperwork and doctor stuff to do"

"Of course" He said "See you later"

One Morgan had closed the door Mindy launched her attack on the large cake left before her. With her bare hands Mindy tore the cake into bite size pieces which find their way quickly into her mouth. Mindy shovelled the cake into her mouth at an ever accelerating speed, ignoring the feeling of fullness she felt in favour of gorging on the delicious fattening confectionary. Mindy was completely lost in her own gluttony, her surroundings fading as her only focus was on eating as much cake as possible. Suddenly the was a knock at the door which brought Mindy back to earth with a bump. The plate before her was bare, meaning that she had consumed the entire cake in about five minutes. Mindy quickly composed herself, removing the plate from the table and brushing the crumbs from its surface.

"Come in -hicc!-" She said, rearranging her top which clung tightly over her bloated belly.

The door opened and Danny entered, which made Mindy sit a little more stiffly and feel self conscious.

"Hello Dr. Lahiri" He said "Do you have that... Um... I think you've got some chocolate on your face or something"

"Oh... Damn" Said Mindy, clearly embarrassed "Urrrrrp!! Oops, excuse me"

Danny raised an eyebrow as Mindy hurriedly wiped the chocolate frosting from the corner of her mouth.

"I could come back later" Said Danny awkwardly.

"No no" Said Mindy, regaining her composure and trying to exude professionalism rather than gluttony "I am listening Dr. Castellano, how can I help you?"

Danny smirked, not wanting to admit to himself how cute Mindy was when she tried to look professional.

What happens next?

That evening, Monica was waiting for Rachel to get home. She had decided against mentioning her friend's weight gain, but had resolved to at least stop serving up so much fattening food.

She heard the key turning in the lock and tried to look nonchalant as she tossed the salad she had made.

Rachel shrugged. "Eh, it's cool. I was kind if in the mood for pizza tonight anyway."

As she picked up the phone and started dialling, Monica tried to redirect the conversation.

"You know, I was planning to go for a jog later, maybe down to the Park?"

Rachel covered the mouthpiece and looked thoughtful for a second. "The Park? Well if you're going... could you pick me up a dozen donuts from that place on third?"

***

"Urp!" Rachel let out a burp, having drained the last of her soda. She still had two slices of pizza left, but she was already pretty full. Her stomach was hard and round, but the pizza was just too good, the perfect balance of grease and cheese. She wiped her mouth with the back of her hand and picked up another slice. She folded it in half and crammed it in her mouth, letting out a little satisfied moan.

Behind her, Monica opened the apartment door, awkwardly balancing the large pink box of donuts. She had considering not getting them, but on the way back she was kind of in the mood for then herself. As she walked into the kitchen, she saw Rachel on the couch, shoving the last slice of pizza down while rubbing her distended stomach with the other, before laying back and letting out a long satisfied belch.

When she saw Monica, she still had the decency to look faintly embarrassed. "Oh, hi." She said, sitting up and pulling her shirt down over her stomach. "Did you get the donuts?"

Monica nodded and brought over the box, which Rachel took eagerly.

As she watched her friend happily grab a donut and start eating, Monica made a decision...
