Today on Mythbusters, some classic weight gain myths are put to the test. First up: can a person really gain hundreds of pounds in a single sitting?

“It’s a scenario that we’ve all seen countless times in weight gain stories,” Kari said. “Somebody gorges themselves endlessly on a ridiculous amount of food and ends up becoming extremely fat in a very short amount of time, sometimes less than a day. But cartoonish as it may seem, could it actually be possible, with the right foods, to actually gain a significant amount of weight in a single day? Well, there’s only one way to find out.”

The camera zoomed out to reveal Kari seated at a large table piled high with a diverse array of cakes, pies, cookies, and other high-calorie pastries.

“For the next twenty-four hours, I am going to eat as much of this food as possible, and see how much weight I can gain. Then we should have a pretty good idea of whether or not a person can become significantly fatter in the course of just one day.”

Grant and Tory quickly escorted Kari over to a large scale to get her starting weight.

“115 pounds,” Tory announced. “Okay, let’s get started.”

Kari then sat down at the table and dug in, stuffing her face with mouthful after mouthful of rich chocolate cake as fast as she could. After the first cake was gone she moved onto another, then another. Two hours into her feast, Kari was feeling very stuffed. Her stomach was starting to bulge out slightly, and the button on the front of her jeans was about to pop off. She was starting to feel tired from constantly shoveling food into her mouth and almost began to slow down, but she was determined to proceed in the name of science. Grant and Tory teased her as she chowed down by doing things like spraying whip cream onto a slice of cake that she was about to bite into, or occasionally poking her in the belly. “Guys, cut it out,” Kari attempted to say with her mouth full.

Several hours and hundreds of thousands of calories later…

Carla nodded again, and went into the bedroom to grab the basket, pausing momentarily to make the bed, partly out of habit from working in the hospital. She brought the dirty clothes down to the laundry room in the building's basement and separated them into darks and lights, with a third wash for delicates. She turned on the machines and went back upstairs to tidy the apartment a little, ignoring Elliot's weak protests. She just straightened and tidied, although she couldn't help but notice that the entire basket of mini-muffins had been emptied.

Taking the list and Elliot's credit card, she headed to the grocery store, after transferring the laundry to the dryers. She picked up everything on the list, getting double the amount of ice-cream because it was on sale, and a few extra things for the meal she had planned. She got back to the apartment, hauling grocery bags in one hand and the nearly folded laundry in the other, letting herself in with Elliot's spare key.

After putting away her clothes, Carla made a quick salad to tide Elliot over, before starting to cook the main meal.

"Ooh, that smells good! What are you making?" Elliot asked, over the hiss of hot oil. She had relaxed a little bit, possibly as a result of her pain medication.

"Empanadas." Carla explained, carrying out a plateful. "It's chicken, cheese and vegetables all wrapped up in little parcels of fried dough. It's a family recipe."

Elliot thanked her profusely as she tucked into the delicious food, finishing the entire plate in minutes. A second soon followed, and then a third. By the time Carla had finished packing another two dozen empanadas into Tupperware containers for tomorrow, Elliot was positively stuffed, her round stomach peeking out from under her top.

Regardless, Carla brought out one of the tubs of ice-cream she had bought, handing Elliot a spoon and a bottle of chocolate sauce. She had already made a noticeable dent in it by the time Carla finished washing up the dishes, and pulled on her coat.

"Good night Elliot, those Tupperware containers are in the fridge, they'll be fine cold, or just two minutes in the microwave." Carla said, trying not to let her tiredness show.

Early the next morning, Sunny was sitting on the bench just across from the hospital's main entrance, sipping a cup of coffee and attempting to piece together the events of the previous evening.

Jordan had lead her into Doctor Cox's office, which Sunny was relieved to discover was empty, the Chief of Medicine having gone home for the evening. Her relief was short lived however, as Jordan shoved her down on to the couch and told her not to move her fat ass.

The older woman had clearly been there already, judging by the half-eaten junk food and empty bottles that were dotted around the room, not to mention the broken chair. Jordan lurched around the room, gathering up whatever she could find before returning to Sunny.

"Open wide!" She had crooned, shoving a partly-eaten chilli dog into Sunny's mouth, muffling her protests. When that was gone, she moved on to a mostly intact cheeseburger, followed by a sleeve of lukewarm curly fries.

Sunny had tried to resist, but Jordan was not to be denied. When she attempted to bat the food away, Jordan had grabbed her stethoscope and used it to tie her hands behind her back.

With Sunny effectively trapped, Jordan had leisurely stuffed her, sometimes taking a few bites for herself before cramming the rest into the immobilised intern. Sunny's belly had swollen out further and further, forcing her scrubs top up to just underneath her enormous breasts. This amused Jordan to no end, and she cackled as she poked and prodded at the younger woman's bloated stomach.

"Wow, you can really put it away, can't you?" Jordan said, slapping her hand against Sunny's taut flesh. "I think you and me are going to have a lot of fun together..."

Sunny must have passed out at that point, because the next thing she knew light was streaming in through the window shade, and Jordan was no where to be seen. Her arms were cramping painfully, and her head was pounding as well, probably due to the half bottle of vodka that Jordan had poured down her throat. She started to panic when she realised that Doctor Cox could arrive at any moment, and with a squeak that turned into a grunt, she heaved herself to her feet, almost tipping over due to her still swollen belly.
Somehow she managed to pull her hands free, and after surveying the mess for a few seconds, decided her best option was simply to flee.

By some miracle the hallway outside the office was empty, and Sunny managed to make it all the way to the women's locker room without anyone seeing her. After cleaning herself up and changing her scrubs, she had realised that her next shift was starting in less than an hour.

Sitting on the bench, Sunny wondered exactly what Ms. Sullivan had meant when she said they were going to have fun together...

Her thoughts were interrupted by the arrival of Denise, who sat down next to her, causing the wooden bench to creak alarmingly. The blonde was panting heavily, dark sweat stains visible at the armpits of her grey sweatsuit. The reason for her exhaustion was the two suitcases, one duffel bag and three black garbage sacks she had dragged all the way from the bus stop.

"Denise? What happened?" Sunny asked, genuinely concerned but also happy for the distraction.

It took Denise another minute to catch her breath, before she launched into her explanation.

It seemed she had been a little late in the rent for her apartment. More than a little late. She had been spending practically all of her disposable income on food, and when that ran out she had started in on her less-than-disposable income. When her landlady came looking for the money, she had found the apartment 'a little messy' and had used that as an excuse to kick her out.

In truth, Denise's apartment had been more than 'a little messy'. Her new habits left little time for cleaning, so anything she was finished with usually just ended up on the floor. Pizza boxes, beer bottles, clothes that no longer fit her... In some places the floor was covered in a layer of trash almost six inches deep. When the landlady arrived she had made her way through the piles of garbage to find Denise asleep on the couch in her underwear, a bucket of fried chicken under one arm, a half-eaten drumstick clenched in her fist.

"That's awful!" Sunny sympathised, taking the story at face value.

"Yeah, it sucks balls." Denise agreed.

Sunny looked momentarily out of sorts, but she immediately perked back up. "You could move in with me! The couch folds out into a bed, and there's still plenty of closet space."

"Cool, thanks." Denise said casually, sniffing at her armpits. "I'll bring my stuff over when my shift ends."

Sunny smiled excitedly, clapping her hands together. Denise was about to tell her to calm down when a car pulled up in front of the hospital.

The passenger door opened, and with a little rocking back and forth and a helpful push from the driver, Katie squeezed her way out of the car.

When she shuffled out of the way and closed the door, Denise and Sunny saw the driver of the car was Doctor Reid.

"See you at lunch Katie! We can try that new cupcake place, and maybe pick you up some new pants." Elliot said, waving to the other interns before driving away.

Katie looked embarrassed as Sunny and Denise stared at her.

"Did you spend the night at Doctor Reid's?" Denise asked, her eyebrows raised.

Katie was a little cagey."No. Well, yes. Nothing happened."

Nothing had happened, to Katie's continuing confusion. After finishing off the entire pie, Elliot hand feeding her the last slice, Katie could barely keep her eyes open.

Elliot had guided her upstairs, to her own bedroom, and had even helped her remove her shirt and pants. Katie had laid there, naked but for her tight black underwear, expecting at any second to feel Doctor Reid's hands on her thighs, when suddenly the lights went out.

"Nighty night!" Elliot had said cheerily, closing the door behind her as she left.

Katie was left in the dark, literally and figuratively. She wasn't sure if she was relieved or disappointed, just that she was very confused.

She was no less confused this morning, Doctor Reid bringing her breakfast in bed, mounds of bacon and eggs, before leaving her to get dressed and driving her to the hospital.

She looked at her two fellow interns and shrugged. "You guys want to get something to eat?"

Their various problems put aside for now, the three hungry interns went in search of breakfast.

Sunny found herself nodding, picking up a burger and biting into it, Jordan smirking at the sight and taking her own big bite of a hot dog loaded with condiments, a wet splat sounding as a glob of ketchup and mustard plopped onto Jordan's exposed stomach.

The burger was followed by a chunk of sandwich, then some spaghetti, after that a few donuts, and then Sunny lost count, eating for all she was worth.

Ms. Sullivan's...or Jordan's she supposed now, glares were scary.

As she finished off the tray, helped by Jordan as she struggled to get a few last bites in, Sunny felt giddy, woozy, and totally stuffed.

"It's fun, isn't it intern?"

Sunny nodded, Jordan's smirk widening as she returned her attention to her own tray.

"Getting...urph...ugh...stuffed until you can't move. I'm almost there and I can't even eat half of what you just consumed now. But I'll get there, trust me intern, and you're going to help me."

"How?"

Jordan's smirk morphed to a grin as she replied...
15531221111111112112.title: Jordan has plans for Sunny...

15532.content: Carrie Heffernan or somebody else?
15532.title: Carrie Heffernan

choices: Carrie gets a job working for Kirstie Alley
1553211.content: The first choice will be a sort of expansion/ homage to an existing King Of Queens episode (entitled "Apartment Complex" I believe), where Carrie gets a job working for Kirstie Alley and ends up becoming a food taster for her. If you want to start a different story choose the second option.
1553211.title: Story choice

15532111.content:
It was around about 6pm in Queens when Doug Heffernan returned home from a hard days work.

“Hey” He said to his beautiful wife Carrie who was fretting in the kitchen.

“Oh hey…” She said without looking up as she frantically disturbed the clutter next to the kitchen cupboard.

“You’ll never believe what happened at work today…” Began Doug as he attempted to regale his wife on a rather dull story about package delivery, which he believed to be particularly hilarious.

“Sorry, no time” Said Carrie vaguely, again without looking up.

“If you’re looking for the Chinese menus they’re right over there, y’know what I’m sayin’” Said Doug, unperturbed by his wife ignoring him.

“Sorry baby” Said Carrie apologetically, looking up at Doug for the first time, “I can’t eat here tonight, I’ve got to go to work”

“Work? It’s 6pm!” Said Doug in disbelief.

“Yeah I know…” Said Carrie, “But I have a new client I’ve got to please”

“Oh yeah?” Said Doug, sounding genuinely interested, “Who?”

Carrie smiled, happy to share this big news “Kirstie Alley!”

“Wow… Awesome” Said Doug, “You’re finally going somewhere then huh?”

Carrie gave him a look which made Doug double back on his words, “Which isn’t to say you weren’t going somewhere before… Your always going forward” He said fumbling with words “In fact sometimes I worry your going too far forward y’know what I’m sayin?”

“Well anyway…” Continued Carrie, “This is very big news for me, but I can’t find my damn car keys!”

“Oh here you go” Said Doug, handing the keys over to Carrie which prompted another stare.

“Arthur was using them to clean something off the bottom of his shoe” He explained.

“Nice” She said unenthusiastically.

What happens next?
15532111.title: Big news for Carrie

155321112.content:
Carrie pecked Doug on the cheek and disappeared out of the door in a flash, leaving Doug to examine the Chinese menu alone. After committing several traffic violations on the way she finally arrived at her office, hurried into the building and pressed a number in the elevator for a floor she’d never visited before. She rearranged herself hurriedly in the mirrored walls of the elevator, making sure her hair was neat and her bra was comfortable before she stepped out. The corridors were unsurprisingly rather quiet, most of the staff having gone home already, though a few stragglers remained still hard at work. Carrie came to the door of the meeting room where she had been instructed to meet Kirstie and knocked lightly before she entered. Kirstie was sat at the long table and smiled at Carrie.

“You must be Carrie” She said, extending her hand which Carrie shook.

“Yeah… Who are you again?” Responded Carrie jokingly and they both shared a laugh.

“Please take a seat” Said Kirstie, gesturing to a seat next to hers and Carrie obeyed.

The next ten minutes were an ice breaking session, as Carrie tried her best to form a good early relationship with her client. Carrie knew exactly how important this was, and if she lost Kirstie as a client she would not only have wasted all the hard work it took to reach this point, but also put her back in possibly a worse position than she was before. Failure was not an option. Soon the topic eventually (and inevitably) arrived at Kirsties recent, and well publicized, weight loss which she was more than happy to discuss with Carrie.

“You look great!” Commented Carrie.

“Thanks” said Kirstie, “It was really hard work, but now I can reap the benefits”

“Yeah I bet, what were you like 300 pounds?” Said Carrie bluntly without thinking and saw Kirstie’s jaw tense momentarily.

“Ahem… about 230 actually” She said rather stiffly.

“Erm… Well you look amazing now at least” Carrie said, trying to save the situation and to her relief Kirstie smiled.

“It’s still hard though” Said Kirstie, “I mean the cravings never truly go away”

What happens next?
155321112.title: Meeting Kirstie

choices: Kirstie asks Carrie to taste the food for her
1553211121.content:
Suddenly there was a knock at the door, and Carrie got up to answer it. Upon opening it Carrie found herself looking at a small half cast man, who had a cart completely packed with all manner of rather unhealthy snacks. The man began to push the cart into the room without waiting for authorization from Carrie and Carrie looked at Kirstie nervously.

"Ok back up buddy boy" She said to the man, "We don't need this"

"Oh it's okay Carrie" Said Kirstie, "Just because I'm on a diet doesn't mean you can't eat anything in front of me"

"Are you sure?" Asked Carrie uncertainly.

"Positive" Replied Kirstie, "I've had to have a lot of willpower to get this far, so I'm sure I'll be fine"

The small half cast man left the room without a word, and when he closed the door the two got back on with business. Carrie could see Kirstie's eyes occasionally flicker to the snack laden cart and she regretted allowing it to stay here.

What happens next?
1553211121.title: Temptation enters

15532111211.content:
"Uh Carrie?" Interjected Kirstie suddenly while Carrie was in mid sentence.

"Yes?" Said Carrie.

"Sorry to interrupt" Said Kirstie, "But you look hungry... Have something to eat"

"Uh okay" Said Carrie a little uncertainly, grabbing a large chocolate glazed donut from the cart and taking a bite.

"How is it?" Asked Kirstie, her eyes wide with intense interest.

"Um it's good" Replied Carrie as she finished the donut, "Are you okay Kirstie?"

"Oh sorry yes I'm fine" Said Kirstie, snapping out of an apparent trance "This is just one of the methods I've used to lose weight, other people eat all the nice stuff I'm no longer allowed to eat and they describe to me how it tastes. It's surprisingly effective"

"Oh that's clever" Said Carrie, hiding her actual opinion of the bizarre method.

"Yeah i know" Said Kirstie smiling, though her eyes noticeably flitted back to the pile of food, "That danish looks really nice"

Carrie understood what Kirstie was getting at, and fearful of losing such an important client she sighed and picked it up.

"How is it?" Asked Kirstie eagerly as Carrie began to eat.

"Very sweet and vanillary" Responded Carrie as she munched on the fattening confectionary.

Kirstie watched her eat with the same wide eyed awe as before and truth be told it was beginning to make Carrie feel a little uncomfortable. She finished the large danish and wiped a rogue piece of icing from the corner of her mouth.

"Yummy" She said with forced enthusiasm.

Kirstie eyed the rest of the food and Carrie realized she wouldn't be happy until she finished the whole cart. Carrie sighed and grabbed another donut, taking a reluctant bite. For the next half an hour Carrie munched her way through the stack of fattening foodstuffs, describing to Kirstie how delicious everything was. She was far from enjoying herself but was extremely desperate to please Kirstie, so she tried her best not to show it.

"Are you full already?" Asked Kirstie disappointedly after half an hour of solid eating on Carrie's behalf, as she had noticeably slowed her pace.

What happens next?
15532111211.title: Kirstie's food taster

155321112112.content:
"Uhh -urp!- to be honest Kirstie, I really am" Said Carrie weakly, shifting uncomfortably in her seat.

"I can't remember the last time i felt full" Said Kirstie, more to herself than to Carrie "And i certainly wouldn't have gotten so full so easily..."

"Sorry Kirstie" Said Carrie quietly "But my appetite just ain't as large as yours"

"Well that's unfortunate Carrie..." Said Kirstie in a casually offhand manner "I thought we had a good thing going here... But perhaps I need to find somebody with a bit more flexibility..."

"Woah there, back up a few steps" Said Carrie, suddenly becoming animated at the prospect of losing such an important client "Maybe I could um... Eat a little more"

Kirstie smiled happily, and handed Carrie a large deli sandwich. Carrie took a deep breath in preparation and undid the buttons on the bottom of her jacket as it felt a little tight over her bloated belly. Carrie ploughed into the sandwich, figuring the faster she ate the easier it would be (a technique she had gotten from Doug), stopping only to explain the taste to Kirstie who was watching eagerly. Carrie groaned as Kirstie's gaze didn't waver and she had to grab the next item off the trolley and began to eat it. It was with commendable effort that Carrie finished everything on the trolley and when she'd taken her final bite she collapsed back into her chair, breathing heavily.

What happens next?
155321112112.title: I remember the last time i felt full...

1553211121122.content:
"Okay Carrie" Said Kirstie sounding appeased "I think we're going to have a very productive relationship indeed"

"That's -urp!- very good to hear" Replied Carrie, sounding rather relieved and tired.

Carrie got groggily to her feet, the bump of her bloated belly looking like the early stages of pregnancy. The two shook hands, exchanged numbers and Carrie was finally allowed to go home.

What next?
1553211121122.title: Carrie goes home

15532111211221.content: It was hours before Carrie could get to sleep, and it had taken several swigs of Pepto-Bismol before her stomach stopped complaining. Hugging it in her nightdress, she tossed and turned in her sheets as her eyes slowly slipped shut, and she began to dream...
15532111211221.title: Later that same night...

155321112112211.content:
Carrie found herself being moved, almost like she was sitting on the subway, only very slowly. When she looked around, she saw that she was sitting in a wheelchair, most of her body covered in a thick, chevron blanket. She tried to get up but couldn’t, almost like her legs didn’t work. She did manage to get one of her arms to move out from under the blanket and made a simple guess as to why most of her body wasn’t moving: She was too weak. From under the blanket she saw she was wearing a white t shirt with short sleeves, showing to her an outstretched arm of almost bone, almost like she hadn’t eaten anything her entire life.

Almost as quickly as she saw her arm, a perfectly healthy hand stuffed her form back under the blanket, as Kirstie’s voice coos, “No, no, no. Not yet, my little pig, soon you will be ready.” Carrie decided to instead start looking around, finding that she was in some hallway, the walls covered with mirrors. She saw Kirstie was dressed like a nurse in a cheap porno, but Carrie looked at her face and saw how sunken in it is. She decided to stop looking at herself and look forward, eventually finding the hallway ending at a simple dining table made of mirrors.

Her wheelchair was placed at the head of the table, and Kirstie struts off to the other side of the table. She claps in a snobbish way, and faceless butlers appeared out of thin air, carrying with them trays after trays of foods. Some had nothing but hot dogs, spaghetti, pizza, steak, cake, burgers, lobster, and other meals and desserts. When the food was placed before her, she didn’t even wait to start. At first she moved slowly with a fork already in hand, jabbing at anything and everything, but with her first bite, she noticed that she started to look healthier already.

The second she thought that, she threw the blanket off of her, now seeing she has on a pair of jeans to go with her white shirt. She suddenly started eating with gusto, it didn’t matter what she ate, it just mattered that she didn’t become like that skeleton again. While she was munching on a burger, she felt her shirt ride up on her, she looked down and saw that she now had a pot belly, now visible as her shirt had ridden up her body into a second bra. She didn’t care and continued to eat.

As she continues eating, she finds that her arms and legs have gotten thicker, with a double chin forming. Her thick frame had popped the button of her jeans off, flying a few feet away at Kirstie's feet. Kirstie takes this as a cue to help out. She struts over to Carrie as she’s busy shovelling ice cream into her mouth, staining her white shirt with all kinds of food. Kirstie takes this time to grope Carries massive stomach and equally massive breasts. She then orders more food and starts taking the fork that Carrie discarded what felt like long ago and started feeding her the food. Suddenly, a tear is heard in Carries jeans and shirt, tearing at the seams.
155321112112211.title: Sweet Dreams....

155321112112212.content:
Carrie was sitting on a gilded chair, at the head of a long table, loaded with food. In front of her was an almost-empty plate, a few scattered shrimps the remnants of a meal that had almost spilled onto the table, and she stabbed at the remaining portions with her fork, quickly and eagerly placing them into her waiting mouth, each one a brief burst of garlic and butter as it went down. Her other hand had a piece of savoury pastry, and she stuff it in after the shrimp, hastily chewing to get it down. Still a few pieces of shrimp remained, but she looked up to see Kirstie walking towards her, carrying another plate.

The new plate was a pyramid of fried rice, liberally doused in heavy, thick sauce with pieces of chicken and pork heaped on top. Kirstie, looking approvingly at Carrie, snatched the empty plate away as she placed the new one down, and Carrie took the opportunity to take another last piece of shrimp before continuing with her meal. Dropping the fork, she switched to a spoon and started to shovel her new course into her mouth, taking huge bites of rice, meat and sauce, which dribbled down the sides of her mouth, running down her growing double chin. She took bite after bite, and her belly began to grow, putting pressure on her buttons as she briefly gasped for breath.

Then Kirstie arrived again, carrying a bowl this time with a ladle placed in it; Carrie had only eaten about two-thirds of the rice, and though she dug in with gusto, she hadn't finished by the time Kirstie switched dishes. She looked down again, and saw a huge bowl of thick, fatty stew, loaded with meat with fat glistening on the top, and forgetting the rice, she started to take huge mouthfuls of the bubbling broth, at first using her spoon before switching to the convenient ladle. Her buttons were really beginning to strain now as she continued to expand, fat building up on her arms and legs, her trouser seams beginning to complain. She paused for a second, gasping for breath, and saw Kirstie walking down again, this time pushing a trolley in front of her. She paused in front of Carrie, looking down with a smile, then reached to her belly, jiggling the fat with her hand.

"You're doing well, my little piggy."

Carrie looked up with a mix of despair and greed, and Kirstie took away the bowl, replacing it this time with half a dozen plates from the trolley, this time all sweets. A pile of eclairs, a jelly as big as her head, a trio of huge cakes, and a massive tureen of chocolate dessert. Her eager hands reached for the new food as Kirstie watched, snatching handfuls of cake and taking them to her waiting mouth, then pushing eclairs down with a trio of bites, before finally she went for the dessert, taking deep mouthfuls.

With a crack, the buttons on her top gave, and her belly fat rolled out across her lap. She looked down, drips of chocolate running onto her exposed stomach, then up at Kirstie who started to laugh, then moved across to the table, picking up one of the cakes and shoving it in Carrie's face.

"Keep eating! You've got to eat more, and more and MORE!"
155321112112212.title: or Nightmares....

choices: They go to a unhealthy restaurant
15532111211222.content:
The next day, after Carrie had bid Doug farewell and was about to leave home herself the home phone started ringing.

"Hello?" Said Carrie impatiently, as she was in a rush.

"Oh yes hi Carrie" Said the voice on the other end "It's Kirstie"

"Uh, hi Kirstie" Said Carrie, sounding a little confused "What's up?"

"Sorry to bother you at home" Said Kirstie "But do you fancy grabbing some breakfast?"

"Um yeah sure..." Said Carrie, not really thinking about the implications of her decision.

"Ok great" Said Kirstie happily.

What happens next?
15532111211222.title: The next day...

155321112112222.content:
"Meet you at Chubbies bar and grill in twenty" Said Kirstie happily "It's just down the road from the office"

"Okay then, I'll see you there" Said Carrie, hanging up the phone and leaving the house.

Perhaps if Carrie wasn't so eager to please her new employer she would of taken some time to think about what kind of restaurant would be dubbed 'Chubbies'. If she had she would of had some idea what was in store for her...

-----------------------------------------------

"Hey Carrie" Said Kirstie as Carrie entered the restaurant, waving her over to the table she was sat at.

"Hey Kirstie" Said Carrie taking a seat, then raising an eyebrow at the table full of food that was already laid out "Wow... That's quite a breakfast you've got yourself there..."

"Oh no no" Said Kirstie, indicating a small plate of toast "This is mine... I ordered this for you"

"Uh... Haha... All of this is for me?" Said Carrie in disbelief, though still attempting you seem jovial "I think you've got me confused with my husband, you know what I'm saying?"

"Oh come on Carrie" Said Kirstie encouragingly "Breakfast is the most important meal of the day. It would mean a lot to me if you gave it a go."

Kirstie gave Carrie a meaningful look after this last sentence, making it easy for her to read between the lines. Carrie looked over the gigantic and rather unhealthy looking breakfast Kirstie had ordered for her and sighed, knowing that she would be expected to finish the lot.

"Well no time like the present I guess" Said Carrie unable to hide her uncertainty as she took her first bite.

"How does it taste? Good?" Asked Kirstie, who had already eaten her toast.

"Yesh actually" Replied Carrie through a very tasty mouthful of pancakes and heavy syrup "Absolutely delicious"

This continued for twenty minutes as Carrie enjoyed each flavourful mouthful, whilst describing her pleasure to Kirstie who watched on with intense interest. By this point Carrie was feeling extremely full and was beginning to slow down significantly, though she knew from her experience the previous day that Kirstie wouldn't be happy if she gave up.

"You can't be done already" Said Kirstie as Carrie's progress slowed to a crawl.

"I'm really trying Kirstie... Urp... But I'm really full..." Replied Carrie sounding fatigued.

What happens next?
155321112112222.title: Chubbies Restaurant

1553211121122221.content:
"Here" Said Kirstie soothingly, picking up her own fork "allow me to help you"

"No that's okay Kirstie serious-Glumph!" Carrie was cut off as Kirstie stuffed a large piece of pancake into her mouth.

"Now now" Said Kirstie "I'm here to help my dear. You continue feeding yourself and with my added assistance you'll be done in no time"

Carrie groaned miserably, but nonetheless complied in order to please her crazy new employer. Each time Carrie swallowed each mouthful of food from her own fork another one quickly followed from Kirstie, who was leant over the table smiling sweetly at her.

"When I used to be fat I loooved being fed!" Said Kirstie, reminiscing as she crammed a forkfull of food into Carrie's mouth.

"Urp! Uhhr, no kidding..." Carrie responded weakly, feeling extremely full already.

"No really" Said Kirstie as she waited for Carrie to consume her own forkfull of food before feeding her her own "I know it sounds weird, but I loved that feeling of being helpless and forced to consume more and more. Being fattened up against my will... You'll grow to love it to honey I promise"

Carrie didn't seem convinced about this statement as she was forced to finish the huge meal, but by now she was too weak to argue. When Kirstie had stuffed the last morsel of food into her mouth Carrie let out a small fatigued burp and slumped into her chair, breathing heavily. She groaned as she rubbed her full tummy which was emitting particularly unhappy noises.

"Well done honey!" Said Kirstie "Now tell me... How do you feel right now?"

"So... Hic!... Full..." Carrie said weakly, her eyes half closed.

"Ahh" Said Kirstie, her eyes closed as she envisioned what Carrie was feeling "Excellent. Its a feeling you'll get used to after time... I promise you"

What happens next?
1553211121122221.title: Helping Carrie eat

choices: Carrie returns home where Doug has dinner waiting for her
15532111211222211.content:
When Carrie had somewhat recovered from her huge meal, Kirstie extended her hand and helped her back to her feet.

"Lets get back to it shall we Carrie?" Said Kirstie and lead Carrie from the restaurant.

"Uh... Yeah sure..." Said Carrie with little enthusiasm, hoping to herself that Kirstie wasn't talking about more food "Why not"

------------------------------------

Back at the office Carrie breathed a sigh of relief when she saw there was no food waiting for her.

"Is everything ok Carrie?" Asked Kirstie, noticing her relief.

"Oh yeah" Said Carrie "Just for a minute there I thought you'd have some food waiting here for..."

"Oh thats an excellent idea!" Said Kirstie, suddenly very animated "I think you could do with a bit more food!"

"Uh... No... No no, that's not..." Stammered Carrie, suddenly horrified but it was too late as Kirstie was already picking up the phone.

"Oh yes hello" Said Kirstie as she held up her hand to Carrie to silence her "Please send up a trolley of all your finest snacks... Mrs. Carrie Heffernan is very hungry indeed"

Carrie was flabbergasted at the sudden turn of events, and cursed herself for not just keeping her mouth shut. Kirstie put down the phone and turned to smile at Carrie.

"They're sending it right up" Said Kirstie.

"Oh goodie" Said Carrie without enthusiasm, self consciously feeling her slightly bloated tummy "I was worried I wouldn't get enough calories today"

Sure enough a knock on the door soon followed which Kirstie went to open. The food cart was wheeled in and Carrie groaned at the sheer amount of snacks it was laden with, still feeling a little full from her huge breakfast.

"You know the drill" Said Kirstie brightly.

Carrie smiled sarcastically and reached out to the food cart, grabbing a large bear claw and taking a reluctant bite. Through the rest of the meeting Carrie slowly ate her way through the food laden cart while Kirstie talked about business aims, stopping every now and then to ask Carrie how something tasted or how full she felt. Carrie groaned as she finished a large iced danish and following a look from Kirstie reached out for a swiss roll. At this point Carrie had really hit a food wall, so with a smile Kirstie took the pastry from her hand.

"I was hoping it would come to this again" Kirstie said happily and proceeded to force feed Carrie the roll.

Carrie's eyes were becoming glazed as she chomped away on the sweet pastry that was being forced into her face, which was causing crumbs and fragments to land on the shirt over her bosom. When she'd swallowed the last bite Kirstie obviously had no intention of stopping and grabbed the next item from the cart (a large donut), which Carrie eyed miserably as it soon approached her mouth.

"Open wiiide!" Kirstie sang and Carrie groaned as she complied.

Over the course of the day Carrie was forced to work her way through the huge pile of fattening foods by Kirstie, and by the end of it she was breathing rather heavily.

"Come on now last bite" Said Kirstie soothingly, forcing the last pastry into Carrie's exhausted mouth.

"Uhhh... -Hic!- Urrp!... So full..." Carrie mumbled, slouching back in her chair as with great difficulty she chewed and swallowed the last bite.

"Very good! That's a good girl!" Said Kirstie, stroking Carrie on the head encouragingly.

"<Huff puff>... Urrrp!" Carrie exclaimed groggily and the top button popped off her skirt.

Carrie's belly looked obviously bloated and was emitting groaning noises as it pushed uncomfortably against the lower buttons of her shirt, which were obviously being strained.

What happens next?
15532111211222211.title: Carrie's big mouth

choices: There's a knock at the front door
155321112112222111.content:
"Hey honey" Said Doug happily as Carrie entered "Got some Chinese food actioooney going on over here"

"Oh thats great honey" Said Carrie with a fake smile "...crap..."

Carrie tried to discretely hold up her skirt as she walked, due to the fact that her overally stuffed belly had popped off the top button. When she reached the kitchen her eyes widened in horror as she saw the piles of take away boxes that Doug had assembled on the table.

"Figured you'd be hungry after your hard day at work" Doug reasoned "I know you've got that really important contract"

Carrie tried her best to think of an excuse not to indulge herself and probably deeply offend her husband in the process, but could think of none.

"Uh... That's so... Um... Thoughtful" She said trying to sound convincing as she grabbed a fork.

Despite how full she already felt Carrie ploughed on with the large meal and put the first forkfull into her mouth. As she ate she was perfectly aware of the fact that her bloated belly, which had already popped off the top button was pushing down her zipper as it grew. Carrie forced herself to eat and eat, all the time forcing a fake smile as her stomach groaned miserably. Carrie was actually surprised at her own consumption rate despite how much she'd already consumed that day, and she groaned at the realisation that her appetite must be increasing. Carrie munched her way through about three quarters of her portion of the Chinese banquet that had been provided for her, when she suddenly stopped with breathing sounding heavy.

"Are you done already?" Asked Doug sounding genuinely disappointed "Thought you'd be a bit hungrier"

"... Crap -urp!-..." She said miserably to herself quietly "Uh no... I'm still... Hic!... Hungry!"

Doug beamed happily as Carrie forced herself to keep eating despite her stomachs groaning protests. Within five minutes Carrie had managed to polish off the last of the meal and collapsed back into her chair breathing heavily.

What happens next?
155321112112222111.title: A Chinese banquet

1553211121122221111.content:
The next day, after a predictably large breakfast with Kirstie, Carrie arrived at the office. She followed Kirstie into their usual room and groaned as she noticed the fully laden food trolley waiting for her.

"Please" Said Kirstie, gesturing at the trolley.

Carrie sighed, her hand probing her tummy which was still full from breakfast.

"Of course" She said, her frustration barely hidden as she grabbed a danish and took a bite.

Carrie noted how nothing of any real importance was being discussed in this meeting, rather her own eating was the prime focus. She wondered grimly if this was now Kirstie's key interest, to live out her own gluttonous ambitions through her and ultimately fatten her up to a weight close to or even beyond her own weight as it had been a few years ago.

"Uhh -hic- Yeah.... Urp!... I'm... Pretty full right now" Said Carrie groggily in response to Kirstie's question on how she felt "Are we going to talk about anything els-Ulp?!-"

"Shh... In good time" Crooned Kirstie as she pushed another sugary pastry past Carrie's lips "In good time... For now just focus on stuffing your face"

Kirstie continued to feed Carrie, as she enjoyed the hands on approach of fattening her up.

"You must be feeling really full now" Said Kirstie, her tone insinuating that this was a question rather than a statement.

"Uhhr... So... -hic-... Full..." Carrie responded weakly, her breathing sounding laboured.

"My word look at that bloated belly of yours" Said Kirstie in awe, simultaneously stuffing another donut into Carrie's exhausted mouth stroking her very full looking tummy.

"Huff puff... Please...." Carrie pleaded quietly "Please... Urp!... Kirstie... Stop feeding me..."

"Aw come on now" Said Kirstie, stroking Carrie's head fondly as she stuffed a donut into her mouth "I'm sure you've got room in that belly of yours for a little more"

Carrie's eyes were drooping as she chewed and swallowed everything Kirstie forced into her mouth. Her belly was protruding obviously now, and was noticeably straining the top button on her trousers. Carrie groaned in discomfort as her sore belly pushed tightly against her clothes, and Kirstie seemed to notice.

"Here, let me get that for you" She said, and undid the top button on Carrie's trousers allowing more room for her taut belly.

Carrie sighed in relief and slumped back in her chair, completely exhausted.

What happens next?
1553211121122221111.title: The next day...

choices: Kirstie takes Carrie shopping for an outfit for the next day
15532111211222211111.content:
Carrie's eyes began to droop as the feeling of the food coma overcame her and soon she was snoring softly. Kirstie watched Carrie slumber with affection, her eyes drawn to her bloated belly which rested on the top of her thighs.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------

The rest of the day progressed in much the same way for poor Carrie, whose desperation to keep the job kept her from escaping her fate. Each time she slept of a feeding she awoke to find a freshly stocked snack cart, which was subsequently stuffed into her growing belly. Carrie didn't want to think about how much weight this constant gorging was making her gain and she just hoped that Kirstie would lose interest before it went too far. When Carrie arrived home that night she staggered through the door, only to be greeted by Doug and a large takeaway for dinner.

"Hey honey!" He said happily "I've prepared dinner again!"

The word "prepared" was accompanied by hand quotation marks from Doug, and Carrie smiled back rather unconvincingly.

"Oh yay" She said, adding under her breath "... Crap"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------

The meal did not go down without a serious fight on Carrie's behalf and once she had finished she could barely move. Doug was a little worried at first about how his wife had reacted the meal, but after mumbled reassurance he seemed appeased (though had to almost physically carry her upstairs to bed). The next morning Carrie awoke and immediately checked her midsection underneath her pajama top, looking for any signs that her bingeing had affected get body. "Luke! Come on, you're going to be late!"

She turned back to put the lid on the container, and noticed that her neat stack had been disturbed. She looked up to see Haley cramming an entire brownie into her mouth.

Either that brownie was one bite too many, or else darting forward to grab it had been too much for the overworked garment, because suddenly Haley's pyjama top burst open. The last two buttons pinged off, one hitting Claire in the face, one skittering across the floor. At that exact moment, Luke walked into the kitchen, and was greeted by the sight of his half naked sister desperately trying to cover herself.

He whimpered and ran out, slamming the front door behind him.
155332222222221212111.title: The next day, Haley is still eating.

1553322222222212121111.content:
Claire sipped her coffee, wondering what to do about Haley. She had just gotten back from the grocery store, needing to restock the kitchen after her latest binge.

That morning, Claire had chased after Luke, to no avail, and when she returned to the kitchen Haley was gone, along with another three brownies. She had considered going down to the basement to confront her about what had happened, but realised that she didn't know what to say. She figured she was bound to emerge sooner or later.

As if on cue, Haley entered the kitchen, wearing a pair of orange hot pants that clung tightly to her thicker thighs, and a once baggy white t-shirt that could no longer disguise her bulging midsection or enlarged breasts. The effect was that of a Hooters girl who had let herself go.

"Mom, do we have any aspirin? My back is killing me." She complained, opening the fridge and taking out a carton of orange juice. After taking a healthy swig, she began looking through the fridge.

"I'm starved. Do we have any watermelon?"

Claire's eyes widened, and she almost dropped her coffee cup. She didn't know why she hadn't seen it before, but it was like the word 'watermelon' had turned on a lightbulb inside her head. It was exactly what she had craved every time she was...

Setting down her coffee, she hurried over to Haley and span her around. Ignoring her protests, she lifted up her shirt, fully exposing her swollen stomach. It was about the size of a soccer ball, and when she placed her hand on it, it felt taut rather than soft and flabby.

"Mom, what are you doing?" Haley asked, still holding the OJ in one hand and a jar of peanut butter in the other.

Claire tried to stay calm. "Haley, when was the last time you had your..."

Haley was pretty dumb, but even she realised what her mother was getting at. "Ew, Mom! It was like, two weeks ago."

Claire didn't feel relieved. "But you're throwing up in the mornings, you're craving watermelon and your nipples are tender."

Haley was starting to look frightened. "My nipples aren't..."

Claire cut her off by flicking her left breast, causing her to squeal in pain.

"Not to mention the fact that you're eating like a pig and blowing up like a Thanksgiving day parade balloon."

Haley pouted. "Mom, I couldn't be..."

Claire shook her head. It seemed impossible, but still. "There's only one way to be sure."

***

"Thank you, again, for seeing us on such short notice." Claire said, as Dr. Miura ushered them into the exam room.

"It's no problem." The Asian woman said, checking a box on her chart. "Now, how far along are you Ms Dunphy?"

Haley was indignant. "I'm not..."

"We're not sure!" Claire said quickly. "We were hoping you could... clear that up for us."

Dr. Miura nodded, and asked Haley to lie down on the padded bench and lift up her shirt. Haley rolled her tight shirt up to just under her breasts, exposing the growing expanse of peach coloured flesh. She shivered as Dr. Miura applied the cool blue gel, spreading it across the dome of her belly.

A few switches were flicked, and Dr. Miura began to slowly run the ultrasound wand over Haley's stomach. Claire bit her lip as the seconds passed by, and was surprised when she felt Haley reach for her hand. She took her daughter's hand and squeezed it reassuringly.

"There we are." Dr. Miura said finally, squinting at the monitor. "I should say, based on what I'm seeing here, that you're about four months along."

Haley and Claire's mouths both dropped open simultaneously. It was Haley who found her voice first.

"But... But... I can't be having a baby." She said, looking down at her own stomach.

Dr. Miura looked confused, understandably so.

"Well, you're not having a baby." She said, turning the monitor to face them. "You're having three."

***

After saying goodbye to Dr. Miura, who recommended scheduling another checkup for a month's time, Haley and Claire returned to their car.

For quite a long time, they sat in silence in the parking lot. Eventually, Haley spoke up.

"Can we get something to eat?"

Claire, after a long pause, nodded and started the car. Ten minute later they were going through the drive thru of a nearby burger place.

"Can I get, uh, ten, double cheeseburgers, four orders of twisty fries, and, two extra-large chocolate milkshakes." Claire said haltingly into the speaker box.

Haley nudged her, urgently.

Claire sighed. "Make that fifteen double cheeseburgers. No, twenty."

It took a while to assemble their order, and a little longer for Claire to find the money to pay for it, but they were soon pulling into the first available parking space, Haley already tearing into the first of three bags.

Claire watched her for a few minutes as she quickly demolished three of the thick greasy burgers, barely pausing for breath between bites.

Various thoughts vied for her attention. How had this happened? What were they going to do? Why did those burgers smell so good?

This last question won out, at least in the short-term, and Claire grabbed some burgers for herself. Side by side, mother and daughter stuffed their faces, problems momentarily forgotten.

Haley obviously had the advantage, but Claire was no stranger to stress eating, and put up an impressive showing. When the last bag was emptied, Claire had finished six and a half burgers, along with an order of curly fries. All the rest had disappeared into Haley's belly, including Claire's abandoned half burger, swelling it out to even greater proportions.

Claire's own stomach was fairly bloated as well, enough to make her regret wearing her tight fitting black jeans. She had just reached down and undone her pants button, allowing herself a little more breathing room, when there was a rap on the window next to her.

"I swear, she must have had an eighteenth century corset on under her dress. Anyway, I suddenly get a phone call, turns out there's an emergency down at the "mayor's office". I tell her I'll call her, and ten minutes later I'm back at the bar, sharing a drink with a Victoria's Secret model!"

Jeff, sitting across the booth, shook his head. "I'd be impressed, if I wasn't so disgusted."

Adam nodded. "Yeah, that's pretty cold Russell."

"Whatever, you're just jealous that if I get stuck with a fatty, I can ditch her without having to give her half my stuff." Russell retorted, sipping his coffee.

"You can't seriously be calling Audrey a 'fatty'." Jeff said, an air of menace coming into his voice.

"Yeah, plus Jen keeps it pretty tight." Adam agreed, smiling smugly.

"Sure, for now. But once you walk her down the aisle, don't be surprised if that's the last bit of exercise she gets." Russell countered, before turning to Jeff. "As for Audrey, you know she constantly has to watch what she eats, one chocolate bar too many and she'd blimp up like that kid in Willy Wonka."

"Well, you'd know all about that, being an Oompah-Loompah and all." Jeff quipped, getting up and taking out his wallet. "Come on Adam, let's go before he starts singing a song."

Just before Jeff and Adam left the diner, Audrey and Jen arrived. As the two couples chatted by the register, Russell suddenly had an idea. He quickly called over a waitress and placed an order, sending her away just before the two women sat down opposite him.

"Oh great, you're still here." Audrey said, unbuttoning her blue jacket.

"Good morning to you too." Russell replied, smiling politely. "That's a nice shirt Jen."

"Um, thanks." Jen replied, justifiably suspicious of Russell's unusual civility.

Before Audrey could ask what Russell was up to, the waitress arrived with two large slices of pie with ice-cream on top, placing them down in front of her and Jen.

"Uh, we didn't order these." Jen told the waitress, but Russell answered before she could respond, trying to look disinterested.

"Oh, that was Adam and Jeff, something about you two being 'so sweet', I wasn't really listening."

Jen and Audrey said 'aww' simultaneously, sharing a look, before digging in to the delicious baked goods. By the time Russell had finished the last of his meal, having watched them eagerly devour their own fattening breakfast, a plan had formed in his mind. He would teach Adam and Jeff a lesson, and have fun too.
1553322222222222222222212.title: Why not both?

choices: Over the next two days, they continue to indulge...
15533222222222222222222122.content:
The next morning, Russell left the diner with Adam and Jeff, but once they were outside he made an excuse and went back into the diner.

He sat down opposite Jen and Audrey, who were both having a light meal of grapefruit and toast, probably feeling guilty about yesterday's unhealthy breakfast.

"I just remembered something." He began, reaching into his jacket pocket and taking out a brochure. "I was offered this spa weekend for two by one of the Dunbar groups corporate partners, and I thought you gals might enjoy it."

Jen took the brochure and started flipping through it.

"Let me guess, this is one of those places with webcams in the bathrooms." Audrey said suspiciously, squinting at Russell.

"No, it's totally legitimate, and its all expenses paid." Russell said, having expected a certain amount of cynicism.

"Wow, Russell, that's pretty generous. Why aren't you picking up some bimbo and going yourself?" Jen asked, passing Audrey the pamphlet.

"Well, normally I would, but this weekend the national cheer leading championships are being held right here in New York, and there are going to be a lot of disappointed runners-up in need of comforting." He explained, rubbing his hands together.

Audrey rolled her eyes."Charming, as always."

"Well, do you want to go or not? I have to call them and confirm by lunch." Russell said, standing back up.

Audrey looked at Jen, who nodded enthusiastically.

"Okay then, yes, we'll go." Audrey said. "And, uh, thanks Russell." She added hesitantly, unused to the idea of being grateful to him.

He bowed his head humbly, hiding his smirk. As he walked back towards the exit, he sidled up to a waitress.

"Could you bring those two a stack of pancakes each? Just tell them they're on the house for two valued regulars." He said, slipping her a fifty. "And extra syrup, okay?."

***

"Wow, this room is enormous!" Jen said excitedly, dropping her suitcase on the bed closest to the door. It was Friday, and after lunch at the diner, they had made the drive up to the spa for their weekend of pampering.

"Yeah, I guess we really owe Russell." Audrey agreed, looking around their room, still half-expecting to find a hidden camera.

"So what do you want to do first? We could head down to the jacuzzi, maybe hit the sauna?" Jen suggested, when the phone rang.

Audrey picked it up. "Hello?"

"Ms. Bingham? We have you and Ms. Morgan scheduled for a six o'clock mud bath down in the rejuvenation centre, unless you would like to reschedule?"

Audrey looked at Jen and mouthed the words 'mud bath'. The brunette smiled and gave a thumbs up.

"Um, sure, we'll be down their in a few minutes." Audrey said, hanging up the phone.

***

A few minutes later, having changed out of their clothes and pulled on luxurious bathrobes and complimentary flip-flops, they arrived at the 'rejuvenation' centre.

As they slipped into the hot mud, both women let out satisfied sighs. The lights dimmed and soothing music was piped in to the room.

After an hour, the lights came back up, and the music gently faded out. After hauling themselves out of the baths and rinsing off in the shower, they decided to head back to their room.

"That was so amazing, my skin is still tingling." Jen gushed, shivering inside her robe.

"I know, I almost fell asleep I was so relaxed." Audrey nodded, her key card beeping as she opened the door.

"So what do you want to do now?" Jen asked, sitting down on her bed.

"Well, I'm a little hungry. We could order some room service?" Audrey suggested, leafing through a menu next to the phone.

"Oh, yeah, I'm actually starving." Jen agreed, hopping back up and looking at the menu. "Ooh, ravioli! And lobster bisque."

"I know, everything looks so good." Audrey agreed. "I almost want to order all of it."

Jen looked pensive, biting her fingernail. "Well... It is all expenses paid..."

***

While they resisted ordering everything on the menu, there was definitely more than enough. Shrimp cocktails to start, followed by a sirloin steak each and a split order of chicken ravioli. For dessert, unable to decide, both women got a slice of cheesecake and the Black Forest gateau, with ice-cream on the side.

After placing the order, they got changed into the comfy silk pyjamas provided by the spa, and selected a film from the pay-per-view. By the end of the meal, they were both practically popping the buttons, their bellies swelling outward as they ate, the movie ignored in favour of the delicious food.

With some groaning and the occasional burp, Jen and Audrey clambered into their beds, wishing each other a groggy 'good night', and falling asleep practically as soon as the lights went out.

As they slept, the familiar music from the rejuvenation room began to play softly, from the hidden speakers behind the beds.
