"Thank you Mr. Van Cleef, I think that's enough for today."

The class let out a sigh of relief as Sikowitz brought an end to the latest rendition of Sinjin's one man show, 'Seven Deadly Sinjins'.

"But I didn't even get to 'Lust' yet!" Sinjin complained, before a chorus of boos and a barrage of wadded up paper forced him back to his seat.

"Now, one last thing before I let you go." Sikowitz continued, pausing to take a sip from his coconut. "It has to do with an old student of mine, Melissa Beaujolais."

There was a pause, as the entire room looked at Tori.

"What?" She asked, looking bemused.

"Well, this is usually the point where you ask who or what a person or thing is, and we all have to explain it to you." Beck said kindly.

Jade nodded."Yeah, it's super annoying."

"But in expository terms, it's dynamite!" Sikowitz added.

"Well too bad, because I already know who Melissa Beaujolais is." Tori said, sticking her tongue out at Jade.

"Then I don't need to tell you she's a young, upcoming director, was Oscar nominated for her debut film 'Fireflys', and is now coming to Hollywood Arts to cast an unknown young actress in her as yet untitled follow-up film?" Sikowitz said smugly.

"Seriously?" Tori asked in shock, as a murmur shot through the class. Cat clapped her hands giddily, and even Jade's expression betrayed a hint of excitement.

"Auditions are this Friday in the auditorium, scripts will be provided, no need to prepare anything." Sikowitz told them. "Best of luck to all of you."

Any further questions were prevented by the discordant notes of the bell, signalling the end of class.

***
UPDATE:

Tori Vega: Can't believe I get to audition for Melissa Beaujolais! What a great opportunity!

Feeling: Blessed 😇

***

"What? I got the part?" Tori asked, her eyes wide with surprise.

The man nodded, then said in a hushed tone. "Could you follow me please?"

When Tori had arrived that morning, it seemed like the entire female population of Hollywood Arts was trying out. She had to wait in line for three hours, nervously going over the script they had handed her at the registration desk.

It was a short monologue, featuring a young woman named Melody, who was struggling to rebuild her life after having a baby at age 17. Tori memorised it in ten minutes flat, and spent the rest of the time thinking about how she would perform it. After all the time waiting the audition itself felt like it was only a few seconds long, briefly stepping in and out of the spotlight on the darkened auditorium stage.

She had only been off the stage a few seconds when Melissa's PA took her by the arm, telling her she had got the part. She barely had time to process this before she was whisked back into the school, down the bright corridors of Hollywood Arts.

To her surprise the PA stopped right outside Sikowitz's classroom.

"If you would please wait in here, Melissa will be with you shortly."

Tori nodded and thanked him, opening the door and stepping inside.

"Hey Tori!"

Cat was sitting on the edge of the raised stage area, swinging her legs back and forth.

"Cat? What are you doing in here?" Tori asked, walking up to her.

The redhead smiled. "I got the part, so they asked me to wait in here."

Tori shook her head. "No, Cat, you must have gotten confused. I got the part..."

Just then the door opened, and they looked over at it. Jade walked in, a satisfied smile fading from her face as soon as she saw Cat and Tori.

"Let me guess." Tori said, piecing it together. "You also got the part."

Jade just scowled, folding her arms.

***
UPDATE

Tori Vega: Good news- I got the part. Less good news- I wasn't the only one?

Feeling: Confused 😕

***

It was close to twenty minutes before Melissa Beaujolais finally appeared, bringing her PA with her. She was in her late twenties, cropped blonde hair and thick framed black glasses, and was wearing a black vest over a voluminous white blouse and ripped blue jeans.

"I'm sure you're all wondering what's going on." She said, apologetically, once they had introduced themselves and taken a seat.

"Uh, yeah." Jade said, unable to keep her annoyance in check.

"Well you see, the thing is..." Melissa broke off, turning to her assistant. "Where's the other one?"

"Other one?" Jade and Tori said simultaneously, just as the door burst open.

"Don't worry, your star is here! I just had to powder my nose!"

Trina bustled in and sat down before she even noticed the other girls.

"Hey, what are you buttlicks doing here?" She asked, looking around.

Jade snorted. "Us? What are you doing here you no-talent b-"

"Ladies, please!" Melissa said, raising her voice. "Trina, I was just about to explain."

She stood up and began to pace around the room.

"You were each told you got the part, and believe me, each time I genuinely meant it. When I saw your auditions, every time I thought 'we've found our Melody'."

She sighed. "You all brought such a different energy to the role. Cat, you really found Melody's innocence, while Jade, you give her this real undercurrent of darkness."

Cat giggled bashfully and Jade smirked.

"And Tori, you really understood Melody's sadness that she would never achieve her dreams. And of course, Trina, you just have this, I don't know, call it je ne sais quoi."

Tori looked sideways at her sister. "Yeah, I guess you could call it that."

"So... who gets the part?" Cat said, asking the obvious question.

Melissa sat back down. "I don't know."

She looked lost in thought, until her assistant cleared his throat, snapping her out of it.

"So, we're going to have another round of auditions, just the four of you, a month from now."

"Why a month?" Tori asked.

Melissa smiled. "Well, there is another thing. You see, I really want this movie to be as realistic as possible. Now, in the movie, Melody has just had a baby, and is also struggling with depression."

"So?" Trina said brusquely.

"So, whoever gets the part, is going to need to put on some weight." Melissa told them. "At least thirty to forty pounds."

All the girls had a similar reaction, jaws dropping and eyes popping.

"Thirty to forty pounds?" Tori asked incredulously.

Melissa nodded. "It needs to look real. It needs to feel real."

The girls all looked at each other. This role could be the opportunity of a life time, but the cost had suddenly gotten much higher.

Melissa shrugged. "Look, I don't want to pressure anyone, but if you want the role, this is part of it."

She stood up, pausing to shake each of their hands. "I'll see you in a month."

With that she was gone, bringing her assistant with her. There was silence in the room for a minute and a half.

"Screw her." Jade said suddenly. "I'm not getting fat just to maybe get a part in some movie."

"Yeah." Tori said, but without much conviction. She looked for more support. "Cat?"

Cat was nervously chewing her hair, and didn't seem to have heard the question. "Huh?"

Trina looked at them scornfully. "Fine by me. If you all wimp out, it just makes it that much easier for me to get the part."

Jade growled menacingly, but Trina ignored her, flouncing out of the room with her head held high.

The three remaining girls shared a glance. What should they do?

1553322222222222222222222222222221211.content:
"Good morning sleepyhead!"

Tori had woken up later than usual, having been kept up by the gurgling and groaning of her overstuffed stomach. Eventually she wandered downstairs, still wearing her blue pajamas, to find her family sitting around the kitchen table.

Her parents were sipping coffee, their plates already emptied aside from a few crumbs. Trina was still eating, methodically working her way through a tall stack of pancakes, each bite drenched in maple syrup and melted butter. Tori, still half-asleep up to that point, suddenly remembered the events of yesterday evening.

After somehow cramming dessert into their painfully overstuffed bellies and paying the painfully large check, Tori, Cat and Jade had driven home in relative silence, aside from the occasional burp or moan. They dropped Tori off in her driveway, leaving her to stagger into her house alone.

Inside she found Trina lounging on the couch nearest to the door, apparently asleep. Her eyes were shut, her head tilted back against a cushion, a thin string of drool hanging from her open mouth. There was an empty pizza box next to her, spotted with greasy residue and globs of congealed cheese. An empty two-liter bottle of soda lay crumpled on the floor in front of her. Her spangly silver top was pulled up, exposing the taut, tan skin of her hugely swollen stomach.

Tori thought that she was about as bloated as a person could be, but her sister looked like she had swallowed a basketball. Judging by the size of the box and the size of her belly, that pizza must have been the size of a bicycle wheel. Unable to resist, Tori crept forward and poked Trina, just above her belly button.

She started slightly but didn't woken up, so Tori was bold enough to place her whole hand on her sister's swollen stomach, feeling its warmth. It was tight as a drum, and she smacked it lightly. The noise it made was more like a thud than a boing, showing just how full Trina was.

Placing her hand back down, she began to move it in small circles, marvelling at how smooth the skin felt. Trina let out a little noise in response, just a slightly elongated exhale. Intrigued, Tori rubbed some more, a little harder this time, drawing a moan from between Trina's parted lips. She spread her fingers out and squeezed gently, and this time Trina burped, the escaping gas bringing the scent of cheese and tomato sauce with it. Yet still she didn't wake up. Tori stifled a giggle, wrinkling her nose at the smell, and continued to rub and stroke.

It was a sound from outside that finally broke the spell. It was just a car passing by, but for a panicked second Tori thought it was her parent's coming home. Glancing up she caught her reflection in the darkened glass of the house's rear windows. There she was, practically massaging her sister's swollen gut, her own bloated belly jutting out over the waistband of her jeans. She blushed, very glad that her parents hadn't chosen that moment to come home. She had scurried upstairs as quickly as she could, which wasn't very quickly at all, leaving Trina on the couch, snoring softly, none the wiser.

"Tori? Sweetheart?"

Her mother's concerned tone brought her back to the present. She looked again at Trina, who was munching away unconcernedly at her breakfast. Seeing this, Tori felt a rumble in her stomach.

"Are there any pancakes left?" She asked hopefully.

"Sorry honey, your sister got the last batch." Her dad told her, before returning to his newspaper. Behind his back Trina looked up and smiled smugly, her cheeks bulging with food.

"There's plenty of fruit." Her mom suggested. "And there's some of that low-fat yoghurt in the fridge."

Tori frowned, ignoring her mother as she began to look through the kitchen cabinets. Sugar cereal, some poptarts, maybe a banana or two to bulk it out a little... She had to catch up with Trina.

She assembled her breakfast, using chocolate milk instead of skim on her cereal, and grabbing a jar of peanut butter. As she sat down at the table her parents exchanged a look but said nothing.

"So," her mom began as Tori spooned cereal into her mouth. "Pretty exciting news about Trina."

Tori looked up and swallowed. "What news?"

"She got the part in that Melissa Beaujolais movie." Her mom said, patting Trina's arm proudly. "Didn't she tell you?"

Tori shot her sister a withering glare. So that was how she wanted to play it.

"Yeah, it was a pretty big surprise to all of us." She said, after crunching down another mouthful of cereal. This would just make it all the sweeter when she got the part, not Trina.

Her mother smiled even wider, probably having doubted the veracity of Trina's claims until Tori seemingly confirmed them. She patted Trina's arm again and gave Tori's shoulder a quick squeeze of consolation, before getting up and clearing her empty plate away. Their dad followed suit, adding an attagirl for Trina and a next time, kiddo for Tori.

Left alone, the two sisters continued to eat. Tori finished her cereal and poured a second bowl, pausing to take a bite from a poptart. Trina was mopping the plate with her last bit of pancake, before popping it into her mouth.

"Oof!" She said as she stood up. "I am fu-ull!"

Tori looked up at her sister's stomach. It was looking pretty round, she must have eaten plenty of pancakes, but it wasn't even half the size it had been last night.

"I could use a belly rub..."

Tori's spoon froze halfway to her mouth, but Trina didn't even look at her, simply traipsing out of the kitchen, leaving her plate and cutlery for Tori to clean up. Had she been awake after all? Or was it just a coincidence?

Tori decided to ignore it. She had bigger things to worry about.


***

Tori wasn't feeling great when she arrived at Hollywood Arts on Monday morning. The weekend had passed in a blur of eating, napping, snacking, lazing around, and even more eating. Her stomach was constantly bloated, pressing against the inside of her shirts and the waistband of her pants. Every time she felt like giving up or even just taking a break, there was Trina, somehow still happily gorging away on whatever she could get her hands on. Their mother had gone grocery shopping on Sunday morning, and by my hat evening found there was no food left to make dinner with. They had ended up ordering Chinese food,, with Tori matching Trina bite for bite, egg roll for egg roll.

And for what? Tori had stepped in the scales that morning, wrapped in just a towel, and found out she had only gained a pound and a half. When she got downstairs she found her sister devouring a huge plate of bacon and eggs, and she could swear that Trina already looked fatter. With a sigh she had piled her own plate high and dug in. She may not have gotten results yet but until she came up with a new strategy it was better than nothing.

She was just wondering how the others were finding it when she spotted Cat and Jade loitering by their lockers. Neither one looked any fatter, but maybe she was expecting too much. As she walked closer she did notice both girl's stomachs looked swollen, suggesting they had also been doing their best to put on weight.

"Hey guys." Tori said casually. "How's it going?"

"Terrible." Cat said with a pout. "I only gained two pounds, and my tummy feels like it's going to explode."

Jade nodded sourly, her overstuffed belly letting out an angry gurgle.

"I know!" Tori said with a sigh. "This is way harder than I thought it would be."

As they stood there commiserating, Trina strutted past, chomping down a breakfast burrito roughly the size of a football. All three of the younger girls stared at her, and her hugely bloated stomach, with a mixture of anger and amazement.

"How is that even possible?" Jade asked.

Tori frowned. "She's always been incredibly driven and also incredibly greedy. I guess those two personality traits just aligned perfectly for this incredibly bizarre situation."

The discordant school bells rang suddenly, and the overstuffed trio continued to grumble as they hurried to class, making an extended stop at the vending machines along the way.

155332222222222222222222222222222121111.content:
As the days went by, each of the girls began to devise their own strategies for gaining weight, with varying degrees of success.


Cat decided quickly that her poor little tummy couldn't handle the vast amount of food she'd been trying to force into it, and that she hated the feeling of being so full. Instead she switched to a mostly liquid diet, and was rarely seen without an extra-large Big Slurp filled with some sort of sweet and fattening soda. She would still get full, but she preferred the feeling of a sloshing stomach to one packed with food, and the constant sugar rush helped too.


It wasn't the most effective method of putting on weight, and by the end of the week she had only gained a few more pounds, rounding her flat stomach out slightly. And that wasn't the only drawback.


***


"Mrs Yonders?"


The Hollywood Arts history teacher sighed, as her explanation of the Emancipation Proclamation was interrupted once again.


"What is it now Ms Grant?"


Cat smiled pleadingly. "I have to go the bathroom."


Mrs Yonders shook her head. "No way, you've already been three times in the last half hour. I don't know what you're playing at but it ends now."


Cat bit her lip as class resumed. She wasn't playing at anything, she really did have to go, just like the last three times. It probably didn't help that every trip to the bathroom included a stop at a vending machine to chug a few more cans of Wahoo Punch. Now her bloated belly was pressing against the edge of her desk, while the haze of high fructose corn syrup made it impossible to pay attention to the lesson. She tried to focus, but she was too aware of everything around her, from the ticking of the clock to the gurgling of her stomach.


She shifted in her seat, pressing her slim thighs together tightly under her skirt, trying to keep her breathing regular. The pressure was growing inside her with every passing second, and she started making quiet little noises of distress. Mrs Yonders didn't seem to notice, continuing to give her lesson.


"And so, while it was originally intended as a mere stopgap solution, the Emancipation Proclamation took on a much greater meaning, as a signal of freedom, a great relaxation of tension, a long-awaited release."


Cat couldn't take it anymore and jumped to her feet, knocking her desk back into the row behind her. She ran for the door, as fast as she could with her legs still held together.


"Sorrysorrysorrygottagobye!" She yelled as she barrelled out of the door, leaving Mrs Yonders shaking her head in bemusement.


Cat waddled awkwardly towards the girl's bathroom. If she didn't get there soon, at least she had a spare pair of panties in her gym locker.

1553322222222222222222222222222221211112.content:
Jade was already tired of needing to eat all the time, so decided instead to simply have one meal a day, as long as it was an absolutely huge one. A pan of lasagne with garlic bread and a gallon of ice-cream one night. A roast chicken with buttery mashed potatoes and an entire apple pie the next. Then half a dozen spicy burritos with extra beans, extra cheese and extra guacamole. Supplemented with a few snacks during the day, she figured she would soon start packing on the pounds.


If Jade's idea was sound, it was the execution that let her down. Try as she might she just couldn't manage to pack away all the food she set out for herself in just one sitting. The pan was still half full of lasagne when she finally dropped her fork, and she barely made a dent in the ice-cream. She finished most of the chicken but blanched at the potatoes, and felt sick two slices into the pie. She just about managed to finish four of the burritos, then spent the whole night tossing and turning, trying to relieve the pressure in her bubbling gut.


Having hardly gained any weight all week, Jade realised she was going to need some outside help.


***


"Just to say, as your boyfriend, I'm not a big fan of this." Beck said as they pulled into an empty parking spot.


"Well just to say, as your girlfriend, shut up." Jade responded. "You said you'd help me get this part."


Beck sighed. "I thought that meant helping you run lines or something, not helping you eat a dozen cheeseburgers."


It was Friday night, and they were in Jade's car, having just pulled out of the Inside-Out Burger drivethru. Two paper bags practically bulging with burgers sat in Beck's lap, along with a tray holding two extra-large sodas and two extra-large milkshakes. All of it was for Jade.


"Shut up." Jade repeated, turning the engine off and unbuckling her seatbelt. "Now give me the first burger. And remember, I have to eat all of them, don't let me stop. If you do, I'll n-urmph!"


She was cut off by Beck shoving the unwrapped burger into her mouth, causing her cheeks to balloon outwards. She shot him a glare but still chewed and swallowed, grabbing it out his hand before taking another bite. Beck smiled, despite himself. At least as long as she was eating, she wasn't ordering him around.


Jade made slow but steady progress through the first bag of burgers, washing each one down with a gulp of soda or milkshake. Her stomach grew steadily too, as the solid mass of food inside it swelled bigger and bigger with each bite. Beck watched with a curiosity that occasionally crossed over into fascination, especially when she reached down and undid her jeans, giving her belly more room to breathe.


By the seventh burger, Jade was starting to flag, chewing more slowly and taking longer between each bite. The eighth burger took even longer, and when Beck tried to hand her the ninth she just sat there, breathing heavily and gingerly rubbing her stomach.


"Come on." Beck said, unable to hide an amused smirk. "Just four more."


Jade didn't reply, just shooting him a venomous glare, followed by an equally toxic belch. Beck, after cracking a window, was willing to just let it go, but then he hesitated. Jade might be mad now, but he figured she'd be even madder tomorrow if he didn't make her finish all of the burgers.


"Ugh, let's just get out of h-urmph!" Jade began, before she was interrupted for the second time by her boyfriend shoving a burger into her mouth. Her eyes bulged in surprise, and for a second Beck thought he may have made a mistake, until she began to chew. Having swallowed the mouthful she opened her mouth even wider, allowing him to stuff even more in.


In this manner they worked through the remaining burgers, Beck hand feeding her until grease was running down her chin and dripping on to her incredibly bloated belly. He even started to enjoy himself a little, though he couldn't quite say why. When the last shred of cheese laden beef was finally consumed, Jade's stomach was the size of a basketball, her pale skin pulled painfully taut. She was moaning as she massaged her rigid gut, and once again Beck felt oddly compelled by the situation. He decided to lend a hand, reaching over and rubbing her stomach softly.


"So." he asked,half joking, half serious. "Where do you want to go for dessert?"

This meant snacking all day long, when she was getting ready in the mornings, on the way to school, between classes, during rehearsals, on the way home, while she did her homework, when she got ready for bed... And all that was on top of three large meals a day. It wasn't easy, and it wasn't particularly fun, but as plans went it at least had the benefit of simplicity.


The only complicating factor was Trina, who was engaging in a very similar tactic. Their had always been a rivalry, spoken and unspoken, between the two sisters. They always felt the need to compete with each other, whether it was something important or just a game. If Tori was being honest, she felt like she was usually the one who came out on top in these competitions, but when it came to trying to gain weight she suddenly felt like she was at a significant disadvantage. Trina had always had the fuller figure, needing to watch what she ate to avoid getting chubby, while Tori had always been slim, and able to eat whatever she liked. Now that excellent metabolism was becoming an annoyance, meaning she had to work twice as hard to overcome it.


By the end of the week, Tori had gained just four more pounds, bringing her up to a total of six. Looking in the mirror she couldn't really see any difference, but the snugness of her pants told her most of it had gone to her ass. Trina meanwhile looked to have gained at least ten pounds, maybe more, giving her a noticeable belly and rounding out her face.


If wanted to get ahead, she'd have to get creative.

1553322222222222222222222222222221211112.content:
Most students of Hollywood Arts spent their lunch periods in the school's courtyard, commonly referred to as the Asphalt Café, enjoying the bright Californian sunshine as they took a break from their studies. It was a chance to unwind, shoot the breeze, and of course, have a little something to eat from the Grub Truck. What the slightly rundown food truck lacked in quality, it made up for with sheer variety, offering a vast array of options at an affordably low price.

Tori was thankful for this last part as she slipped her change into the pocket of her increasingly tight black jeans and picked up her heavily laden tray. Two burgers, three pizza slices, an order of fries and a slice of chocolate cake, all for less than ten dollars, even with two cans of Wahoo Punch. Even so, it had been less than two weeks since she had started her new 'diet' and pretty soon she was going to have to dip into her savings.

Cramming a few fries into her mouth, she scanned the courtyard until she spotted Cat and Jade at one of the circular metal tables.

"Hey." Tori said as she sat down, dropping her backpack and letting her tray land on the table with a thud. She winced as she felt her panties work their way up into her buttcrack for the umpteenth time since breakfast. She had taken it as a sign of progress at first, but now it was just getting annoying. "We need to talk."

"Must we?" Jade asked wearily, sprinkling her half-eaten burrito with a liberal amount of hot sauce. It had been five days since that night at Inside-Out Burger, and with Beck's surprisingly enthusiastic help she had finally managed to reach the ten pound mark. The straining buttons of her red flannel shirt showed where most of the extra weight had settled, her snug bra giving her a deep valley of cleavage, which distracted from her small but growing belly.

Cat, who was sitting across the table slurping down Joke-A-Cola through a bright pink crazy straw, had also started seeing some results, as the vast amounts of sugar she had consumed over the past week was quickly being converted into jiggling fat. Her stomach was now noticeably round even when it wasn't filled with soda, and it was a struggle to keep it from peeking out under her floral tank top. Her face had also gotten slightly chubbier, with rounder cheeks and a softer chin. She looked like she was going to say something, but when she opened her mouth all that came out was a fizzy sounding belch, followed by Cat's usual lilting laugh.

"It's about Trina." Tori continued, after pausing to scarf down a burger and some fries. She nibbled on a pizza slice as she began to explain.

"So this morning I was in my bedroom, getting dressed..."

In fact she had been standing in front of her full length mirror, craning her head around to try and get a good look at her butt. Her jeans were only pulled up to her mid-thigh, leaving the full swell of her expanded ass exposed. Pinching and poking it, was clear that it had taken the brunt of her 13 pound weight gain, which wasn't a bad thing. If she ignored her thicker thighs and sucked in the slight potbelly pressing against her zebra-print top, she thought she looked pretty great. She was actually considering taking a selfie when...

"...when Trina starts hollering for me to come into the bathroom."

She had reflexively hitched up her pants when Trina called her name, inadvertently giving herself her first wedgie of the day. She picked it out as she made the short trip to the bathroom, reluctantly opening the door.

"She wouldn't shut up, so eventually I go in, and she's just standing there on the scale."

She decided not to mention that Trina had only been wearing underwear, a lacy white bra and pink panties. Or that she had been practically bursting out of them. Aside from her gut, which was so packed from breakfast it was practically spherical, she was clearly developing a decidedly hourglass figure, with her added weight distributed between her hips and breasts. Trina had always been the bustier of the Vega sisters, but when Tori saw her threatening to burst out of her bra she had felt a pang of jealousy mixed with a strange feeling of-

"Um, Tori?"

Tori blinked, suddenly realising she hadn't said anything for almost a minute. Cat and Jade were both looking at her quizzically.

"Oh!" She said, a slight flush tinging her cheeks. "So, yeah, she's standing there and she says that she can't read the scale, can I tell her what it says?"

Her exact words had been: "Tori, be a good little sister and tell me what the scale says. I can't quite make it out."

With these last words she had patted her belly and let out a little moan of discomfort. Tori didn't say anything, but she did step a little closer, slowly leaning down until her face was level with her sister's swollen belly. She had to resist reaching out and touching it, instead leaning in a little closer and peering down at the dial.

"What does it say?" Trina asked again, speaking causing her taut gut to vibrate almost imperceptibly.
Glancing up, Tori could barely see her face over the bloated sphere of her stomach. She mumbled something, her voice catching in her throat.

"Speak up!" Trina commanded.

"146 pounds!" Tori said incredulously, taking another bite of pizza. "She's gained 25 pounds in less than two weeks!"

She was relieved to see Cat and Jade were also perturbed by the news, that she wasn't just overreacting. They sat in silence for a minute, aside from the sound of Tori chewing her pizza.

"Well, what can we do about it?" Cat asked, shrugging her shoulders.

"We could poison her." Jade suggested, casually reapplying her dark lipstick.

Tori nearly choked, thumping her chest to force down a lump of cheese and pepperoni. "We are not going to poison my-"

"Hey little sister!" Trina announced, placing special emphasis on the word 'little'. "Are you and your friends enjoying your snacks?"

Tori, Cat and Jade all glared at the older girl, whose outfit proudly emphasised her recent weight gain. Her broad hips were muffining over the waistband of her denim shorts, which had the top button undone to accommodate her protruding gut, itself only half covered by her pale yellow t-shirt, through which the cups of her straining bra were clearly visible. Tori doubted if she could even zip the pink tracksuit top draped around her shoulders all the way up.

"Full already?" Trina asked, looking at Tori's half-eaten lunch. "Let me help you out."

Before Tori could react Trina had snatched the slice of chocolate cake off of her tray.

"Hey!" Tori snapped, standing up quickly and nearly tripping over her own backpack. She managed to stay on her feet by grabbing on to the table, but was horrified to hear the sound of fabric ripping. There were a few laughs and one or two whistles as she clapped her hands to her butt, trying to cover the gaping hole that had appeared in the seat of her pants. She could feel the bunched cotton of her underwear and the smooth flesh of her buttcheeks bulging through the tear, as well as the hot flush rising in her face.

Trina was nearly doubled over with laughter, while Cat was stifling giggles and even Jade was smirking as Tori sat back down with as much dignity as she could muster.

"See Tori?" Trina said, still wheezing with laughter. "You really don't need dessert."

She was still chortling as she sauntered away, hips swinging as she munched on the stolen cake.

Tori waited until she was out of earshot, then locked eyes with Jade. "Alright. Let's poison her."

The rest of the day passed slowly, or at least it seemed that way to Tori. Everywhere she went people seemed to be giggling behind her back, though she couldn't be sure whether they knew about her splitting her jeans or if it was just the sight of the bell bottoms she had found in the school's Wardrobe Department. While the flared pants might have been unfashionable, Tori had to admit that the rich red velour and elasticated waistband at least meant they were comfortable.

Even when the final bell rang Tori still couldn't go home, as they were running rehearsals for Sikowitz's latest one act play, a story of love and betrayal on an Art Deco space station. She only had a minor role, as the satellite's onboard computer, but that meant she had to work backstage as well. She quickly assigned herself the role of assistant costume designer, letting Cat do all the actual work.

During a break necessitated by a small electrical fire, they were taking Jade's measurements while she went over her lines. She was the play's lead, and needed to be fitted for a retro style space suit. Cat wielded the tape, calling out the numbers for Tori to take down.

"Bust, uh, 38." Cat said, double checking the tape was taut around her friend's ample assets.

"38." Tori repeated, making a note.

"Waist... 28, no, 30." Cat continued, leaning forward and slipping the tape down until it was just above Jade's hips, pressing it against the underside of her potbelly.

Tori's pencil scratched again. "30."

"Hips... Oh!" Cat said suddenly, as something crossed her mind. She looked up at Jade. "I forgot, I meant to ask you something."

"No." Jade said instantly, without looking away from her script.

"But I didn't even tell you what it was yet." Cat said, sounding slightly hurt.

Jade glanced down at her, unsmilingly. "Okay, go ahead, tell me."

Cat frowned warily. "Are you still just going to say no?"

"Ask, and find out." Jade told her.

"Well, I'm going to my Nona's house for dinner after school, and I'm supposed to bring a friend." Cat explained.

"Oh, that's nice." Jade said. "No."

Cat pouted, her lower lip trembling.

Tori rolled her eyes. "I'll go with you Cat."

The redhead turned to look at her, her sadness instantly replaced with joy. "Really?"

Tori shrugged. "Sure, why not? You said there would be dinner right?"

***

"Tori dear, would you like some more Mac and Cheese and Cheese and Cheese and Cheese?" Nona asked, already digging a spoon into the steaming dish.

Tori was so stuffed that all she could do was nod as Cat's grandmother scooped more of the incredibly rich pasta on to her plate, which was already loaded with fried chicken. Next to her, Cat was in a similar state of satiety, moaning softly as she rubbed her swollen stomach.

Nona smiled as Tori resumed eating, holding a piece of chicken in one hand and a fork in the other.
From the moment they had arrived, after a brief introduction where she complimented Tori's bell bottoms, she had been serving them up a variety of snacks, sweet and savoury, and insisting that they try every single one, not that they needed much encouragement.

"So nice to see young ladies with a healthy appetite." She kept repeating as Cat and Tori ate everything she put in front of them.

"Holy crap Cat!" Tori said in a whisper when her grandmother had retreated to the kitchen area. "Does she always feed you like this?"

Cat had nodded, still crunching down a handful of potato doodles. "She says I'm too skinny, that I need more 'meat on my bones'."

"At this rate we'll have caught up with Trina in no time." Tori had laughed, licking barbecue sauce from her hands before tucking into another rack of ribs.

That had been almost two hours and an entire ham ago, and Tori wasn't laughing anymore. Her stomach took up almost half her lap, making her looking heavily pregnant. Every bite she took caused her a twinge of pain, yet the food was just too good to resist.

Cat must have agreed, because after letting out a few impressively resonant belches she resumed eating, bypassing a plate and eating straight from the dish of cheesy macaroni. Between them they finished off the last few morsels of chicken and pasta, before collapsing back in their chairs with a simultaneous moan.

In response, Nona simply clapped her hands and told them to sit tight while she got dessert ready.

"Cat..." Tori wheezed, her breathing heavy. "I think... I think I'm going to explode."

Cat just groaned in response, followed by a weary hiccup. Her tank top had actually torn along the sides as it stretched to accommodate her expanding stomach.

Despite their protestations, both girls sluggishly tucked in when Nona returned with two huge brownies, layered with chocolate fudge and covered in freshly whipped cream. Tori ignored her cutlery picked hers up in two hands, crumbs cascading down on to her shirt and exposed stomach as she ate. Cat took the opposite approach, bringing her head down to the level of the plate and shoving the fudgy confection in the direction of her mouth.

"Oh my god..." Tori gasped when she had finally swallowed the last of the thick brownie. She tried to push her chair back from the table, causing the legs to creak ominously. She couldn't even think about standing up, her tightly packed gut was literally pinning her to her seat. She rubbed it tenderly, feeling the taut surface.

"Looks like someone ate a little too much." Nona chided jokingly.

Tori looked up as if to say 'no duh', then realised she was referring to Cat, who appeared to have passed out face down in her dessert, mouth still full of half-chewed chocolate, a dab of whipped cream on the tip her nose.

***

While Nona guided the dazed Cat in the direction of her apartment's spare bed, Tori recovered enough to haul herself to her feet, nearly toppling forward with the weight of her distended stomach.

She staggered as far as the couch, leaning heavily on the back of it. Her striped shirt had rolled up to just above her belly-button, leaving the bottom half of her stomach exposed. On a whim, she hiked it up the rest of the way and took out her PearPhone. Holding it at chest height, she snapped a photo of her bloated belly, the tips of her shoes just peeking out underneath it. She tapped a few times, paused momentarily, then hit send.

"You know that couch folds out, if you'd like to stay over."

Tori nearly dropped her phone at Nona's sudden reappearance, trying to surreptitiously pull her shirt back down.

"Oh! Um, no, I should really get home." She said, slipping her phone back into her pocket.

Nona smiled, walking over and taking Tori by the hand.

"You know, when I told Cat to bring her special friend over for dinner, I admit I was expecting to meet a handsome young man." The elderly woman said kindly. "But you seem like a lovely girl, and as long as Cat is happy, I'm happy."

Tori's confusion quickly gave way to understanding, and she groaned inwardly. Of course Cat would misunderstand what her grandmother meant when she said 'special friend'.

"Um, that's really sweet, but-" Tori began to explain, but Nona cut her off.

"And of course, you're welcome to come over to dinner any time."

Tori hesitated as she considered this new information, resting her hands on her tightly packed gut. It didn't take her long to come to a decision.

While Tori and Cat continued to hobble and limp around the track, Jade was in the nurse's office, leaning against the padded examination table, sucking on a lollipop from the large glass jar on the desk. She hadn't even gotten changed for Phys. Ed., still wearing a fishnet top over her black corset, with a dark grey skirt and her usual black leather boots.

Nurse Kotter, wearing a pink cardigan over her scrubs, was crouching down and looking through the bottom drawer of a grey filing cabinet. The school's nurse was in her mid thirties, but she had been blessed with a youthful complexion, and in fact wore her strawberry blonde hair bobbed to make herself appear more mature.

"So Jade, how are you feeling today?" She asked as she stood up, having retrieved the Manila folder labelled 'WEST'.

"I was feeling sick, but now I'm not, so if you just sign me a class absence slip I'll get out of here." Jade told her, not bothering to stifle a yawn.

"Uh-huh." Nurse Kotter replied, looking the young woman up and down. "Well, I'm glad you're feeling better, but I notice in your file that you missed your annual physical assessment this year."

Jade narrowed her eyes but didn't say anything, so Nurse Kotter continued.

"Since you're missing class anyway, how about we do the physical now?"

Jade scowled, unable to think of an excuse. She had been planning to meet Beck and drive to Inside-Out Burger, getting back just in time for third period. All she could do was shrug.

"Excellent!" Nurse Kotter said with a smile, flipping open the file and clicking her pen. "If you just want to strip down, we can get started."

Reluctantly Jade began to undress, sitting down on the padded table and pulling off her boots, and unleashing the smell of her slightly sweaty feet, before slipping her skirt down her legs, revealing her lacy black panties. She had slipped off her mesh top and was about to unlace her snug corset before she remembered that she wasn't wearing a bra. She had gotten sick of having to readjust every few minutes to stop the straps from pinching her, so she had finally decided to just go without.

She momentarily hesitated, then resumed undoing the knots and removing the stiff paneled garment, exposing her pale potbelly as well as her large dark nipples.

"Five foot, seven inches." She said as she marked it down. "You've grown a whole inch taller!"

Jade didn't return the nurse's smile, not appreciating being treated like a child. He mood soured further once she had stepped on the scale.

"146 pounds, let's see that's, oh my, 14 pounds heavier than last year." Nurse Kotter said with a slight frown. "Seems like gym is the last class you could afford to miss."

Jade blinked, almost not believing what she had heard. To her amazement, Nurse Kotter actually poked her pudgy stomach with the end of her pen.

"Tell me, what kind of breakfast did you have this morning?" She asked, either ignoring or failing to notice her patient's flared nostrils and death glare.

"I skipped it." Jade told her through gritted teeth. She had been planning to breakfast on bacon double cheeseburgers, so she had slept in late.

Nurse Kotter tutted. "You should always eat breakfast, it kickstarts the metabolism. Try some whole grains and fresh fruit, and plenty of water."

"Are we done?" Jade asked brusquely, stepping off the scale.

"Just a few quick tests." Nurse Kotter told her, making another note. "Could you please touch your toes for me?"

Jade, pausing just long enough to indicate her disdain for the task, sighed and bent down, reaching for her toes. She couldn't suppress a grunt as she felt her belly being compressed, while her bare breasts flopped down heavily.

"Keep your legs straight." Nurse Kotter reminded her as she stretched, the tips of her fingers only just reaching below her knees. With a gasp she gave up, standing back upright with feigned nonchalance.

The school nurse made another small noise of disapproval as she marked the result down. "Flexibility is an important indicator of overall health."

This continued for some time, with Nurse Kotter assigning tasks and then quietly denigrating Jade's poor performance. She could barely manage ten sit-ups, not even half as many push-ups, and even her balance seemed off as she wobbled on one foot for thirty seconds. The only test she passed convincingly was the eye exam. Finally she was allowed to catch her breath, although she had to listen to Nurse Kotter lecture her.

"You're at the upper limits of a healthy weight for a girl your age, and your fitness level is frankly appalling." She said sternly, holding Jade by the wrist in order to check her pulse. "If you don't make some changes soon-"

"Yeah yeah yeah." Jade said, having recovered her breath and some of her bravado. "We can't all be flat-chested twigs."

She refrained from adding 'like you', but it was clear from Nurse Kotter's drawn expression that the implied insult had been understood.

"Are we done here?" Jade asked, unable to conceal a smirk.

Nurse Kotter didn't respond for a few seconds, then shook her head. "One last test. I need to check your aerobic recovery rate."

Jade's smirk disappeared as Nurse Kotter retrieved a sturdy wooden box from under her desk and laying it on the floor, explaining as she did so. "You need to step up and down off this block for three minutes, then I'm going to see how long it takes your pulse to return to normal."

Jade reluctantly took up a position in front of the box, and on a signal from Nurse Kotter began to step up and down as she had been told. By the end of the first minute she was breathing hard, holding an arm across her chest to try and stop her breasts from bouncing. By the end of the second minute her face had turned red from exertion, her body coated in a thin sheen of sweat. By the end of the third minute she was gasping for breath, each step accompanied by a groan of discomfort. Nurse Kotter tried to conceal her grin as they approached the end of the fourth minute. Maybe that would teach the little cow not to try and skip class.

Just as she was about to put Jade out of her misery, the door suddenly burst open. Cat was standing in the doorway with one arm around Robbie's shoulders, using him to support her rapidly swelling ankle. Both stared open mouthed at the sight of Jade standing half-naked in front of them. Equally startled by their sudden appearance, Jade lost her footing on the block. After a second of comical teetering, she fell backwards, landing on her ass and letting out a yelp as pain shot up her spine.

The next thirty seconds were total chaos. Nurse Kotter yelled and tried to shut the door, inadvertently slamming it into Cat's injured ankle, causing her to cry out. Robbie, after a few seconds of shocked ogling, recovered his senses enough to shut his eyes and begin apologising fervently, backing away just as Nurse Kotter was trying to bring the limping Cat inside. Throughout it all Jade was sprawled on the floor, alternating between cursing at them and moaning in pain as she clutched her tailbone.

Eventually order was restored and Robbie, still apologising, was sent back to class. Cat and Jade sat side by side on the padded examination table, a blanket draped around the latter's shoulders. Nurse Kotter was rooting through her cabinets for supplies to tend to Cat's ankle.

"What happened to you?" Jade asked sullenly, not looking her friend in the eye.

Cat shrugged. "I fell and hurt my ankle."

Nurse Kotter returned before Jade could press any further, her arms filled with rolls of gauze and medical tape.

"Okay Ms. West, I think we can finish this another time. If you'd like to get dressed you can go back to class."

Jade narrowed her eyes. "I don't know if I can go back to class, I might be too hurt. I might need to be excused for the rest of the day."

Nurse Kotter began to speak, but then she caught the look in the teenager's eye. The door should have been locked during the physical, and Jade knew it. She swallowed and nodded her head.

"I suppose... that might be for the best."

Jade smiled and stood up, leaving Nurse Kotter to tend to Cat's ankle while she got dressed. As she squeezed back into her skirt and laced up her corset she noticed Beck had sent her multiple text, asking where she was. She typed a reply with one hand as she slipped on her boots.

Across the Hollywood Arts campus, Beck's eyes widened as he read the text, then smiled as he read it again. He might get in trouble if he ditched school, but if Jade was serious, it would definitely be worth it.

It was David Vega's birthday, and to mark the occasion the whole family were enjoying dinner at Maestro's, one of the city's finest and fanciest restaurants.

"I have to say," the Vega patriarch began, looking around the table, "just getting to spend time with my three favourite girls is the greatest birthday present I could ever get."

"Oh David, that's so sweet." Holly Vega said, leaning over and kissing her husband on the cheek.

His daughters were too busy stuffing their faces with the contents of the complementary bread basket to acknowledge the sentiment. They had matched each other roll for roll since they had sat down, only pausing to slather each one with butter. Their parents shared a concerned glance, leading their mother to clear her throat.

"Ahem, Tori, Trina, maybe you should save some room for dinner."

Tori swallowed the mouthful of bread she had been chewing and smiled apologetically. "Oh, um, sorry, I just really love the food here."

Trina took advantage of her sister's distraction to snatch the last piece of bread from the basket. She shot her a triumphant glance as she crammed it into her mouth. Tori ignored her, taking a sip of the wine her parents had allowed her to order as a special treat, while surreptitiously readjusting her dress, a long-sleeved zebra print number decorated with red roses. It was one of her favourites, but what had been fashionably tight over fifteen pounds ago was now decidedly snug, especially around the middle, clinging tightly to her rounded stomach. Even worse, the extra few inches of fabric need to cover her expanded rear end meant the dress had gone from just north of the knee to decidedly risqué mid-thigh, forcing her to keep pulling the skirt back down. It was far from ideal, but it had taken so long to squeeze herself into it that she hadn't had time to change before dinner.

"Welp, gotta pee." Trina announced abruptly, standing up from the table. Tori had to admit that her sister had done a much better job choosing an outfit. Her deep blue dress was a much looser fit on her thicker frame, and she had accessorised it with a broad black leather belt, which served to disguise her belly while emphasising her voluptuous hips and chest. Watching her walk towards the restrooms, she noticed a few heads turning to do the same, prompting one woman to jab an elbow into her husband's side.

Tori got a jolt herself when someone suddenly tapped her on the shoulder. She whipped her head around and tried to not to spit out her wine.

"Ms. Vega?"

It was the hostess who had shown them to their table. With her she had an ice bucket which held a bottle of expensive-looking champagne, which she placed at the side of the table.

"A gift from the owner." The hostess explained, as a waiter brought over four champagne flutes and began to open the bottle. "He was wondering if you might be interested in singing for us again tonight."

Tori smiled, remembering the night she and André had literally sang for their supper, then blanched at the idea of performing in her constricting, revealing dress. She stammered an excuse. "Um, n-no, uh, thank you, but not tonight."

"Oh come now Tori, don't be shy all of a sudden." Holly Vega told her, clearly impressed by the free booze, eagerly taking her glass.

"I just figured this is supposed to be dad's special day, not mine." Tori said, nervously tugging at the hem of her dress.

"What could be more special than a song from my little girl?" David Vega countered, clinking his flute against his wife's.

Tori could feel herself starting to sweat, then inspiration struck.

"Well, if I do, Trina might want to sing a song as well."

Her parents didn't quite cringe, not exactly, but it was clear she had convinced them. There was no way Trina wouldn't insist on singing.

"Another time maybe." Holly Vega said, to an empathic nod of agreement from David and a sigh of relief from Tori.

The hostess left and Trina returned shortly after, gulping down her champagne just as their waiter returned to top up their wine glasses and ask if they had decided on what they would like to eat. David chose the lobster bisque to start, followed by a medium-well t-bone, while Holly plumped for the Cobb salad and the veal cutlets. Then it was Trina's turn to order.

"I'll have the seafood risotto and the garlic bread to start, then I want the 24 ounce porterhouse, medium rare, with an extra side of mashed potatoes."

The waiter looked slightly taken aback by her substantial order, as did her parents. Their surprise was only magnified when Tori snapped her menu shut and said that she would have the same thing. The waiter glanced at Holly and David to see if they would object, but seeing only bemusement, simply nodded.

"An, uh, excellent choice." He added, before hurriedly going to place the order.

"Wow, you girls sure are hungry, huh?" David ventured after a few moments of silence.

Tori slugged back her champagne to avoid having to answer, while Trina just shrugged. Conversation remained stilted until their starters arrived, when it was completely abandoned in favour of enthusiastic eating.

The seafood risotto was creamy and delicious, but also surprisingly spicy, and Tori drained two glasses of wine before she finished the generous helping, mopping up the remnants with a slice of garlic bread. The waiter refilled her glass every time she emptied it, and her parents didn't seem to notice how much she was drinking, probably distracted by how much she was eating.

Trina demolished her risotto and garlic bread, and the half block of parmasaen cheese she had grated on top of them, in a similar manner to Tori, though she was slightly messier, catching crumbs and the occasional grain of sticky rice in her cleavage.

The brief wait between the courses threatened to lapse into the same awkward silence, until Holly decided to reveal David's birthday present: tickets for a two week cruise to Hawaii, all expenses paid.

"Wow mom, that's amazing!" Trina said, beaming. "When do we leave?"

There was a brief, pregnant pause. Tori, anticipating what was coming, winced and slugged back some more wine.

"We leave on Monday." Holly said, quietly but firmly. "Just the two of us."

Trina, taking a deep breath, was about to launch into one of her trademark tantrums when she was interrupted by the arrival of the main course, her rage temporarily forgotten at the sight of a steak so large it could barely fit on the plate, accompanied by a veritable mountain of buttery mashed potatoes. After a brief moment of anticipation she tucked in, knife and fork hacking into the huge slab of beef.

When her own dish arrived, Tori was slightly overwhelmed by the sheer size of it, but quickly set about her task, feeling confident she could manage it. It helped that the meat was perfectly cooked, each bite almost melting in her mouth. And that she was ever so slightly drunk, even if she didn't realise it. The only real problem was her dress. Under the napkin spread across her lap, her dress had retreated even further up her legs, inching slowly higher as her stomach continued to swell outwards. She really could have used a trip to the ladies' room, but she wasn't sure what would happen if she stood up.

Trina, halfway through her steak, was having wardrobe issues of her own. Her belt, already cinched tight, was straining across her bloated belly, getting tighter with each mouthful. She tried to adjust it, moving it up and down, but eventually gave up and released the ornate buckle, the belt popping open as her stomach surged forward. Her parents raised their eyebrows but made no comment.

Both David and Holly had long finished their meals by the time Trina dropped her cutlery with a clatter, followed half a moment later by Tori. It was with a mixture of fascination and trepidation that the waiter asked, once their empty plates had been cleared away, if they would care for anything from the dessert cart.

Despite their visibly bulging stomachs, Trina and Tori both nodded eagerly.

"Oh no, I don't think-" Holly tried to say, but Trina interrupted her.

"Uh, mom, if you and dad are going to go on vacation without us, we should at least get some dess-URRRPPP!"

Trina's cacophonous belch carried on for a full five seconds, briefly quieting the hubbub of the restaurant. The first sound to break the silence was Tori's stifled giggle, which soon broke out into an unrestrained laugh. She couldn't help it, the whole thing was just too funny. Soon Trina was laughing too, pounding the table with her palm.

"Trina! Tori!" Holly hissed, as the other restaurant patrons began to murmur, but her stern expression only made them laugh harder. David quickly signalled to the waiter to bring the cheque.

"Let's get out of here before you embarrass yourselves any further." Holly said, standing up and pulling Tori to her feet, which was harder than it used to be. There were a few gasps, and one or two laughs, and Holly quickly saw why.

Tori's dress, already struggling to accommodate her larger derrière, had been completely overwhelmed by her slowly expanding stomach. It now barely brushed the tops of her legs, giving the restaurant a full view of her chubby thighs along with glimpses of the lower half of her ass and the crotch of her purple thong. The sight of this set Trina to laughing even harder, which, along with the large amount of wine she had consumed, allowed Tori to see the funny side too, despite her embarrassment.

With Holly staring in disbelief at her giggling, gluttonous daughters, it fell to David to finish paying the cheque and quietly shepherd his family members out to their car. He left a generous tip, despite a suspicion this would be the Vega family's last trip to Maestro's.

Nothing to do with poop or urine.

No popping or death

No vore

I would also like to add that though I'm not a particularly skilled writer, I would also prefer that all additions are written relatively well, with no sudden jumps in weight (the characters should go from skinny to chubby to fat) or complete deviations from the story which make no sense. But yes, please add and remember... Have fun :)
